name: 1010 Bridge Restaurant & Catering
description: 1010 Bridge Restaurant & Catering was opened to showcase Appalachian roots matched with low country influence. With a menu inspired by local farms and businesses, 1010 Bridge represents the city of Charleston and West Virginia. Wine and beer lists are crafted to highlight and complement the cuisine with an emphasis on specialty craft cocktails.

name: For the Kids, by George Children’s Museum
description: The Washington Heritage Trail Welcome Center in Martinsburg is a kid-friendly orientation exhibit and shop leading visitors into our region's national scenic byway. In the process of development the Center opens on the Porch Level of the oldest continuously operational railroad station in America in October and has views of the Martinsburg Roundhouse Center, a national historic landmark. Tours of the Roundhouse can be arranged by the Center.

name: Pearl S. Buck Birthplace
description: Located along U.S. Rt. 219, the Pearl S. Buck Birthplace was built by the Stulting Family who emigrated from Holland to America in 1847 and lived here on a sixteen acre farm. On June 26, 1892, Pearl Comfort Sydenstricker was born here. Writing under her married name of Pearl S. Buck, she won the hearts of Americans with her PULITZER PRIZE winning novel, THE GOOD EARTH. She is the first American woman to ever receive both the Pulitzer Prize and Nobel Prize for Literature.

name: Council of the Southern Mountains
description: The Council of the Southern Mountains is a community action agency established in 1964 to help low-income individuals and families achieve economic, social and psychological self-sufficiency in southern West Virginia, especially McDowell County. The Council of the Southern Mountains presently provides services for individuals and families to help them achieve self-sufficiency. The Council also provides programs for unemployed and underemployed individuals, high school drop-outs, unwed parents, parolees and TANF recipients as high need individuals that need CSM assistance in gaining meaningful community services that provide all measures of citizenship and dignity. CSM provides job training and other services for these individuals and strives to keep the agency functioning at a level that will provide meaningful interventions for the people targeted for help.

name: WVU Jackson’s Mill Farmstead & Heritage Programs
description: demonstrations can include grist milling, weaving, spinning, basket making, candle dipping, wood working, blacksmithing, paper marbling and other heritage arts that were a part of frontier life. These activities are set against a historic backdrop that features the Old Mill – the only original structure left from Tom Jackson’s day – as well as other authentic 18th and 19th century buildings. Tours/programs can run from 2 hours to all day.

name: The Flatwoods Monster Chairs
description: The Flatwoods Monster Chairs is a project started by the Braxton County Convention and Visitor's Bureau as a way to celebrate and bring attention to the history of the Flatwoods Monster. Currently five chairs have been placed and painted. The first chair was placed in Gassaway, WV at the antique Dairy Queen and Elk River Water Trail access. The second chair has been placed in the garden at Cafe Cimino Country Inn in Historic Downtown Sutton, WV. The third chair is set behind the Days Inn and Suites, overlooking the Flatwoods Exit of I-79, exit 67. The fourth chair is placed in Flatwoods beside the town's municipal building right down the road from "the Spot". A Fifth chair has been placed at Holly Gray Park in Sutton off Airport Road. Each chair, once placed, will have a dedicated Facebook page made for it to allow visitors to "Check In" and share their experiences with others.

name: Humane Society of Harrison County
description: The Humane Society of Harrison County is a non-profit organization, and it is the HSHC mission to rescue animals left at the Animal Control Center and prepare them for adoption within a loving and safe home. With this comes ensuring the animals are vaccinated and dewormed, as well as spayed or neutered (in accordance with state law).

name: Abolitionist Ale Works
description: Abolitionist Ale Works is a microbrewery, pub and restaurant located in historic Downtown Charles Town. We specialize in crafting unique, creative and fun beer and pizza. We feature over 12 craft beers brewed on premises along with guest taps from other WV breweries, as-well-as local wine and cider options, plus a menu of original artisan pizzas. We regularly host live music, comedy and other special events throughout the week and operate a "bed and beer" above the brewery that has 5 full condos available as vacation rentals. Open Wednesday & Thursday: 3PM-10PM; Friday: 3PM-Midnight; Saturday: 11AM to Midnight; Sunday: Noon to 8PM
address: 129 W Washington St, Charles Town, WV, 25414

name: ACE Adventure Gear
description: You love to paddle, climb and get outside… we do too, and, we want to help make your outdoor time better. Welcome to ACE Adventure Gear here in Fayetteville, West Virginia. We’re the New River Gorge National Park’s local boating and paddlesports outfitter shop.

name: The ACT 2 Theatre Company
description: The ACT 2 Theatre Company is a 501(c)3 non-profit community theatre. We are an all volunteer organization—governed by a volunteer board of directors, presenting shows that are cast and staffed with volunteer performers and crew and that are directed by volunteer directors.
address: 318 West Main Street / PO Box 2164, Clarksburg, WV, 26302-2164

name: Alfredo’s
description: Made from scratch Greek and Italian fare including pastas and pizzas, calzones, Stromboli's, gyros, and cannoli. The menu includes a large selection of appetizers and desserts. Dine in, carry out and delivery available.
address: 413 Greenbrier Valley Mall Dr., Fairlea, WV, 24901

name: Allegheny Echoes
description: Allegheny Echoes is a weeklong workshop with instruction in music and literature. Morning classes and evening activities include dances, concerts and jams. Dances and concerts are free and open to the public.

name: Alpine Theatre
description: The Alpine Theatre opened December 25, 1936. Admission was 25¢ per adult and 15¢ per child. Candy was 5¢; popcorn and soda were 10¢. Used as a movie theatre and for live shows, the Alpine is a good example of the Modern style. It is a two-story, flat roof, commercial building with a stepped parapet wall in the front. It has a red brick facade and its marquee along with the lights. There is a central ticket booth flanked by the original paired doors. The original “coming attraction” poster frames are intact and are situated on the pilasters flanking the double doors. This building is in “as built” condition and vividly illustrates what downtown meant to many residents of Ripley. It is in the process of being rehabilitated and is now used for concerts, movies, music, plays and workshops. (Listed NRHP 2004)

name: New Martinsville Inn
description: Located on the bank of the beautiful Ohio River, the New Martinsville Inn is designed for the business and leisure travelers alike, offering a unique combination of quality, comfort and value. The New Martinsville Inn includes distinctive features and an amenity package not typically found in similarly priced hotels. Area attractions: LG Wright Glass, WV Penitentiary, Wheeling Downs, Jamboree in the Hills, Palace of Gold.

name: Shahady’s Antique Warehouse
description: Antiques, fine arts and decorative accessories.

name: Apple Grove Fish Hatchery
description: Warm water Hatchery with visible fish at times. Fished reared include: large mouth bass, small mouth bass, hybrid-stripe bass, walleye, sauger, channel catfish, blue catfish, paddlefish, musky, tiger musky, and other species will be raised at Apple Grove Hatchery.

name: Arden Summer Arts Festival
description: Kick-off summer with a weekend of fun and festivities! Outdoor juried artisan vendors, food truck vendors, and live bluegrass music. Let's support locals and bring back the feeling of the community! The farm market will be open and we'll be taking reservations for the strawberry picking and spring barnyard, which include fun hayrides!

name: Arts & Antiques Marketplace
description: One of West Virginia's newest and largest retail art and antique mall located in the heart of Downtown Fairmont with easy access from I-79 at exit 136. More than 80 artists and vendors on 3 floors of the Historic Jacob's-Hutchinson Building next to the Marion County Historical Society Museum and Court House. Beautiful original artwork by local artists and an array of antiques, collectibles, vintage and more!

name: Avenue Motel
description: Avenue Motel offers 17 unit facilities which include: AC, TV, cable, HBO, telephone, private baths and handicap accessible. Monthly, weekly rates available. Service pets allowed. Location is I-79, Exit 132, 3 miles on the right to Avenue Motel.

name: Holiday Inn & Suites – Barboursville
description: Conveniently located between Charleston and Huntington, Barboursville Holiday Inn & Suites has 134 guest rooms, meeting space totaling 2,000 square feet, and banquet or reception space with dance floor for over 120 guests or a day meeting for 200 with theater style seating . Full service catering available. The hotel is off exit 20 on interstate 64 just 10 minutes from Huntington and 30 minutes from Charleston.

name: The Barn With Inn Bed and Breakfast
description: After many years of planning now it's time for guests to have the opportunity to enjoy the property as a reservation only bed and breakfast. The mission of Barn With Inn is to provide a unique farm experience focusing on farm life , animal care and local-farm-to-table foods. The motto is: Feed and be Fed! Rural Elegance with a focus on mindful farming and farm-to-table foods.

name: Barnum Whitewater Area
description: Owned by the Army Corp of Engineers and leased by Mineral County Parks and Recreation. The area consists of approximately 40 acres and is accessible by US Rt. 50, east-west to the junction of WV Rt. 42 at Saddle Mountain Overlook, then five miles north to Elk Garden and the junction of WV Rt. 46, then east on Rt. 46 to signs for Jennings Randolph Lake, continuing past Jennings Randolph Lake Campgrounds approximately 1.5 miles on Rt. 46. Follow Barnum Whitewater signs to the Barnum Whitewater Area.

name: Battlefields Inn Vacation Rental – Harpers Ferry
description: The Perfect Harpers Ferry Vacation Rental: Welcome to the Battlefields Inn in Historic Harpers Ferry, West Virginia, where the Battlefields Inn will transport you to a world of warmth and relaxation. Experience the beauty, history, and attractions of the area. Relax on our covered front porch or in the luxurious hot tub. Whether you are seeking a peaceful retreat, a romantic getaway, or simply want to experience a natural wonder, you will find what you are looking for at the Battlefields Inn. Just a short drive brings you to the quaint town of Harpers Ferry, where you will find charming antique shops, historical tours, and even a restaurant/bar overlooking the river (a local favorite!).
address: 194 Alstadts Hill Road, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Batton Hollow Winery
description: We offer a wide variety of locally made fine wines, certain to please any taste. We are slso proud to offer seasonal wines corresponding to each season throughout the year. Come for a free tasting of our award-winning wines and tour of the winery!

name: Baxa Inn
description: A well-defined, intimate Inn where there is great emphasis placed on thorough cleanliness along with many personal touches and amenities. A special kind of hospitality combined with a lifetime of experience and pride in a ’boutique’ setting. Features include a newly renovated inn, free coffee in the lobby, non-smoking room, and a convenient location to Main Street shopping and West Virginia Wesleyan College.

name: Beachamp – Newman Museum
description: This historical museum building was built in the 1830s by Alfred Beauchamp from local handmade bricks. Alfred was the grandson of the first settler in Wirt County, WV around 1796. This building served as Wirt County's first courthouse. The building was purchased by the Daughters of the American Pioneers using funds donated by citizens interested in preserving the rich history of Wirt County, WV. Housed in the historic old landmark are priceless relics and memorabilia of early life in Wirt County. Items include the original county seal, weapons, tools, and personal possessions. The desk of Mr. Alfred Beauchamp and a large square piano that belonged to Elizabeth Beauchamp Baldwin grace the Newman room. A cradle made by a Newark furniture maker in 1862, a high wooden bed made when ropes were used instead of springs and its low trundle bed, also with rope “springs”, and an unusual copper bathtub are among the items in the upstairs bedroom. Other rooms display dolls, cupboards, old cooking utensils, cobbler’s bench, glassware, mannequins in costume and rooms of period furniture. Recent contributions to the museum include a World War II uniform that belonged to the late Jim Roberts, owner of Robert’s Store. The uniform, a typewriter and a wooden telephone from the historical old store was donated by Pat Roberts. The building was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1974.
address: 29 Beauchamp Dr / P.O. Box 621, Elizabeth, WV, 26143

name: Bear Cabin at WV ATV Rentals
description: Bear cabin is ready to rent and spotless. Sleeps 6 to 8. Refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, range, dish network, tankless hot water heater, 3 full bathrooms. All linens included, grill, mattresses are pillow top and memory foam. Parking for your ATV/UTV underneath the cabin. Full-service garage on site as well as a pressure washer for our customers to use and we rent ATV/UTV, guided trips. All this at 3,500 ft on top of the mountain with a breathtaking view.

name: Bear Heaven Recreation Area (USDA Forest Service)
description: There are 8 single sites available on a first come, first serve basis. Sites are irregularly spaced with some distance between them. Each campsite has a gravel parking spur, table, fire ring, tent pad, and lantern holder. Campsites are suitable for tent camping with vault toilet (no dump station). Rock outcroppings offer unique landscapes. Pets are permitted if on a leash at all times. From Elkins go east on State Highway 33 for approximately 11 miles, turn left on Forest Road 91 at the top of Shaver's Mountain. Follow Forest Road 91 for approximately 3 miles. Bear Heaven Campground will be on the left.

name: Bear Rocks Preserve
description: Time stands still high above Canaan Valley, in Dolly Sods, where a flat, windswept expanse of subalpine heath barrens opens up to the sky. Stunted red spruce, ancient bogs and forlorn boulders define this haunting landscape, where creatures typically found in more northern environs roam oblivious to their geologic isolation. The Nature Conservancy’s 477-acre Bear Rocks Preserve is a cornerstone of this wonderfully diverse and complex ecosystem, which lies on a ridge crest that forms part of the Eastern Continental Divide. Whipping, whistling wind greets visitors to Bear Rock’s barren expanse, where the undulating mountains of the east fold out across the skyline. Dotting this view are large birds of prey that ride warm air currents rising from the valley below, while colorful warblers, vireos, thrushes and other songbirds hug low to the ground, where a profusion of plant life provides protection and food. Lightly treaded trails entwine throughout the preserve’s unique plant communities, leading hikers through a variety of shrubs like blueberry, huckleberry, mountain laurel, azalea and rhododendron. In some areas, soggy, decay-logged soil supports unique high-elevation cranberry bogs, which flourish each autumn. Throughout, red spruce trees poke from patches of soil, and are at once both nurtured and hampered by the icy cool climate. Secreted away amidst these plant communities is an assortment of unique creatures that cling heartily to the unforgiving landscape. Here, lucky travelers might catch a glimpse of the Cheat Mountain salamander, on the federal threatened and endangered species list. Harder still to spot is the snowshoe hare or saw-whet owl, animals that typically are found further north.

name: Bear Wood Company
description: Rustic. Reclaimed. One-of-a-kind. Bear Wood Company makes furniture using locally reclaimed wood. They find old barns and buildings and upcycle the materials they recover into handmade pieces; knowing the history of the wood allows them to pass its story on to you. Stop in and see their wood shop and showroom in Hurricane, WV.

name: Bears Den
description: The Bear's Den features lunch and dinner options that include wood-fired oven pizzas and a full service bar with craft beer growlers. Or, if you want to stop in at the start of your day, you can grab some Starbucks coffee and a breakfast sandwich. Delivery is available within Silver Creek Lodge.
address: 10 Snowshoe Drive / P.O. Box 10, Snowshoe, WV, 26209

name: Beartown State Park
description: The Park is actually one large rock formation split into sections and clefts large enough for walkways. The Park is noted for its massive boulders, overhanging cliffs and unusual rock formations, which are comprised of Pottsville Sandstone formed during the Pennsylvanian Age. Faulting and erosion of the sandstone capping the mountain created a unique system of ‘sunken streets’ in this ‘town of rocks.’ Huge rock formations, deep caves, and dark corners invite the imagination to speculate if bears really do inhabit the vicinity. Beartown State Park is a natural area. Its 107 acres are located on the eastern summit of Droop Mountain, seven miles southwest of Hillsboro, West Virginia. The land was purchased in 1970 with funds from the Nature Conservancy and a donation from Mrs. Edwin G. Polan, in memory of her son, Ronald Keith Neal, who lost his life in the Vietnam War. Development of the park has been minimal in order to preserve the natural attractions of the area. However, basic facilities are provided, and a boardwalk permits easy access. Interpretive signs along the boardwalk guide visitors and provide insights concerning the ecology of the area.

name: Beaver Creek Antiques
description: Beaver Creek Antiques is a Crafts & Collectors Mall. We offer many products including Avon, candles, collectibles, books, movies, CDs, video gaming items, glassware, primitive and antique items, U.S coins and Coal script, handcrafted items and much more!

name: Beckley Events
description: Under the City of Beckley Parks and Recreation Department, Beckley Events committee organizes special events and festivals such as the Rhododendron Festival, Fridays in the Park, Taste of Beckley, Kids Classic Festival, Chili Night, car shows and parades.

name: Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine Campground
description: Enjoy the beauty and serenity of the country at the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine Campground. The campground features 17 back-in sites with 50 amp electric, water and sewage. For tent campers, there is a grassy area with picnic tables, fire pit and draw water. Tent camping is for non-residents only. We provide daily, weekly, or monthly rentals. Registration is at the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine Gift Shop from 10am - 5:30pm and at the Campground Office on Willis St. from 5:30pm -9:30pm.

name: Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine
description: Take a trip through what once was an operating coal mine. Let Veteran Miners guide you through the past and into the future of mining in West Virginia. Guests ride through the mine in a ‘man car’ that holds 35 people. Tours last 35 minutes. Wear a jacket – mine temperature is 58 degrees year round. In addition to the Coal Mine Tour, enjoy the Coal Camp, which includes a restored coal camp house, miner’s shanty, church, school and more. The Coal Mine also has a museum and gift shop.

name: Beckley Raleigh Convention & Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Beckley-Raleigh County, the hub of Southern WV, is home to the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, Tamarack, Lake Stephens, Little Beaver State Park and the Grandview section of the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve.

name: Beckley-Raleigh County Chamber of Commerce
description: Chamber of Commerce building a vibrant community through programs of advocacy, public awareness and policy development in Beckley / Raleigh County, West Virginia. A voluntary organization of business and professional firms who have joined together to promote the civic, commercial and economic progress of our community.

name: Becky Creek – Wildlife Management Area – Randolph
description: Located approximately nine miles south of Huttonsville, access is via county Route 43 (Becky Creek Road) from state Route 219. Several stream crossings can limit access during high water. Deer, turkey and bear are abundant in this mountainous terrain covered mostly by hardwood forest. Trappers and hunters alike can expect to find raccoon, fox and bobcat. Primitive camping is available in designated areas.

name: Bee Run Campground
description: Bee Run provides 10 first come, first served pull thru, primitive tent and RV camping just a stone’s throw away from the Bee Run recreational area and the Sutton Lake Marina on the Sutton Lake. No electric, vault toilets, no potable water, shower house nearby. Call for details.

name: Beech Fork State Park
description: Beech Fork State Park has six fully equipped vacation cabins that sit on a ridge-line above Beech Fork Lake. Two are pet-friendly. These beautiful cabins are distinguished by their open-trussed ceilings and large decks. Cabins are available year-round. Check in begins at 3 p.m., and check out is by 10 a.m. for all cabins. Beech Fork offers 275 campsites in four distinct camping areas, of which 99 campsites are lakefront. All campsites have a paved parking pad, grill and picnic table and have fully-equipped bathhouses and restroom facilities. Wi-Fi is available at the park headquarters and Old Orchard Campground. Old Orchard Campground is open year-round whereas Four Coves Campground, Moxley Branch Campground, Lake View Campground are open seasonally. A group tent camping area is available at Beech Fork State Park. This area is well suited for large groups looking to enjoy tent camping in a beautiful, private streamside setting. The group site is close to the swimming pool complex, the paved fitness trail and day-use restroom facilities. The group camp site (non-electric) is reservable from April 15 to October 15. There are four picnic shelters with electrical outlets, charcoal grills, playgrounds, and restrooms located in the recreation areas upstream and downstream of Beech Fork Dam. These shelters are available on a first-come, first-served basis EXCEPT WHEN RESERVED IN ADVANCE.Reservations must be made at Recreation.gov (See "Shelter Reservation System in Effect.")  Beech Fork also has a seasonally operated Camper’s Corner Store which offers basic grocery needs, gift shop items, hand dipped ice-cream, camping supplies, fishing supplies, bait, ice, and firewood. Game equipment is available for rent. The Corner Store is open April through October. Summer hours are 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Hours are limited to late afternoon and evening before Memorial Day and after Labor Day. Beech Fork is located 12 miles south of Huntington and Barboursville, WV, and is a short drive from Charleston WV, Cincinnati OH, and Lexington KY.

name: Beekeeper Inn B&B
description: The Beekeeper Inn, nestled among the beautiful mountains of Randolph County, West Virginia, is a magical place hidden by tall firs and lulled by the nearby mountain stream. It is one of the oldest buildings in Helvetia, circa 1870, and home of the original beekeeper. The antique-filled inn has three comfortable bedrooms, each with its own private bath, a book-filled common room, kitchen and an airy deck. It is the perfect place for couples, offering seclusion and quiet. You may walk the shady country roads, fish in the nearby stream, laze in the hammock under the massive pines, cross country ski in winter, or just do nothing! The Beekeeper Inn is located by the Hutte Restaurant in Helvetia, WV.

name: Bellacino’s – Lewisburg
description: At Bellacino’s, “Fresh” is no gimmick. We bake our bread from scratch every day in each of our over 60 locations nationwide! All of our grinders, pizzas, salads, and appetizers are made to order so try any of our delicious items today! At Bellacino’s, we have been using the same scrumptious “Grampa Sam” bread recipe since 1959! Bellacino’s is proud to state “Oven Baked from Scratch…Everyday! Pizza & grinders with bread made from scratch daily. Dine in or carry out.

name: Belle Boyd House
description: Famous civil War Spy, Belle Boyd, spent part of her childhood in this house built in 1853. During the war, she supplied information to Stonewall Jackson about enemy activities and was imprisoned twice before being banished to England. Inside the Belle Boyd House, on the right of the entry hall is the original ball room decorated in Victorian style as it would have been in the late 1800s. This is the only room in the house decorated as living quarters. Two black slate mantles (prepared as faux Belgian marble) decorate the twin fireplaces. Acanthus leaf brackets of white marble support the mantles; this was a common theme in Greek Revival style. Visit the second floor rooms, including the master bedroom, in the northeastern front of the house and what may have been Belle’s room across the hall in the front. Exhibits on Berkeley County history fill these rooms, some rotating and some permanent. Permanent spaces include a Costume Room, Black History, Industry, War & Military, County History and Toy Rooms.

name: Bellissima
description: This shop designed especially for women features special occasion apparel including formal dresses, specialty sportswear and accessories for ladies from collections by Misook, J'Envie, Gerry Weber, Joseph Ribkoff and Badgley Mischka. Location: Visit this store located in the Lower Lobby Shop Corridor of The Greenbrier.
address: The Greenbrier, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Belly scRubs
description: Belly scRubs is a dog center. Full service pet grooming is available by appointment 7 days/week. For nail clips just walk-in any day between 9 and 5. Save your back and your bathroom with the self-service pet wash open 24/7 and includes 3 herbal shampoos, conditioner, 2 speed blow dyer and towels always available in the clean, well-lit wash bays. Belly scRubs also has retail dog products available.
address: 119 State Route 34 (in Teays Valley), Hurricane, WV, 25526

name: Benedict Haid Farm B&B
description: Three bedroom 1840's hand-hewn log house with hot tub, 4 fireplaces, huge deck, fully furnished, gas heat and air conditioning. Adjoining cabin sleeps 4 economically. Highest quality third log home has 3 bedrooms & bath with commanding view. The Benedict Haid Farm is a 650 acre rural, secluded mountain top retreat located only 21 miles from Charleston, West Virginia. A perfect location for wedding venues, corporate retreats, reunions, special anniversaries, and family gatherings. The Farm consists of four rustic log structures, The original Haid House, the newer constructed Black Bear Lodge, the Chestnut Cabin, (no longer available for rentals), and the recently renovated Barn. The Haid House and Black Bear Lodge have fully furnished modern kitchens. The Haid House kitchen has a commercial freezer and refrigerator to accommodate catering services food. The Haid House has two bedrooms plus a pull-out sleeper, and the Black Bear Lodge has two private bedrooms plus a loft bedroom area over the living room with three full baths. The Haid House has a 36'X48' screened-in porch with a fireplace and a hot tub for relaxing. The elevated Wedding Arbor is surrounded by a large, flat area for attendee chairs to view a wedding. Space is also available to set up a tent for tables & chairs and/or a dancing area. The Barn is now available space for a wedding, reception, or party area. The Black Bear Lodge is a great place for wedding family or guests to stay. A massive stone fireplace adorns the living area and three bedrooms with private bathrooms can accommodate up to six guests. Two separate decks adjoin each bedroom on the ground level. The mountaintop views are spectacular! Highlights of nature include miles of hiking and a pond for fishing. This is truly a magical rural retreat!

name: Berdine’s 5 & Dime
description: America's Oldest 5 & Dime, operating continuously since 1908. Our oak floors, tin ceilings and classic merchandise evoke not just a step back in time, but a giant leap. See tin toys, bulk candies, sewing notions, books, practical items and just plain fun stuff. Open Mon-Sat: 9 a.m. - 5 p.m.; Closed Sunday.

name: Berkeley County Historical Society
description: Housed in the Belle Boyd House, the Berkeley County Historical Society is a focus group dedicated to the preservation and perpetuation of history in Berkeley County, West Virginia. The archives and research center contains the following files: files on local families, family genealogy books, 34 Berkeley County Journals, marriage records, deeds, wills, obituaries, house files with pictures and history of houses, county maps, vintage postcards, Histories of Jefferson, Berkeley, and Morgan Counties and Microfilm, etc. Our Goals: Develop the Belle Boyd House as an education center Create a depository for historical papers and materials Restore and protect the artifacts, documents, and manuscripts Write, research, publish and continue to develop architectural and genealogical materials for public access Catalog and document all artifacts and items donated or loaned to the Berkeley County Historical Society. Research is by appointment only on Thursdays and Fridays.

name: Berkeley Springs Bike and Skate Park
description: Outdoor Action Sports Facility maintained by the Parks and Recreation Office. The facility is open from Dawn to Dusk. Skate/BMX Park on public land. Free - just bring your helmet. We are located on 187 South Green Street in Berkeley Springs.
address: 187 S Green Street, Berkeley Springs, WV, 25411

name: Berkeley Springs Antique Mall
description: Berkeley Springs Antique Mall is a 7000 square foot antique mall featuring 26 dealers in the heart of Berkeley Springs, across from the historic Berkeley Springs State Park. Hours: 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. except on Wednesdays (closed).

name: Berkeley Springs Farmers Market
description: The BSFM is a producer only market featuring locally grown produce, dairy products, eggs, meats, baked goods, honey, pickles, jams, jellies and other preserves such as chutneys and butters, local foods, lunch, salad and sandwiches, vegetable plants, bedding plants, heirloom varieties, and hanging baskets. April through Mid-December: Sundays 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.
address: Route 522 and Fairfax Street, Berkeley Springs, WV, 25411

name: Berkeley Springs State Park
description: Berkeley Springs State Park is located in the center of Berkeley Springs, W.V. Long before the first Europeans discovered the warm waters of Berkeley Springs, it was already a famous health mecca which attracted Indians from the St. Lawrence Seaway in Canada and the Great Lakes to the Carolinas. Those first settlers, who came in 1730, learned the uses and value of the springs from the Indians and began spreading the word of its benefits throughout the settlements of the east. Those first settlers, who came in 1730, learned the uses and value of the springs from the Indians and began spreading the word of its benefits throughout the settlements of the east. The bathhouse first opened in 1930. Since then, thousands have enjoyed the variety of baths and treatments in the warm mineral waters that flow from the springs at a constant temperature of 74.3 degrees Fahrenheit. The springs discharge from five principle sources and numerous lesser ones, all within a hundred yards, approximately 2,000 gallons of clear, sparkling water per minute. Spa services today include Roman baths, massage, sauna, mineral showers and enjoying the shops and artistic-style of town.
address: 2 S. Washington St., Berkeley Springs, WV, 25411

name: Berry’s Campground
description: Our family-friendly campground is located along the banks of the New River, just a few miles from the beautiful Sandstone Falls and Bluestone Dam. We provide 20 RV/Tent sites along the river with 30 amp electric, water, in-ground fire pits, picnic tables, dump station, clean restrooms, hot showers, and wireless internet.

name: Berwind Lake Wildlife Management Area
description: The 85-acre Berwind Lake Wildlife Management Area (WMA) consists of steep mountain forest surrounding 20-acre Lake Berwind. Principal game harvested in the management area include deer, squirrel, raccoon, and turkey, though hunting is limited due to the limited acreage of the management area. Lake Berwind is equipped with a Class-Q fishing pier and accommodates fishing for warm-water species. Trout is stocked from February until May. Berwind Lake provides a warmwater fishery for largemouth bass, bluegill, and channel catfish. Adult channel catfish are stocked annually in June. Berwind Lake Wildlife Management Area is located in southern McDowell County four miles south of War, WV, and 12 miles south of Welch, WV, on highways WV-16 and WV-12/4.
address: WV Rte. 16 and WV Rt. 12/4; P.O. Box 38, Warriormine, WV, 24894

name: Best of Canaan
description: Canaan Valley vacation lodging. Fully-equipped mountain home provides an affordable way to stay and play. Enjoy the beauty of Blackwater Falls, Canaan Resort, Dolly Sods, Monongahela National Forest and more! Local cuisine, craft breweries, art studios, hiking, biking are all just a short drive.

name: Best Western Berkeley Springs Inn
description: Experience true West Virginia hospitality with comfortable accommodations and affordable rates at the BEST WESTERN Berkeley Springs Inn. Located in the heart of Berkeley Springs, just 90 minutes from the Washington D.C. area, close to the Civil War Trials site and just minutes from the country's first spa, the BEST WESTERN Berkeley Springs Inn is the perfect place to rest, relax, and revive after exploring historic sites and area attractions. Staying at the locally owned and operated BEST WESTERN Berkeley Springs Inn means you're getting the best accommodations in town, which comes complete with breathtaking mountain views, cable satellite television and high-speed Internet access. Other amenities at this Berkeley Springs hotel also include a complimentary hot breakfast every morning, an outdoor heated swimming pool and an on-site restaurant and lounge located next to the hotel. There are several bath houses and day spas surrounding the hotel, and we proudly offer weekend getaway and spa pampering packages - call today for availability and details. Guests traveling to Berkeley Springs on business will also appreciate this hotel's business center, convenient business services, meeting space that can accommodate up to 100 people and a close proximity to area businesses. Additionally, we now have designated Pet Rooms. So feel free to bring your furry companion along for the trip, as I am sure they will appreciate it!

name: Best Western – Huntington Mall Inn
description: Stay at this Barboursville hotel located off I-64 convenient to the Huntington Mall, West Virginia's largest shopping mall. With free high-speed Internet and both smoking and non-smoking rooms, the comfort of guests is our top priority. We're a pet-friendly hotel with only a small additional fee to bring your furry friend along. An outdoor pool is the ideal relaxation spot for many guests at our Barboursville hotel, and it's the best way to cool down after a day of shopping or exploring. Additional amenities include: *Complimentary continental breakfast, *Exercise facility *Ice/vending machines *Safe deposit box *Public areas accessible by physically challenged *Golf course, packages available, Lavallette Golf Course and Sugarwood Golf Club *Amusement park, family fun packages available, Camden Park tickets and accommodations *Free parking *Meeting facilities *Fax services *24-hour front desk

name: Best Western Logan Inn
description: We are proud of being the "Official Lodging of the Hatfield McCoy Trails”, as well as having received the Chairwoman's award from Best Western International putting us in the Top 5% of all 2200 Best Western's in North America. The Best Western Logan Inn offers travelers a great location, friendly service, impeccable accommodations, and unbeatable amenities all for an affordable price. This hotel offers convenient access to many local attractions, shopping, and dining options in order to make any stay in West Virginia a comfortable one. Guests staying at this hotel will enjoy well-appointed guest rooms featuring cable satellite television and free high-speed Internet access. Best Western Logan Inn is equipped with a heated indoor pool and an exercise facility. We also feature: interior corridors, elevator, handicap accessible facilities, in every room, and free local calls. Guests wishing to indulge can request an executive suite or a guest room with a beautiful mountain view. To ensure a great start to the day, we serve a complimentary extended continental breakfast every morning. Guests planning a meeting or event in Chapmanville will appreciate the on-site meeting space flexible enough to suit any meeting or event need. This hotel offers ample guest parking.

name: Best Western Plus Bridgeport Inn
description: Searching for Bridgeport West Virginia hotels with full service accommodations then look no further than the Best Western Plus Bridgeport Inn. We are the only full service hotel with 164 guest rooms, a restaurant, lounge, fitness room, refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers and 37 inch flat screen TV's, guest laundry and outdoor pool, airport shuttle, business center and 3,000 square feet of conference / meeting space. On and Offsite Catering available. Professional event planner on property. Our property is also close to the FBI Complex, WV Army National Guard, United Hospital Center and the Bridgeport Recreation Complex. Four destinations that bring many guest to our Bridgeport West Vrginia Hotel.

name: Beverly-Fairmont Turnpike
description: The main column of Confederate Gen. William Jones rode by here April 29, 1863 en route to attacking the B&O Railroad Bridge, part of the objective of the 1863 Jones-Imboden Raid. This is the northern end of the Beverly-Fairmont Turnpike, a gravel road completed in 1852. Trails sign at 100 Kirk St.

name: Beverly Heritage Center
description: The Beverly Heritage Center combines four historic buildings in the center of Beverly, West Virginia, to tell the story of the Battle of Rich Mountain and the First Campaign of the American Civil War, the pivotal role of the Staunton-Parkersburg Turnpike, and daily life in a small rural county seat through the 19th century. Off-Season Hours-(Non-Summer/Travel Season Months) Thursday through Monday — 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. Tuesday and Wednesday by chance or appointment Closed Major Holidays Summer Hours-(mid-May through Labor Day) Thursday, Friday, Saturday: 10 a.m. - 6 p.m. Sunday – Wednesday: 11 a.m. - 5 p.m.

name: Bicentennial Inn – Home of 88 Restaurant and Lounge and The Peak Pavilion
description: The Bicentennial Inn - Buckhannon’s Hotel featuring 47 comfortable rooms, great food, banquet facilities, and catering services. Plus, live music every Friday night from 9pm - midnight. The Peak Pavilion is now available to rent for private parties and events! A great place to eat, play and stay! With pure, heart and soul hospitality, we are your home away from home!

name: Big Anchor Campground
description: 75 Lot RV and Camper Campground with riverfront and one row back from river camping. The entire campground is full hookup-direct sewage, direct water and direct electric hookups on every lot. We also offer 5 temporary full hookup lots for weekly or montly camping. We feature 30/50amp electric and 110 plug-in, 3 stall shower/bathroom trailer (private & clean), large metal garbage cans, large pavilion, fire ring, picnic tables, firewood for sale, beach area, fishing area, boat/kayak access to river, pet friendly, commerical playground, basketball court, soccer field, dumping station and water filling station.
address: 661 South Branch River Rd., Romney, WV, 26757

name: Big Bear Lake Camplands
description: Our privately owned family oriented facility was developed with fun, relaxation, and fellowship in mind. We are committed to a safe, convenient, and affordable camping experience. Unlike many campgrounds and RV parks, Big Bear Lake Camplands is a deeded property development. If you are interested in being a property owner, our comprehensive real estate staff is here to assist you. Want the Big Bear experience, but not quite ready for the commitment? Then Beaver Creek Village is just what you are looking for. Our exclusive overnight campground offers several camping options. Cabins We offer both one room and two room cabins in Beaver Creek Village at Big Bear lake Camplands. Staying in a cabin is both easy and economical - all you need to supply is bed linens, cooking and eating utensils, and personal items. All of our cabins are equipped with air conditioners, picnic tables, a fire ring and charcoal grill. Our cabins are not equipped with bathrooms or kitchens. Comfort stations, restrooms and hot showers are within walking distance. Tent Camping Standard Tent Sites: Electric hookup Fire Ring Picnic Table On site parking for one vehicle Off season rates are: April 13th to May 21st and September 5th to October 29th; Summer Rates are: May 22nd to September 4th Standard Site $30*; Week Day Standard Site $40*; Week End Standard Site $50* (Two night minimum stay on Holiday weekends). Standard RV/Tent site Back in site Electric Only Picnic Table Fire Ring Off season rates are: April 13th to May 21st and September 5th to October 29th; Summer Rates are: May 22nd to September 4th. Standard Site $30*; Week Day Standard Site $40* ; Week End Standard Site $50* (Two night minimum stay on all Holiday weekends). Bearfoot Springs water park is the newest entertainment attraction located inside of Big Bear Lake camplands. This waterpark is for the exclusive use of Big Bear Lake property owners, their guests, and overnight Beaver Creek Village campers. Located in an area called Yukon Circle which hosts most of Big Bear Lakes other recreation facilities such as mini-golf, the tennis courts, basketball area, volleyball, and horseshoe pits. With basketball, tennis, and volleyball courts, and our newly opened water park, Bearfoot Springs, Big Bear Lake offers mountains of outdoor activities such as hiking, biking, kayaking, etc. Hikers and bikers find our world class trail system both exciting and challenging, with some of best foliage and terrain on the east coast. Come and enjoy a weekend get away or your vacation at Big Bear Lake’s "Beaver Creek Village". Stay on one of 25 wooded rv sites located close to all the activities. With several different campsite options including rustic tent sites, standard rv sites with electric hook up, pull through full hook up sites with electric, sewage, and water hook up, and cabins.
address: 450 Big Bear Lake Rd., Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: Big Belly Deli
description: Big Belly Deli was founded in 2013 with the idea that food should be not only quick, but fun, filling, and inexpensive. We searched the globe (or at least our little corner of it) to bring you the best ingredients that we could find for our made-to-order sandwiches and deli salads, soups and baked goods to meats and cheeses by the pound. We wanted to make sure that you never went hungry. Oh, who are we kidding? We just wanted to be able to get a Pastrami sandwich in this town.

name: Big Bend Campground (USDA Forest Service)
description: Big Bend is located in the Smoke Hole Canyon next to the South Branch of the Potomac River at the end of County Route 2. Located 10 miles south west of Petersburg, West Virginia. Big Bend offers 46 sites; 18 sites are non-reservable. Twelve sites on the river loop have tent pads. All sites have a lantern holder, picnic table and fire ring. Drinking water is available. There are two pit toilets, one shower house, and flush toilet restrooms in each loop. There is also a dump and fill station. Upper Loop Sites 13-30 are not reserveable and are on a first-come, first-serve basis. The River Loop sites and the Double Campsites are reserveable. More information on this campground is available through the Potomac Ranger District, HC 240, Petersburg, WV 26847. (304) 257-4488, extension 0 or 304-478-2000 or by contacting American Land and Leisure. Reservations can be made online at https://www.recreation.gov/, or by calling (877) 444-6777. Available from Open: Mar. 31 -Oct. 28.

name: Big Bend Golf Course
description: Eighteen hole championship golf course, par 71; 6,237 yards. Course rating: back 69.9; slope 116, middle 68.7; slope 114. There is a pro shop and snack bar that serves hot sandwiches and beverages. The Golf Course is located in Tornado, WV. Take I-64 west from Charleston, exit at Institute and turn West onto Route 25. Turn left at the stop light and cross the St. Albans Bridge. Go under the railroad underpass. Turn right at the stoplight (onto 6th Ave.). Follow 6th Avenue around the 1/2 loop and turn right onto the bridge, onto West Main. Follow to the Fire Department and turn left onto Coal River Road. Stay on Coal River Road until you see a sign on the left to Big Bend Golf Course. Summer: 7 a.m. - dusk; Winter hours: 9 a.m. - dusk.

name: Big Branch Falls
description: Big Branch Falls call the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve home, flowing through a dense canopy of green and blanketed wildflower forest. This cascading wonder has an 8-foot drop that spans out across bedrock to create the perfect heavenly backdrop. To find this scenic wonder, begin at Brooks Falls Parking Area before crossing the road to find the start of the Big Branch Trail, which will take you on a 2-mile loop, passing by the falls.

name: Big Ditch Lake – WMA-Webster
description: (388 acres) Webster County. Located one-half mile from Cowen on County Route 30, 15 miles southwest of Webster Springs. Big Ditch is located in a valley with moderate side slopes offering small game, waterfowl and bow hunting. HUNTING IS LIMITED DUE TO THE SIZE OF THE AREA. The lake was built in 1969 with a maximum depth of 16 feet and an average depth of 5 feet. The lake is usually clear; however, summer growth of aquatic weeds can be a nuisance to shoreline anglers. Picnic facilities, foot trails, pit toilets, drinking water, and boat launching facilities are available. Electric motors only are allowed. Camping and the use of live minnows for bait are prohibited. Big Ditch Lake is a 55-acre warm water impoundment located 1 mile west of Cowen in Webster County. The lake is part of the 380-acre Big Ditch Wildlife Management Area and is accessible from WV Route 20. Big Ditch Lake provides a warmwater fishery for largemouth bass, tiger musky, black crappie, bluegill, green sunfish, channel catfish, and carp. Growth of bass, crappie, and bluegill is fair and the lake provides good catches of these species. Growth and catches of channel catfish have been excellent. Six artificial fish attractors have been placed in the lake and are marked for fisherman use. Fishing accommodations provided for the physically disabled.

name: Big Earl’s Campground
description: 14 RV Sites available with water and power hookups (20, 30, and 50 amp. breakers) also access to our shower house, restrooms, and washer/dryer; lots of tent sites in open field. We also have 4 Amish built cabins that include: Room for four adults, full width front porch, heat and A/C, refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, kitchen sink, commode and lavatory. Amish built furniture in all cabins, hardwood floors, mattress sheets and pillows furnished, and ceiling fans.

name: Big Ridge Campground
description: Private wooded sites, bathhouse, hot showers, electric hookups, dump stations, horse camping available, horseback riding, hiking trails and swimming are available within walking distance at Lost River State park. Fishing nearby. Campsites: 22 tent, 7 trailer, 15 tent or trailer; year-round camping available for smaller trailers with minimal services available. Season: May 1- October 15 Location: I-81 exit 257, adjoining Lost River State Park.

name: Big Rock Campground (USDA Forest Service)
description: Five semi-private campsites. Sites will accommodate small campers. Each site features a picnic table, fire ring, lantern pole, 2 non-accessible vault toilets, gravel parking spur and activity area. Sites are suitable for tents or small - medium size campers. There is no electric available. No dump station is available. There are two privately owned dump stations available in Richwood. Dogs are permitted if on a leash at all times. Leash must be 6 ft. or shorter. Food storage order applies to pet food also. Location: Located on forest road 76 approximately 7 miles north of Richwood, WV. Directions: from Richwood travel one mile east on state route 39/55, then 6 miles north on Forest Road 76. More information on this campground is available through the Gauley Ranger District, 932 North Fork Cherry Rd., Richwood, WV 26261 (304) 846-2695. Camping season: Apr - Nov. Maximum length of stay is 14 days; Check-out time is 2:00 p.m. Location: Located on Forest Road 76 approximately 7 miles north of Richwood, WV. Directions: from Richwood travel one mile east on state route 39/55, then 6 miles north on forest road 76. More information on this campground is available through the Gauley Ranger District, 932 North Fork Cherry Rd., Richwood, WV 26261 (304) 846-2695.

name: Big Sandy Superstore Arena
description: The Big Sandy Superstore Arena sits on a five-acre tract overlooking the Ohio River in downtown Huntington. A 9,000-seat multi-purpose arena with attached conference center, the Big Sandy Superstore Arena is the largest in the Tri-State. The arena hosts numerous concerts, family shows, trade shows and regional/state athletic competitions year-round. The Convention Center has over 15,000 square feet of flexible space for meetings, weddings or training sessions.
address: One Civic Center Plaza, Huntington, WV, 25701

name: Big T Shop & Franklin Florist
description: We are a combination florist, clothing and gift shop providing fresh cut flowers, bouquets and floral arrangements for all occasions since 1990. We also sell silk flowers, balloon bouquets, potted plants and cards for every occasion. Free local delivery provided. We are located on Main Street directly across from the town parking lot. We are a Teleflora Florist and accept Visa and Mastercard. Hours: Monday - Friday 9 a.m. - 5 p.m.; Saturday: 9 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.; Closed Sunday

name: Big Timber Brewing
description: Big Timber Brewing’s brewery and taproom is located in the Heart of Appalachia, Elkins, West Virginia. Our name pays homage to the surrounding forests and the industry that built our community. We make beer we love and enjoy doing it, creating a product that we, our town, and our State can take pride in. What started as a dream, became a reality in 2014 when our first keg went out the door, and our commitment to our beer, our community, and our dream continues to grow stronger everyday.

name: Big Wheel
description: Wagon wheels abound in this casual, local favorite. We have homemade pulled pork barbecue, made from scratch coleslaw, hand pattied hamburgers, and full salad bar. We serve old fashioned milkshakes, malts, coke floats, sundaes, Blue Bunny hand dipped ice cream, banana splits and gourmet pies. We take pride in our country homecooked food from our homemade chicken and dumplings or meatloaf, to our locally grown hand snapped fresh green beans and batter dipped by order fried green tomatoes. Every Friday at 4 p.m., we start serving our all-you-can-eat southern fried chicken - in house only - and comes with your choice of side, one trip to our salad bar and roll. Monday–Friday: 6:30 a.m. – 9 p.m.; Saturday-Sunday: 7 a.m. – 9 p.m.

name: Bike Friendly Matewan
description: With the help of the Turn This Town Around initiative, Bike Friendly Matewan was created. As part of this initiative, a new bicycle station was built outside the Matewan Depot Replica Museum. Several map boards are found throughout downtown outlining possible routes for bikers to enjoy. Bike racks are also found throughout downtown, allowing visitors to take a break and enjoy some local cuisine, visit locally owned shops, or take a better look at the history Matewan offers. We also feature Bicycle Safety courses designed for educating individuals about Bicycle Safety.

name: Bishop Knob Campground (USDA Forest Service)
description: A 60-unit wooded, semi-primitive campground centrally located on a ridgetop between the Cranberry and Williams Rivers. Facilities: There are two loops with 49 single campsites and 6 double sites. Each site includes a picnic table, fire ring and lantern post with a gravel parking spur and an activity area. There is one handpump in each loop. There are 4 accessible vault toilet buildings. Sites are not reservable. Sites are on a first come, first serve basis. Directions: From Richwood travel east on State Route 39/55 to Forest Road 76, travel for 6 miles north to Forest Road 81. Follow Forest Road 81 for 6 miles to Forest Road 101. From Dyer, go east on State Route 46 to Forest Road 101. Follow Forest Road 101 3 miles to the campground. Season: 4/15 - 11/30; Fee: $8.00. More information on this campground is available through the Gauley Ranger District, 932 North Fork Cherry Rd., Richwood, WV 26261 or by calling 304-846-2695.

name: Bisou Bistro at The Canal House
description: Located in a charming 1790's stone house in historic Harpers Ferry–Bolivar, Our Menu is seasonally changed to offer classic New Orleans Cajun & Creole French cuisine. We focus on, fresh, delicious, local food in a friendly and casual atmosphere. While holding true to our South Louisiana Heritage, we also have developed gluten free and allergy sensitive versions of most items. Owner & Executive Chef Kevin Plunkett, a New Orleans Native and Classically trained French Chef, is passionate about sustainability and supporting local producers whenever possible. Chef has made a commitment to transform a little slice of West Virginia into Cajun Country with a dash of South Louisiana Hospitality and traditional New Orleans fare. We also offer Vegetarian and Vegan options with the same New Orleans Flair. We do not post our vegetarian or vegan options because as a Farm to Table restaurant, we rely on our producers to inspire us!! Just come in and ask one of our servers what our daily offerings are, or send Chef an e-mail and he will let you know. We also serve a great selection of domestic and international wines.
address: 1226 West Washington Street, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Bistro 112
description: Bistro 112 is a neighborhood French Bistro in the center of historic downtown Shepherdstown. The Bistro, decorated in eclectic art, offers creative French food at affordable prices. Built in 1830, the Bistro has several dining areas: front bar, upstairs salon or outdoor patio under wisteria. We prepare locally grown ingredients into French favorites such as steak au poivre, coquille St Jacques, roasted chicken, salad nicoise, pommes frites, savory & sweet crepes, house made soups and rich desserts. We have a cozy martini bar. We are dog friendly. Free wifi. Wheelchair accessible. Rooms are available for private events.

name: Black Bear Burritos
description: Black Bear Burritos has the right variety for every food mood. Exotic and international cuisine are beside all-American classics on the menu, and customers can even build their own orders. The Black Bear has live entertainment six nights a week.

name: Black Bear Evansdale
description: Worldly burritos served in a unique, family-friendly Appalachian atmosphere.
address: 3119 University Ave., Suite B, Morgantown, WV, 3119 University Ave., Suite B

name: Black Dog Ranch Off-Road Resort
description: The Black Dog Ranch Off-Road Resort consists of 3 rental units located on two hundred pristine acres conveniently located at Windmill Gap in southern West Virginia. The Bailey House is a 3-bedroom farmhouse. Kate's Place is a large, modern 2 -bedroom mobile home with an added sunroom. Ted’s Place is a newly renovated 2-bedroom mobile home. These three units are within 100 yards of each other. Please refer to the web page for pictures and lists of the many amenities. Conveniently located on the Indian Ridge Hatfield McCoy Trail System, less than two miles from the Pocahontas Trail System, and short ATV ride via local trails to the Pinnacle Creek Trail System. All three trail systems can be accessed without trailering ATVs. Convenient, clean, and comfortable the Black Dog Ranch offers many amenities. If your goal is to ATV/4 wheel, hunt, hike, bird watch, star gaze or simply get away, the Black Dog Ranch is your best choice. 40 minutes from I77 or US-460. Immediate access to trails. Amenities include: Additional miles of unpaved roads nearby; immediate access to trails - no need to haul or trailer ATVs; weekend, weekday, and weekly rate packages available; units have full kitchen and laundry facilities; color TV featuring satellite service (all premium channels) and DVD Player in each unit; free WiFi; electric heat and air conditioning in all units; private parking for trucks, trailers and ATVs; linen (towels & sheets) and cleaning included in price of rental; each unit has a commercial charcoal grill; each unit has a fire pit with stock of complementary firewood; two units have garages with air compressor, lights, and 20 amp receptacles. Located 3 hours from Winston Salem, NC and 2 hours from Charleston, WV, Bristol, TN, and Roanoke, VA. on 200 scenic and serene mountaintop acres. All Paved Access-No dusty roads to soil your truck! Visa and MasterCard accepted.

name: Black Draft Distillery
description: Black Draft Distillery is the first grain-to-glass craft distillery in Martinsburg, WV since prohibition. Founded in December of 2014, we produce small-batch whiskey and bourbon, using local natural ingredients. Black Draft's Barrels even have West Virginia Wood in them! Black Draft Distillery currently offer tours on Saturdays by appointment between 11am to 5pm. To schedule a tour, please contact by phone 540-686-0100 or email info@blackdraftdistillery.com.

name: Marsh Fork Falls and Black Fork Falls
description: Twin Falls Resort State Park is home to two seasonal waterfalls that give the park its name – Marsh Fork Falls and Black Fork Falls. Found in the rugged mountains of southern West Virginia, these falls can be viewed from the 1-mile Falls Trail loop within the park. Marsh Fork Falls and Black Fork Falls tend to dry up during the warmer months, so be sure to visit them after a little rain or in the spring and winter seasons.

name: Black Sheep Burritos & Brews
description: If you’re looking for a unique place to eat and relax, Black Sheep Burrito & Brews is a place to separate from the flock and identify yourself however you please. Known for unique burritos and craft beer. With a menu that boasts burrito-based foods with fresh ingredients, other world street fares, and numerous craft beer choices, patrons have the ability to be whomever they feel. Locations in Charleston and Huntington.

name: Blackwater Bikes
description: Come and enjoy the best mountain biking in the East. We are a full service bicycle store with retail sales, rentals service, and repairs by certified mechanics, along with best biking info to be had.

name: Blackwater Outdoor Adventures
description: Blackwater Outdoor Adventures is an outfitter located on the Cheat River near Blackwater Falls and Canaan Valley, WV. We specialize in whitewater rafting and canoeing, duckies, camping, fishing, flyfishing lessons and guiding, tubing and kayaking. We offer outdoor adventure for families. Seasons are spring, summer and fall.

name: Blackwater WMA-Tucker/Preston
description: 58,978 acres - Hunting for bear, turkey, deer, snowshoe hare, squirrel, and grouse. Trapping for fisher, beaver, fox, raccoon, and bobcat. Blackwater River, Horseshoe Run, Clover Run and Slip Hill Run provide excellent trout fishing. Ten (primitive) campsites, picnic areas/shelters, and pit toilets available at Horseshoe Recreation Area. Recreation area closed winter months/opens May 30. Seventy-five primitive campsites are located along Canaan Loop Road. Class Q hunter accommodations provided.
address: WVDNR Wildlife Resources Section 1110 Railroad St., Farmington, WV, 26571

name: The Blennerhassett Hotel
description: For more than a century, The Blennerhassett has imparted upon its guests the uniquely attentive service for which its name has become legendary. While we celebrate our storied past, we believe our legacy to be an obligation, not a birthright. Our enduring commitment is a passionate and unfaltering dedication to fulfill the needs and surpass the expectations of every guest. Share the legacy.

name: Blennerhassett Island Historical State Park
description: Blennerhassett Island is a gem. Visiting the island is ‘a must see’ attraction in West Virginia. Located on a small island in the Ohio River, Blennerhassett Island Historical State Park features a Palladian mansion and museum visited by 40,000 people each year.

name: Blue Bend Recreation Area (USDA Forest Service)
description: Constructed in the 1930's by the Civilian Conservation Corps, Blue Bend is in a rustic and beautiful setting along scenic Anthony Creek. The area serves both campers and daytime visitors, and is popular for fishing, swimming, hiking, and picnicking. Individual picnic sites are not reservable. Pavilion reservations may be made online or by calling 877-444-6777. Camping reservations for Blue Meadow Group Campground can be made online or by calling 877-444-6777. No water in Blue Meadow. Running water available in Summer only. Hand Pump available Spring/Fall. Flush toilets available in camping areas. Vault toilets are all that is available in Spring/Fall. Maximum length of stay: 14 days maximum number of campers per site: 8. Directions: From White Sulphur Springs, travel 8 miles north on State Route 92. Turn left (west) at Alvon, West Virginia, onto State Route 16. Travel 4 miles to the recreation area.
address: Monongahela National Forest, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Blue Goose Inn
description: The Blue Goose Inn is a historic building that was built in 1911. The Blue Goose Inn is best for trail riders looking for a comfortable and affordable place to spend the night after a long day on the trails. There are rooms for groups as well as rooms for two. There is also a coal miner’s den, which connects four rooms together, each room sleeping up to four people. Satellite television and wireless Internet are provided to all guests. There is also truck/trailer and secure ATV parking with every Blue Goose Inn suite rental.

name: Blue Moon Cafe
description: Best known for great homemade dishes from soup to quiche to steak and cheese subs. The artwork decorating the cafe wall offers an eclectic view at this hot spot. The Blue Moon Cafe proudly offers many things from our local farms, ice creameries, bee hives and roasters! We will be offering Weekend Dinner Specials every Friday and Saturday from 5 - 9 PM. Open Monday - Sunday: 11AM - 9PM

name: The Blue Spoon Cafe
description: The Blue Spoon Cafe is 'Darling Dining' at it's best. This adorable cafe is open for Breakfast and Lunch. It's dishes focus on fresh, organic ingredients. There are new seasonal specials that are updated weekly. Catering is also available for baby showers, weddings etc.

name: Bluefield Arts Center
description: The city of Bluefield located in southern West Virginia is a community passionate about the arts. The Bluefield Arts Center located downtown, is the focal point for the arts serving Bluefield and surrounding region. The Bluefield Arts Center provides two galleries, a neoclassic performing arts center, and restaurant with a comfortable and inviting atmosphere. The Center also serves the local community by housing offices for small businesses.

name: Bluefield City Park and Recreation Center
description: The City of Bluefield Parks and Recreation Department is excited to serve your leisure needs and interests through our development of recreation programs and facilities. We provide a picnic area with 4 pavilions (tables and grills under sheds), playground, softball fields, football stadium, youth center with recreational equipment, walking trails, tennis courts and gymnasium with indoor goals.

name: Bluefield Elks Golf Course
description: Avid golfers and beginners will enjoy this scenic nine-hole golf course on one of the oldest courses in Mercer County which opened in 1912. The 9-hole "Bluefield Elks" course at the Bluefield Elks Club facility in Bluefield, West Virginia features 2,776 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 35. The course rating is 35.1 and it has a slope rating of 123. After a few rounds, grab some lunch or dinner and relax with friends and family. Hours: Sun-Thurs: 1pm - 1am; Fri: 1pm - 2am; Sat: 11:30am - 2am; Sun: 1pm - 1am

name: Bluefield Inn
description: Enjoy this 5-star rated bed and breakfast offering elegant and comfortable accommodations. Perfect site for events, special meals and meetings. The beautiful 113-year-old mansion is listed on the National Historic Register. All room have their own en-suite bathroom with upscale linens and amenities, furnished with original art and beautiful chandeliers. Open daily from 8am - 6pm.

name: Bluestone Dam
description: Bluestone Dam spans the New River, forming Bluestone Lake, the third largest lake in West Virginia. With a 2,040 acre surface area, the lake provides boaters, water skiers, and fishermen with great recreational opportunities. This concrete gravity dam is used for flood control, recreation, fish and wildlife. Easily accessible from I-77 and I-64, Bluestone Lake is located at Hinton, WV, on WV 3 and 20.
address: US Army Corps of Engineers, 701 Miller Ave., Hinton, WV, 25951

name: Bluestone National Scenic River
description: Bluestone National Scenic River was created in 1988, to protect 10.5 miles of the Bluestone River as a free-flowing river. This stretch of river is also managed by the West Virginia Division of Natural Resources as part of the Bluestone Wildlife Management Area. Whitewater boating is possible at some water levels. Camping is prohibited, but is available at the adjacent state parks. The 8-mile Bluestone Turnpike Trail, is open to hikers, mountain bikers, and horseback riders. Hunting and fishing are allowed at Bluestone National Scenic River, although hunting is prohibited at the adjacent state parks.

name: Bluestone Nursery
description: Choose-and-cut Christmas tree farm, where holiday traditions and environmental stewardship go hand in hand. Christmas trees stabilize the soil, protect water quality and provide cover for wildlife. Growing Christmas trees absorb carbon dioxide while emitting fresh oxygen. They also beautify the landscape with their classic shape and lush foliage – something not found on artificial trees. Best of all, they can be easily recycled after the holiday. So gather up your family and friends and get out there – your perfect Christmas tree awaits you at this choose-and-cut Christmas tree farm. Directions: Leave I-77 At Exit 20; Turn South (right) on US 19 and go 2 Miles; turn right on Stovall Ridge Road and travel 3.2 miles to the farm. Parking is available in front of the house. Hours: Thanksgiving To Christmas Eve. Monday-Saturday, 9am to dark; Sunday, Noon to dark.
address: 3517 Stovall Ridge Rd., Camp Creek, WV, 25820

name: Bluestone State Park
description: Bluestone State Park is the perfect lakeside retreat camping spot, located along the state’s third-largest body of water. Bluestone is home to four distinct campgrounds, with a combined total of 120 campsites. Meador Campground has 32 sites that are open to both RV and tent campers, seven of which offer electric and water hookups. Fifteen of the sites are electric only. The campground also offers a central bathhouse for guests. Old Mill Campground offers 44 rustic campsites. The campground is open to both RV and tent campers. The campground has a central bathhouse available for all guests. Looking for a remote experience? Then East Shore Campground is for you. The campground offers 39 primitive sites that are accessible by boat only. NOTE: East Shore Campground will not open in 2020 due to the Phase 5 renovation/construction of the Bluestone Dam project by the Army Corps of Engineers. Bluestone State Park has 26 cabins located in a wooded area on the mountainside above the Bluestone River. Cabins accommodate two to eight people, so they’re perfect for romantic retreats or family vacations. Select cabins are pet-friendly. Cabin guests also have access to nearby Pipestem Resort State Park’s facilities, including an indoor pool and sauna for some more rest and relaxation. Cabins are available year-round. Check in begins at 4 p.m., and check out is by 10 a.m. for all cabins.

name: Bluestone Wildlife Management Area
description: Bluestone Wildlife Management Area offers visitors a variety of outdoor recreational opportunities on 17,632 acres. Being adjacent to Bluestone Lake, the state's second largest body of water, the area offers guests boating, canoeing and fishing opportunities. Hunting is offered due to the wildlife management area status, and Bluestone has over 330 primitive campsites and picnic sites along New River, Bluestone Lake and Indian Creek. Avid fishermen can enjoy float fishing and stocked trout fishing in Indian Creek. Hiking and equestrian trails are also popular. Summers County Camping operates the campgrounds: "Bertha", "The Mouth of Indian Creek", "Cedar Branch" and "Shanklin's Ferry" in the Bluestone Wildlife Management Area. Over 200 primitive campsites. May 15th - September 14th: The site fee is $20 per night and $100 per week. ​September 15th - May 14th: The site fee is $15 per night and $75 per week. The sites are on a first come first serve basis. We do not take reservations.

name: Boar’s Nest ATV Lodge
description: The place to stay, play and relax near The Hatfield McCoy trail system! Amenities include: 3 bedrooms with 8 total beds, 2 recliners, a couch to sleep on, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen including: stove, refrigerator, pots, pans, tableware, silverware, coffee pot, microwave and more; Washer and dryer; 2 flat screen HDTV's with Direct TV digital service and a DVD player; Free wireless internet and phone with unlimited long distance calling; Living room and dining room with dining table; Central air conditioning and heat that you control from a digital thermostat; Extra floor space if you need to bring sleeping bags, air mattress or cots; A full flat acre of property for parking and relaxing with a fire pit; Charcoal Weber BBQ grill and tools; Indoor storage for ATV's to keep them dry and secure; Front and Back decks to hang out on; Direct trail head access for Buffalo Mountain at Matewan is less than a mile up the road; Restaurants, fuel, snacks, supplies etc., begin across the road and end in Matewan, WV or Buskirk, KY about a mile up the road, all are accessible by ATV.

name: Bob Evans – Lewisburg
description: Family-style restaurant serving breakfast all day, as well as lunch and dinner. Specializing in providing farm-fresh food and quality customer service at fair prices. Open Sun-Sat: 7am - 9pm.
address: One Gateway Blvd - Rt. 219 N, Lewisburg, WV, 24901

name: The Bodega Market and Cafe
description: The Bodega Market & Cafe is a fun place to eat and shop. We feature locally sourced ingredients in our gourmet sandwiches & soups, unique grocery items for the "foodie", over 180 craft beers and a fine selection of boutique wines.

name: Bonnett Run Basketry
description: Handmade baskets, basketry kits, and basketry education programs and classes. Visiting our studio and shopping can take place any day. Call first. Basketry education programs can include a "natural materials walk" teaching identification , gathering and preparation techniques for honeysuckle, cattails, yucca, and bark. "Learn to make a Basket" Classes are also available with several styles, prices, and materials to choose from. We specialize in family classes (6 year old minimum). All education classes are scheduled individually. Please call one week ahead to make arrangements.

name: Bonnie Dwaine B&B
description: Charming, Elegant, Romantic Victorian featuring many antiques with a bit of contemporary flair. 5 Guest rooms; each featuring private adjoining bath, whirlpool tub/shower, fireplace, cable T.V. private phone, high-speed wireless Internet and much, much more. Saturday and Sunday mornings feature a gourmet breakfast in the formal dining room. Monday through Friday enjoy an extended continental breakfast. Corporate/weekly rates are available.

name: Booker T. Washington Boyhood Cabin
description: Located just behind the African Zion Baptist Church, Booker's cabin was built to match a photograph of his home. Booker T. Washington had a major influence on southern race relations and was the dominant figure in black public affairs from 1895 until his death in 1915. Born into slavery and illiteracy, Washington rose up to become the foremost educator and leader of black Americans at the turn of the century. In 1865, the nine-year-old Booker walked with his family 225 miles from Hales Ford, VA, to his freedom home in Malden. There he labored as a salt-packer and worked in the coal mines before becoming a houseboy for the wife of Lewis Ruffner, owner of the mines. She encouraged Booker to continue his education and, in 1872, he entered the Hampton Agricultural Institute. A forceful speaker, Washington became skilled in politics. Powerful and influential in both white and black communities, Washington was a confidential advisor to U.S. presidents. For years, presidential political appointments of African Americans were cleared through Washington. A man who overcame near-impossible odds himself, Booker T. Washington is best remembered for helping black Americans rise up from the economic slavery that held them down for so long after they were legally free citizens.

name: Boparc
description: The Morgantown Board of Parks and Recreation (BOPARC) is committed to providing a quality system of parks, trails, facilities and programs that enhance the community and the well-being of the residents.

name: Bowden National Fish Hatchery
description: Bowden Hatchery was built in the early 1960’s by the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service. The WV DNR took over operation and ownership of the hatchery on July 1, 1997. Water is supplied by the North Spring and the South Spring as well as the Shavers Fork River for a combined flow of approximately 4,000 gallons per minute. Nearby Shavers Fork, Gandy Creek and Glady Fork, as well as other waters around the state, are stocked from Bowden Hatchery. Annual production of trout is over 170,000 pounds, which is typically about 240,000 trout! Bowden spawns brook and brown trout and receives rainbow and golden trout eggs from Petersburg Hatchery. Rearing facilities consist of 40 concrete raceways, each 100 feet long and configured in two pair series. Six half acre ponds are also used seasonally for the rearing of muskies. The Bowden Fishing Derby is held here every June. This event is for children 3-14 and takes place on the Saturday of the state's free fishing days. Three ponds are filled and stocked especially for this event. Two ponds are for the young anglers to harvest several trout while the third pond is Catch and Release. Visiting hours are from 7:30 AM to 3:00 PM every day, pending on weather conditions. Hatchery open 7:30am - 3:00pm daily. Visitor Center closed indefinitely. No public restrooms. Located 10 miles east of Elkins, WV on old U.S. Highway 33. Old rt. 33 E Bowden, WV.

name: Bowers Maple Farm
description: Bowers Maple Farm was founded by Carl Bowers in 1998 and is currently owned and operated by Mark Bowers. Just 9 miles South on Rt. 220 outside of Petersburg, WV. Product from this farm can be purchased in Petersburg at the South Side Depot.

name: Out of the Box Room Escape
description: Do you have what it takes to escape in 60 minutes or less? Prove it! Work together with your teammates to find clues and solve puzzles to beat the room!You look around and notice strange items, markings, and messages. In an escape room experience, players will be "locked" (only in your imagination!) in a themed room and use out-of-the-box thinking and teamwork to solve a series of puzzles using clues found around the room. We recommend at least 4 players for the best experience!

name: Boyce Art Glass
description: Hand-blown and hand-crafted art glass. Kevin Lee Boyce went to work at a glass factory after graduating from high school in 1977. After workingwith glass for 22 years, Kevin’s dream of starting his own business became a reality in July of 1999. He has extended his dreams to his wife, Edna, and their family and they look forward to being of service to you. Tours: No set hours. Call ahead for tours. We also have an online catalogue at http://www.boyceartglass.com/.

name: Boyer Motel, Restaurant and Campground
description: Our motel offers 20 charming, comfortable units. We have both single and double occupancy rooms, and each room features a private bath, television, air conditioning, and electric heat. We also feature a campground with 6 full hook-ups, 30 electric hook-ups, two bath houses and a restaurant on site. The campground and restaurant are seasonal. Our campground offers all the amenities any camper would expect, such as: Water and electric hookups Picnic tables on each site Hot showers with private dressing rooms Flush toilets (with privacy) Sewer hookups Dump station Playground Grocery stores and gas stations nearby Boyer Station is located on Route 28/92 in Boyer, West Virginia. It is about 14 miles from Cass Scenic Railroad State Park, or about 6 miles north of Green Bank.

name: Bramwell High School ATV Lodge
description: This old high school has been turned into a convenient lodging facility for ATV riders. It is less than two miles from trail connector for the Hatfield-McCoy Trail. Choose from dormitory rooms or private rooms .

name: Bramwell Hill Manor
description: Located in Historic Bramwell, just a 1/4 mile from the Hatfield McCoy's Pocahontas trailhead. This spacious 4 bedroom house is a great option for families or groups of riders. This ATV friendly house gives you the feeling of home while offering access to the trails. It also features a full kitchen, free WiFi, and parking for trailers behind the house.

name: Bramwell Historic District
