description: The Bramwell Additions Historic District in Bramwell, West Virginia memorializes the African American contribution to the economic and social development of the Pocahontas coalfields. The site is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
address: Bramwell Town Hall / 100 Simmons Ave., Main Street, Bramwell, WV, 24715

name: Bramwell Soda Fountain and Corner Shop
description: Step back in time and treat yourself to a famous soda foundation drink and a famous burger from the menu. Featuring homemade ice cream, and a "real" gooseneck soda fountain, The Corner Shop serves up all your favorite floats, shakes, sundae's, splits, and cones!!! Also, don't miss our huge "millionaire" burgers, and delicious hot dogs made with homemade chili.

name: Bramwell Train Depot Visitor Center
description: Begin your visit to historic Bramwell with a stop at the Bramwell Trail Depot Visitor Center. Spend some time viewing the exhibits in the museum area, pick up a Historic Bramwell Walking Tour brochure and visit the gift shop to purchase West Virginia made items or a book on local history. The Depot is a great place to visit for travel and attraction information if you are traveling the Coal Heritage Trail, a National Scenic Byway.

name: Brandon’s BBQ
description: More than BBQ, Brandon’s is fine dining at a great value. Whether your passion is barbecue or a great steak, or all your kids will eat are chicken strips, we’ve got the dishes for you! Check out our full menu and see actual pictures of food we serve. We serve the best to the best, our friends and customers! We use only the best, freshest ingredients money can buy. Brandon makes his own sauces, rubs, desserts & more! Comfortable and friendly setting for couples, families, college kids, etc. Weekly specials that will keep you constantly surprised at what we offer! Brandon’s offers catering for groups and parties of 15 or more!

name: Brandywine Motel
description: The motel has moderately priced rooms, 2 full-size beds, AC, showers, remote control 40 channel TV, and you don't have to get in your car to find a good place for meals, especially if you like pizza. Smoking and pets are not permitted in the motel rooms. Brandywine Motel is tucked behind Fox's Pizza, away from the traffic and noise. There is an inconspicuous sign, easily missed, so use Fox's Pizza as your landmark, since the restaurant houses the motel office as well.

name: Brass Pineapple Bed & Breakfast Inn
description: Our elegant, cozy, Inn is accommodating to business & leisure travelers and is an excellent alternative to hotels in the Charleston area. Located in Charleston’s quiet historic district, ½ block from the State Capitol Complex, just off I-77 & I-64, this early 1900’s home has an eclectic blend of Art Nouveau and Victorian styles. The Inn is smoke free, we use biodegradable cleansers, and no air fresheners or perfumes. The Inn is excellent for allergy sensitive people. The well lighted guest rooms have private bathrooms and are furnished with pristine Victorian antiques, comfortable mattresses, soft-ironed sheets, terry robes, and hair dryers. Each room is equipped with free high speed wireless internet, desk, phone, tv and vcr. Our interior walls are plaster covered bricks that allow for an almost soundproofed environment. A full breakfast is served each morning and an afternoon tea featuring sweets and hors d’oeuvres is served each afternoon into the evening. Our attentive, friendly staff prepares items from scratch and meets dietary requirements. We use natural ingredients and no artificial flavors or colors. We also have several organic, vegan and other healthy items. Adorned by two stately 100 year-old oak trees, our lawn, grounds and flowers are organically cultivated. Large ferns and potted plants provide a private oasis for relaxing in the spring, summer & fall. We have off-street parking and flexible check in times. Guests are issued security keys to an always locked front door and room so they are free to come and go as needed. All the amenities top shelf. Breakfast and Tea Times meticulously prepared and sumptuous to the pallet. Accommodations abundant for several patrons. Located within several yards of the Capitol Complex.

name: Braxton Jamboree
description: Located on Chapel Road a half mile outside of Gassaway, the Braxton Jamboree showcases various bluegrass, country, and gospel artists LIVE! every Friday night as well as many specially scheduled events. Admission at the door is $4.00 per person, kids under 12 get in FREE. Doors open at 5 p.m. Music starts at 7 p.m. Food available for purchasing including hot dogs, chicken strips, corn dogs, taco salad, onion rings, and french fries. Soda, coffee, and water available as well. Visit us on facebook for more details and scheduling information. Take I-79 to Gassaway and Sutton exit 62,​​​​​​​​​ Turn right at stop sign. Travel 4 miles to Chapel Road, we are located at 6780 Chapel Road on the lefthand side.​

name: Brazenhead Inn
description: 20 Guest Rooms, each furnished with antiques, collectibles, and in the upstairs south wing, with locally crafted classic bedroom suites in mission, English country, and Shaker traditions. All have private baths. All are centrally heated and air-conditioned. Of the eight rooms on the ground floor, two rooms are wheelchair accessible. Six offer queen beds; two are furnished with full size beds. Each of the upstairs rooms on the north and south wings have cathedral ceilings with a loft. All the upstairs rooms will accommodate up to 4 people. In the north wing, of six upstairs rooms, four rooms offer one queen bed in the walk-in area and one full-size bed in the loft. In the remaining two rooms on the north wing there are two twin beds in the walk-in area and a full size bed in the loft. In the south wing, of six rooms, five of those rooms offer one queen bed in the walk-in area and one full-size bed in the loft. The sixth room is furnished with two twin beds in the walk-in area and a full-size bed in the loft. See floor plan, reservations. A Full Service Dining Room, seating 34 inside and 20 on the back porch when weather permits. Dinner is served Thursday through Saturday from 5:30 PM through 9:30 PM; Our menu features a variety of home-cooked meals and daily specials. Each morning we offer a continental complimentary breakfast to our guests from 8:00 AM until 9:30 AM. Mike’s Pub, seating 28 friends and family for good conversation and a bit of blarney. We offer live music most Saturday evenings. There is always plenty of Guiness, Smithwicks and some local micro brewery favorites on tap. We also serve other bottled imported beers, bottled all-American favorites, and a selection of classic liquors and wines. In a small room just off the pub there is a satellite TV, for those who just can’t miss the big game or the latest news. Please call our office at 304-339-6917 between the hours of 8 a.m. and 7 p.m. EST for reservations and specific information, and especially for updated information on days and times of operation, or send us an e-mail.

name: Breakfast Nook
description: Serving home cooked breakfast and sandwiches to the Canaan Valley residents and visitors.

name: Brew Ha Ha
description: Family owned and operated restaurant serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Local and WV brewed craft beer available on tap or bottled. Also serving a variety of coffee and espresso drinks, with all coffee beans roasted in house. Bread for sandwiches is baked fresh every morning. Also available- smoothies and freshly baked pastries.

name: Brew Keepers
description: Brew Keepers is a production craft brewery for self distribution with takeout growler service for off premise consumption. Hours: Mon & Tues: Noon - 4pm; Wed - Fri: Noon - 6pm; Sat: 11am - 4pm.

name: Brewstel Hostel
description: The Brewstel Hostel encompasses the entire second floor of our historic building. It features all the amenities of a hotel but with the affordable price tag of a hostel. A special feature of our hostel is its two uniquely themed communal bunk rooms. Guests may stay in either our cozy Cabin or retro Caboose rooms. Both bunk rooms have six bunks, six lockers, two private showers and toilets. We offer 24-hour security, Wi-Fi, internet access, news and weather information and sheets. Available at an additional cost are locks for the lockers, blankets, pillows, towels, personal hygiene items and washer and dryer service. $25 per night per bunk. Brewstel Brew Shop is our craft beer and brewing supply store located on the first floor, below the hostel. We aim to feature the most elusive beers we can get our hands on. We celebrate the rare, the seasonal, and the unique. We also carry the largest selection of gains, hops, and malt extracts in the area. It's not always cost efficient for homebrewers to purchase these brewing ingredients themselves. We buy in bulk and portion to your specifications. Our draft system currently boasts twenty-one taps running directly from our walk in cooler. Enjoy our rotating selection of craft beer here or to go. We offer pints, flights, and growler fills. You can purchase 32- and 64-ounce growlers from the shop or bring your own. - now brewing on site -brewing 1 barrel batches - many house brews, seasonal and experimental batches Brewery: 2pm-10pm. Closed Tuesday and Wednesday Hostel: Open 24 hours. Call 304-997-4769 or check out Brewstel on Airbnb for booking.

name: Brick House Antiques
description: Enjoy exploring 9 rooms of antiques and collectibles. We offer something different every time you visit with our constantly changing inventory. Regional treasures displayed in an 1815 two-story building featuring furniture, linens, silver, glassware and other fine collectibles and antiques. Also offering appraisals and estate tag sales. Hours: Mon-Sat: 10am-5pm and Sunday's seasonally.

name: Brickside Bar & Grille
description: "All you can eat" Steak and chicken buffet – grilled to order! With over 100 buffet items, featuring BBQ Ribs, roasted chicken, fried shrimp, vegetables, pasta, salads, fresh baked rolls, breadsticks, cookies, a variety of fruit and cream pies, brownies, ice cream and much more. Buffet items may vary daily. Family style environment. Reasonable prices – senior and children discounts. Great local Bar & Grille featuring delicious menu items, full bar, outdoor patio, entertainment and more. Hours: Mon-Sat: 11am - 12am; Sun: 10am -11pm

name: Bridge Brew Works
description: We are a small brewery with a lot of heart and experience doing what we love to do. We started brewing at our current location in January 2010 as a production brewery selling only kegs through a distributor. Over the years we have carefully expanded our fermentation and distribution capacities and added a low production high quality bottling system. When Bridge Brew Works was just a dream, we couldn’t of predicted the explosive growth of independent breweries across our country. Through these changes we have kept our attention on being a reliable brewery and friend to the West Virginia beer drinker. Our 2 flagship draught beers, Long Point Lager and Mountain Momma are available at your favorite hangout across our great state, along with a long list of seasonal and occasional brews in draft and very limited bottle runs. During the spring of 2018, we will be able to at last open our doors to allow our customers to come have a pint in our newly built 1000 sq. ft. timber frame and patio. We would like to thank everyone who has made our success possible - Cheers!

name: Bridge Road Bistro
description: The Bridge Road Bistro is located in the quaint South Hills neighborhood of Charleston, just minutes from downtown. Since opening in 2004, the Bistro has earned both regional & national acclaim for its cuisine & has earned The Wine Spectator’s Award of Excellence for the last 5 Years. Its cuisine is classically rooted with global & contemporary influences while supporting local farmers, regional producers & it's community. The Bistro specializes in locally grown vegetables and grain fed natural beef, veal & lamb.

name: Bridge Road Bistro
description: The Bridge Road Bistro is located in the quaint South Hills neighborhood of Charleston, just minutes from downtown. Since opening in 2004, the Bistro has earned both regional & national acclaim for its cuisine & has won a prestigious Wine Spectator Magazine award for 10 years straight. Our cuisine is classically rooted with global & contemporary influences while supporting local farmers, regional producers & our community. We specialize in locally grown vegetables and grain fed natural beef, veal & lamb. We support our WV Farmers and provide many seafood and American dishes as well. American Fused-Farm to Fork Casual/Fine dining. Live Entertainment Wed, Thurs and Saturdays. Catering and deliveries available, Weddings, Reunions & Private Rooms. 11am to 11:30-(9:30 food service ends) Fri-Sat Closed on Sundays-except Mother’s Day we have a Brunch Buffet

name: Bridge Walk
description: Bridge Walk visitors travel on a catwalk among the structural beams of the New River Gorge Bridge 851 feet above the New River. Our unique belay system keeps you harnessed at all times while your guide educates you on the history of the New River Gorge and the building of the bridge. Offering some of the most scenic views of West Virginia. Open year round (weather permitting; closed Thanksgiving & Christmas); tours departing daily.
address: 57 County Rte 85/9 PO Box 132 / Fayette Mine Rd, Lansing, WV, 25862

name: Bridgeport Conference Center
description: Located just off Exit 124 at I-79 at Charles Pointe, the Bridgeport Conference Center features more than 16,000 square feet of flexible, upscale space. Winner of the 2018 Convention South Magazine's Reader’s Choice Award, we're the ideal destination for your next meeting, wedding, conference or training event in the heart of North Central West Virginia. Our large ballroom, sophisticated and comfortable meeting spaces and outdoor venues provide you with maximum flexibility for your event or multi-day conference. Need accommodations? There are 600 hotel rooms within one mile of our conference center! Two hundred rooms are immediately adjacent to the center. The Bridgeport Conference Center has a dedicated team of culinary experts and nearby dining choices include award-winning Mia Margherita Coal Fired Pizzeria as well as Meagher’s Irish Pub, Mountain State Brewing, Buffalo Wild Wings and local favorite, Cody’s. Air transportation is available via North Central WV Regional Airport (CKB), Pittsburgh (PIT) and Charleston (CRW), West Virginia. BOOK BY JULY 1 AND GET FREE A/V! Book your next new 2019 meeting with us by July 1, and get free audio visual equipment from our in-house inventory, fully supported by our IT experts. Our experienced meeting planners and dedicated culinary team are ready to help you plan your meeting and menus now. Call or visit our web site for this offer and their expertise.

name: Bridgeport Farmers Market
description: The mission of the Bridgeport Farmers Market is to create and sustain a community of local vendors & supportive customers in order to cultivate the local economy and provide fresh, healthy food to the people of North Central West Virginia. We believe that farmers markets provide a positive environment for conscientious consumers to make a direct connection to their food sources. In addition to a diverse group of local farmers, the market brings together local musicians, chefs, artisans & authors. Regular Season: Every Sunday May thru October from 10am to 2pm. Winter Market Season: November thru April, second Sunday of each month, 11am to 2pm. Regular Season, 300 Market Place******* Winter Season, Bridgeport Conference Center, 300 Conference Center Way Contact is via email only.

name: Bright Morning Inn
description: Built in 1896 as a boarding house for lumberjacks, the Inn has been completely renovated to accommodate 25 guests in 7 bedrooms and one family suite, all with private baths. Simple, comfortable and uncluttered, our rooms are furnished with country antiques, rustic pine floors, colorful rugs and hand-made quilts. In the evenings, a relaxing common area offers a large screen TV, piano, board games, magazines and plenty of books about West Virginia and the Potomac Highlands region. The inn is a smoke-free facility with wireless access available throughout. Nestled in the heart of downtown Davis, WV, the Bright Morning Inn is in walking distance of boundless trails, cute shops and bustling restaurants. Fuel your outdoor adventure with a full country breakfast in our restaurant, complimentary with your stay. Once a boardinghouse for lumberjacks, the Bright Morning Inn is warm and cozy, kid and pet friendly.

name: Broken Wheel Campground
description: Broken Wheel Campground & Country Store, established in 1995, is a family owned and operated business. We hope to provide family camping experiences that will last a life time. Cooking on an open fire, making smores, bike riding, fishing, and enjoying a campfire under the moonlit sky are a few of the memorable moments that can be cherished forever.

name: The Bronze Look, LLC
description: The Bronze Look LLC operates three stores in Southern WV: The Bronze Look at 311 Mercer St, in Princeton; the company's showcase, premier store Diamonds 'N Gold Look at 901 Mercer St., Princeton; and Only One Look, in Bluefield.

name: Brooke County Farmers Market
description: Come shop at the Brooke Farmer Markets...for the freshest veggies, fruit, bake goods, crafts & more!

name: Brooke County Historical Museum
description: Located in the former G.C. Murphy Building in historic Wellsburg, West Virginia, the Brooke County Historical Museum and Cultural Center, formed in 1975, was the first county museum in the state. The “life museum” captures moments of small-town history, displaying furniture manufactured in Wellsburg, items of the 1780-1800-1900's, toys, and other artifacts of interest. The rich military background of the area is on display with samples of uniforms, ammunition, maps, and recorded stories from all branches of the military. The museum is committed to protecting, preserving, and presenting Brooke County artifacts dating from 1730 to the present. Location: 704 Charles Street, Wellsburg, WV 26070. Address: 600 Main St., Wellsburg, WV 26070, 304-737-4060. Open: April-October, Thursday, Friday, & Sunday 1pm to 5pm; or by appointment.

name: Brooke County Visitors Center
description: Our goal is to attract visitors to the region in order to promote the treasures that are found in the northern panhandle. Patrons and visitors love the fact that while they browse for books, they can also obtain data on travel materials and WV Vacation Guides as well as information on local events.

name: Brooke Hills Park
description: Brooke Hills Park is a beautiful county park that offers Executive Golf Course, miniature golf, paddle boats, swimming pool, full hook-up camping, primitive camping, disc golf and much more!

name: A. Brooks Fleming House
description: The home of Aretas Brooks Fleming (1839-1923), the eighth governor of West Virginia (1890-1893). During the war, he was the Marion County prosecuting attorney and served in the Fairmont Home Guard. The house is 3 stories and features antique furnishings though out. The marker is located on the grounds of the former American Legion Home.

name: Browning Fork Trailhouse
description: Browning Fork Trailhouse is located in the Gilbert area off the Rockhouse Trail. It is conveniently located in the rural community of Browning Fork surrounded by mountains and trails. Browning Fork Trailhouse provides their guests with a unique environment defined by the natural beauty of the Appalachian Mountains and the southern hospitality of its people. It offers five separate facilities. The trailhouses can be rented separately or combined to easily accommodate large groups of 40 or more. Each spacious unit is fully furnished to meet the needs of the riders. The trailhouses have air conditioning and heat, cable TV, gas grills, picnic tables, campfire sites, and ample parking. Washers and dryers are available. The owners are authorized vendors to sell permits and souvenirs for the Hatfield McCoy Trail System. Browning Fork Trailhouse is open 365 days a year. Check in is from 3pm until 11pm. Check out is at 11am. Early arrivals and late check outs are honored when possible. A five percent discount is given to return customers and a five percent discount is given to active military personnel. A ten percent discount is given for a stay of at least seven consecutive days. A winter discount of twenty five percent is given from December the thirty first until February the twenty eighth. A full refund minus a twenty five dollar handling fee is given for cancellations made at least thirty days before arrival. The customer is responsible for the full balance if cancelled with less than thirty days before arrival.
address: Browning Fork Rd./ P. O. Box 501, Gilbert, WV, 25621

name: Browning Lambert ATV Resort
description: The Browning Lambert ATV Resort is a quiet, fully furnished house located just outside the Pocahontas Trail. Off Roading enthusiasts have lots of easy parking at the house and ride directly to the trails. Located only 20 minutes away from Historical Bramwell boasting a wide variety of shops and restaurants.

name: Bruceton Antique Mall
description: The area’s largest antique mall. Buying and selling toys, furniture, glassware, advertising, stoneware, quilts, old clothes, tools, old car and motorcycle parts, clocks, and much, much more. Stop in for coffee, look around and enjoy yourself. 200 yards north on Route 26 off of Interstate 68 at Exit 23. 7 days a week 10:00 am – 5:00 pm.
address: 15041 N. Preston Highway, Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: Brush Creek Falls
description: Brush Creek Falls roars along a tributary of the Bluestone River – standing at over 30 feet tall in Mercer County. Start at the small parking area and take the Brush Creek Falls Trail a quarter mile before reaching this scenic cascade. To make a day of your adventures, pack a picnic lunch to enjoy before exploring the nearby Camp Creek State Park.

name: Brush Creek Preserve and Falls
description: Open year-round, this preserve is near Brush Creek Falls, a popular spot for photographers and nature lovers. From the Athens Exit (#14) of I-77 turn east on County Route 7 (Mercer Springs Road). In .1 mile turn left on County Route 14 (Ead’s Mill Road). Go 3.3 miles and turn right on County Route 3 (Brush Creek Falls Road). At .3 mile cross the bridge and park at the shelter. Walk the trail down the east side of the creek for .25 mile to reach the falls and Nature Conservancy Preserve.
address: Camp Creek Speedway Road, Athens, WV, 24712

name: Brushcreek Falls RV Resort
description: Situated in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, Brushcreek Falls offers 4 cottages and 52 RV/Campsites with power, water, and sewer. We offer select campsites that have concrete patios and patio tables, we also provide picnic tables. We also have FREE Wi-Fi for our guests. We offer plenty of opportunities to have fun. Brushcreek Falls RV Resort is conveniently located just 1.8 miles off I77 Exit 14 near Princeton, WV.

name: Buckhannon Antique Mall
description: The Buckhannon Antique Mall carries thousands of antiques and older collectibles, and is located 2 1/2 miles north of Buckhannon on the Clarksburg Road (Rt. 20 North). The Antique Mall is open 7 days a week, and has been open continuously for more than twenty years. Spend the afternoon browsing to find some hidden treasures of yesterday. The large parking lot is accessible to tour buses & motor homes.

name: Buckhannon – Upshur Farmer’s Market
description: We provide quality, local WV grown produce to the community and educate the community and our patrons on the importance of fresh produce. Local fresh fruits and vegetables, baked goods, honey, jams and jellies and more. The market is held yearly from May - season end. Monday: 8am-2pm; Wednesday: 8am-2pm; Friday: 8am-2pm; Saturday: 8am-2pm
address: Jawbone Park, Madison Street, Buckhannon, WV, 26201

name: Buck’s Pizza
description: Serving pizza, stromboli, salads, hot wings, oven baked hoagies. Delivery and takeout are available. Hours: Mon-Thur: 11am-10 pm; Fri-Sat: 11am-11pm; Sun: 12am-10pm.

name: Buddy’s All-American Bar-b-que
description: An All-American Bar-B-Que restaurant serving killer wings, ice cold beer, sandwiches, great bbq including pulled pork, brisket, and baby back ribs. Don't forget to top the meal off with one of our luscious desserts.

name: Buffalo Lake
description: Buffalo Fork Lake is a 22-acre impoundment located in the Monongahela National Forest in Pocahontas County. Buffalo Lake offers fisherman a quiet retreat from cities. The lake is stocked with trout once in February, bi-weekly March through May, and twice in October. Some trout remain in the lake the entire year. The lake also provides a limited warmwater fishery for smallmouth bass, bluegill, green sunfish, and channel catfish. Swimming is not permitted at Lake Buffalo. Boating is limited to electric trolling motors. Facilities include vault toilets, a parking lot, and a concrete boat ramp. Some dispersed camping is available in the area. Lake Buffalo also includes an accessible fishing area. Buffalo Lake is open Year Round. There are 1-5 campsites at this location. You may stay up to 14 days at Buffalo Lake. The lake is 5 miles east of Bartow and can be reached by traveling WV Route 28 and Forest Service Route 54. From Bartow, take US-250S to WV-28N, Stay on WV-28N for 0.3 miles to Forest Road 54, take Forest Rd. for 2.5 miles and the parking area will be on your right.

name: Bulltown Campground
description: The large campground is on the edge of Burnsville Lake, just beside the Bulltown Historic Area. This spot occupies the site of a Civil War battle, where reenactments of the historic event take place twice a year. The campground offers 204 campsites. Playgrounds and showers on located within each loop. A boat ramp is within the campground and a beach is about a mile away. Reservations: 1-877-444-6777. Opens late April, closes Thanksgiving weekend. Reservation Season: Memorial Day through Labor Day. Amenities: RV sites, tent sites, sites with 50 AMP electric, water and sewer hookups, sites with 30 AMP electric hookups only, restrooms, shower facilities, drinking water, dump station, lake swimming, mountain view. Directions; From North of Charleston, WV and I-79, take Exit 67 (Flatwoods) and travel north on U.S. Highway 19 for 10 miles. Follow signs into campground. From Clarksburg, WV and I-79, take Exit 91 (Roanoke), travel south on U.S. 19 for 28 miles. Follow signs into campground.
address: 1 Burnsville Lake Rd, 1183 Bulltown Campground Road, Napier, WV, 26331

name: Bulltown Historic District
description: Take a trip back in time at the Bulltown Historical Village to get a taste of life during the Civil War era. This spot occupies the site of a Civil War battle, where reenactments of the historic event take place twice a year. In 1863, Confederate forces led by William L. "Mudwall" Jackson, cousin of "Stonewall" Jackson, attempted to overtake Union fortifications on a knoll overlooking a key bridge that once crossed the Little Kanawha River along the Weston-Gauley Bridge Turnpike. At the hilly site are Union trenches, the graves of seven Confederate soldiers and intact sections of the Weston-Gauley Turnpike.
address: 1 Burnsville Lake Rd.; Burnsville Lake / Army Corps of Engineers, HC 10 Box 24, Burnsville, WV, 26335

name: The Greenbrier Resort
description: Summer comes to life at The Greenbrier, America’s Resort. Sip on a refreshing cocktail, explore 11,000 acres of beautiful mountains, test your luck at the on-site casino or take the horse-drawn carriage around the resort. The resort’s excellence is perhaps best defined by its array of restaurants for any palate. Don’t pass up a tour of the once secret cold war bunker. This is life as few know it. Stay for a day, a cozy weekend or a lifetime. Learn More
address: 101 Main Street West, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Bunner Ridge Horse Park
description: Bunner Ridge Horse Park offers one of the few camp grounds for the pleasure/trail rider in North Central West Virginia. Bunner Ridge Horse Park offers overnight camping and trail riding to horse owners only, the park sports two pavilion, two outhouses, a riding ring, picnic tables, hitching posts, camp sites, and plenty of spring water for the horses. No potable water or electric. No alcohol or ATV’s permitted. Walkers, hikers, and mountain bikes are welcome on our trails through the park. Located 6 miles east of I-79, off the Prickett’s Fort Exit 139. Follow Route 33 (Bunner Ridge Road) to the “Y”. Turn right and travel for 2.2 miles. It is the first driveway on the right after the Fire Department. Activities: Country music next door at Sagebrush Round-up on Saturdays from Oct-May Location: I-79 Exit 139, follow the signs to Bunner Ridge, Rt 33, 5 Miles.

name: Burger Carte
description: This favorite has been serving up homemade hot dog chili and slaw, hand-patted hamburgers, pretzel dogs, sea dogs, funnel fries and broccoli bites for 40 years.

name: Burning Springs Park
description: Money. Power. Politics. War. Prosperity. A self-guided tour presents the captivating stories of the nation's first oil and gas field. See the world's oldest producing oil well and learn the role it played in West Virginia statehood and the Civil War.

name: Burnsville Docks
description: For all your boating and fishing needs! Burnsville Dock offers Slip Rental for boat mooring seasonally beginning April 15-Oct 1. Boat rentals available by reservations, walk in when available. Burnsville Docks marina store offers live bait, artificial bait, gas, concessions a gift shop plus much more.

name: Burnsville Lake
description: The 12,579-acre Burnsville Lake Wildlife Management Area (WMA) protects old farm fields and young forests on gentle uplands along the Little Kanawha River. One of the largest lakes in central West Virginia, Burnsville Lake, at 968 acres, is equipped with three wheelchair-accessible boat ramp and accommodates fishing for bass, trout, walleye, crappie, bluegill and catfish. It is stocked with trout February through May. The area supports Class-Q hunting access and game traditionally hunted in the management area includes deer, grouse, rabbit, raccoon and turkey. More than 260 tent and trailer campsites and six primitive campsites are located in the Burnsville Wildlife Management Area. Directions: The Burnsville Lake Wildlife Management Area is located in northern Braxton County three miles east of Burnsville, WV, off I-79 and six miles northeast of Flatwoods, WV.

name: Busted ATV Resort
description: The Busted ATV Resort is the oldest home in Bramwell, WV, built in 1880. The beautifully restored Main Lodge is the perfect place to begin your ATV adventure. The Main Lodge is over 2000 sq.ft. with 6 bedrooms and 2 baths, 3 king beds, 2 queen beds, and a twin bunk bed. It has a full kitchen and lounge down stairs, and a kitchenette upstairs. All the sheets, towels, and cooking utensils are provided. There is a large porch and fire pit for relaxing. Need more space or is that too big? Check out The Hatfield Lodge! It has 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, 1 king bed, 1 queen, and a twin bunk bed. It has a full kitchen with lounge; all the sheets, towels, and cooking utensils are provided. There is a porch and fire pit for relaxing. Located on Highway 52, just twenty minutes from I-77, and just a half mile from the Hatfield-McCoy and Virginia Spearhead trails. Located next food and fun, the Busted ATV Resort is the perfect place to begin your ride.

name: Butcher Branch Falls
description: Butcher Branch Falls tumbles down a tiered sandstone wall, creating a series of picturesque cascades. Trek about one mile on Butcher Branch Trail from Kaymoor parking area. When the path forks, you’ll want to hang a right onto the offshoot labeled “climbers’ access.” This steep trek down a series of rocky switchbacks will include some minor scrambling – simply follow the sound of the tumbling falls past the rockface, popular among climbers, to find your way. A hidden gem in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, these falls are worth the trip for any true waterfall wanderer.

name: Butler’s Farm Market
description: Butlers Farm Markets opens just in time every March as Spring fever sets in! When the cold weather is fading and warmer, longer days are calling you outdoors, Butlers is full of great ways to help you spruce up for Spring! You can find a variety of mulch, top soil, colored landscape stones, gravel, sand, flowers and lots of hand-crafted Amish outdoor furniture. Spring is also the time to start enjoying the early seasonal fruits and veggies at Butlers. Market-goers can get locally grown asparagus, spinach, kale, lettuce and other seasonal produce that is harvested daily. By May, Butlers is always overflowing with their sweet homegrown strawberries, plus the market is is full of other special treats. From peaches, plums and nectarines to corn on the cob, garden veggies and melons, if you are craving it, you can find it at Butlers Farm Market! And don’t forget about our full line of Butler’s Best jams, jellies, and canned products! When you stop by Butler’s, you can enjoy the smell of our fresh-baked pies that are prepared daily for your enjoyment and they go great with our Trickling Springs home-made ice cream that is available in a variety of flavors. Butler’s grows and sells a wide variety of apples in a variety of sizes from a bag to bushel you will find all of your favorites in the order of their ripening including; Ginger Gold, Gala, Honey Crisp, Golden Supreme, Golden Delicious, Jonagold, Red Delicious, York, Rome, Fuji and Pink Lady. And of course, apples mean fresh pies and dumplings baked fresh by our family each day. Farm market at the junction of Dry Run Road and Thatcher Road.

name: Butter It Up!
description: Farm to Table Restaurant and Cafe. Butter It Up is committed to providing you the highest quality grass-fed and natural products available. We carry a full line of locally sourced, grass-fed meats, cheeses, eggs and so much more! Serving breakfast, lunch, dinner, gluten free, lo carb options, smoothies, drinks and coffee!

name: Buxton and Landstreet Gallery & Studios
description: The Buxton and Landstreet building, established in 1901, is now home to two contemporary art galleries and public and private studios. The public studios have equipment for pottery, printmaking, papermaking, bookbinding, jewelry making, painting, and drawing. Classes are offered in various mediums throughout the spring, summer, and fall.

name: BW3
description: Buffalo Wild Wings Grill and Bar -- Great food in a fun, casual atmosphere. Something for everyone! Hours: Monday - Saturday 11:00 am – 2:00 am; Sunday 11:00 am – 1:00 am.

name: Byrnside Branch Farm
description: Our family farm was purchased in March 1982. During that time the farm was a full operational dairy farm. The name was Dima Ja Diary, named after our registered cattle. Dima Ja Diary ran for almost 18 years before it switched over to agritourism. When the diary operation ceased and cattle left we changed the farm name to Byrnside Branch Farm because of the branch that runs through it. We began growing pumpkins, gourds, potatoes and started the corn maze with many activities during the fall season. Then, approximately eight years ago we began growing vegetables. In extended season, we utilize 3 high tunnels. We offer pick your own produce as well as selling through a local online farmers market that delivers to Charleston, WV once a week. Along with growing vegetables and doing the corn maze, we also farm a small beef cattle herd. Over the years our farm has also raised pigs, cattle, horses, lambs, and rabbits. Hours: We sell to the online Monroe Farm Market customers year round offering vegetable sales on the farm any evening for pick your own. Please call ahead for your reservation! Our fall season opens Mid September everyday through early November. We take appointments for field trips during the weekdays and are open to the public Friday-Sunday every weekend. Tour through the pumpkin patch and around our beautiful farm. The tractor driver also gives educational information on farming procedures and growing techniques! What we offer: 10-Acre Corn Maze, 2-Acre Corn Maze, Hay Maze for the Kiddies, Twilight Maze, Seasonal Produce, Pick Your Own Pumpkin, Farm Tractor Tours, Mini Horse-Drawn Wagon Tours, Barrel Train Tours for Kids, and Farm Animals.

name: C & G RV Park
description: This primitive campground features 16 sites for any size camper, 4 that are rented on a daily basis. All RV's must be fully self-contained. Full hookups of water/electric/sewage. No bathrooms or bathhouses on site. Discounts are available for long term agreements.

name: C & H Taxi Inc
description: Transportation-taxi cab service.

name: Cabela’s
description: Whatever your favorite outdoor pastime, Cabela's has the equipment you need to make your next adventure a success. Explore 175,000 sq. ft. of camping, hunting and fishing gear and apparel, all backed by our world-famous 100% Satisfaction Guarantee. Cabela’s has something for the entire family including a deer museum, laser shooting gallery and a 50,000 gallon aquarium filled with trophy fish. Enjoy delicious wild game or traditional fare at the Powderhorn Grill Restaurant. Cabela’s- the World’s Foremost Outfitter! Store Hours: Mon. - Thur. 8 a.m. - 9 p.m.; Fri. - Sat. 8 a.m. - 10 p.m.; Sun. 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. Exit 10 off I-70.

name: Cabin Creek Quilts
description: Cabin Creek Quilts promotes and markets high quality quilts and patchwork creations by West Virginia artisans. Cabin Creek Quilts’ products portray superb craftsmanship and award-winning designs. We craft bold, original, distinctive, one-of-a-kind creations inspired by traditional quilt designs using vibrant, designer fabrics. Our pieces are functional, well-crafted and durable quilts that are superior to foreign made quilts. Your Cabin Creek Quilts purchase is an investment in an heirloom that actually increases in value, as well as adding warmth and beauty to your home. Let us inspire you with our colorful fabrics and the nostalgia in owning a piece of our mountain culture - creatively made in wild, wonderful West Virginia!!

name: Cabins at Pine Haven
description: Ten Luxury Log Cabins that include Full Kitchens, Washer/Dryer, Hot Tubs, WiFi, Heat/Air, 75 Channel Flat screen TV's. Two Treehouses with Mini Kitchens, Hot Tubs, WiFi, and Satellite Premium TV. Four Bedroom Lodge and Conference Center that accommodates up to 85 guest for meetings and /or meals. PACKAGES AVAILABLE: ATV/UTV RENT AND RIDE, WHITEWATER RAFTING, SNOW SKIING, GOLF, FISHING, ONSITE ACTIVITIES, NINE HOLE DISC GOLF, NINE HOLE LIMITED FLIGHT GOLF COURSE, SAND VOLLEYBALL COURT, CHILDREN'S PLAYGROUND, PICNIC SHELTER, WALKING TRAILS. VISIT OUR WEB SITE OR FACEBOOK PAGE FOR PHOTOS

name: Cabins of Kelly Mountain
description: Cabins of Kelly Mountain, four luxury cabin rentals 5 min outside the town of Elkins WV. Our cabin rentals sit on the mountainside of Kelly Mountain which overlooks the start of Monongahela National Forest and Stuarts Recreation Area. Each cabin features king size beds, gas-log fireplaces, and saunas. Two of the cabins feature a private hot tub. All cabins are pet friendly and great for family retreats, long term stays, or a romantic weekend getaway.

name: Cabwaylingo State Forest
description: Spruce Creek Campground features eleven sites, six with electrical and water hookups and full shower and bathroom facilities. All campsites have tent pads, fireplaces, drinking water, picnic tables, and firewood. Shower and toilet facilities are located nearby. Tick Ridge is a 10-site rustic campground. There is no water or electric at these 10-sites, however, pit toilets are available. Group Camping: Cabwaylingo State Forest offers a 100-person fully-equipped group camp and serves as a great location for church retreats, civic meetings, family reunions and other large social outings. This rustic style camp was formerly the old Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) barracks, featuring two new barracks, rebuilt in 2004, which sleep fifty each and a third building which houses a dining hall with a completely furnished kitchen.A complete shower house was added in 1999.The group camp features a council circle that is perfect for an evening campfire. The group camp is available from early May through late October and must be reserved in advance. Campers can enjoy the park's many recreational offerings, including biking, fishing, hiking, and more throughout their stay. A basketball court is located near the group camp and equipment can be rented at a nominal fee. Volleyball courts are on site, as well as the Crum-Morgan picnic shelter. The campgrounds are open from April 1 through October 31.

name: Cacapon Resort State Park
description: Cacapon Lodge is situated on the east side of Cacapon Mountain overlooking the wide expanse of a Robert Trent Jones, Sr. golf course. The 48-room classic lodge offers a relaxed setting complete with lounge with a TV, board games, fireplace, and cozy furniture creating a cozy area for family and friends to gather. The full-service restaurant at Cacapon Lodge is popular and offers a variety of menu options. Small groups and conferences, in addition to families and reunions, appreciate the amenities and hospitality at Cacapon State Park. Cacapon’s rental cabin styles are Vacation, Classic, Legacy and Economy. Lodge rooms and cabins reservations are year-round. Cacapon is near Berkeley Springs State Park, also open year-round. With 6000 acres to explore at Cacapon State Park, you’ll find the park website includes park map, park history, rates and special events.
address: 818 Cacapon Lodge Dr., Berkeley Springs, WV, 25411

name: Cacapon River Arts
description: A resource for the Potomac Highlands community, Cacapon River Arts exists to present fine arts and music education through enrichment programs in a professional and welcoming setting that encourages participation in the arts. Events and programs are designed to help Appalachian youth expand their outlook on life, enhance self-esteem, and build skills that promote their future success and happiness, from personal presentation to college readiness.

name: Cacapon’s Country Hideaway
description: We have a country home, with 3 bedrooms and fully furnished kitchen (food not provided). Living Room: Spacious Living Room Sofa, Love Seat & Rocker (all recline for your comfort), Satellite TV. Kitchen: Full Kitchen with microwave , full size refrigerator & electric range. All cookware and kitchen utensils provided. Dining room / Kitchen Combo; Three Bedrooms. Master Bedroom: Queen size bed, Ceiling fan,Window Air conditioning. 2nd Bedroom: Full Size Bed, Ceiling fan. Spare Bedroom: Single Bed, Desk. Outside Charcoal Grill, Fire Pit, Pond for fishing, Large deck. Rustic Cabin: The hardwood floors, wooden beams, and its mountain setting, make this a perfect get-away. Accomodations: Kitchen/dining combo, Refrigerator, electric range, microwave Complete cookware and kitchen utensils, Livingroom/bedroom combo Gas fireplace, One queen bed, Bathroom has shower, sink and toilet. Amenities: Satellite TV, Window Air conditioning, Charcoal grill, Fire pit, Pond for fishing, and Picnic table. Rustic Camping: We have several primitive campsites, we do provide portable toilets and hand washing stations. We do not have running water or showers yet, but you can shower or bath at Berkeley Springs State Park. **You only need to bring your own Food, Drink, and Hygiene Products. No Smoking; No alcohol; No ATV's; No Pets! Reservations: All reservations require a payment of one night in advance and are subject to availability. Maximum of four. Cancellation Policy: seven days notice. 25% fee on refunds Check-in Time is 3:00 pm, Check-out time is 11: AM Payment: Payment can be made by cash or personal check camp sites, fishing, paddle boats, trails and more.

name: Cafe One Ten
description: Open for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. We have flatbread pizzas, pulled pork BBQ, spaghetti with our homemade meat sauce, delicious garlic bread, salads, burgers, soup and salad bar, cheese fries, beer, wine and DESSERTS! We have a buffet on Sunday. Food types: American (New), American (Traditional), Burgers, German, Hot Dogs, Sandwiches, Seafood and Vegetarian **Known for fried Oreos dessert.
address: 110 Main St. W., Oak Hill, WV, 25901

name: Calhoun County Park
description: Calhoun County Park is located on land formerly used as a farm. The site currently hosts mountain bike competitions and civil war reenactments. Heritage village on site. Offering beautiful hiking trails, five different ponds for fishing, baseball diamond, basketball court, putt-putt golf, several playgrounds, camping facilities, picnic shelters, and the community park “Herb Smith” barn. "One of the darkest places in WV." The Calhoun County Park is located approximately 4 miles South of Grantsville, WV on S Calhoun Hwy/WV-16.

name: Calvin Price State Forest
description: The forest is the newest in West Virginia's system, having been mostly purchased in 1953 from New River Lumber Company. The forest is named for Marlinton newspaper editor, Calvin W. Price. Calvin Price State Forest has 9,482 acres. 93 of these acres have been developed or are maintained as open areas for primitive camping and picnicking. Hunting and hiking are the principal recreational uses of the forest. The primary focus on Cal Price is in the areas of forest, wildlife, and watershed management.

name: Camden Deli & Eatery
description: Casual dining serving traditional American foods.

name: Camden Park
description: For more than 100 years Camden Park has been the destination of choice for family fun! Join us for another unforgettable season of rides, games, fireworks, concerts and special events. Affordable fun close to home. Check the following for hours and admission prices: http://www.camdenpark.com/park-information/calendar/ http://www.camdenpark.com/admissions/

name: Camp Allegheny 1861-1862
description: This haunting, windswept encampment was successfully defended on December 13, 1861, when Confederate Gen. Edward Johnson’s troops repelled an attack by Union forces. However, the loss of men contributed to the decision to abandon it in April 1862. Earthworks, gun positions and chimney falls from the encampment are evident. Location: From U.S.250 near the Virginia/WV state line, turn south at sign on County Rd. 3, turn right at the T junction, then go 2 more miles (Road may be closed due to snow in winter.) Open: year-round, dawn to dusk. NR & CWDT, Disabled Access parking & interpretive area, Brochure Available.

name: Camp Creek State Park and Forest
description: Camp Creek State Park and Forest is known for beautiful waterfalls and great camping. With nearly 6,000 acres of lush forest, 35 miles of trails and seven miles of seasonally stocked trout streams, there is something for every hiker, biker, horseback rider and angler to explore and enjoy. Camp Creek State Park and Forest has four campgrounds, all of which include picnic tables, grills and fire rings. Mash Fork Campground offers Wi-Fi and a heated bathhouse. In its entirety, the campground includes 26 trailer/tent sites with the following options: 9 with electrical hookups, 8 with water and electric hookups, and 9 with full hookups. Blue Jay Campground offers 12 rustic sites for tent campers. Double C Horse and Rider Campground is perfect for those traveling on horseback. The site offers two, four or six horse occupancy sites. Riders may bring as many horses as their campsite stall accommodates. Pack It In – Pack It Out Campground is the ideal spot for those looking to travel away from mainstream facilities. To reach the campsite, guests must hike or bike more than three miles to the Almost Heaven Road and Trail. Advance reservations for this remote campground are preferred. Camp Creek campgrounds are open year-round, weather permitting. Campsites may be reserved anytime online, by call, or at the campground office.
address: 2390 Camp Creek Road, Camp Creek, WV, 25820

name: Camp Hidden Meadows
description: Camp Hidden Meadows is a coed, non-sectarian program, offering a wide array of activities. Campers experience these activities in an environment fostering personal growth, individual responsibility, and active participation in the camp community. We have committed ourselves to providing young people with experiences that are fun, safe, and rewarding. We offer campers a wide variety of instruction and activities in the areas of outdoor adventure, arts and crafts, swimming, boating, horseback riding, farm work, sports and performing arts. Children experience these activities in an environment fostering personal growth, individual responsibility, and active participation in the camp community. Traditional Camp: for ages 7 – 16. Equestrian Camp: for ages 9 – 16. Via Ferrata at Nelson Rocks Outdoor Adventure Center: for ages 14 -16.

name: Camp Pioneer
description: Camp Pioneer offers accommodations ranging from rustic to modern campsites and dormitory-style lodging for private family use, retreats, and other overnight events. We have 57 sites ranging from standard tent campsites to full hookup campsites, as well as unlimited primitive camping (Car or Tent Camping; No utilities) over 97-acres of gorgeous mountain land. Camp Pioneer offers dorm room-style lodging for families visiting our region, as well as participants in group events, retreats, and camps. Additional amenities include, water, 30/50 AMP electric & sewer hook up. basketball, volleyball, and dodgeball court, playground, fishing ponds, and walking trail.

name: Camp Splinter
description: Perhaps you've stayed here over the years or visited it as a child. Camp Splinter has been in existence since 1940. The Chamber has been responsible for it since 1967. Since 2012, grants, donations and rental fees have helped clean up and improve the Camp. Several other projects are planned. We are blessed with a beautiful location and with a little TLC, we have made it an even better place for families to visit. Many families come back every year!

name: Camp Washington-Carver
description: Camp Washington-Carver is a beautiful retreat listed on the National Register of Historic Places. This Fayette County complex is a group of buildings and facilities that have achieved exceptional importance within the past 50 years as the focus of cultural activities and events significant in West Virginia’s black history. Originally named The Negro 4-H Camp when it was dedicated in 1942, Washington-Carver served from 200 to 1,600 black youth in vocational agriculture, soil conservation, home economics and 4-H standards. It survives today as a well-preserved example of one of West Virginia’s most ambitious Works Progress Administration (WPA) projects. The camp was renamed by West Virginia State College for Booker T. Washington and George Washington Carver. Continued use of Camp Washington-Carver for educational and entertainment purposes was assured in 1979 when ownership of the complex was passed to the West Virginia Division of Culture and History. Programs like the African-American Heritage Arts Camp and the Appalachian String Band Festival, along with the camp's Great Chestnut Lodge, the largest log structure of its kind in the world, make this site a favorite place for Mountain State festivities. Camp Washington-Carver, a Mountain Cultural Arts Center located at Clifftop in Fayette County, West Virginia, programs a summer season of events from music concerts to theater. The facility may also be rented for family reunions, company picnics, weddings and other private activities.

name: Campbell Falls
description: Well-known for its picturesque backdrop, Campbell Falls can be found within Camp Creek State Park in the mountains of Mercer County. With a multitude of shelves, all 15 feet of these cascades pour into an oval pool – the perfect location for fishing or swimming in warmer weather. Start on Camp Creek Road, before stopping at a small pull-off and following a short path to this roadside beauty.

name: Campbell Mansion
description: The Campbell Mansion is a National Historic Landmark and the 19th century home of Alexander Campbell, founder of Bethany College, a renowned leader in religion, education, and business. Here you will find the original 1840 wallpaper and some of the original furniture. Imagine yourself back in time with the Campbell family. The parking area accommodates both buses and automobiles Tour Time Price* Campbell Mansion 1 ½ hours $4.00/$2.00 Campbell Cemetery ½ hour $1.00 Old Meeting House ½ hour $1.00 Old Main ½ hour $1.00 Campbell Room 1 hour $1.00 * Adults and children ages 6-17; children ages 0 to 5 are free There is no charge for unguided tours of the Campbell Cemetery, Old Main and the Old Meeting House.

name: Campestre
description: We pride ourselves in serving only the freshest, most delicious, authentic Mexican Cuisine. Our dishes are perfectly seasoned, generously portioned and always made to order. Whether it’s a lunch outing with co-workers, a wholesome family meal or a full-on fiesta with friends you’re seeking, we’re confident you’ll enjoy your visit at any of our great locations. Alcoholic beverages and soft drinks available.

name: Canaan Realty
description: "Imagine a Place that's Yours." Canaan Realty, located at Mirror Lake, offers resort property sales and vacation home rentals in beautiful Canaan Valley. Free sales and/or rental guide upon request. Browse our website with virtual tours and online reservations. Hot tubs, fireplaces, lakefront, mountain view, slope side or secluded; the choice is yours. Call upon our friendly staff to assist you with your vacation planning. Canaan Realty is open seven days a week from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

name: Canaan Valley Cabins
description: Canaan Valley Cabins offers Cabins and Vacation homes for up to 12 people near many activities in the Canaan Valley, WV, area. We are minutes away from Black Water Falls State Park, Timberline Ski Resort and Seneca Rocks. Winterset 12 Starry Nights: Winterset 12 Starry Nights is a lovely 5 bedroom, 4 bath home with a short walk to the Winterset ski trail at Timberline Resort. This custom designed cedar house has 4 kings, 1 queen, and queen sleeper in loft. With Large vaulted ceilings, uniquely decorated, spacious family gathering areas, Gas fireplace, 8 TV’s w/cable, 1 DVD, Blu-Ray, VCR, WiFi, charcoal and gas grill, 2 gas fireplaces, pool table, foosball and hot tub on separate deck area make this a great getaway. New carpet throughout. Additional amenities include patio furniture, air conditioning, high speed wireless internet and badminton in the side yard and a firepit for fair weather. Non-smoking. PEACEFUL GETAWAY CABIN: This cozy and unique, pedestal cabin sits in a luxury resort in Canaan Valley . It features incredible amenities both in and around the cabin including a deck and grill for outdoor enjoyment. As a guest in the resort, you’ll have easy access to fantastic activities including two nearby ski resorts, a giant, heated swimming pool, miniature golf, tennis courts and more! Rent the Peaceful Getaway Cabin and find yourself relaxing in peace in no-time! Sleeps 4; 2 beds; 1 bath. REST ASSURED CABIN: This cozy and unique, pedestal cabin sits in a luxury resort in Canaan Valley . It features incredible amenities both in and around the cabin including a deck that overlooks the National Wildlife Refuge. As a guest in the resort, you’ll have easy access to fantastic activities including two nearby ski resorts, a giant, heated swimming pool, miniature golf, tennis courts and more! The Rest Assured Cabin will bring you just that: Rest, assured! Sleeps 4; 3 beds, one bath.

name: Canaan Valley National Wildlife Refuge
description: 16,000-acre refuge conserving the largest high elevation valley east of the Rockies. 31-miles of roads and trails for hiking, 23-miles for biking or horseback riding and 10-miles of cross-country ski trails. Open to hunting, fishing, wildlife observation, photography, interpretation and education. 198 species of birds can be viewed on the refuge. Trails open one hour before sunrise and close one hour after sunset. Visitor center/office is located on Rte. 32 in Tucker County. Check website for more info. From Davis, WV: Take SR 32 S approximately 8 mi. on the right. From Harman, WV: Take SR 32 N approximately 9 mi on the left
address: H.C. 70, Box 330, Rte. 32 North/ 6263 Appalachian Hwy, Canaan Valley, WV, 26260

name: Canaan Valley Resort State Park
description: With 160 rooms, 23 cabins, and 34 campsites, our resort provides lodging for any occasion. Perfect your swing on our championship golf course, swim in our outdoor and indoor pools, or ski down our 47 slopes and trails. No matter the season, you'll find no shortage of family-friendly activities. You'll also find state-of-the-art conference and event spaces, on-site restaurants, and a fully-equipped fitness center. We have everything you need for the ultimate resort experience.

name: Candlewood Suites Morgantown
description: Morgantown's newest all Suite hotel. Featuring both Studio and One Bedroom Suites. Come and enjoy the free 24 hourr fitness center, stay connected with complimentary WiFi. Borrow a movie from the Lending Library or a slow cooker from the Lending Locker to finish that perfect meal in our fully-equipped kitchens. Use our free guest laundry facilities to clean up after a long day of enjoying all that Morgantown has to offer. Bring along your furry friend, we are pet friendly. Come and see why our guests "Consider us Home".

name: Cannery Creek Candles
description: Candles are made with 100% American Soy Wax. Cotton wicks & pure fragrances oils. We handcraft all our products using all natural products.
address: 86 Calf Creek Road, St. Mary's, WV, 26170

name: Cantrell Ultimate Rafting
description: Cantrell Ultimate Rafting offers river services on the New River, Gauley River, Greenbrier River and the Bluestone River. Our whitewater adventures range from mild to wild, depending on your desires: (1.) The family float trip (ages 5 and up)... perfect for the younger adventurer and first-time rafters. These trips are designed with a gentle, lower risk into to rafting. (2.) The Adventurous (age 12 & up) ... These trips are action packed and a bit more challenging than the family class. First timers and experienced. (3.) The World Class (ages 16 & up) ... this is the ultimate thrilling adventure. These rides are highly technical, fast and hard. Experienced paddlers only. (4.) Guided Fishing Trips or Boat/Raft Rentals ... Cantrell is the only outfitter to offer boat/raft rentals on the New River Study Zone. If you choose a guided fishing trip, our guides know all the hot spots for bass and catfish. Trout fishing is available locally. Specials offered throughout the season.
address: 49 Cantrell Dr, Gatewood Rd., Fayetteville, WV, 25840

name: Canty House
description: Now a part of the holdings of West Virginia State University, the Canty House was privately built and owned until the 1960s, when the college purchased it. Since its purchase, West Virginia State University has used the Canty House as an office building, as the campus health center and currently is the site of the college's Sports Hall of Fame. Originally the building was the residence of "Colonel" James Munroe Canty, one of the early instructors at the West Virginia Colored Institute. He was appointed as its "Superintendent of Mechanics" in January 1893 upon Booker T. Washington's recommendation to Principal J. M. Hill. On the National Register of Historic Places.
address: West Virginia State University, Institute, WV, 25112

name: Canyon Rim Gifts
description: Souvenirs of West Virginia, New River Gorge Bridge, and White Water Rafting: T-shirts, hats, shorts, sweats, magnets, keychains, mugs, Spoons, thimbles, bells, shot glasses, Moccasins, decals, figurines and jewelry, pottery, pewter, Collectibles, Coal figurines and jewelry, Fenton glass, Gifts and Collectibles. Country food Section: jams, jellies, soups, salsa, seasoning, honey, hot Sauces, coffee, candy, cookbooks. Hot dogs, ice cream, many flavors of Home Made Creamy Fudge.

name: Capitol Market
description: Come see why Charleston’s year-round Capitol Market is a vibrant part of West Virginia’s capital city. Tucked in a turn-of-the-century train station, the indoor-outdoor market offers an exciting mix of farm goodness and specialty shops. Pick up seasonal goods to enjoy now and WV-made gifts to take home. Enjoy seafood, sushi or just-carved meat from the butcher. Order soup, salad or a sandwich from one of the many lunch hot spots, or pop in to a lively Italian restaurant for a sit-down meal.

name: Capitol Market
description: Capitol Market is located in a renovated freight station from the 1800's. It is eclectically designed to capture the essence of an outdoor farmers' market and host to many indoor specialty shops featuring fresh simple food fare to gourmet pleasures with a full-scale restaurant featuring fine Italian cuisine. Hours: January through March: Monday – Saturday 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sunday - Noon to 5 p.m. April through November: Monday – Saturday 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sunday - Noon to 5 p.m. December: Extended Holiday Hours December 1 through Christmas: Monday – Saturday 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Sunday Noon to 5 p.m. Christmas & New Year’s Eve – 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Closed: New Year's Day Easter Memorial Day Independence Day Labor Day Thanksgiving Christmas

name: Capitol Theatre
description: The Capitol Theatre offers a variety of rental services to the community. Rooms in the Capitol are available for renting by school and church groups, local dance studios, local colleges, and other community groups. Make your reservations at the Capitol Theatre today by calling 1-800-828-3097, 304-233-7000 or E-mail us at info@capitoltheatrewheeling.com. For a list of events, visit our website. Box Office Hours: Open Mon. thru Fri. 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. The Box Office is closed on Saturday and Sundays. On event days the Box Office will open one hour prior to event.

name: Caplan’s Jewelry Store
description: We are your local diamond specialist. Family owned since 1927, we offer a wide variety of jewelry, gift options, and Vera Bradley.

name: Carlito’s
description: Extensive menu filled with Mexican favorites. Sizzling fajitas, tacos, burritos, enchiladas and more. Daily lunch buffet Mon-Fri 11-2 and Sun 12-9.

name: Carnifex Ferry Battlefield State Park
description: Carnifex Ferry Battlefield State Park is located on the rim of the Gauley River Canyon, minutes from Summersville Lake. This official Civil War Discovery Trail site offers picnicking, reservable picnic shelters, hiking trails, three overlooks of the Gauley River, softball field, volleyball court, horseshoe pits, and the Patterson House Museum. The park is seasonal in nature. This is the site of the Sept. 10, 1861 battle in which confederates failed to regain control of the Kanawha Valley. West Virginia's statehood proceeded without serious threat as a result. THE PATTERSON HOUSE MUSEUM The museum is open seasonally, on Saturday, Sunday and holidays from 10:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. For park map and travel directions, open hours, reenactment events, and area history, visit the park web link below.

name: Carnifex Ferry Cabins
description: In the heart of the New River Gorge in Wild and Wonderful West Virginia, two minutes from Summersville Lake, on the doorstep of Carnifex Ferry State Park, you will find Carnifex Ferry Cabins. The State Park includes a museum and historical information, which appeals to Civil War and history buffs. Couples and families love the miles of hiking trails, picnic facilities, and famed view of the Gauley River from the park. Hiking trails lead to three different waterfalls. From our romantic, one-bedroom, 1840's McKinley log Cabin, to our six-bedroom Gauley Getaway, Carnifex Ferry Cabins has the perfect vacation rental for you, your family, and your friends to enjoy. The cabins are located 20 minutes from Fayetteville, named one of America’s Coolest Small Town by Budget Travel Magazine and Matador Networks. Fayetteville is known by most as being the home of the New River Gorge Bridge, the longest arch bridge in the Western Hemisphere. This foodie town, with outdoor shops and boutiques, will delight everyone who visits.

name: Carol’s Crossroads Best
description: Stop by for the famous Deluxe Nancy Burger – two hamburger patties, three slices of bread and your favorite condiments. A homemade cream pie also is recommended.

name: Carriage House Inn Bed & Breakfast
description: The five bedrooms and attic suite have been thoughtfully restored with a unique blend of country charm and comfort. All rooms and the suite have their own private baths and are non-smoking. The Carriage House Inn Gift shop, located in the attached renovated barn, offers a variety of arts and crafts created by local artisans. The raised bed gardens on the property are a must to see, fresh grown herbs become a culinary addition to Jeannie's creative breakfast dishes.

name: Carter G. Woodson Memorial
description: In the fall of 1995, the city of Huntington erected a statue in honor of Dr. Carter G. Woodson, "Father of Black History." Woodson had served as principal of Douglass High School in Huntington and dean at West Virginia State College, Institute. After earning a Ph.D. from Harvard University in 1912, he published the influential Journal of Negro History, the Bulletin of Negro History and a series of seminal books. In 1926, he launched "Negro History Week," which has been expanded to "Black History Month." The statue stands in the community along Hal Greer Boulevard in Huntington.

name: Cass Historical Museum
description: Cass Historical Museum. Located in the Company Store Building, and founded by Kyle J. Neighbors, the museum features items and artifacts of Cass. Open to the public at no charge, visitors can learn more about the trains, community spirit and history of Cass and the surrounding area. The history of Cass and the regions logging industry come alive before your eyes through railroad artifacts, train paintings and antiques. Open daily, Saturdays before Memorial Day to Labor Day, 9 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.; Weekends Sept. - Oct. (Schedule concurrent with Cass Scenic Railroad.

name: Cass Scenic Railroad State Park
description: Cass Scenic Railroad State Park features train excursions that transport you back in time to relive an era when steam-driven locomotives were an essential part of everyday life. The town of Cass remains relatively unchanged. The restored company houses now rent as vacation cottages any time of year. The company store and museum, town and locomotive shop tours, and the Last Run Restaurant are seasonal delights. The Last Run Restaurant is a featured eatery in WV's 101 Unique Places to Dine. Train rides departing from the Cass Depot are filled with rich histories of the past, unparalleled views of a vast wilderness area, and close-up encounters with the sights and sounds of original steam-driven locomotives. Train rides dates begin in May and continue through October and ticket sales are through http://mountainrailwv.com/. COMPANY HOUSE RESERVATIONS: Stay overnight in a two-story company house when you visit Cass Scenic Railroad. There are 20 houses that will accommodate from 4 – 14 guests. Open year-round, the houses are rented by the day, up to a maximum of two weeks. Reserve by telephone by calling Call Cass Scenic Railroad directly at 304-456-4300. Reserve via online services. Make company house reservations anytime, day or night via the internet. Stop by the park office during office hours to make house reservations.

name: Castaway Caboose
description: We’ve refurbished 2 original Wabash RR cabooses into comfortable efficiency suites on rails! Your overnight package includes a round-trip fare on the DURBIN ROCKET steam train ride, where you will be "cast away" at one of two remote settings. Located several miles from the nearest encroachment of the modern world, this secluded wilderness setting along the beautiful Greenbrier River is where you will spend the evening with only the rushing waters of the river to break the quiet of the night. At the end of your stay the train will pull your caboose car back to Durbin where you will be treated to your first glimpse of civilization! Each CASTAWAY CABOOSE has room for up to six adults and includes a refrigerator, range, heat, linens, towels, utensils, DVD player, full-size shower, and restroom. They depart and arrive from the Depot in Durbin on the regular schedule of the DURBIN ROCKET train, so plan accordingly. A personal load of firewood will be provided for your campfire. No cell phone service is available. Bring your own food/clothing: Towels/Wash Clothes (Bring your own towels for swimming). Boarding Location: Durbin Depot Durbin, WV 26264 38°32 50 N 79°49 41 W

name: Castaway Yarn Shop
description: Knitting and crochet supplies. Knitting lessons available. Plymouth yarn and Brown Sheep yarn. Knitting groups welcome. Free knitting lessons every Thursday evening from 6 - 8 p.m., just purchase yarn and supplies.

name: Castiglia’s Italian Eatery
description: Great Italian food with generous portions. The staff is very personable and makes you feel right at home.

name: Castle View Cottage
description: Three bedrooms: two with queen beds and one with two twin beds, rollaway bed. Living room with wood burning fireplace, dining area, screened porch, central a/c and heat. Large fully-equipped kitchen, 2 TV’s w/dish satellite, one with DVD, and the other with VCR. Full washer/dryer, fireplace wood, linens, beach chairs and towels provided. Game room in large walkout basement, adult & kids pool tables; air hockey; foosball; darts & board games. Children's table set, play area with books & puzzles and more. Sitting area with full-size futon & rocking chair. Pet & child friendly. Rates $145 per night weekdays and $175 per night on weekends. Ask about 6 nights and other specials. Most major credit cards accepted. Check in is 3pm and check out is 12 noon. A 50% deposit is required to hold the reservation. Return renters get a 10% discount. Year round rental.

name: Castlemans Run Lake Wildlife Management Area
description: 486 acres Hunting is permitted on the area. Terrain: moderately steep slopes dominated by mixed hardwoods, brushland and open fields. Hunting Prospects: deer, grouse, raccoon, squirrel, turkey. Lake is 22 acres, provides fishing for bluegill, catfish, muskellunge, northern pike and trout. A boat launch ramp is located on the area. Electric motors only. Overnight camping and open fires are not permitted. Toilet facilities are available. *no camping* Location: Approximately three miles south of Bethany along county Route 32, off U.S. Route 40 near Potomac Settlement in Brooke County. Access can also be gained from county Route 32/3 and 32/5.

name: Castlerock Restaurant
description: CASTLE ROCK RESTAURANT is southern West Virginia's place to go for fantastic food, perfect pizza and delicious desserts! The pinto bean and cornbread dinner is absolutely fabulous. Castlerock represents true cuisine of southern West Virginia.
address: Located between Pineville WV and Oceana WV in the little town of Jesse WV on RD 10., Jesse, WV, 25943

name: Cathedral Falls
description: Cathedral Falls is one of the tallest and most scenic waterfalls found in Almost Heaven. This natural wonder sits at 60 feet tall, with waters plunging over sandstone and shale cliffs. Cathedral falls is both beautiful and easy to access – visible from Route 60 and with a designated parking area. Follow the short roadside path to get up close and personal with this mountain wonder.

name: Cathedral State Park
description: Cathedral State Park is an ancient hemlock forest of majestic proportions, and one of the last living commemorations of the vast old-growth hemlock forest that once flourished in the Appalachian highlands. Trees up to 90 feet tall and 16 feet in circumference from cloisters in the park. Throughout the woods, eastern hemlock is the dominant species. The 133 acre park is located on Rt. 50, in Preston County, in northeastern WV. The region is hilly to mountainous, but the park is located on rather gently sloping ground with an elevation varying from 2460 to 2620 feet. More than 170 species of vascular flora have been cataloged, including: Nine species of fern; three species of club moss; more than 30 tree species; and more than 50 species of wildflowers. Cathedral offers 6 miles of hiking trails. The combination of ancient Hemlocks, rhododendrons, ferns, mountain stream, and wildlife offers excellent hiking and photography opportunities. The Cathedral Trail follows Rhine Creek through the forest allowing the opportunity to see a variety of plant and tree species. Cathedral has a picnic area with two shelters and a playground area. Shelters may be reserved by calling the park office. Restrooms are also located in the picnic area.
address: 12 Cathedral Park Drive, 12 Cathedral Way, Aurora, WV, 26705

name: Catherine Miller Designs
description: For 34 years, self-taught artisan Catherine Miller has pursued the dying art of intaglio crystal engraving, and specializes in original one of a kind heirloom items. Catherine's inspiration originated with an article in National Geographic covering the dying art of copper wheel engraving. She uses the old world method of hand engraving original art into crystal with a variety of stone wheels of different diameters and profiles on a lathe. All work is executed free hand without the use of stencils or patterns, with some items taking close to 200 hours to engrave.

name: Cato Park Golf Course
description: The 9-hole "Cato Park" course at the Cato Park Golf Course facility in Charleston, West Virginia features 1,719 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 30 . The course rating is 70.0 and it has a slope rating of 113. Open: 8 am - 5 pm Monday thru Friday Closed Saturday and Sunday

name: Cave Country Store & Camping, LLC
description: We offer 80 sites with water, electric and sewer, 30 sites with electric only, bathhouse nearby with restroom facilities. South Branch of Potomac runs along backside of campgrounds with trout stocked fishing. Seneca Caverns and Smoke Hole about half hour away. Season:Mid-March through December
address: 8695 Upper South Branch Rd., Franklin, WV, 26807

name: Cav’s Coaches
description: Cav's Coach Company has been in business since November 2005. Cav's Coach Company is committed to providing excellent service and meeting the needs of our customers. We specialize in tours for small and large groups and provide total tour packages to meet the needs of your group. We also offer Charter services.

name: CB Ranch Rental Suite
description: One Bedroom Suite located approx. 4 miles from downtown Lewisburg's fine dining, antique shops and quaint stores. We are located on a 100+ acre farm with beautiful views and awesome hiking trails. We are in a very private setting and the atmosphere is serene. We offer horse boarding, a vacation rental and primitive horse camping. We have lush green pastures for horses, beautiful wooded trails for hiking/riding/exploring and magnificent mountain views to take in. Some of our favorite restaurants in Lewisburg are the Irish Pub, Food and Friends, The Asylum, The French Goat, The Wild Bean, Stardust Cafe, Hill and Holler, Delsol Cafe and plenty more. For outdoor recreation, you may wish to visit Greenbier State Forest, Droop Mountain Battlefield State Park, Monongahela National Forest (Cranberry Glades), Bearytown State Park, Babcock State Park, and Bluestone State Park. Additional attractions include: Lost World Caverns, Organ Cave, Carnegie Hall,Greenbrier Historical Society and North House Museum, Rails to trails, numerous covered bridges, Snowshoe Ski Resort and The Greenbrier Resort. Area activities include: biking, hiking, canoeing, kayaking, skiing and caving opportunities. Or you can just kick up your feet, take in the views and relax.

name: Cecilia’s Bridal & Formal Wear
description: Boutique style shopping in downtown Lewisburg. Great for special occasions and every day wear. Offering the most current styles and fashions in wedding, formal wear, day wear and accessories at competitive prices. Bridal fittings by appointment. Mon-Sat: 11 a.m. - 6 p.m.

name: Cedar Creek State Park
description: Nestled on 2,588 wooded acres near Glenville in West Virginia’s central region, Cedar Creek State Park has sites for single campers, families and large groups. The campground offers 66 regular campsites and 10 group campsites. The campsites feature water hookup, 30 amp electric only, fire ring, grill and picnic table. Visitors and patrons enjoy fishing, hiking, game courts and more. The campground is open spring through fall. Campsites may be reserved anytime online, by phone, or at the campground office. Reservations may be made for no less than two consecutive nights on weekends (Friday and Saturday) or one-night Sunday through Thursday.

name: Cedar Run Farm
description: From the sweet, delicious taste of pure maple syrup, to the fresh scent of pine at Christmas, Cedar Run Farm works to bring nature's bounty direct to you. Our syrup is pure and natural, with none of those additives and fillers found in the grocery store syrups. We use traditional and modern harvesting techniques, and lots of old-fashioned hard work to create quality products for your family. Products: West Virginia Maple Syrup Christmas Trees Fresh Blueberries Christmas Trees. Choose from a great selection of Norway Spruce and Fraser Fir trees starting in December. We will trim and bale your tree and help secure it on your vehicle. We will be open every weekend in December. After selecting the perfect Christmas tree, you can also pick up some last minute gifts in our Christmas shop. Arts & Crafts: (available at select shows). Debbie Metz has been interested in Arts & Crafts since childhood. After experimenting with different mediums for about 20 years, her love of art has blossomed. She paints gourds raised on the farm and loves to attend auctions and yard sales to find unique used treasures such as old sleds, ice skates and furniture. Through decorative painting with acrylics, she transforms each piece into a beautiful work of art. You can find her hand-crafted items at the select craft shows and at Tamarack, Best of West Virginia, in Beckley, West Virginia.

name: Centennial Motel
description: Centennial Motel is "Your Home Away from Home". We have clean comfortable rooms and friendly service. We offer free coffee, free local calls and each room has a mini frig and a microwave. We are located just off Route 33 with many restaurants located nearby. Affordable nightly and weekly rates.

name: Central City Antique Mall
description: Known as the "Antique Capital" of the Tri-State (Ohio, Kentucky and West Virginia), you can enjoy shopping, eating, and experience our rich history at nearby museums.
