We have antique, specialty and gift shops, home style cooking Cafés, an Amish market, bed and breakfast, museums, arts and crafts, and more. Old Central City is conveniently located just off of the 17th Street West interchange of I-64 on West 14th Street in West Huntington.

name: Central City Cafe
description: Mom & Pop eatery offering ample plates of traditional American fare in an old-fashioned dining room. Cafe offers the best darn soup and sandwiches this side of the Mississippi!

name: Central City Market
description: Open Air Farmers Market selling only locally grown produce.

name: Centre Market Historic District
description: Welcome to Centre Market, an eclectic mix of shops and quality dining. Wheeling's Centre Market, built in 1853, is older than the state itself. The Upper Market House, the oldest market house in the country, was originally an open air market. The Lower Market House was built in 1891. The Historic Centre Market neighborhood has many other points of interest for make for an enjoyable day trip. Unique eateries, a number of antique shops and salons are all within a one block walking area.

name: Century Inn Restaurant
description: Daily specials featuring home-cooked meals, homemade pies, bread, & soups. Serves breakfast and lunch.

name: Ceredo-Kenova Library
description: The Ceredo-Kenova Library is a one-story structure adjacent to the Ceredo-Kenova War Memorial Building. Built in the 1980’s, the library offers large print books along with books on CD and cassettes. Mondays 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Tuesdays through Fridays 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Open on Saturdays 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. September through May. All libraries are closed on Memorial Day, July 4, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day and New Year's Day. The Christmas/New Year's closing schedule is subject to additional days. In case of bad weather (snow, ice, high water) call ahead before making a special trip!

name: Chalet in the Woods
description: Chalet in the Woods is nestled in the award-winning Cacapon South community near Berkeley Springs, voted "Best Development of the Year" by the West Virginia Homebuilder's Association. It is centrally located between Virginia, Maryland and Pennsylvania and is less then two hours to nearby Washington, DC. This three-story, four-bedroom, and three-(full) bath chalet, accommodating up to 10 guests, is located directly across from 6000-acre Cacapon State Park, which offers a beautiful 18-hole Robert Trent Jones golf course, more than 20 miles of trails for hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming, fishing, picnic areas, basketball courts, tennis, a restaurant and recreation center.

name: Chalets at the Lake
description: 12 chalets located on 20 acres of beautiful West Virginia wilderness, minutes from Summersville Lake. Chalets at the Lake offer a rustic style cabin, with the amenities of home, including free WiFi and hot tubs in most.

name: Chamber of Commerce of the Mid Ohio Valley
description: Whether you’re relocating to the Mid-Ohio Valley or simply visiting, we welcome you and hope your stay is just what you hope it will be! We connect business and community! The following counties make up the Mid-Ohio Valley: Calhoun, Jackson, Pleasants, Ritchie, Roane, Wirt and Wood in West Virginia and Washington County in Ohio.

name: Charles Fork Lake
description: A 70 acre impoundment located just south of Spencer on WV Rt 36 features 1,600 acres and 21 miles of trails in pristine Appalachian backcountry for you to explore. The lake is well known for world class walleye, musky and bass fishing. Paddlers flock to these waters for a peaceful glide across the waters where they might see blue herons or even a bald eagle. The Tour de Lake Mountain Bike Race is one of the most popular and longest running events in the WV Mountain Biking Association points series. The lake has hosted bass fishing tournaments and is home to the annual bluegill tournament for kids ran by the local Sal font Chapter of Trout Unlimited. Charles Fork Lake features camping with electric hookups and non-electric sites. Vault toilets are available at the campground and a beautiful picnic pavilion for your birthday party, family reunion or other activity at no charge (first come, first serve).

name: Charleston Capitol Hotel
description: Ideally located in the beautiful city of Charleston, WV, the Charleston Capitol Hotel is situated across from the Clay Center for the Arts and Sciences, just a mile from the State Capitol Building, walking distance to Downtown, Civic Center and Town Center Mall. Business services and high-speed internet access in the lobby and WiFi access in the guest rooms at no charge. Check-in time starts at 3 p.m; Check-out time is 11 a.m.

name: Charleston Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Charleston is rich in historic architecture, an eclectic music scene, bountiful shopping, unique dining and four seasons of changing mountain landscape. The capital city serves as the gateway to all that is wild and wonderful in the Mountain State, including world-class zip-line canopy tours, whitewater rafting, ATV trails, golfing, hiking, fishing, rock climbing, mountain biking, canoeing and kayaking. A trip here during the spring reveals some of the best weather to take walks along Kanawha Boulevard and on nearby hiking trails. [if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif] https://wvtourism.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/03.13.24-Charleston-CVB-Listing.mp4

name: Charleston East End Main Street
description: One of the oldest and most diverse neighborhoods in Charleston, the East End is an eclectic community with a funky, urban style. Charleston’s East End is home to the West Virginia State Capitol, Appalachian Power Park, and Clay Center for the Arts and Sciences of West Virginia, Capitol Farmers’ Market and more than 25 restaurants. • The self-guided Walking Tour is a colorful guide through the East End that features the area’s urban myths, unique history and architecture. • “East End Eats” is a guide to the 25 great restaurants that dot the community. Featured are restaurants, specialty shops and tasty gems. • The colorful mural on the corner of Elizabeth and Washington Streets is the product of local artist, Rob Keeley, who captured images of local families and children and brought them to life in a mural dedicated to the East End.Signature events• The East End Yard Sale in May has grown into one of the largest events in this beautiful historical district. The sale attracts more than 200 different sellers and thousands of visitors who come to hunt for bargains, shop, dine and sightsee. • FestivALL in late June takes to the streets of Charleston, showcasing high-quality local and world-class artists in music, dance, theater, visual art and film. • The East End Garden Showcase visits more than 25 gardens on a free self-guided tour through the month of June. The tour celebrates the East End historical neighborhood’s diverse urban gardens. East End homeowners, apartment dwellers and businesses have cultivated beautiful green spaces in the heart of the largest city in the state. As a partner in the Charleston FestivALL the participating gardeners will be available for an informal “Q & A” or meet and greet with visitors. • On Memorial Day weekend the state capitol grounds celebrate traditional West Virginia arts at the annual Vandalia gathering. This free festival brings to the visitor art, music, dance, stories, crafts and food of the state. • A yearly calendar of Broadway shows, symphony performances, and musical events are held at the Clay Center for the Performing Arts.
address: 1210 Smith Street, 3rd Floor (Contemporary Galleries building) / P.O. Box 11255, Charleston, WV, 25301

name: Charleston Town Center Mall
description: Charleston's premier shopping destination.

name: Charleston West Side Main Street
description: The West Side is a significant and historic passageway in its region. It is home to the Charleston Light Opera Guild theater company and some of the oldest and most well-known family businesses in the state. Popular places to please the palate include The Smokehouse and The Grill, a lunchtime/dinner hotspot for many state leaders and town locals. February’s Valentine Promotion includes a gift basket from Main Street retailers with prizes, such as car detailing, spa treatments, flowers and sweet treats. The Kanawha Trestle Rail Trail Project is currently working to create an urban trail for walking, biking, jogging and in-line skating in the West Side area. In June, wiener dog races are part of Charleston’s FestivALL. Included are races for puppies, adults and senior dogs, puppy parade, vet corner, food vendors, pet blessing and wiener dog merchandise.

name: Charlie’s Harley-Davidson
description: Since 2007, Charlie's Harley-Davidson® has served the tri-state area with award winning sales and service of Harley-Davidson® motorcycles. Our showroom displays close to 100 new and pre-owned Harley-Davidson® motorcycles while the MotorClothes® department utilizes two floors to merchandise hundreds of clothing and gift options for all shapes, sizes and tastes. Need to give your bike come TLC? Charlie’s award winning Service Department is on deck to help out! Our shop brings over 80 years of experience that ranges from bike building, wreck reconstruction and monster horsepower builds. At Charlie’s Harley-Davidson®, we work relentlessly to be a total package dealership who values consistency as well as the integrity of our products. We treat our customers with respect and do everything in our power to take care of our customers like they are family. We are your Gold Bar & Shield dealership. Charlie's Harley-Davidson carries a full line of Harley-Davidson motorcycles, parts and accessories and MotorClothes items and collectibles. We also have a '50s-style diner which serves super-sized sandwiches and salads.

name: Charlotte Ryde Nature Preserve
description: Charlotte Ryde Nature Preserve is located in Preston County, WV, in a remote part of Cheat Canyon approximately 5 river miles downstream of the town of Albright. The Preserve protects approximately 3 river miles of the Cheat River. The Cheat River is one of the premier whitewater rafting locations in West Virginia. Charlotte Ryde Nature Preserve is home to a great diversity of species, including rare land snails, bats, cave animals, plants, salamanders and more. The preserve is open to the public as the Cheat Canyon Wildlife Management Area (WMA). The WMA also includes approximately 8 miles of the Allegheny Trail, a 330-mile hiking trail extending North-South through West Virginia from the Pennsylvania line to the Appalachian Trail on Peters Mountain at the Virginia border. Mailing address: West Virginia Field Office 435 Wilson St. Elkins, WV 26241

name: Cheap Thrills Records
description: Take a stroll through this music lovers paradise. Browse the largest selection of new and used music releases including the areas only vinyl record section. While you are there, don't forget to check out their counter which is covered in a 20-year music sticker collection!

name: Cheat Lake Trail
description: A scenic, wooded 4.5 mile trail follows the east bank of Cheat Lake and offers a playground, picnic tables, restrooms, fishing piers, and boat docks. Recreational use includes walking and cycling on a smooth crushed limestone surface. The Cheat Lake Trail can be accessed via the Cheat Lake exit on Interstate 68. Follow the signs for State Route 857 and turn left onto the highway. Then turn left onto Morgans Run Road. Be careful, as the road is narrow. Morgans Run Road ends at the trail’s main parking area.

name: Cheat Mountain Pizza
description: Located In Highland House At Snowshoe. A Different Twist On An Old Favorite. Stop In And Try A Variety Of Gourmet Pizzas--from Traditional Red Sauce Classics To Basil Pesto Creations. You'll Be Hard Pressed To Find A Favorite. Choose From a Variety Of Salads With Homemade Dressings. Sit And Watch The Skiers And Snowboarders Go By While You Enjoy Some Of The Best Pie On The Mountain.

name: Cheat Mountain Touring Center
description: Cheat Mountain Touring Center offers lodging, canoe rentals & shuttles, mountain bike shuttles & tours, area information & map sales. The center is situated at the base of Cheat Mountain in the heart of the Monongahela Forest. We are located 17 south of Elkins and 25 miles north of Snowshoe Mountain Resort, in Huttonsville, WV on Rt. 219.
address: Post Office Box 145, Mill Creek, WV, 26280

name: Water Gap Retreat
description: With a comfortable cabin and the recent addition of five new riverside sleeping shelters, we can accommodate groups ranging from two to 25 people. Water Gap Retreat is a perfect spot for a family reunion, board meeting or small group retreat. The 133-square-foot, custom-designed waterproof canvas shelters have a spacious four-alcove design that will comfortably accommodate one to three people. Each one has two sets of shelves, a writing table, single-bed air mattresses, and solar-powered lights. The Cabin at Water Gap Retreat has three sleeping areas and comfortably accommodates up to eight people. The two downstairs bedrooms have full-size beds. The cabin's sleeping loft, accessible by a ladder, has a single bed and a full-size bed. The cabin has a fully-equipped kitchen, dishwasher, clothes washer and dryer, front porch, stone fireplace, television with a DVD player, small stereo, and air conditioning.

name: Cheat River Lodge & Riverside Cabins
description: The Cheat River Lodge is a unique privately owned getaway located on the Cheat River in the Monongahela National Forest six miles east of Elkins, West Virginia. Lodging accommodations include spacious rooms in a quaint six room country inn overlooking the river and five unique cabins situated along the river. Each lodge room has a private bath and large picture window that faces the river. Each cabin is unique in structure, architecture, location, placement on the river and overall size. The cabins range from riverfront to mountain, log to stone, and historic to contemporary, but they all have a private hot tub! Whether a naturalist, adventurist, or a sightseer, there are many interesting places nearby to explore that offer year round adventure. The Cheat River and Monongahela National Forest located adjacent to the Lodge offer unlimited venues for hiking, birding, mountain biking, cross-country skiing, snow-shoeing, swimming,tubing, canoeing, kayaking, native & stocked fishing, and hunting. Rock climbing, spelunking, horseback riding, and downhill skiing are also nearby. The Cheat River Lodge is located on Old Route 33 approximately 5 miles East of Elkins, West Virginia. From the 4-lane, take the Stuart Recreation Park exit. Proceed 1 ½ mile to the green bridge, but do not cross. Turn right just before the bridge.

name: Cheat River Outfitters
description: Located in Albright, in North Central West Virginia, the Cheat Canyon section of the Cheat River is West Virginia's premier springtime Class V whitewater run. The Canyon boasts 13 miles of unsurpassed wilderness beauty and breathtaking whitewater adventure. Not to worry, Cheat River Outfitters also offers adventures on the Class II-III Cheat Narrows. The Narrows is one of the cleanest and beautiful runs around. Enjoy fully guided whitewater rafting as well as swimming, rock jumping, rock climbing, paintball and riverside picnicking for a perfect day on the river all summer long. Plan your river trip today in West Virginia today!

name: Cheat Summit Fort
description: General George B. McClellan ordered this fort to be built in 1861 to secure the Staunton-Parkersburg Turnpike and protect the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad. The Confederacy’s inability to take the fort in September, 1861, was central in the failure of Robert E. Lee’s western Virginia Campaign. In the October battle of Greenbrier River, troops from Cheat Summit Fort, under General R. H. Milroy, attacked Camp Bartow. Neither side could claim victory and the Union troops returned to Cheat Summit Fort while the Confederates withdrew to Camp Allegheny. In December of the same year, soldiers from Cheat Summit Fort attacked Camp Allegheny, but were driven back. The site is also significant for, perhaps, the earliest use of telegraph technology in the Civil War. The unique earthworks of this encampment remain. Located: on COUNTY ROUTE 43/4 in Valley Head, WV. From I-79 near Weston, take U.S. 33 east to Elkins, then U.S. 250 south to just before Cheat Bridge. Turn right at the sign and right again at the T. Go about 1 mile to the top. Note: Road is sometimes closed due to snow; call 304-636-1800 for road information.
address: Monongahela National Forest, 200 Sycamore St (mailing), Elkins, WV, 26241

name: Cheetah B’s
description: Cheetah B's has all American cuisine and offers dine in, carry out, delivery or catering. From delicious steaks and burgers to wraps, seafood and sushi. Enjoy and appetizer and favorite adult beverage before dinner in this family friendly atmosphere!
address: 2099 North Fork Highway, Suite #2, Petersburg, WV, 26847

name: Chestnut Boutique Hotel
description: Located in downtown Morgantown, this boutique hotel offers oversized guest rooms featuring top-of-the line luxury bedding, Tivoli Elegance pillow top mattresses and suites that appeal to every sense. Start the morning off right with a fresh cup of coffee, hot tea, or coco from one of the new Keurig Coffee stations conveniently located on each floor. Each station features complimentary fresh fruit, wrapped pastries, and an array of healthy breakfast bars. Other amenities include complimentary on-site garage parking and complimentary wifi. Awarded 2014 and 2015 CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE Located less than 3 miles from Morgantown's Regional airport (MGW) and within steps of local businesses, theatre, shops and both WVU campuses.

name: Chestnut Brew Works
description: Chestnut Brew Works, LLC started as a small beer brewery nestled in the woods of southern Monongalia county, about 10 miles south of Morgantown, WV in April of 2013. The demand quickly outpaced the supply, however, so we recently expanded our operations and added a taproom in the historic South Park area of Morgantown. Tap Room is open Wed. - Fri.: 4 p.m. - 11 p.m.; Sat noon - 11 p.m. We sell and fill growlers!

name: Chestnut Creek Campground
description: 34 Camp Sites plus large group accommodations with advance booking. All sites have a picnic table plus a fire ring and provide a natural, private forest setting for tents, campers and RVs. No electric or water hookups. Campground facilities include a modern bath house (hot showers), rustic tent sites, firewood and ice available (at the office), large picnic shelter for groups and a tent/camping/cabin/kitchen complex available. Some sites are able to accommodate pop-up campers and trailers up to 16 ft. Office open until 11 p.m. with self registration for late arrivals. Located: North on U.S. route 19 past Fayetteville and the New River Gorge Bridge. Turn right onto Lansing Road. Go 1 ¼ mile to campground entrance on left. (PF20) Traveling South on U.S. Route 19, turn left onto Lansing Road, 5 miles south of U.S. Route 60.

name: Chestnut Ridge Country Inn
description: We are a country Bed & Breakfast in a restored 1890 farmhouse, in the heart of Pocahontas County, with 4 private guestrooms with private baths and a bungalow with private bath. While you're here, ride the Cass RR logging train to the top of the mountain, hike/bike the 78-mile Greenbrier River Trail, take a personal tour of the National Radio Telescope where they listen to outer space, bring your skis and enjoy Snowshoe Ski Resort just 15 short miles from our Inn, or just relax to our getaway and see the brightest stars you've seen in a long time while you sit by the campfire at our backyard firepit. Special events include Skiing @ Snowshoe in November, December, January, February and March, Greenbrier River Race in April, RailFan Weekend @ Cass in May, the GNCC motorsports race @ Snowshoe in June, Cass RR fiddles and viddles in July, August and September, Roadkill Cookoff in September and fall festivals and fall colors in October.

name: Chestnut Ridge Regional Park and Campground
description: Picturesque Chestnut Ridge Park & Campground is surrounded by Coopers Rock State Forest and the West Virginia University Forest, creating a total outdoor recreational area of over 12,000 acres. Open year-round, CRP offers a place to cool off in the summer with lakes for swimming, fishing, and paddle boating and a warm fire to come in to after tubing down the sled hill in the winter. At Chestnut Ridge Park & Campground you can camp, hike, bike, swim, fish, snow board or sled. Yearly events include a Toboggan Festival, Kid Fishing Rodeo, and the best Mountain Music Concert Series of the summer! Chestnut Ridge Park offers 50 wooded tent sites. We have both Single (1 tent) and Double (2 tents) pad sites, some of with have buildt up sand pads. All of the sites are front country camping and primitive, meaning no electricty. Each site includes a picnic table and fire ring. Chestnut Ridge Park has 12 back-in, water and 30 amp electric RV sites (dump station available on property).Sites are wooded, graveled and include a picnic table and fire ring.Tents are NOT permitted to be set up in the RV areas. The park is located just 10 miles east of Morgantown, WV on I-68 at exit 15 / Coopers Rock.
address: 346 Chestnut Ridge Camp Rd., Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: Chestnut Ridge Winery
description: Winery/Vineyard · Wine, Beer & Spirits Store · Arts & Entertainment Chestnut Ridge Winery is located inside the Chestnut Ridge Artist Colony overlooking the City of Spencer. You can enjoy a stroll through the grounds to see the Woodworking, Jewelry Studio or the Blacksmith shop. There are also hiking and biking trails with picnic tables located near the winery. The winery also offers a large deck to sit and enjoy the views.  Open Wednesday through Saturday from 11 a.m. - 6 p.m. and Sunday 1 p.m. - 5 p.m.

name: Chestnut Springs Farm
description: Goat farm for raising goats for pasture reclamation and meat goat production. Boer Goats.
address: Rt. 20 Between Princeton and Bluewell, Bluefield, WV, 24701

name: Chetty’s Pub
description: The laid-back casual atmosphere of his namesake restaurant offers a huge deck overlooking the New River Gorge and multiple large-screen TVs. With a menu stacked with burgers and sandwiches to seafood, vegetable dishes and appetizers, plus weekend specials, Chetty's is perfect for grabbing appetizer, a pub sandwich or just a frosty beverage to wash down your latest adventure. It's our only year-round restaurant, so come in and enjoy the atmosphere anytime.

name: Chetty’s Pub
description: With the best view in West Virginia this is the restaurant you don't want to miss. We also have the best burgers around and a whole lot more—right smack dab on the rim of the 900-foot deep New River Gorge. Open 7 days a week until after Bridge Day, then 5 days a week until April. Join us for Wing Night on Monday's from 5 p.m. -9 p.m.; all of our best flavors sold by the half dozen.

name: Chief Logan Lodge & Conference Center
description: Chief Logan Lodge, Hotel and Conference Center offers superior customer service, 75 modern rooms and suites, guest laundry, indoor pool, fitness room, free WiFi, and hot tub, this overnight facility is a welcome addition for travelers of US 119. Overnight guests of Chief Logan Lodge enjoy a complimentary continental breakfast from 6:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m. daily. The Continental breakfast is included in room rental rates. The Chief Logan Conference Center offers planners a destination with all the meeting conveniences. With 20,000 square feet of meeting space and full-service restaurant. The hotel and conference center at Chief Logan is perfect for vacation, reunion, conference, or business travel. Pets are permitted in designated lodge sleeping rooms. This room type is not available as an online reservation option. Please call for pet-friendly reservations. Check-in is 4:00 p.m.; Check-out is 11:00 a.m. An early check-in option by 1:00 p.m. is available at an additional fee. One mile off US 119 at exit 30.5, this lodge and restaurant is exceptional. Visit http://www.chiefloganlodge.com/ for special rates and packages, events, hours and more.

name: Chief Logan State Park
description: Located four miles north of Logan in the heart of West Virginia’s southern coalfields, Chief Logan State Park is one of the most visited facilities in the West Virginia State Parks System. The park is also located within close proximity to the Hatfield-McCoy ATV trails for campers looking for a uniquely West Virginia adventure. Chief Logan State Park is all about recreation. The campground offers 26 units, 14 of which have full water, sewage and electric hookups, 12 have electric and water only. Hot showers are available at a centrally located bathhouse. The campground also features a water slide at the swimming pool and an outdoor amphitheater (seasonal by nature), Museum in the Park, hiking trails, multiple picnic shelters, fishing and more, makes this state park a favorite destination for daytime activity or overnight camping. Campsites may be reserved anytime online, by phone, or at the campground office.

name: Children’s Easter Egg Hunt and Community Cookout
description: Easter egg hunt and community cookout

name: China Buffet (Golden Garden Restaurant) – Lewisburg
description: Chinese and American cuisine. Serving lunch and dinner from menu or buffet. Offering Vegetarian options and take out. Mon-Thurs: 11 a.m. - 9 p.m.; Fri-Sat: 11 a.m. - 10 p.m.; Sun 11:30 a.m. -9 p.m.

name: China Kitchen
description: Chinese cuisine and sushi.

name: Chin’s Restaurant – West Virginia
description: Family owned and operated restaurant offering authentic Chinese cuisine. Each entree is cooked to order. Serving the Kanawha Valley in current location since 1985.

name: Chip Shots FootGolf
description: Where Soccer meets Golf in the beautiful mountains of Tucker County West Virginia! We are a small 9 hole Footgolf links. Loads of fun! Come try it out! FootGolf is a combination of soccer and golf. The game is played with a soccer ball. The rules largely correspond to the rules of golf. The player with the fewest kicks wins. Chips Shots is a dedicated FootGolf course. FootGolf can be played individually and in groups. A group of 4 is ideal. Chips Shots was created out of a small family farm. Enjoy the game and great views.

name: Chocolate Moose Coffee Shop
description: Beckley's local coffee shop, featuring fresh blends roasted onsite. 100% fruit smoothies and hand-dipped Hershey's ice cream, as well. Plenty of room inside and out to relax or work or visit with friends and family as you enjoy a treat from the Chocolate Moose. We're also the home of Mountain State Miniature Golf and the Outside-In Climbing Gym. You could stay here for awhile!

name: Christmas Shoppe & More
description: Christmas Shoppe & More is a locally-owned retail shop located in historical Front Street of Thomas. We have Christmas here all year. As well as christmas we have gifts for all seasons along with primitive items. At the Christmas Shoppe & More we carry Christmas items along with many other things including: Yankee Candles, Krasco Baskets, Bauble LuLu Jewlery, West Virginia Logo Items, Stephaine Dawn Purses, Appalachian Hand Blown Glass, Carson Flags and Accessories, local made crafts, and many many other things.

name: Chunki’s Pizza & Subs
description: Pizza, subs, hoagies, burgers, salads and sandwiches .Carry out and deliveries.

name: Cider Press Deli & Grill
description: In 2016, the Cider Press Deli & Grill was born with a mission to be a great family place, in Inwood, serving fresh food, hand-crafted in our kitchen featuring seasonal market ingredients from local farms when available. Amidst the rustic and relaxing atmosphere, the Cider Press Deli & Grill offers amazing housemade specialties including sandwiches, salads, soups, local hand-pattied burgers, Black Dog coffee, heavenly desserts & so much more! Thanks for taking time to visit our spot!

name: City of Bluefield
description: Once called "little New York", the city of Bluefield's downtown area is famous for nine historical buildings, all registered on the National Register of Historic Places. In the summer, beautiful flowers and hanging baskets adorn the sidewalks. Summertime is also a perfect chance to get a free glass of lemonade, but only if the temperature in Bluefield reaches a scorching 90 degrees! The Norfolk-Southern railyard still runs, shipping coal to places outside the area.

name: City of Bridgeport Parks and Recreation
description: City of Bridgeport Parks and Recreation operates the Benedum Civic Center Complex which includes an outdoor swimming pool, four parks and the Bridgeport Cemetery. We offer year-round recreational opportunities.

name: City of Dunbar Shawnee Regional Park
description: Shawnee Regional Park now managed by the City of Dunbar contains something for everyone. The park offers areas for meetings, weddings, reunions and other gatherings whether outside or inside by use of the Clubhouse, which has a picturesque view of the golf course and swimming pool, or 8 shelters of various sizes; all of which are handicap accessible. However, if you are into sports, the park also offers an outdoor swimming pool during the summer months, and athletic fields, as well as an 9 hole golf course. Or, you may be interested in the Shawnee Reservation Mound which was built by the Adena culture, probably around 250-150 BC.

name: City Of Dunbar
description: City government organization in Dunbar. The City of Dunbar would like to invite everyone to visit our city. We are located between Charleston and Nitro along the Midland Trail. We believe you will enjoy our community whether you anchor your boat on the Kanawha River at Dunbar Landing to picnic or fish, or travel by car to visit one of our parks (Wine Cellar Park, Laura Anderson Lake, Shawnee Regional Park). Please plan on attending one of our many events held throughout the year.

name: City of Elkins
description: City Government office.

name: City of Hurricane Convention and Visitor’s Bureau
description: The Hurricane Convention and Visitor’s Bureau offers visitors and residents alike information surrounding the City of Hurricane’s events, attractions, and endless things to do and see in the city. The City of Hurricane continues to be voted one of West Virginia’s ‘Best Places to Raise a Family’ for a measurable amount of reasons. The City of Hurricane holds tons of annual events and festivals, walking and biking trails, outdoor recreational facilities, a spray ground, Main Street specialty shops, and a host of dining options. Nuzzled perfectly between Huntington and Charleston, Hurricane is conveniently located off Interstate 64.

name: City of Moundsville
description: City Government Office/Public Service Office. Moundsville is a small town nestled in the northern panhandle of scenic West Virginia. Moundsville is a growing family based community rich in heritage and history. Deriving its name from the many Adena Indian burial mounds constructed more than 2000 years ago. Moundsville is home to the largest conical burial mound in North America. Moundsville is not only a land of sacred pasts, but of promising futures. Moundsville, WV is a melting pot of fine education, a strong blue-collar workforce, bountiful heritage and beautiful landscapes.

name: City of Nitro
description: Our city is located between Huntington and Charleston, two of the Mountain State’s largest cities. Nitro is known as a "Living Memorial to World War I.” A shortage of gunpowder during the conflict sparked the birth of this town as a place to manufacture nitrocellulose. Although the war ended shortly after the first shipment of explosives, the town continues to thrive today.

name: City Of Oak Hill
description: CITY HALL/Municipal Offices/City Government/Public Service Office.
address: 100 Kelly Ave./P.O. Box 1245, Oak Hill, WV, 25901

name: City of Philippi Convention & Visitors Bureau (Barbour CVB)
description: The Philippi Convention & Visitors Bureau promotes Philippi to state and nation.

name: City of Princeton
description: If you like the arts, Princeton is the place to visit. Colorful murals on Mercer Street create a vibrant downtown area. New attractions and shops make up a lot of the downtown revitalization. One of these attractions is the Princeton Railroad Museum, which features exhibits, artifacts and more. You can catch a show or performance later in the evening at the Chuck Mathena Center. As for history, Civil War buffs will want to visit the McNutt House, the first stop on the Civil War Trail.

name: City of Saint Albans (COC)
description: Chamber of Commerce for Saint Albans. Public information service. Event promotions and support including publicity.

name: City Of St. Marys
description: St. Marys is part of the Parkersburg-Marietta-Vienna, WV-OH Metropolitan Statistical Area. Annual Events: Onion Festival, Elks Youth Fair, and Alumni Week in May, West Virginia Bass Festival in June, The Farmers Market on Friday and Saturday during the summer, Agricultural Youth Fair in September, and Lights to the Past Display at the St. Marys Marina in December. We have the St. Marys Marina for fishing and boating and community events available year round. The Pleasants County Parks has shelters, ball fields, and a public swimming pool. Access to Ohio River Wildlife Refuge Island.

name: City of Vienna
description: Local City/County Government office providing information to the public about the area. In 1794, Dr. Joseph Spencer gave our city its name after Vienna, New Jersey, where he had participated in a Revolutionary War battle. Incorporated in 1935, Vienna steadily grew to the city it is today: An important hub of commerce in the Mid Ohio Valley — home to retail stores, shopping malls, motels, restaurants, manufacturing facilities and much more.

name: City Of White Sulphur Springs
description: White Sulphur Springs City Hall housing Local/City Government Offices and Public Services.
address: 589 Main St. West, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: City of Princeton Parks and Recreation
description: While you are in town stop by and discover outdoor hiking and exercise trails, an Olympic-size swimming pool with a water slide, family friendly picnic facilities, a gymnasium and two large playgrounds perfect for kids of all ages.

name: CJ Maggie’s
description: Since opening our first restaurant in 1992 we have worked to find the highest quality, freshest ingredients to create the great tasting, bold flavors you crave. We start fresh every morning... We slice, dice, sizzle and stir fresh ingredients into all dishes. We cut our own Steaks in house, and make our own Sausage and Meatballs. We also have fabulous Wood Fired Oven Pizzas! Be sure to check out the Kids Menu for the little ones in your life!
address: 16 East Main Street, Buckhannon and 309 Davis Avenue, Elkins, Buckhannon & Elkins, WV, 26201

name: Clarion Hotel & Conference Center
description: The Clarion Hotel & Conference Center is located on a quiet 12-acre site near historic Shepherdstown, WV, just 70 miles from downtown Washington, D.C. Our friendly staff is dedicated to making your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. With 168 upscale guest rooms, executive suites and business class rooms, two full service restaurants, 6,000 square feet of conference space, and full service fitness center, The Clarion Hotel is the perfect place for your next weekend getaway, banquet event, or business meeting. All rooms are non-smoking and elevator accessible. Room service is available to all rooms. FACILITIES: conference/meeting space, wedding receptions, full service Tavern & restaurant, health club, outdoor pool, basketball gymnasium, walking trails. Public Transit: We proudly offer shuttle or limousine transportation through All Star. Contact them for scheduling and to inquire about rates at 304-876-2500. Amenities: Two Line Speaker Phone 32 Inch Flat Screen Color TV Complimentary Wireless Internet Upgraded Bedding In Room Safe Cribs and Roll-away Bed Iron and Ironing Board In Room Microwave & Refrigerator Complimentary News Paper In-room Coffee Service Hair Dryer Handicap Accessible Complimentary Parking Elevator CHECK IN: 4:00pm CHECK OUT: 11:00am DIRECTIONS: I-81 N, Exit 16 E, Route 45 E to Shepardstown

name: Clarion Inn Fairmont
description: We are the only FULL service hotel in Fairmont. We offer rooms for events, along with catering, food and beverages, providing all the essentials you’re searching for when you get together. Corporate travelers will appreciate our business center, as well as copy, print and fax machines. You can order room service or grab a bite to eat at the hotel’s restaurant and bar. You're always a VIP here which is why we offer such additional amenities as: Free breakfast Free WiFi Seasonal outdoor pool Fitness center Free weekday newspaper Our hotels provide you with personalized service, all the amenities you need, and a dash of fun to make every trip enjoyable. Each guest room offers a refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer and TV. Select rooms include sofa sleepers, and guests receive free coffee in the lobby. The Clarion Inn hotel in Fairmont, West Virginia is conveniently located near Morgantown, Clarksburg and Bridgeport. Fairmont State University and West Virginia University are minutes away. Our pet-friendly hotel in Fairmont is also located near these points of interest: Valley Worlds of Fun Valley Falls State Park Heston Farm Winery Fairmont General Hospital Marion County Historical Society Museu

name: Clarion Inn – Harpers Ferry
description: Full-service hotel and conference center featuring 100 rooms, indoor pool, three on-site restaurants, lounge, exercise facility and room service. Over 10,000-sq. ft. of conference/meeting/wedding space with superb on-site catering and a competent staff to handle any size functions. Located directly off Rte. 340 in beautiful Harpers Ferry and within minutes of various attractions such as Harpers Ferry National Historical Park, Charles Town Races & Slots and outdoor recreation.
address: 4328 William L. Wilson Freeway, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Clarion Pointe Beckley
description: The beautiful surroundings of Beckley are at your fingertips when you stay at the conveniently located Clarion Pointe® Beckley hotel. Whitewater rafting on the New River is only 15 minutes away. Enjoy over 10,000 acres of ATV trails at Burning Rock Off-Road Park only 10 minutes away. If that's not enough access, the Hatfield-McCoy trail systems are only 30 minutes away. You'll get to experience over 700 miles of fun on your ATV in the mountains of southern West Virginia.

name: Clarksburg Country Club
description: The Family atmosphere, picturesque location and club facilities situated on over 146 acres make the Clarksburg Country Club a place for the entire family. Semi-private, 18 Hole, beautiful golf course, historic. Limited public times throughout the day. Specialties: Serves lunch, dinner and drinks. Services: Takes Reservations, Good For Groups, Good For Kids, Take Out, Waiter Service, and Outdoor Seating. Hours: Tuesday-Friday From 9 a.m. - Dusk, Saturday After 2 p.m. Tee times are required. For tee times, call 304-624-5807. Call Club: 304-624-6361; Pro Shop 304 624-5807.

name: Classic Plastics Toy Store
description: Classic Plastics Toy Store is a local vintage (mainly 70s-90s) & new toy store/arcade dealing in toys, video games, comic books, arcade machines and more! Classic Plastics is always searching for new inventory and arcade machines to offer. Features currently held licenses from modern toy companies like Funko, NECA, Mezco, Super7, and Moose Toys. If you are looking for something specific or wanting to sell your collection, give Classic Plastics a call!

name: Classics 3 Lounge & Restaurant
description: CLASSICS 3 is a street-level family diner with great food, char-grill burgers, wings and more. We offer a freshly-prepared full menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We have a great menu plus serving breakfast all day long as well as our delicious sandwiches, hoagies, soup and salads. Try our Spaghetti and meatballs,sausage or chicken ,served with salad and garlic bread or parmesan bread,(your choice) We also offer Flavor Burst Ice Cream in eight great flavors. Children’s cones start at 50 cents. Call ahead for eat-in or carry-out. Enjoy our upstairs bar (M-Sat. @ 11am) with pool tables, HDTV and jukebox. Play all WV Lottery games here. We have plenty of parking. All major credit cards accepted.

name: Classy Clutter Antiques & Consignment
address: 3284 Robert C. Byrd Dr., Beckley, WV, 25801

name: The Clay Center for the Arts and Sciences
description: The Clay Center for the Arts & Sciences of West Virginia opened on July 12, 2003. The Center, a 240,000 square foot structure, houses performing arts, visual arts and sciences under one roof – one of the few of its kind in the country. Located in the state’s capital city of Charleston, the facility is home to the Clay Center’s Avampato Discovery Museum, the Juliet Art Museum and the Maier Foundation Performance Hall, home of the West Virginia Symphony Orchestra. The Clay Center’s mission is to inspire creativity, learning and wonder through experiences in the Arts and Sciences for all people of West Virginia and the region. The Clay Center remains one of the most ambitious economic, cultural and educational undertakings in West Virginia history. The Clay Center enhances the region’s “quality of life” and enriches the lives of all West Virginians.

name: Clay Center for the Arts & Sciences
description: Discover the excitement at the Clay Center for the Arts and Sciences, where you can experience music, theater, art and science all under one roof! Visit our magnificent theater for outstanding performances from star musicians and comedic greats, enjoy fun educational science exhibits, check out the art gallery and more! The Clay Center’s Avampato Discovery Museum houses two floors of interactive science exhibits, a world class art museum and state-of-the-art ElectricSky™ Theater, which shows large format films and planetarium shows on a 61-foot dome. GALLERY HOURS Tues-Sat: 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. Sun: 12 p.m. - 5 p.m. Mon: CLOSED BOX OFFICE HOURS Mon-Fri: 9 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Sat: 9:30 a.m. - 5 p.m. Sun: 11:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Planetarium shows and large format films are additional; combination tickets are available. Group discounts are available for many activities.  Visit the Clay Center today for an unforgettable family experience!

name: Clay Memorial Park
description: Go back to the early days and visit the first area settlement dating back to 1775. Mitchell and Phoebe Belcher Clay settled in Mercer County near Princeton on the Bluestone River. The family was later attacked by Shawnee Indians. A memorial is dedicated to the children who died in the attack.
address: Junction of Rt. 10 and Rt. 19, Kegley, WV, 24731

name: Clearfork Valley Country Club
description: Clear Fork Valley Country Club opened in 1959. It is an 18 hole Semi-Private course. From the back tees, the course plays over 5753 yards with a slope of 96 .

name: Cliff’s Museum of Automobile Memorabilia
description: Cliff's Museum of Car Memorabilia is presented as a mid-40's car dealership with WWII era auto-related memorabilia with showroom, parts room, repair shop and large collection display room. A small restaurant display is included featuring a Coca Cola collection and a porcelain doll collection. Other collections in 'The Building' are chauffeurs badges, drivers licenses, registration cards, automobile titles, state inspection stickers, automobile club badges, license plate attachments, DAV & other keychain licenses, cereal box & other play licenses, West Virginia travel guides, state issued road maps, and oil company issued road maps. Open by chance or by appointment. Call 304-643-4227. No admission fee, but donations appreciated. Look for us on facebook.

name: Clique Club
description: We are a family owned restaurant, located on Old Bridgeport Hill, since January 1, 1949. So come out and see us, and enjoy our friendly atmosphere, service, and a bite to eat... Known for the best Steaks in Town!!! Serves lunch, dinner, coffee and drinks. Takes reservations, but walk-ins are welcome. Mon - Thur: 11 AM to 9:30 PM Fri: 11 AM to 10:30 PM Sat: 4 PM to 10:30 PM Sun: Closed
address: Old Bridgeport Hill Rd, Clarksburg, WV, 26301

name: C & O Railroad Depot
description: The restored C&O Depot (c. 1896) sports its original colors and a small museum of local and railroad history which is open by appointment. The depot is also an Amtrak whistle-stop--a flag stop along the route of the Cardinal. The train stops only when passengers are present, either on the train or station platform, and ticketed to and/or from this station. Reservations are required. The station consists of a platform and shelter adjacent to the historic depot. Amtrak began serving the community on April 29, 1979. Amtrak does not provide ticketing or baggage services at this station, which is served by the tri-weekly Cardinal (Westbound: Sunday, Wednesday, Friday; Eastbound: Wednesday, Friday, Sunday). For information about Amtrak fares and schedules, please call 1-800-872-7245.
address: 1 C&O Plaza Railroad Avenue, Alderson, WV, 24910

name: Coach’s Inn
description: Number of units: 47 Facilities: AC, TV, satellite, non-smoking rooms, handicapped facilities, and pets allowed with permission, truck parking. Credit cards: Yes; Reservations: recommended. Location: I-64, exit 6 onto Adams Ave. Follow Adams Ave., take a left on 11th St.

name: Coal Country Miniature Golf & Batting Cages
description: Play eighteen holes of miniature golf with a coal mining theme, or try your luck at the batting cages. Grab a bite at the snack bar and enjoy it at our picnic area. Give us a call and we would be happy to accommodate your large group or party. Even take in some history at the coal mining museum!

name: Coal Heritage Museum & Arts CenterCoal Heritage Museum & Arts Center
description: A downtown museum dedicated to preserving the heritage of the coalfields for future generations. The museum contains memorabilia of the early coal mining days to the present. The museum contains a simulated coal mine and other hands-on activities, and includes a company store and miners home. The adjacent arts center holds a display of Daniel Boone and the story behind how the county got its name. The museum is open and available for special tours Monday through Friday from 12:00 noon until 4:00 p.m.

name: Coal Heritage Trail Interpretive Center
description: Invest time in the town of Bramwell and visit this museum that houses relics and exhibits of West Virginia's coal history. You will find photos of former Bramwell coal barons, their wives, memorabilia of the millionaire days and much more.

name: Coal Heritage Trail
description: The Coal Heritage Trail is a driving trail that winds through more than (13 counties) 187 rugged miles of scenic industrial heritage, where thousands of hard-working miners labored to produce the coal which created modern America. The story of the southern West Virginia “smokeless” coalfields is a remarkable legacy of working-class culture, industrial might, racial and ethnic diversity, and the creation of a unique and distinctive culture of national significance. As you journey along the Coal Heritage Trail you will pass through National Historic Districts and see many of the physical remnants of the coal boom such as coal miners' homes, company stores, company offices, railroad yards and other structures that defined life in the "smokeless coal fields”. You may want to visit the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine or stop in one of the many towns for a relaxing lunch and chat with some of the locals. The trail takes about 4.5 hours to drive and can be broken down into a two day travel experience. The Trail begins on RT. 52 in Bluefield and travels to Welch, the takes RT. 16 North to Ansted. No tolls. The Coal Heritage Trail Is part of the National Coal Heritage Area.

name: Coal Miner’s Statue
description: Coal miner's statue is a tribute to our coal heritage in Boone County and West Virginia.
address: Boone County Courthouse Lawn, Madison, WV, 25130

name: Coal River Science & Education Center
description: The Coal River Center is an educational and informational center for visitors to the Coal River Watershed region. The Log lodge is situated in the Kanawha County's Meadowood Park and overlooks the historic Upper Falls of the Coal River. An outdoor classroom and a self- guided tour offers visitors with information about the river and the region. The River Center is also the headquarters for the non-Profit Coal River Group. The Cabin at the River Center can be rented for private events, such as weddings, conferences, reunions, and meetings. With a large indoor meeting space, breathtaking views of Upper Falls, plenty of parking, and handicap access, the CRG's River Center is the perfect place for your next event! Contact CRG Chairman Bill Currey for more details on making reservations: 304-419-4417 or bike1@suddenlink.net. The Coal River Kayak and Canoe Rental business is also located at the site and offers Kayak and Canoe Rentals to the public. The location also is equipped with a 1.6 mile walking and running trail, two wilderness trails and a river front portage trail. An 8 acre fishing lake is on site and all the amenities are available to the public. An 18 hole golf course (Big Bend) is also located nearby.

name: Coal River Coffee Company
description: We are a coffee shop that roasts our own coffee, bringing coffee from small farms to our small town. We bake our own gluten and dairy free goods. We also love the arts! Enjoy live music Friday nights, local art for sale, as well as local writers.
address: 64 Olde Main Plaza, Saint Albans, WV, 25177

name: Coal River Kayak and Canoe Rental
description: Coal River Kayak & Canoe Rental is based in the Coal River Watershed that includes the Coal River, Big Coal River and Little Coal river that are within the Walhonde Water trail. These streams are flat water streams with class 1 rapids that are very safe for family float trips. The float trips are great for fishing, wildlife viewing, beginners and just a relaxing day on the river. The rental center is located in the CRG River Center which is located in Meadowood Park at Upper Falls of the Coal River in Tornado, WV. All trips originate at the River Center and includes several 6 to 7 mile options, plus one 12-mile adventure trip. Many options are available for specialty trips, overnights, catering, and student paddle lessons. The group operates a rental and shuttle service too. Season begins in mid-April and extends through September of each year. Credit cards, cash and checks are accepted. Advance reservations are recommended.

name: Cody’s Restaurant
description: Cody's is a kitchen and cocktails restaurant that take prides in the quality of the ingredients used for each and every dish. Cody's sources fresh, local ingredients to create the signature entrees that make up our menu. You'll also find unique, seasonal items; created especially for your enjoyment. A cozy atmosphere, relaxed bar, dinner service, pub-style lunch and Sunday brunch will delight the foodie in each of you.
address: 20 Shaner Drive, Suite 104, Bridgeport, West Virginia, 26330

name: Colasante’s Ristorante and Pub
description: Located minutes from the campus of West Virginia University, across the bridge in Westover, Colasante's is one of the true Italian restaurants in Northern West Virginia. For more than 40 years, Colasante’s has been preparing homemade sauces and foods in this quaint town. A favorite among locals and WVU fans passing through for a game. Their pizza starts with homemade dough made fresh daily, homemade pizza sauce and 100% real cheese. Try the "Smokin' Joe Pizza": it truly smokes with hot Italian sausage, jalapeno peppers, hot peppers and onions! Find family dining downstairs and the "Pub Above" upstairs with WV Lottery games, full bar and sports on the screens. Colasante’s has a kid's menu available, full catering menu including Party Trays for up to 20, featuring pastas, salads, Italian Sausage & Peppers and Chicken Parmesan.

name: Colasessano’s
description: Visit Colasessano's Pizza & Pepperoni Rolls for our famous signature pizza and pepperoni rolls. Colasessano's has been in business for more than 50 years. We are a dine-in and carryout pizza restaurant. Fairmont is known to be one of the places to have originally started the pepperoni roll, so visit Colasessano's Pizza & Pepperoni Rolls for one of these famous and delicious dishes today. Our rolls can be bought frozen or freshly baked and we serve them with sauce and a wide variety of other dishes too. Two locations: White Hall location is 141 Middletown Circle Fairmont, WV, behind the Middletown Mall, exit 132 on I-79. Call 304-363-0571 and Bellview location is at 506 Pennsylvania Avenue, Fairmont, WV. Call 304-363-9713

name: Cold Spot
description: Sports bar/restaurant located in Dunbar/North Charleston area known for the wings.

name: Cole Harley Davidson
description: When you visit us you will see that our mission is to provide you with superior products and service. To build quality relationships with you and others is what we strive for, whether it be out on the road or in the store. Cole Harley-Davidson® is a family-owned dealership that fosters an environment which makes it easy for you to do business,

name: Coleman’s Fish Market
description: The famous Colemans Fish Market is located in the historic Centre Market district in Wheeling, West Virginia. Home of the famous Colemans fish sandwich. Coleman's Fish Market was honored by Gourmet Magazine as one of West Virginia's most popular eating establishments. As quoted in the June 2001 issue: "A visit to the Mountain State leads to a surprising discovery: The Country's best fish sandwich (tartar sauce not included)." Coleman's Fish Market is a unique and different dining experience.

name: Collis P. Huntington RR Historical Society
description: The Collis P. Huntington Railroad Historical Society (CPH) is one of 160 National Railway Historical Societies in the United States. Founded in 1959 and became a part of the NRHS the same year. Our goals as a chapter are: “Preserve documents and artifacts of railroad history, to promote the use and improvement of the present railroad industry, to acquire and restore rolling stock for display and operations, and to generally encourage public interest in the ongoing story of the North American railroads.” CPH actively sponsors the preservation of rail passenger service throughout the country; in particular we maintain one of the oldest narration programs in existence. This is conducted onboard Amtrak’s “Cardinal” (Named for the state birds of the states through which it passes) from Ashland, KY-Huntington, WV through the New River Gorge and on to White Sulphur Springs, WV. Features include: Railroad Excursions (New River Train Excursions), Outdoor and Indoor Museum and private railroad car rental. Our outdoor Museum is an outdoor museum located at the end of Memorial Park on 14th Street West in Huntington, WV. We have multiple displays and an operating hand pump car.

name: Colombo’s Restaurant
description: Family-owned Italian's best with casual and fine dining. The restaurant seats 300 which allows for large parties, as well as small occasions. The staff treats its customers like family. First and best pizza in Parkersburg!

name: Colonial Hotel-Motel
description: At our quaint, independent hotel and motel, you'll discover old-fashioned hospitality and an unprecedented level of customer service. Colonial Hotel-Motel preserves the charm and décor of the early 1900s with the amenities of the 21 century. We take pride in creating an authentic, homey environment. Our lobby is classic in style with wormy chestnut panels and elegant oak fireplaces. The delicious scent of freshly brewed coffee wafts through every corner, and the lobby is decorated with the folk art of Ron Hinkle's West Virginia glass creations. There are 14 hotel rooms, 21 motel units, and 3 efficiency suites available for you to choose from. For your convenience, we are located within walking distance of West Virginia Wesleyan College, the court house, and many great restaurants, pubs, and stores. Hunters are welcome at our affordable motel, and we even let you bring you pet for a small fee. Weekly Rates Based On Availability. Take Exit 99 off 1-79, East US 33 to the Buckhannon Main Street exit. At the first stop light turn left and the motel is on the right on Route 20.

name: Colonial Motel
description: The Colonial Motel has twenty-two rooms situated on a large three acre lot adjacent to the Guyandotte River in Man, WV. The Colonial Restaurant in the Motel complex, for your convenience, offers home cooked meals from 5:30 A.M. until 9:00 P.M. daily. The Convenience Store, also on the Motel grounds is open from 8:00 A.M. until 11:00 P.M. daily to supply all those little extras you need when away from home. Hatfield McCoy trail rider permits are available in the convenience store. The Colonial Motel is less than one half mile from the Hatfield McCoy Rockhouse Trail Head. Our large parking lot will accommodate trucks and ATV trailers. In addition to the Hatfield McCoy trails, within a short drive are additional recreation facilities for your entertainment. These include: Chief Logan State Park and the Larry Joe Harless Center, with exercise facilities as well as a large indoor pool and movie theaters.

name: Comedy Zone Charleston
description: The Charleston WV area's only comedy club! Featuring two of the Nation's Funniest Touring Comedians on Friday and Saturday Nights. Perfect for group functions, birthday and bachelorette (and even divorce) parties, dates and couples nights! Full bar available and delicious food before, during and after the shows! Fundraising opportunities available for organizations, schools and groups!American style dinner options, full bar, room service, weekend comedy shows.

name: Comfort Inn Aikens Center – Martinsburg
description: At the Comfort Inn Aikens Center, all of our guests enjoy our complimentary breakfast, high speed internet in each room along with coffee maker and coffee, iron and ironing board and a microwave and refrigerator. The Front Desk is available 24 hours a day to assist you as needed with your stay and reservations. This 109 room property has an outdoor seasonal pool, fitness room and business facilities to use during your stay. Check in time is 3:00 p.m. and check out is 12 p.m. Guaranteed reservations can be cancelled up to 6 p.m. the day of arrival. No pets permitted and parking is complimentary. The Comfort Inn Aikens Center is located just off I-81 at exit 16e.

name: Comfort Inn – Morgantown
description: Our Value Qs deliver professional, responsive and friendly service, as well as amenities that include: meeting space that can accommodate up to 25 individuals Free hot cooked breakfast and coffee Free WiFi Seasonal outdoor pool Exercise room Free weekday newspaper non-smoking rooms available handicap facilities All spacious guest rooms include TVs, coffee makers, microwaves, refrigerators, desks, irons and ironing boards, along with a refreshing shower and more. Some rooms come equipped with a wet bar or a hot tub. Nearby attractions include: WV University, Ruby Memorial Hospital, Coliseum, Airport, Cheat Lake and Coopers Rock State Forest.

name: Comfort Inn – Parkersburg / Vienna
description: Enjoy the combination of cozy accommodations, friendly service and wonderful amenities at the Comfort Inn near Grand Central Mall hotel in Parkersburg. We invite you to relax in your guest room, which features a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. Some rooms also feature a whirlpool and a balcony. Corporate travelers appreciate our meeting room and our business center, which features copy and fax services and a computer with Internet access. As our valued guest, you can enjoy such amenities as: Free WiFi Free Manager’s Reception Monday-Saturday, 5-6 P.M. Indoor heated pool Guest laundry facilities Hot Tub sauna/spa Fitness Center in-room coffee makers Start your day off with our free hot breakfast offering everything from eggs, waffles and meat, to healthy options like yogurt and fresh fruit. You can shop at Grand Central Mall and explore such nearby points of interest as: Actor’s Guild of Parkersburg Julia-Ann Square Historic District Holl’s Swiss Chocolatier Parkersburg Art Center Ohio River Location: I-77, Exit 179. Follow Route 68 South to Route 14 North. The hotel is located directly behind Red Lobster.

name: Comfort Inn & Suites – Fairmont
description: From premium bedding and a refreshing shower to hot breakfast and friendly service, it all adds up to real value for you. Rooms include: coffee makers, irons and ironing boards, hair dryers, free high-speed internet, free newspaper and TVs. Jacuzzi Rooms and Suites are also available. Some rooms feature whirlpools, microwaves and refrigerators.

name: Comfort Inn & Suites – Triadelphia
description: We invite you to relax in your guest room, which features a refrigerator, microwave, 32-inch flat-screen TV, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. Start your day off with a great hot breakfast offering everything from eggs, waffles and meat to healthy options like yogurt and fresh fruit. While you are searching for pet-friendly hotels near Wheeling Ohio County Airport, look no further than the Comfort Inn & Suites. For your convenience, we offer copy and fax services, a computer with Internet access and guest laundry facilities. As our valued guest at this Triadelphia hotel, you can also take a moment to pause and enjoy such amenities as: Free WiFi Fitness center Free weekday newspaper Indoor heated pool and spa Billiard room and pool table. You can explore the Oglebay Institute Glass Museum, shop at The Highlands and visit such points of interest as: Wheeling Island Casino & Racetrack West Virginia Independence Hall Smart Center WesBanco Arena Suspension Bridge Benedum Theater Wheeling Heritage Port Amphitheater

name: Comfort Inn
description: Comfort Inn offers 79 guest rooms, 12 whirlpool rooms, meeting space to accommodate up to 35 guests, indoor heated pool and spa, and fitness facility. All spacious guest rooms offer High Definition TVs, hair dryers, coffee makers, desks, irons, ironing boards, microwaves, refrigerators, free wired and wireless internet, and pillow top mattresses.

name: Comfort Inn
description: The Comfort Inn hotel in Barboursville, West Virginia is located off of Interstate 64 and near the Huntington Mall. It is near Blenko Glass Company, Marshall University, Huntington Junior College and Camden Park. Enjoy free WiFi, complimentary breakfast every morning, an on-site fitness center and free weekday newspaper. Each room comes fully equipped with 32-inch flat-screen TVs and irons, while the suites include microwaves and refrigerators. Comfort Inn will ensure your stay is a success!

name: Comfort Motel
description: Our hotel is nestled along the Coal River in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains. Spend the day at the 9,300-acre Kanawha State Forest, which offers an impressive network of hiking and biking trails, as well as picturesque picnic areas and beautiful wildlife. Off-roading enthusiasts will want to hit the popular Hatfield-McCoy Trails in Williamson. You can also head north to Charleston to visit the State Capitol, West Virginia State Museum, and Coonskin Park. During the summer months, cool down with the slides and lazy river at Water Ways water park. Get energized for the day ahead with a workout in the fitness center and use free WiFi to scope out the area—or ask our friendly front desk staff for recommendations. Guest rooms offer an optimal sleep environment for tired travelers, as well as a flat-screen HDTV, workspace, mini-refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. Kids under the age of 16 bunk for free and dogs up to 25 pounds are welcome for an additional fee per night. Free parking and guest laundry facilities ensure a stress-free stay.

name: Comfort Suites Bridgeport – Clarksburg
description: The Comfort Suites Bridgeport-Clarksburg hotel is located right off Interstate 79 in the White Oaks Business Park area. This hotel gives you easy access to popular attractions like Prickett's Fort State Park, Valley Worlds of Fun, Fort New Salem, Criminal Justice Information Services Division, Fairmont State University and Meadowbrook Mall. The Bridgeport hotel provides many amenities, including free WiFi, fitness center, business center, meeting space and Your Suites Success Marketplace.

name: Comfort Suites Parkersburg South – Mineral Wells
description: 100% non smoking all suite, full service hotel. Amenities at our hotel are perfect for business and leisure traveler alike. They include: Free WiFi Free weekday newspaper Guest laundry facilities Start your morning in Mineral Wells with our free hot breakfast offering everything from eggs, waffles and meat to healthy options like yogurt and fresh fruit. Spacious guest rooms are equipped with microwaves, refrigerators, wet bars, coffee makers, irons and ironing boards, sofas, desks and TVs. Keep your electronic devices charged with the recharge device including AC and USB outlets provided in all guest rooms. Pets are welcome $20 per pet, per night; 2 pets per room; Maximum 100 lbs. per pet.

name: Company’s Comin’ Murray’s Downhome Diner
description: Company's Comin' specializes in Preston County buttermilk pancakes, fresh homemade apple dumplings, tantalizing omelets and daily specials. In mid-April, enjoy a crowd-pleasing cornbread, bean, ham and ramp feed. Open Wednesday-Sunday

name: Concord University
description: When you begin your future at Concord University, you are setting yourself up for lifelong learning and success. 48-bell Carillon harmonic melodies from 48 bronze bells ring daily across the beautiful landscape of Athens, WV, marking a point of interest for your journey in the Central Appalachians. We are conveniently located in Mercer County off I-77.

name: Confederate Cemetery
description: A cross-shaped mass grave containing the remains of 95 once-unknown Confederate soldiers who were killed or mortally wounded during the May 23, 1862 Battle of Lewisburg. The site lies within the position occupied by the Union forces.

name: Coni & Franc
description: We offer fine ladies clothing for every occasion including complete pageant apparel, bridal salon and wardrobe consultation. We hand select every article of merchandise that comes into the store, making sure it is the finest quality for our clientele. Not only have we dressed countless brides, pageantry contestants, and ladies both young and old, but we strive to work with the community to support the youth and many organizations. Summer hours are Mon. - Fri. 10 a.m. - 6 p.m. and Sat. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. Fall and Winter hours are Mon. 10 a.m. - 8 p.m., Tues. - Fri. 10 a.m. - 6 p.m., Sat. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. and Sun. noon - 4 p.m.

name: Conncert Music World
description: CONNCERT Music World is a family owned business focusing on providing musical instruments and supplies, outstanding customer service, and great products and brands you trust at reasonable prices. Our full line music store offers instrument repair, piano delivery, piano tuning, piano moving, and sound system installation.

name: Contemporary American Theater Festival
description: The Contemporary American Theater Festival produces the newest plays in America – in the oldest town in West Virginia. Discover the ultimate theater experience in historic Shepherdstown. Named as one of the top theater festivals in the world, by publications such as The New York Times, American Theatre, and World Guide, the Contemporary American Theater Festival shapes the future of American theater. Each summer, the Festival produces six new plays in rotating repertory. Shows book up fast, so be sure to start exploring these spectacular performance options this spring.
address: 92 West Campus Drive, Shepherdstown, West Virginia, 25443

name: Cook’s Country Kitchen
description: Serving home-style favorites for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Offers all day breakfast and a large salad bar.
address: 38154 Midland Trail East, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Cool Hollow Maple Farm
description: Cool Hollow Maple Farm, LLC, is a small family owned farm established in 2013. Ricky and Sam Harper embarked on this journey in order to provide more people with the chance to eat a natural sweetener; pure maple syrup! Along with our products shown on our website, we do wedding favors, gift baskets and other specialties. With our gift baskets, you can create a custom package for any occasion. Some items to consider for the gift baskets include: all bottle sizes of maple syrup, any combination of maple glazed nuts, maple tea (herbal and caffeine-free), homemade pancake mixes, etc. You can create a themed gift basket as well. For example, Mountaineer fans will surely enjoy a pint of pure maple syrup that is decorated in blue and gold! Ricky and Sam Harper embarked on this journey in order to provide more people with the chance to eat a natural sweetener; pure maple syrup! And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose. Romans 8:28
address: 627 Cool Hollow Drive, Sugar Grove, WV, 26815

name: Cool Water Outfitters
description: Located in Glady, WV (Randolph County), we are experienced outdoorsmen offering a wilderness, backcountry fishing experience on Shavers Fork in the Allegheny Mountains of West Virginia. Shavers Fork is one of the five forks that makes up the Cheat River and has been ranked as one of the top ten cleanest rivers in the United States, boasting some of the best trout fishing available. Our experienced guides will take care of you every step of the way. The horseback ride from the trailhead is roughly 3.5 hours into our base camp. Our horses, packers, and guides will ensure you have a safe and enjoyable ride into your camp. Excursions are two nights and three days, where your days will be filled with trout fishing followed by excellent meals by the campfire. You will enjoy a peaceful night’s sleep in the quiet of the Monongahela National Forest at a camp we have set up and ready for you.
address: West Fork Trail Parking, Glady, WV, 26268

name: Coombs Flowers
description: Fresh cut flowers, plants and gift items.

name: Coonskin Grotto
description: Tucked away in Coonskin Park just outside the capital city is a hidden waterfall known as The Grotto. These short cascades – spilling into a shallow cave, shaded by a sandstone overhang – are best enjoyed after a good rainfall. Make your way past the stone monument at the trailhead, hang a left on Alice Knight Memorial Trail and follow the red blazes for about a third of a mile before arriving at this unique structure. You’ll want to watch your footing on this rocky, sometimes narrow trail, but (once you arrive) you'll find this treasure is the perfect nook to relax while chasing waterfalls.

name: Coonskin Park
description: Located 10 minutes from downtown Charleston, the park includes over a thousand acres of woodland, hiking and biking trails, a handicapped accessible 18 hole par three golf course, an Olympic size pool, picnic shelters of all sizes, tennis courts, sand volleyball courts, bike rentals, pedal boat rentals and a modern playground area. Meeting and reception room rentals are also available. Coonskin has a modern amphitheater, 2000 seat soccer stadium and a Wedding Garden. Programs throughout the year include numerous golf events, athletic events, children's events, nature activities, birding, concerts and a winter light display. Hours: Dawn to dusk every day. Directions: Exit 1 off I-79 North or South. Coming from the South: Take I-79 North Exit 1 Mink Shoals Turn Right onto Pennsylvania Avenue Approximately 1/2 mile to Coonskin Entrance on right. Coming from the North: Take I-79 South Exit 1 Mink Shoals Turn Left onto Pennsylvania Avenue Approximately 1/2 mile to Coonskin Entrance on right.

name: Cooper Farms, LLC
description: Corn maze, hayrides, corn crawl crib, and cow train. Special rates for groups! Haunted maze, free wagon rides during the regular maze, concessions and glow sticks available. Come zip over the Maze. Gain a birds eye view of the whole farm. The course is made up of three towers (the highest being 80+ feet, nick named "Stairway to Heaven") and 3 zip runs with over 1,500 feet of fast flying fun. $20 for a single course pass and $30 for a twice through pass (Same Person) No Age Limit Rider weight limits are 100 lbs. - 260 lbs. All Riders must fill out a waiver, riders under the age of 18 must have a guardian signed waiver. Scouts, 4-H or sport teams and church groups are welcome! Birthday parties are unique and fun at the Maze!! Hours: Friday 5 p.m. to 10 p.m.; Saturday noon to 10 p.m.; and Sunday 1 pm to 5 p.m.; weekdays by appointment. Directions: Parking behind Milton Middle School in Milton, WV.

name: The Cooper House Bed and Cocktail
description: Cooper House has four rooms- two with double beds, one with a queen and one with a king that can become two singles. We are located next door to The (fabulous) Purple Fiddle in Thomas, West Virginia. We will not compete with the serious breakfast already served in town but will serve cocktails and savories in the afternoon and early evening by the fireplace. Very civilized. Performers travel from San Francisco and Boston, Philadelphia and Brooklyn, Ashville and Nashville, Sweden and Tuva to play music ranging from alt folk and bluegrass, blues and reggae, the traditional to the un-pigeonholeable. No matter the genre it's always a great time and you’ll most likely want to head over in the evening. The music usually goes on till 11 and the street can stay lively till midnight. Those with early morning business should probably stay somewhere less festive. Cooper House has four distinctive guest rooms, each with a private bathroom and a silly name. 1) Canary, Crimson & Coal - double bed – 100.00 2) Duchess in Reduced Circumstances – double bed – 100.00 3) E’s Portmanteau – queen bed - 120.00 4) Clare Q. – king bed or two singles – 120.00
address: PO Box 451, 114 East Avenue, Thomas, West Virginia, 26292

name: Coopers Rock Climbing Guides
description: Coopers Rock Climbing Guides & Backcountry Adventures (CRCG) offers guiding and instruction in climbing, mountain biking, backpacking and cross country skiing in Coopers Rock State Forest and the surrounding region. Guided rock climbing trips for beginners and visitors of all ages and experience levels. Guided climbing and adventures for Scouts, youth groups, businesses, and more. DAY CAMPS: 4 full days of rock climbing and outdoor adventure for children 8 to 17 years old.
address: 61 County Line Drive, Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: Coopers Rock State Forest
description: Located less than 15 miles from Morgantown, Coopers Rock State Forest offers a multitude of activities including picnicking, fishing, camping; and more than fifty miles of hiking and biking trails wind throughout the woods of the Wild and Wonderful. Licensed hunting and fishing is permitted, and a six-acre pond full of trout is located on the north side of the forest. The main overlook gives way to beautiful views of the Cheat River Gorge and the nearby trading post is open from May through October. The McCollum Campground has twenty-five sites complete with electric hook ups, perfect for tents or smaller RVs. A central bathhouse is available with showers, laundry and outside faucet. Wi-Fi is available for registered campground guests. Pets are permitted as long as they are kept on a leash. The Rhododendron Campground has 25 primitive tent/hammock campsites, each with their own picnic table and fire pit. There is a central bathroom with flushing toilets and running water is available for campground guests. Pets are permitted as long as they are kept on a leash.
address: 61 County Line Dr., Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: Cooters Cabins & Campin’
description: Cooters' Cabins & Campin' is situated in beautiful Southern West Virginia, secluded and quiet. Cabins & Campin' & RV's is centrally located and close to golfing, rafting and horseback riding. Motorcyclists and pets welcomed. Camping Season: March-November 1st. Facilities: Electric, water, and dumping stations. Located 4 miles South of the New River Gorge Bridge, and 20-25 minutes South of Summersville Dam and Lake for Gauley Season. Secluded and peaceful see the wonders of beauty in Southern W.V.

name: Copper House Grill
description: The Copper House Grill offers casual dining in a relaxed atmosphere. Our upstairs and deck delivers a casual space for dining. Grab a table and some friends for great food, drinks, and good times. Wanting more? Move to the downstairs and see the best entertainment in the area. Local, Regional and National touring acts call the Copper House "home" for north central West Virginia. Come out and see the best rock, country, bluegrass, and more on our stage. Wanna dance? We also have the best Live DJ's for dancing. Regular Events: Working Women's Wednesdays Fridays & Saturdays: The best local, regional and national entertainment on our stage. Watch the schedule for more details and see who is coming to the Copper House for a great night of music and fun. Just look for the copper roof!!!

name: Core Arboretum
description: The WVU Core Arboretum is an outdoor facility for education, research, and recreation. The Arboretum has 3 miles of foot trails, lawns with planted trees and shrubs, old growth forest on hillside and floodplain sites, interpretive signs, trailside benches, a small amphitheater, and an information kiosk. Bicycling is only allowed on the Service Road. The WVU Core Arboretum has a variety of natural habitats in which several hundred species of native WV trees, shrubs, and herbaceous plants may be found. Some of the large trees are likely over 200 years old. The Arboretum is well known as a superb site to see spring ephemeral wildflowers from late March to early May, and our guided spring wildflower walks are a long-standing tradition. Varied habitats and riverside location also make the area an excellent site to observe birds and animals. Hiking Trails With Varied Species Of Trees, Shrubs And Wild Flowers. Some old-growth forest. Good birding. Superb wild flowers in late April. Many trees are labeled. 91 acres. 4 miles of trails.

name: Corner Cafe @ Mathney Motors
description: Great homemade food, homemade desserts, and service! Family Style with favorites like baked steak, roast beef special, liver & onions, creamed tomatoes over biscuit and homemade pie. Marilyn Plum's Corner Café is now located at Matheny Motors, downtown Parkersburg on the corner of Third and Anne St.
address: 3rd and Ann Streets, Parkersburg, WV, 231 Ann Street

name: Cornerstone Christian Bookstore
description: Specializing in a variety of Christian books, music and gift items.

name: Cornfed’s Smokehouse & Grill
