description: BBQ and traditional food. Daily specials.

name: Cosmic Cab Company
description: Offering a four-passenger sedan or mini van that can comfortably accommodate up to six passengers with luggage. The only cab service in Greenbrier County. Mon-Thu 8 a.m. - 10 p.m.; Fri-Sat 8 a.m. - 12 midnight; Sun 9 a.m. - 5 p.m.

name: Cottrill’s Opera House
description: The mission is to make Cottrill's Opera House into a 425 seat state-of-the-art theater and performance hall, once again making it the center of cultural and civic activities for the community of Tucker County and its visitors. Cottrill’s Opera House is part of the economic development vehicle for the Thomas Commercial Historic District supporting the culture and history of our community. If you're interested in a tour, please contact us at 304-698-2869 or email cottrillsoperahouse@gmail.com.

name: The Country Cabin Farm Retreat
description: Just Located on Rt. 19 at Spanishburg, WV, it is just four miles from Interstate 77, exit 14. The historic cabin retreat has an absolutely beautiful setting, situated on a 60-acre farm in the Bluestone Valley, surrounded by beautiful mountains and bordered by the Bluestone River. Five state parks are within a 30 minute drive. The Country Cabin is near many sites and activities visitors enjoy in southern West Virginia. Fully equipped, just bring groceries! WiFi/cable tv. Near Princeton/Bluefield, hospitals * colleges.

name: Country Cabin
description: You won't want to miss our cozy old log cabin, the homey atmosphere, and the feel of 'goin' to Grandma's house! The Country Cabin is neither luxurious, nor rustic, but is simply an old log cabin farmhouse that our guests enjoy with evenings in front of our cozy fireplace and quiet, peaceful surroundings. It is fully furnished with a full kitchen (dishes and cookware provided), one bath, all towels, linens, washer and dryer, antique furnishings and can accommodate 4 people.

name: Country Club Bakery
description: "Home of the Original Pepperoni Roll." Country Club Bakery has been around since 1927, selling the original and best pepperoni rolls in the state of West Virginia in addition to Italian breads, rolls and cookies. Specialty orders welcome. We pull fresh, warm pepperoni rolls out of our ovens all day, every day, ensuring that every roll you buy in our store has been made within the hour. This is a snack that needs no refrigeration or heat, but is hearty enough to be a meal.

name: Country Inn of Berkeley Springs
description: The Country Inn was originally opened in 1933, by the local Harmison family as the Park View Inn and has been open year round ever since. We have 70 unique guest rooms and suites, our relaxing Renaissance Spa, our full service Restaurant & Morgan Tavern, English country gardens, an exclusive cottage and retreat center, gift shop, Gallery Room, and Conference Facilities. Our inn possesses both bucolic charms with modern amenities. The Historic Inn offers unique rooms and suites with the charm and feel of a bed & breakfast. The more contemporary West Inn offers spacious rooms with modern accommodations while maintaining the inn’s historic charm. Please note that our Historic Inn does not offer an elevator, while our West Inn does. Special packages are available that include Spa Packages, Receptions and Wedding Packages. The Country Inn Restaurant & Morgan Tavern: Stop by and enjoy our New Summer/Fall Menu, created for our guests with Country Inn Favorites and New Chef Creations. Our menu is offered at each of our unique dining areas including our outside garden when the weather is nice. Open everyday for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner. Our Dinner Menu is available for all guests starting at 11 am. The Parkview Garden Room is an enchanting venue providing wonderful natural light through numerous windows and skylights and home to 3 resident trees that the room has been built around. Accommodating up to 200 guests, the garden room is perfect for wedding receptions, banquets, corporate meetings, and parties. Room amenities include a Beautiful Baby Grand Piano, Large Stage, Spacious Dance Floor, and In-Room Bar if requested. Our Banquet Room is a beautiful facility that can accommodate up to 60 guests, Ideal for small parties, meetings, banquets, and conferences this room can provide a wonderful setting for any event. Room amenities include a Projector Screen and Room Divider. Please contact us for additional information or download our event brochure below. We are perfectly located in the heart of Berkeley Springs. Our town is known for its warm springs, art, antiques, and beautiful scenery. Whether you are here to take in the waters at the historic state park next door, the Renaissance Spa, or visiting our quaint shops you will be within walking distance while staying at the Country Inn.
address: 110 South Washington St., Berkeley Springs, WV, 25411

name: Country Inn & Suites by Raddison
description: Country Inn & Suites offers the warmth and charm of a southern bed and breakfast. Make the most of these services and amenities: Complimentary, Hot Be Our Guest Breakfast Free High-Speed Internet Access Business Center Fax, Copier and Computer Services Fitness Center with Treadmills Children 18 and Under Stay Free in the Same Room with an Adult Indoor Pool/Outdoor Pool, Open Daily 7:00 a.m.-10:00 p.m. Except on Thursdays 10:00 a.m.-10:00 p.m. Indoor Kidding Pool Whirlpool Tub Conference Facility and Catering That Accommodates up to 300 Guests Pets Welcome (nominal fee required)* Laundry Facilities Free Weekday USA TODAY® Newspaper Complimentary Parking Safety Deposit Boxes Suites Available Wake-Up Service Located off I-64/77 just minutes from the whitewater Mecca of the east and 14 miles from Winterplace.

name: Country Inn & Suites – Charleston
description: 64 rooms and suites, equipped with refrigerators and microwaves. Free hot continental breakfast in the morning. Take a dip in our indoor pool, relax in the Jacuzzi, or work-out in the exercise room. We are conveniently located off Interstate 64/77 (exit 95 east - MacCorkle Avenue). Complimentary, Hot Be Our Guest Breakfast Free High-Speed Internet Access Corporate Services Fitness Center Indoor Heated Pool and Hot Tub Pets Welcome in Designated Guest Rooms and Lobby Only Read It and Return Lending Library 32" Flat-Screen TV (featuring more than 70 channels) Refrigerator Microwave Coffee- and Tea-Maker Only 1/4 mile from the interstate, we are very close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. Check in: After 3 p.m. Check out: Noon Pets accepted. *Please note that only certain rooms are pet-friendly. We have five pet-friendly rooms available, so please do not make a reservation with pets under a room that is not listed as "Guest Room Queen Pet Friendly."

name: Country Inn and Suites – Princeton
description: With the majestic Appalachian Mountains as your backdrop, you can make yourself at home at the Country Inn * Suites By Carlson, Princeton, WV, with rooms and suites equipped with microwaves and refrigerators. Just off I-77 and US 460 in Princeton, WV, this hotel's proximity to popular attractions like Pipestem Resort State Park, Princeton Railroad Museum, Winter Place Ski Lodge and the Chuck Mathena Center makes it the ideal place to relax and explore.

name: Country Road Tours – Coach USA
description: We are the leading provider of exciting deluxe motorcoach tours and professional charter services to individuals and groups of all sizes in the Clarksburg, WV area.

name: Country Roads Cyclists
description: The Club has been active in north central West Virginia since 1979. We promote the fun of bicycling through group rides, cycling advocacy, new-cyclist encouragement, social events, and the dissemination of safety and skills information. For rail-trail bicycling and road bike riding in West Virginia and beyond, Country Roads Cyclists is the Club to join! We welcome adult cyclists and their families (beginners, old pros, casual, or ambitious) for congenial bicycling activities including rides ranging from five miles to multi-day tours. Every year our members enjoy picnics and parties, as well as bicycling throughout the region. We have rides scheduled every Saturday and Sunday from March 1 to October 31. Each September we sponsor a Century Ride (100 miles). We also sometimes offer overnight trips and tours from several days to up to two weeks. We belong to the League of American Bicyclists, the Mon River Trails Conservancy, and the North Bend Rails to Trails Foundation. We coordinate our activities with other area bicycling clubs. Club Members receive our bi-monthly newsletter, bi-monthly ride schedule offering approximately 80 organized rides March-October, plus discounts at local bike shops and a restaurant. Mailing Address: P O Box 4322 Clarksburg, WV 26302
address: 515 South Linden Ave, Nutter Fort, WV, 26301

name: Country Roads Distillery
description: I'll bet ya our country roads connect to your country roads. Come visit Country Roads Distillery and Moss Farms Winery and enjoy the Appalachian experience. Enjoy a view of West Virginia forest and farmland. Open Thurs - Sat. noon - 7pm; Sun noon - 5pm. Call 304-243-WINE (9463) for more information.
address: 100 Harvest Lane Stone Church Road, Wheeling, WV, 26003

name: Country Store and More
description: We offer wide variety of clothing, groceries, firewood, and ice. For the kids, the store offers some video games, interactive pucker powder, and stuff a buddy (our version of Build a Bear) along with a wide variety of toys and candy! After you have fun playing you can have dinner at our restaurant then come to the snack bar for a delectable desert. You can also enjoy ice cream while sitting on the front porch in a rocker, playing games with loved ones, or checking your email on your laptop. No matter what you choose to do it all starts by visiting our Country Store where memories are made. Bring the kids and purchase a wristband so they can have day use of our mini golf and jumping pillow. In October we turn one of our walking trails into the “Trail Of Terror”. We work with local groups to provide a fun but scary haunted attraction. Located at Mountain Lake Campground in Summersville, WV.

name: Country Trails Bikes, LLC./ The Cairo Supply Co.
description: We have old-time General Store merchandise, bike shop, visitor's information center, snacks and foods for the trail and for home, and a unique display of railroad, rail trail, military and local memorabilia, and we also have local history books for sale. Rest on our front porch benches after (or before) your trip on the trail or as you visit our community!! We're at the back of the lot behind the gazebo, and our front porch faces the trail, the old B&O rail line!! Enjoy your visit here. Pick up a trail map and tourist guides here! General Information: 3 miles from Tunnel #13 (by trail) 3 miles from the legendary haunted Tunnel #19 (by trail) 4 miles from North Bend State Park (by road) 4 miles from U. S. Rt. 50 (by road)

name: The Country Roads Inn
description: The Inn has been beautifully renovated with four tastefully decorated bedrooms each with a queen sized bed, three with their own en suite bath and one shared bath. It can be rented per room or as the whole house. Coffee, hot tea and snacks provided in the dining room 24 hours a day. Enjoy the local town charm at several cafes and restaurants, coffee shop, antique and primitive stores, most within walking distance. Then relax on the front porch swing or back patio while enjoying beautiful mountain views. Located just a short, scenic drive from attractions such as Seneca Rocks, Cass Railroad, Blackwater Falls and Nelson Rocks.

name: County Line Guest House
description: As a non-hosted B & B vacation facility, located on a working farm, you really do have the place all to yourself. It's ideal for family reunions, vacations and group get-together's as you can reserve the entire house or just one room. There are 4 bedrooms: 3 queen-size beds, 1 full-size bed and 2 shared baths, which can comfortably sleep 8 people. There is also a couch and a sleep sofa in the living room for 2 additional guests. The living room has a gas-log fireplace. Prepare your own meals in the large, fully equipped kitchen complete with dining area. A laundry room is also part of the facilities. Sorry, no pets. No smoking indoors; DirecTV is available; telephone; catering service available. Air conditioning has been replaced with cool mountain breezes and ceiling fans. County Line Guest House is located on Rts. 33/55, 7 miles west of Seneca Rocks, WV and 30 miles east of Elkins, WV, near the top of Allegheny Mt. on its west-facing slope. The guest house is located on the south side of the highway and is visible at the end of a long driveway. There is a sign for the County Line Guest House at the driveway's entrance.
address: P. O. Box 41, Seneca Rocks, WV, 26884

name: County Seat B & B
description: Relaxed atmosphere, charming 1910 house. Five minutes from New River Gorge. Full breakfast.

name: Court of Claims
description: The Court of Claims hears claims against the state for money damages. Awards are made subject to final approval by the Legislature. Upon request, it issues advisory opinions to state agencies. It also investigates and hears claims made by victims of criminally injurious conduct for awards from the Crime Victims Compensation Fund.
address: 1900 Kanawha Blvd., E. Rm W334, Charleston, WV, 25305

name: Courtyard By Marriott
description: Get FREE high-speed Internet access at this Courtyard. Come experience plush mattresses and bedding, and a beautiful lobby and breakfast area! Restaurants located next door. Relax and get ready for the day ahead in one of our 4 suites, or any of our 102 spacious guest rooms which feature a comfortable large, well-lit work desk, two phones, complimentary weekday newspaper, and in room coffee. When you need to unwind at the end of the day, take advantage of our swimming pool and exercise room. Courtyard the hotel designed by the business travelers. The Bistro offers healthy choices, a variety of breakfast and dinner options, an evening bar, and specialty beverages made with Starbucks coffee. Facilities: sitting areas, large work desks, cable TV, in room coffee, pool, whirlpool, exercise room. Check-in: 3:00 PM Check-out: 12:00 PM Directions: from I-77 & I-64: exit 44 (Harper Road). From I-77 south: turn left onto Harper Rd. From exit 44. The Courtyard by Marriott is located on the left after crossing the overpass bridge on I-77. From I-77 north: turn right onto Harper Road from exit 44. The Courtyard by Marriott is located on the left.

name: Cox Camping
description: Cox Camping is located on 60 acres of wooded land. Over 35 camp sites available for RV or tent camping. Each site is equipped with water and electric hook ups as well a picnic table and a fire ring. We also have horse shoe pits, pool table, red neck golf and many more outdoor and indoor games, and fish in our stocked pond (Catch & Release). We have hiking trails, fishing pond, children's playground, horseshoes, etc. Check our directional map on our web site. Our Main Lodge includes a Pool & Game Room, Camp Store with Antique Shop, Soda Machine, Large Viewing Deck, Wedding - Event Pavilion and much more. The lounge area is A/C controlled and has TWO 50” Satellite TVs and another TV on the outside deck for your viewing enjoyment. Our new and improved Free WiFi which is widely available, but not at all sites. We have hot showers, flush toilets and a laundry room available 24 hours a day. Other amenities include: two bedroom cottage is available for $85 per night and includes full kitchen with refrigerator, electric range, microwave, washer and dryer, bathroom w/shower, central A/C, picnic table and a large swing; and a 16 ft. camper trailer with heat and air conditioning $30.00 per night. Bring your own sleeping bag. NO SMOKING INSIDE ANY OF OUR FACILITIES. Pets must be on a leash at all times. Open all year, but water will only be on at the main lodge and at a couple of frost-free hand washing stations during freezing winter months. Our dump station, showers, laundry room, flush toilets and hot showers are always open. Check in time is optional with prior arrangements. Check out time is 1 p.m. Cash, checks or money orders accepted. We will accept credit cards in the near future. PAY 6 NIGHTS AND 7TH IS FREE! BRING YOUR OWN LINENS, PILLOWS,SLEEPING BAGS ETC.

name: Crabby Patti’s
description: Home to the best jumbo lump crab cakes in WV! Maryland style seafood, steamed shrimp, blackened salmon, shrimp salad, cream of crab soup, seafood bisque. Voted 101 Unique Places to Dine in WV, featured in WV Living Magazine and the Charleston Daily Mail news. Specializing in Maryland jumbo lump crab cakes, shrimp salads and cream of crab soup.

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store
description: Homey chain restaurant serving American comfort food, with an on-site general store. Open 6 a.m. daily. Come visit our old country store, see the old-fashioned jams, jellies, glassware, clothing, cast iron products, quilts, toys and woodwork. Bus/RV accessible.
address: 2206 Pleasant Valley Rd. / I-79 & CR 64, Fairmont, WV, 26554

name: Craft Connection
description: Gifts, antiques, pottery, dolls, Boyd bears, candles, baskets, primitives, wreaths, Webkinz, flags, teachers' gifts, aspen spices and West Virginia foods. VI, MC, AX accepted. Open Mon. - Fri. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. and Sat. 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.

name: Craft Memorial Library
description: Check out a book or visit story hour with children and family. Each month features a variety of activities for children and adults. The Craft Memorial Library located in the heart of downtown Bluefield also houses the Regional Coal Archives.

name: Craig Branch Falls
description: Take a hike on the Kaymoor Trail at the New River Gorge National Park and Preserve to see the Craig Branch Falls. Descending off a cliff of wildflowers, these cascades are the tallest in the park and leave you with a dazzling display.

name: Cranberry Campground (UDSA Forest Service)
description: Cranberry Campground features 28 single campsites and two double sites in two loops. Most sites can accommodate a 40' trailer. Each site has a picnic table, fire ring, lantern post and gravel parking spur. There are two handpumps and four accessible vault toilets. There is no electricity available but the use of generators is permitted from 6am until 10pm. No dump station is available at campground. There are two privately owned dump stations available in Richwood, WV. Maximum length of stay is 14 days. Check-out time is 2:00 p.m. Dogs are permitted if on a leash at all times. Leash must be 6 ft. or shorter. Food storage order applies to pet food also. Located on Forest Road 76, 13.5 miles from Richwood, West Virginia, and 7 miles from Dyer, West Virginia. More information on this campground is available through the Gauley Ranger District, 932 North Fork Cherry Rd., Richwood, WV 26261 (304) 846-2695.

name: Cranberry Glades Botanical Area
description: The Cranberry Glades Botanical Area protects the largest area of bogs in West Virginia. Bogs are acidic wetlands more commonly found in the northern areas of this country and in Canada. The ground in a bog is spongy and consists largely of partially-decayed plant material known as peat. Because of its unique conditions, some unusual plants grow in bogs, including carnivorous or insect-eating plants. The Botanical Area encompasses 750 acres. The Cranberry Glades consists of four bogs whose plant and animal life is similar to that found in the bogs or "muskegs" of the north. This life spread southward with the changing climatic conditions that allowed glaciers to creep across the northern part of our continent. Several species ended their migration here, and the Cranberry Glades are now the southern-most point in North America where some of these life forms are found. A half-mile boardwalk has been constructed through two of the bogs so you can enjoy the area without disturbing this fragile community. Help protect these bogs and stay on the boardwalk, and leave the flowers for others to enjoy.
address: 932 North Fork Cherry Rd., Richwood, WV, 26261

name: Cranberry Mountain Lodge
description: The Cranberry Mountain Lodge is one of the most unique lodging experiences in the U.S. Located at 4,000 feet elevation on top of Cranberry Mountain, the lodge adjoins nearly one million acres of national forest. The views off the deck are spectacular, exceeding 40 miles. You can hike, bike or ski right out the front door to a vast trail system. The lodge is very isolated, with the nearest neighbor being 4 miles away. When you rent the lodge, you rent the entire seven-bedroom facility, so you get the privacy you deserve. Rates are based on the number of guests and length of stay. The Cranberry Mountain Lodge is a bird-watcher's and nature-lover's paradise. The lodge adjoins the Cranberry Black Bear Sanctuary, which is one of the largest black bear sanctuaries east of the Mississippi. Accommodations: seven bedrooms and five baths will house up to 16 people, by reservation only. General: Air Conditioning: Nature. Not Needed. Clothes Dryer Internet: DSL added in January 2017! Linens Provided Telephone Towels Provided Washing Machine Wood Stove Kitchen: Coffee Maker Cooking Utensils Dishes & Utensils: Provided Well Stocked Microwave Pantry Items Refrigerator: Two Refrigerators. Stove: New Stainless Steel Gas Stove Toaster Boat: Inflatables. Pond. Deck / Patio: Outdoor Grill Hot tub-no jets. Directions: Rt 219, Hillsboro THEN 3 miles up Lobelia Road to John Wimer Road, then 2 miles up John Wimer to our private road at sign, then 1 mile to lodge. Road Warning: Last 3 miles to the Lodge: steep, narrow, gravel road, with no guardrail.

name: Cranberry Mountain Nature Center (USDA Forest Service)
description: Cranberry Mountain Nature Center is located at the mouth of Highland Scenic Highway. The location is near Cranberry Wilderness Area, Cranberry Glades and Hills Creek Falls. Cranberry Mountain Nature Center features include interpretive programs, native wildflower garden, live snakes, interpretive displays, nature-related items and clothing for sale, trails, picnic tables, children's events and programs. There are no fees for programs, events and admission. Location is 23 miles east of Richwood and 16 miles west of Marlinton. Open from April to October, Thursday - Monday, 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
address: Jct. State Routes 39/55 and Route 150, near Hillsboro - Highland Scenic Highway, Hillsboro, WV, 24946

name: Cranesville Swamp Nature Preserve
description: At Cranesville Swamp the elements of wind, water, mountains, and temperature have created a landscape that is both beautiful and rare. In combination, these climactic elements have produced a natural occurrence known as a “frost pocket” – a low area that collects moisture and cooler temperatures. As weather travels west-to-east across North America, the hills surrounding Cranesville Swamp channel precipitation and chilled air into the valley, which make the preserve one of the coolest and soggiest spots in West Virginia. The cool, wet environment of Cranesville Swamp has over thousands of years fostered the formation of peat – made of compacted sphagnum moss that creates a nutrient-poor environment as it breaks down. Few trees can survive in the resulting bog, but tall eastern hemlock, red spruce and tamarack prevail in the acidic environment. Lower to the ground, plants like sundew, cranberry and sedge thrive in open areas.  Throughout these rare and diverse wetlands communities, visitors to the preserve can witness a spectacular range of birds and mammals. Lucky visitors may spot the rare northern water shrew, or catch a glimpse of a bear rummaging through the shrub thickets surrounding Muddy Creek. Patience and binoculars may afford others a glimpse of any one of the more than 100 bird species found at Cranesville, such as alder flycatcher, Blackburnian warbler, or the saw-whet owl – which nests in stands of red spruce and hemlock in the conifer swamp forest. This 2,000 acre preserve straddling Maryland and West Virginia features five trails, including a 1,500 foot boardwalk.  West Virginia Field Office 435 Wilson Street Elkins, WV 26241 Phone: (304) 637-0160 Fax: (304) 637-0584
address: Muddy Creek Road, (nearest city) Friendsville, WV, 21531

name: Crazy Mountain Cycles
description: Crazy Mountain Cycles offers guided tours of the Hatfield McCoy trails. You can rent 2017 Polaris RZR's for the best ride and most fun possible. 4 full apartments with a full kitchen and washer/dryer are also available for your stay. There will be trail passes available on site for purchase.

name: Creekside Camping, LLC
description: Creekside Camping, LLC is a family owned and operated campground, located in Triadelphia, just a couple miles from Wheeling. 14 total camper sites, each with all new 50 amp and 30 amp electric, full hook-ups, water/sewage/trash disposal are also included. Located on safe, secure private property. The owner lives on premises to assist with needs.

name: Creekside Golf Course- Lavalette
description: This beautiful 18-hole facility in Lavalette, West Virginia, just outside Huntington, features 6469 yards of golf from the Championship tees. Par 70 The course rating is 69.5, with a slope rating of 119. The Creekside Golf Course has a variety of holes with 8 lakes, a par 3 with a drop of over 150 feet, and 3 challenging Par 5's.

name: Crepe Myrtle Bags & Beads
description: Located at The Greenbrier Resort, Crepe Myrtle offers Vera Bradley, Brighton, Pandora, Dooney & Bourke, and more which make make this the perfect spot for accessories and gifts. The popular Greenbrier charms are also available in The Greenbrier Online Store. Location: Visit this store located in the Lower Lobby Shop Corridor of The Greenbrier. ** Open to both overnight and day guests of The Greenbrier**
address: 300 West Main Street, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Creperie Cafe
description: Delicious crepes stuffed with fresh fruit and chocolate for the sweet tooth, or smoked salmon, ham and egg and other dinner favorites. Try a Greek coffee!

name: Cress Creek Country Club
description: As the eastern panhandle’s only private golf and country club, The Club at Cress Creek offers the tranquility and natural beauty of a rural setting just minutes from home. You can relax among friends and family in a private, yet casual club atmosphere and enjoy outstanding recreational and social opportunities. Our 18 hole championship golf course is expertly maintained and features stunning views of the Potomac River. An indoor har-tru tennis court offers year-round tennis opportunities. The competition sized swimming pool provides a wonderful and fun family atmosphere to cool off in the summer. The restaurant features both casual dining with four flat screens for watching sporting events in our newly renovated Players Lounge and finer dining in our more formal dining room. We offer flexible Social, Golf, Tennis and Pool Membership options and we are definitely more affordable than you may think! In-Season: (April 1 - October 31): Sunday - 9:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. Monday - Closed Tuesday - Thursday: 11:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m Friday: 11:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. Saturday: 9:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. Winter: (November 1 – March 31): Sunday - 11:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Monday - Closed Tuesday - Thursday: 11:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Friday - 11:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. Saturday - 11:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Dining Room is closed on Sunday, Monday and Tuesday.

name: Crim-De La-Crim
description: Collectibles, Antiques, Consignments and Auctions.

name: Cross Creek Wildlife Management Area
description: 2081 acres. Six miles NE of Wellsburg along Co. Rt. 7 at Virginville. Gently rolling terrain to moderately steep slopes, scattered high walls - elevation 1250 feet. Area consists primarily of mixed hardwoods, reclaimed strip mined areas, beaver ponds, strip benches. Deer, turkey, ruffed grouse, and waterfowl are primary game species. No camping on area.

name: Crossroads Mall
description: Crossroads Mall has over 50 popular stores, including the Buckle, Aeropostale, American Eagle Outfitters, Bath & Body Works, Dick’s Sporting Goods, Victoria’s Secret and more! Come find exactly what you're looking for, from affordable and fashionable apparel, to home furnishings, electronics, and everything in between. We also offer a variety of delicious dining options, such as Auntie Anne's, Habanero's Grill and Cantina, Steak Escape, or Chick-Fil-A. In addition to our excellent selection of shopping and dining offerings, Crossroads Mall hosts many free events and programs for the community and families to enjoy! Crossroads Mall is located in Mt Hope, West Virginia, located off of I-77 and within miles from many tourist attractions, including the Bechetel National Family Scout Reserve.

name: Crumpets And Tea
description: At Crumpets & Tea, we offer a cozy setting for your special event, with special attention to detail and an old-fashioned, home made goodness, harking back to a time when table elegance was important. We provide a special and unique experience, drawing from a combined 75 years in the hospitality business. We provide a singular downtown Huntington eating experience in a tastefully decorated space. The down-home culinary environment touts the artful eyes and experience of Karen Shook and her husband, Dr. Dale Shook, who have many years of experience in the Tri-State area and Saratoga Springs, NY where they owned the Wayside Inn, a well-known bed & breakfast and conference center, with a tea room. For afternoon tea, luncheon with friends, or your special event, we offer a variety of delectable selections, all prepared with careful attention to detail. The quiche, comfort food, soup and dessert menu items change weekly. Crumpets & Tea is open for lunch Wednesday through Saturday, 11 am-2 pm. Arrangements can be made for special events for times other than the open lunch hours.

name: Crystal Cafe
description: Has cafe charm with quick and friendly service, not to mention delicious daily specials that are very reasonably priced. Multi-cuisine. Serves breakfast, lunch and coffee.

name: Curtisville Lake Park and Campground
description: Curtisville Lake offers 695 acres of lush scenery. Around the 30-acre lake there are hiking trails and picnicking. An ADA accessible fishing pier has been added to the lake. The lake is periodically stocked by the Department of Natural Resources and the fishing is good. Activities include: non-motorized boating, hiking, biking, fishing, and leisure activities. Home of the Annual Family Fun Fishing Day each Spring on Good Friday. No swimming is permitted in the lake. No gasoline powered motors are allowed, only electric motors and oars are permissible to power a boat in the lake. There are five RV sites and six primitive sites available on a first come, first served basis. Camping is permitted from April 1 through October 31 each year. Check-in is at 1:00 PM and check-out is at 11:00 AM. Pets are allowed if they are on a leash and under control at all times. Pets must be cleaned up after and pet waste should be disposed of at pet stations. Pets are not allowed in the restrooms or playground area. RV Site: $20.00/night/Each site includes electric, fire ring and picnic area. (Pay on-site) Primitive Site: $10.00/night/Each site includes fire ring, picnic area and lantern post. (Pay on-site) Picnic Area Regulations: Picnic areas (other than the pavilion) are on a first come, first serve basis. Portable grills are permitted and must be used responsibly. Please leave the picnic area as you found it, clean and free of trash. Directions to Curtisville Lake: From Fairmont: Take Route 250 North out of Fairmont towards Mannington. When you reach the Town of Mannington, take a left on Main Street, (there are brown signs for Curtisville Lake). Main St. turns into Rt. 1 and passes the Mannington Fair grounds. Stay on Rt. 1 for about 5 miles just past Logansport. Take a left on Curtisville Pike (Rt.7). Go about a mile and the lake is on the left.

name: Custard Stand – Danville
description: America's tastiest hot dogs, burgers, fries, 50-plus flavors of soft serve and more! Drive through or dine in. The CUSTARD STAND restaurant in Danville, WV serves lunch and dinner. Restaurant hours: Monday – Saturday: 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Sunday: 12 p.m. to 6 p.m.

name: Custard Stand – Oak Hill
description: America's tastiest chili dogs! Burgers, fries, 50-plus flavors of soft serve and more. Dine in or al fresco. Restaurant hours: Sunday – Thursday: 10:30 AM – 10 PM Friday – Saturday: 10:30 AM – 11 PM

name: Dallas Pike Fuel Center
description: One of 18 national heritage areas. Number of units: 5 Facilities: ac, TV (cable with HBO), restaurant, game room, general store & gift shop, truck parking, cat scales, electric hookup for diesel, pay at the pump gas, WV lottery and Powerball, keno saloon, truck garages for rent. Credit cards: all major credit cards accepted Location: from i-70, take exit 11, .1 miles.

name: Daniel Boone Park
description: Park, picnic tables, fishing pier and boat docking.

name: Daniel Vineyards, LLC
description: Daniel Vineyards, founded in 1990, is a family-owned and operated conservation grape farm and estate winery nestled in the beautiful Appalachian mountains of southern West Virginia. We grow 100% of every grape utilized to make our wine. Currently, 15 different varietals are grown on 20 acres of the property with over 10,000 vines. Wine tastings are available at the winery Tuesday-Saturday from 10am - 5pm. Call in advance to ensure open availability.
address: 200 Twin Oaks Rd., Crab Orchard, WV, 25827

name: Daniels Maple Syrup
description: Pure maple syrup is produced from boiling the sap from Sugar maples commonly referred to as hard maples and Red maples also referred to as soft maples. We have been making pure maple syrup for over 25 years and we look forward to supplying your needs with our pure WV maple syrup.

name: Daniel’s Mens Store
description: For the finest in men's clothing. Open Mon. - Fri. 9 a.m. - 6 p.m. and Sat. 9 a.m. - 5 p.m.

name: David’s Downtown
description: Located in the historic Bluefield Area Arts Center David's Downtown is open during the week for lunch. Soups, sandwiches, salads, baked goods and coffee. Also a full catering service. Call to set up your next event be it a small intimate gathering or a large banquet dinner.

name: Davis Handmade Marbles
description: This gift shop offers a variety of handmade glass items, such as flowers, paperweights, napkin rings, eggs and figurines. A specialty line of handmade marbles has recently been put into production as well. Directions:Located on U.S. Route 50 between Parkersburg and Clarksburg. Hours: Open year-round Monday - Wednesday and Friday 9 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Thursday and Saturday 9 a.m. to Noon
address: P.O. Box 59, 114 Collins Ave, Pennsboro, WV, 26415

name: Day Run Campground
description: Many of the 12 camping sites boarder the upper scenic Williams River and the campground is within walking distance of many popular trails. Each site is equipped with a wooden picnic table, lantern post, and fire ring. Several campsites also have a tent pad, although all sites are suitable for tent or trailer camping. One hand pump for water, 2 vault toilets, pet friendly. All sites are on a first-come, first-serve basis. Camping fee is $8.00 per site per night, payable at the camping self-service fee station. Open season is from March 12 each year until November 30.

name: Day Trippin Adventures, LLC
description: Day Trippin Adventures is a full service outfitter. We offer tube rentals, kayak rentals, guided fishing trips and much more!

name: Days Inn – Charleston East
description: Enjoy old-fashioned southern hospitality at the Days Inn Charleston East. Conveniently located off Interstate 64 & 77, the Charleston, WV hotel near the University of Charleston offers easy access to downtown. It provides thoughtful amenities like refrigerator, microwave, offer non-smoking and handicapped-accessible rooms to ensure your comfort. It offers free high-speed Internet access to help you to stay connected during your trip and kids 17 and under stay free with an adult.

name: Days Inn – Huntington
description: Welcome to Days Inn Huntington hotel in Huntington, WV 25705

name: Days Inn – Martinsburg
description: We offer large-vehicle free parking and a fitness center. Enjoy a daily free Daybreak continental breakfast. Pleasant in-room amenities include a refrigerator, microwave, and free WiFi, with hard-wired Internet access in some rooms. Laundry facilities and dry cleaning services are also at your disposal at our pet-friendly hotel.

name: Days Inn – Mount Hope
description: 2-Diamond AAA Rated. Conveniently located just north of Beckley off I-64/I-77 at Exit 48. Our 2-story Inn offers 119 nicely furnished guestrooms featuring cable TV with HBO, Internet access, free local calls, coffeemaker, workstation desk and more. We proudly offer our guests complimentary deluxe continental breakfast, 2 meeting facilities, game room, outdoor swimming pool, complimentary morning newspaper and free parking. Only minutes away from all the local attractions, business and commercial areas including New River Gorge National Park, Tamarack, Winterplace Ski Resort and Exhibition Coal Mines. Click here for more information.

name: Days Inn – Princeton
description: Welcome to Days Inn Princeton, WV. As our guest, you can expect warm hospitality and a range of services including Daybreak Breakfast, free internet, pool, meeting space and truck/bus atm. Located just minutes from I77 and close to many restaurants and area attractions.

name: Days Inn & Suites – Bridgeport
description: 38 suites with complete kitchenettes, free deluxe continental breakfast daily from 6am -10am, free high-speed interent access in all suites, ample parking for cars and buses, meeting rooms, heated indoor pool

name: Days Inn
description: We offer great amenities and a serene setting with beautiful mountain backdrops and lush landscapes.With 5000 square feet of event space, our hotel features 1 meeting rooms, which can be arranged to accommodate 230 conference guests or 230 banquet guests. Located Exit 105 off I-79.
address: 1322 Hackers Creek Rd, Jane Lew, WV, 26378-8600

name: Deb’s Diner, LLC
description: Soups! Salads! Sandwiches! Deb's Diner has just what you're looking for! Featuring great homecooked foods and a daily special and daily soup. We offer a full menu that won't be disappointing! We have an amazing atmosphere to go along with our amazing food and service! Deb's Diner is your favorite small town full service restaurant!

name: Dee Jay’s Ribs
description: Family Dining casual restaurant. BBQ Ribs and grill.

name: Deerfield Country Club
description: Deerfield is an exciting 9 hole regulation course located at the Deerfield Country Club facility in Weston, WV. From the longest tees it presents 3,405 yards of golf for a par of 36. The course was designed by Dr. Michael Hurdzan, ASGCA/Jack Kidwell and opened in 1978. The course rating is 36.5 with a slope rating of 120. Deerfield is a daily fee golf course. Course is open all season.

name: DeFeo Winery
description: DeFeo Winery
address: 1249 Pee Wee Hill Road, Leroy, WV, 25252

name: DeFluri’s Fine Chocolates
description: Award-winning chocolates made right here! Come and watch our chocolatiers at work. Browse through our factory store where you'll find a luscious array of award-winning confections: truffles, butter crunch, caramels, cherries, crunches and more. We have 18 feet of candy cases filled with our homemade confections. Kids not behaving, you need our Dr. DeFluri's 72% Cacao Behaviour Modification Tablets! Fashion conscious, check out our stunning "Well-dressed Twinkie." Group tours accommodated with advance notice.

name: Del Sol Lounge
description: Martini bar featuring dinner daily.

name: Deliziosa Cafe at Unexpected Treasures
description: Deliziosa is a quaint restaurant located in downtown Elkins. In addition to great soups, sandwiches and desserts, patrons also can take a stroll of the store for gourmet gift baskets, crafts, candles, lotions, bath products and other unique gifts.

name: Della’s Deli LLC
description: Conveniently located downtown, you can pick up sliced-to-order meats and cheeses, salads & Italian specialties; freshly-baked pepperoni rolls, hot dogs, and made-to-order sandwiches. Order platters for office parties and outings.

name: Der Dog Haus Pub & Grill
description: Multi-Cuisine restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. Friendly atmosphere with incredible service, full menu, bar, TV's in every room!

name: Devil Anse ATV Resort
description: Devil Anse ATV Resort is a full service resort offering 6 cabins, 6 RV sites, and tent sites. Located directly in the middle of all 3 Hatfield McCoy Trail Systems, specifically just 3 miles east of the tunnel on the Devil Anse Connector trail # 52.

name: Diamonds ‘N Gold Look
description: The Bronze Look's Diamonds 'N Gold Look is your go-to shopping destination. Located at 901 Mercer Street in Princeton (formerly Barbakow's and Elizabeth's Boutique) we are a department store offering unique items that appeal to both men and women. While our speciality is numismatics, we also sell gold and silver bullion, art, WV artisan glass, both estate and new jewellery, as well as Citizen watches.

name: Dickinson and Wait Craft Gallery
description: The regions finest collection of handmade American crafts. Open 7 days a week 11:00am to 5:00pm.

name: Did’s Designs
description: Did's Designs is a country gift shop located in an historic 1902 bank. Hand woven grapevine wreaths, locally produced candles, mustard relishes, jellies, and candy are jam packed into this one of a kind shop! Home to the largest selection of Jim Shore's Heartwood Creek in the state of WV. Here you can find a gift for anyone! Antiques grace the walls and are used for displaying the beautiful floral arrangements created here. Did's Designs welcomes and invites you to visit anytime!

name: Diehl’s Restaurant
description: The down-home atmosphere is a welcoming ingredient in this family-friendly, family-owned restaurant. Choose from a broad selection of foods like salads, sandwiches and steak dinners. And don’t forget the dessert!

name: Dirtbean Coffee and Bike Shop
description: Located on Main Street (8th Ave) in Marlinton, the Dirt Bean provided a healthy alternative to fast, casual dining. Specialty wraps, sandwiches and the daily special are all made on site with healthy ingredients. Specialty coffees and teas abound along with Chai Teas. Great atmosphere.

name: Dirty Ernie’s Rib Pit
description: New faces and old friends stop by Ernie’s for the famous ribs, hot wings, pastas, salads, soups and sandwiches. You definitely won’t leave hungry.

name: Discount Decorating
description: A selection of primitives, gifts, flags, candles, pictures, wreaths and furniture at affordable prices. Home decorating section with closeout prices on wallpaper. Tues-Sat 10-5:00

name: Discover Historic Oakhurst Links at The Greenbrier
description: Enjoy a round of golf on the most historic course in the United States! Built in 1884, Oakhurst Links was the first golf course designed and built in America. Enjoy a unique game of golf with hickory-shafted clubs and tees made of sand and water - the same way it was done more than 130 years ago!
address: The Greenbrier, 300 W Main Street, 300 W Main Street, WEST VIRGINIA, 24986

name: DJ’s 50’s & 60’s Diner
description: Serving classic American food, cooked to order, and treats such as ice cream floats and rich, creamy milkshakes.

name: Dobra Zupas
description: Dobra Zupas offers a unique dining experience consisting of new dishes paired with craft beer in a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere at a reasonable price.

name: Doc’s Guest House
description: An historic doctor's home in downtown Davis full renovated and full of treasures. The house sleeps nine guests in five beds. The blue room, formerly a maid’s quarters with its own staircase to the fully equipped kitchen, offers one double bed. The spacious green room offers a Queen size bed and a twin, the cheerful yellow room features a Queen only and the large and airy pink room offers a Queen. Two full and two half baths provide added convenience. Kid and pet friendly. Although breakfast is available at the nearby Bright Morning Inn restaurant, it is NOT included in the rates for the guest house.

name: Doddridge County Fair
description: Celebrating our 40th Anniversary the Doddridge County Fair. The 40th Annual 2016 Doddridge County Fair will be held August 23 – 27, 2016 hosted at the beautiful Doddridge County Park along U.S. Route 50 near West Union, WV. Take a stroll through Livestock, Horticulture and Arts / Crafts Exhibits. Enjoy the variety of Family style entertainment at the Main Stage this includes Pageants, Amateur Talent Contest & award winning Country & Gospel Entertainment. Enjoy the fun and thrills of amusement rides and do not forget our Motorsports. Our fair is a one low price admission so with your gate fee you get to enjoy the following: parking, exhibits, amusement rides, award winning entertainment, Motorsports & Family Fun for all ages.
address: Doddridge County Park - County Rte 50/16, West Union, WV, 26456

name: Doddridge County Museum
description: Doddridge County Museum is a small county museum which houses artifacts and documents ranging from pre Civil War and forward. A sketch done by J.H. Diss DeBar is housed here and is the pride of the county as this is the home county of the designer of our state flag. The family history library housed within the museum is a regular stop for genealogists and researches from all over the nation.

name: Dodd’s Log Cabin Grill
description: The lunch specials change monthly but the menu remains full of good, stick-to-your-ribs, hometown food. Daily specials may range from porcupine meatballs or beef stroganoff over noodles to creamed tomatoes over biscuits or salmon patties. You’ll love the homemade gravies, soups and sauces, as well as unique menu items like horseradish pickles and butter beans.
address: Rt. 16 S., 142 Main St., Ellenboro, WV, 26346

name: Dogs Run Farm
description: A small farm in Tucker County, nearby to Dolly Sods and Roaring Plains. We grow naturally raised fruits, vegetables, and eggs.

name: Dogwood Ridge Farms B&B, LLC
description: Chestnut Cabin: Features: private screened in porch with hot tub, huge stone wood burning fireplace, 4 cable televisions , surround sound, XM radio inside and outside, 3 bedrooms, 2 1/2 baths, central heat and air, a grill, and a washer and dryer. Linens included. Accommodates up to 8 people. The Evergreen Cabin: Features: hot tub, wood burning fireplace, cable TV, premium movie channels, VCR, air conditioning, full kitchen, fire pit, charcoal grill, 2 full baths, dining room, 3 bedrooms, sleeper sofa. Linens included. Accommodates 2 to 8 people comfortably. Just 1/4 mile off Rt 19.

name: Dola Mine Memorial
description: At 10:57 p.m. on Thursday, April 25, 1963 an explosion at Clinchfield Coal Company's Compass No. 2 Mine in Dola, West Virginia took the lives of 22 miners. Through the efforts of family members and friends a memorial has been constructed to honor them. On September 3, 2006 this memorial was dedicated on the site of the explosion. For more information contact: info@dolaminememorial.com Level paved parking lot provides handicapped accessibility. Free Admission. Hours: 8AM-Dusk Directions: From I 79 take exit 119, take US 50 West to the exit that says, West Pike St., US Rt. 19 North. Get on US19 North and go to Rt. 18 toward Lumberport. Then in Lumberport take WV 20 North approximately 5 miles and the Dola Memorial should be on the left side of the road.

name: Dolly Sods Wilderness
description: The 17,371 acre Dolly Sods Wilderness in the Monongahela National Forest is part of the National Wilderness Preservation System. It is located in Grant, Randolph and Tucker Counties, West Virginia. The Dolly Sods Wilderness contains much of the Red Creek drainage and contains bog and heath eco-types, more commonly typical to southern Canada. Elevations range from 2,500 to over 4,700 feet. Freezing temperatures can occur anytime of the year. Snow can be expected anytime from October through April. Forest Roads are not maintained during the winter. There are fords on some of the trails that may be a problem to cross during high water events. Directions: From Petersburg follow WV 28/55 south to Jordan Run Road. Turn right and go 1 mile to Forest Road 19. Turn left and follow FR 19 six miles to the Dolly Sods Scenic Area. The wilderness is directly ahead of you at the intersection with FR 75. Turn right for Wildlife and Fisher Spring trailheads; turn left for Rohrbaugh and Red Creek trailheads. From Canaan Valley: follow WV 32 south to the Laneville Road (WV 45). Turn left and go approximately 6 miles to the Red Creek Bridge, where the road changes from pavement to gravel and is now Forest Road 19. Red Creek trailhead is on the left behind the Laneville wildlife management cabin. Continue on FR 19 to get to Rohrbaugh trailhead and FR 75

name: Donel C. Kinnard Memorial State Veterans Cemetery
description: The Cemetery serving veterans of the southern counties, has 354 acres designed to provide a final resting place for West Virginia’s veterans and their closest family members. The Cemetery is named after Donel C. Kinnard who completed seven tours of duty in Vietnam.

name: Dorsey’s Hog Tails Bar & Grill
description: Friendly Neighborhood Bar & Grill Located one mile from Rt.19 on Rt 60.

name: Dorsey’s Knob Park & Lodge
description: Morgantown is the newest park in the Boparc Park System. The 70-acre site is one of the highest points in Monongalia County. From its "Sky Rock" peak, you can see for miles. Enjoy luxurious amenities and a relaxed mountaintop atmosphere at Dorsey Knob Lodge. The lodge is available for rental and accommodates up to 16 people with eight bedrooms and five full bathrooms. It is exclusively located at the top of Dorsey Knob Park. Morgantown’s finest restaurants and shopping are only minutes away. Amenities include a fully-equipped kitchen, dining/conference room, living area with fireplace, outdoor grill, gas fireplaces, fresh linens and air conditioning. For additional information or to make a reservation please call the Boparc administrative office, Monday - Friday, 8:30 a.m.- 4:30 p.m. No smoking, pets or kegs are allowed in the lodge. Extra amenities: coffee, tea, dry condiments, paper products and cleaning supplies can be requested. Check-in: 5 p.m. Check-out: 10 a.m.

name: Dottie’s Country Crafts
description: Crafts and country furniture, quilts and heritage lace. Hand-crafted gifts, wood items, ceramics, glassware, WV souvenirs, dolls, rowe pottery, WV. Potpourri, Tom Seely country furniture and Fenton glass. Gifts for all occasions. Open Tues. - Sat. 10:30 a.m. - 4 p.m.

name: Doughboy Monument and Memorial
description: This life-size, historical replica of a WWI foot soldier, also called a doughboy, stands at approximately seven feet tall on a 12-foot base. Dedicated as War Memorial Park, this monument includes large stone tablets that honor Logan County residents who made the ultimate sacrifice. Midelburg Island, Logan, W.Va.

name: Doughboy Statue
description: Sponsored by the American Legion Auxiliary and erected in 1925 by the Berkeley County Memorial Association, this memorial is dedicated to the patriotic citizens of Berkeley County who served the United States in World War I. Martinsburg, W.Va.

name: Douglass Junior and Senior High School
description: The Douglass Junior and Senior High School stands as a symbol for the black citizens of Huntington. The school served as a cultural and educational center for the black community for nearly 40 years. Among the graduates of Douglass was Carter G. Woodson, the noted black essayist, historian and activist. In 1915, he founded the nation�s oldest black history organization and the Association for the Study of Afro-American Life and History. On the National Register of Historic Places.
address: Douglass Centre, 1448 Tenth Ave., Huntington, WV, 25701

name: Dove’s Factory Outlet
description: Factory Outlet.

name: Downtown Bluefield Historic District
description: Located five miles from exit 1, off I-77. View historic Victorian architecture. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places, Bluefield is the "capitol" of the Southern West Virginia Smokeless Coal Fields.
address: Main Street Bluefield, 224 Law, Bluefield, WV, 24701

name: Downtown PKB
description: Downtown PKB is a catalyst to bring together like-minded, passionate people who are invested in the improvement of downtown. Downtown PKB is the place for you and your family to get involved, celebrate community, get inspired, savor the flavors and to live an active life. We are a Mainstreet Community.

name: Dr. Robert B. McNutt House
description: Dr. Robert McNutt House is located at 1522 North Walker Street, Princeton, WV. It is the only house left standing in Princeton after the town was burned during the Civil War. The House is on the National Register of Historic Places. The McNutt House was used as headquarters during the war for Lt. Col. Rutherford B. Hayes and Sgt. William McKinley (both past U. S. Presidents). The McNutt House was also used as a hospital during May 1862. Located along the West Virginia Civil War Trail. Hours: Monday-Friday 9-4. No admission charge. Visitors welcome.

name: Dragon Palace
description: With dozens of traditional buffet items, The Dragon Palace is a great way to satisfy your craving for Chinese food while in Southern West Virginia. To go orders are always a convenient option for families and travellers alike.

name: Draper’s Cafe
description: Located at The Greenbrier Resort, Draper's Cafe is conceived as a bright and colorful tribute to Dorothy Draper. Draper's offers casual dining with a menu that includes classic Dorothy Draper recipes as well as traditional southern dishes. Enjoy lunch and dinner served in a cheerfully unique setting.
address: The Greenbrier, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Drawdy Falls
description: Keep your eyes peeled to be sure you catch a glimpse of the stunning Drawdy Falls in Boone County. Sitting just off Route 3, these falls are a perfect pair, reaching 6 feet in height. Surrounded by rock shelves, these falls pour into Drawdy Creek – creating the perfect roadside oasis for you to stop and enjoy. Get an up-close view by parking across the road at Drawdy Falls Roadside Park and carefully making your way back over towards the falls.

name: Droop Mountain Battlefield State Park
description: A peaceful park with a panoramic view from the iconic Droop Mountain Tower, now marks the spot where one of West Virginia’s largest and last important Civil War battle was fought on November 6, 1863. The decisive victory of Union forces under General William W. Averell over the Confederate army under General John Echols ended serious efforts by the Confederacy to control West Virginia. For hiking trails, history, and hours of operation, visit the web link below.

name: Drovers Inn
description: Drovers Inn Built in 1848 and listed on the national register of historic places operates as a restaurant and tavern. We begin answering phones at noon Wednesday through Saturday.

name: DuBois on Main Museum
description: DuBois High School, 1917-1956, was one of two black high schools in Fayette County, WV. Black students came from the entire plateau region of the county to be educated there. The museum has a collection of newspapers, pictures, articles and items donated to show the history of this school. DuBois football teams were state champions in 1930's, 1940's and 1950's. Students were state and national winners in areas including commerce, art and vocational agriculture. The little school on the hill received national attention due to having a staff member who also was a reporter for a national black newspaper. In spite of the poor physical conditions and old textbooks, students became local and national leaders, attaining levels of success unparalleled. They had the best armor needed....excellent teachers and adults who guided them very well. This history is unknown to many local residents because it was not in their textbooks..unrecognized black history.  Visit is free, but donations are gladly accepted. We are a volunteer run 501-c-3 nonprofit. Hours are 11am-5pm Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday. Other times by appointment. Small gift shop area. Inclement weather? Call first. Thank you. P.S. Often there on Mon & Thurs. also. Check it out if in area.

name: Duck Soup Books & Toys, LLC
description: Unique toys and books for kids of all ages. Open Tues. - Fri. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m., Sat. 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.

name: Dudash RV Lots and Campground
description: We are a small, friendly, family-owned 6 site RV park. Rates include water and electric. We are located approximately 7 miles from I-79.

name: Dunbar Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
address: 12th St. and Myers Ave., Dunbar, WV, 25064

name: Dunbar Fall Festival
description: Arts and Crafts Street Fair located at Dunbar Landing (10th Street Shopping Plaza) Free to public. Arts and Craft vendors along with diverse food vendors. Free entertainment daily. Gage, Toothless Ruth and Siren's Song on Friday evening; Pour House Band, Tommy Griffith and The Chase on Saturday evening and Gospel Sunday. Kids day on Saturday with Minute to Win It Games, Archery Irish Road Bowling and inflatable games.
address: Dunbar Landing (10th Street Shopping Plaza), Dunbar, WV, 25064

name: Dunhams Sports
description: Founded in 1937, Dunham's has grown into one of the nation’s largest full line sporting goods chains. Dunham's has built its reputation by offering a wide variety of name brand merchandise at everyday low prices. So, get in the game®....at Dunham's!!

name: Dunloup Falls
description: Found near the abandoned mining town of Thurmond is a hidden waterfall – Dunloup Falls. These flowing cascades stumble 20 feet across a sandstone ledge, capping the falls for a view worth seeking out. Catch your first glimpse from a roadside parking spot along Thurmond Road, before making the quick scramble down to the creek bed for the perfect view.

name: DUO VIANNO
description: Viola/Piano duet Bernard Di Gregorio, viola and Patrice Ewoldt, piano performers

name: Durbin and Greenbrier Valley Railroad
description: Discover West Virginia by rail! The Durbin & Greenbrier Valley Railroad offers Mountain Rail Adventures that depart the depots of Elkins, Durbin, Cheat Bridge and Cass – April through December. These remote wilderness excursions on historic steam-driven locomotives and vintage diesel-powered passenger trains explore the more remote areas of the Mountain State where even autos cannot access!

name: Dutch Haus Restaurant
description: Located At The Greenbrier Valley Airport. Fine Food In A Casual Atmosphere. Serving Steaks, Seafood, Sandwiches, And Subs. We Offer Breakfast, Lunch, And Dinner. Hours Are: 8:30 a.m. - 9 p.m. seven days a week.

name: EAGLES NEST CAMPGROUND
description: ALL LOTS FULL HOOK UP! ALL LOTS PULL THROUGH. GREAT RESTAURANT, (50 SITES ON THE WATER) FISHING, SWIMMING, ETC. ETC. HORSE SHOES, PARK, VOLLEY BALL, PUTT PUTT GOLF AND SO MUCH MORE!! DO NOT MISS OUR 4TH OF JULY. MASSIVE FIREWORKS, ALL DAY EVENTS!! THE BIGGEST LITTLE CAMPGROUND IN WEST VA.
address: 1714 PATTERSON CREEK VILLAGE PIKE JUST 9 MILES OUT OF CUMBERLAND MD. INTO WILED WONDERFUL WV., RIDGELY, WV, 26753

name: Eagle’s Nest Campground
description: We offer camping for recreational vehicles and tents. For RV's, there are three rows of campsites providing our campground with 80 total sites. Each site is equipped with 30 or 50 amp electrical hookup, water, and on-site sewage hookup. These amenities are included in flat rate pricing for nightly, weekend, monthly, or seasonal renting. Additional amenities include: Horse shoes, corn hole, volleyball and basketball, weekend community float trips, live music most Friday nights and holidays, Open Barbecues, on-premises restaurant and lounge. We also have a pavilion and small cabins for rent.
address: 1714 Patterson Creek Village Pike, Ridgeley, WV, 26753

name: Eagle’s Nest Campground
description: New campground in Glen Jean, WV located 10 miles from Beckley and The New River Gorge Bridge. We have full hook-ups, drive-thru sites and tent camping available. We also have a Bath House and Laundry Facility. We are two miles from the Boy Scout Adventure Camp entrance. Now taking reservations, please call 804-240-8149 for information and rates.
address: 500 Wood Mountain Road, Glen Jean, WV, 25846

name: Eagles Nest Outfitters
description: West Virginia is a different world -- a vacation destination for couples and families in search of relaxation, adventure and fun! Don't just send your kids off to camp -- join them! An Eagles Nest Outfitters vacation is an adventure "camp" for the entire family. Eagles Nest Outfitters adventure will fill your photo album with meaningful and happy vacation memories.

name: Earth Dog Cafe
description: This eco-friendly restaurant has a welcoming atmosphere, great food and great drinks! Cafe is in a funky old storefront that has been adapted into a really fun place. Its pulled pork and beef brisket are hearty, flavorful, and always carefully seasoned and cooked for the peak of flavor.
address: 398 S. Washington St., Berkeley Springs, WV, 25411

name: East End Bazaar
description: Each week, the Bazaar hosts a wide variety of high-quality, juried artisans, live music and entertainment, locally-sourced food, and plenty more surprises. The Bazaar provides local and regional artists and craftspeople a much-needed venue to display and sell their wares, such as paintings, jewelry, sculpture, stained glass, handmade crafts like soaps, textiles, and baskets, photography, value-added food, pottery, hand-blown glass, and much, much more. Local musicians and performers are showcased each week at the Bazaar, as are a variety of local food vendors and producers. The Bazaar is located at the corner of Washington Street, East and Ruffner Avenue, in what for years has been a vacant lot. The Bazaar is held Saturdays from April through October.
address: Washington St. E. and Ruffner Ave., Charleston, WV, 25339

name: East Fork Campground
description: Located on the East Fork of the Greenbrier River, this family oriented campground is fun for everyone. You can swim in the river, ride the Durbin Train, hike the trails and sit around the campfire and roast marshmallows. RV and Tent Camping is available.
address: Rt 250 Main Street, Meadow Lane Drive, Durbin, WV, 26264

name: Eastern Regional Coal Archives
description: Dig deeper into the history of Bluefield and surrounding areas by visiting the archives. There you will find artifacts, blueprints, films, ledgers, maps, miner's tools, newspapers, photographs, mine scrip, railroad memorabilia and more.

name: Eckhart House Tea Room, Tours and Gift Shoppe
description: The Eckhart House is an 1892 Queen Anne Town Home located in Victorian Old Town which is the N. Wheeling Historic District. The Tea Room - elegant Teas are served in the dining room on Saturdays, May through December. Reservations are required. Home Tours - Guided Tours of the home's living quarters are offered May through December on Fridays and Saturdays. 1 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. Teas and Tours are available by appointment for groups of 6 or more or for a minimum charge. Built in 1892 by wealthy banker George W. Eckhart Jr., the Eckhart House was considered by the Wheeling Daily Intelligencer of October 29, 1892 to be one of the residential building achievements of the year. With most of its original architectural features well preserved, it is truly deserving of the title Victorian Wheeling’s ‘Crown Jewel’. The three story Queen Anne town home is nestled in the heart of Victorian Old Town and is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The Eckhart House offers a Tea Room, a Gift Shop and is also available for touring.

name: Econo Lodge
description: The Econo Lodge hotel in Huntington near Marshall University is a pet-friendly hotel that is located near Huntington Museum of Art, Blenko Glass Company, Camden Park, Harris Riverfront Park and Huntington Mall. This hotel offers free continental breakfast, an on-site fitness center and free coffee. Each room includes microwaves, coffee makers, refrigerators, hair dryers, irons and ironing boards. The Econo Lodge at Huntington provide an afforadable stay with amenities you can expect.

name: Econo Lodge
description: The Econo Lodge hotel in Morgantown, West Virginia is located near Interstate 79 near West Virginia University. Other nearby popular destinations include Westover Shopping Mall, Chestnut Ridge Park, Mountaineer Mall, Seneca Center Museum and Core Arboretum. The hotel is also near Morgantown Municipal Airport - Walter L. Bill Hart Field. The amenities include free continental breakfast, free WiFi, guest laundry, free coffee and fax machine services.

name: Econo Lodge
description: The Econo Lodge hotel in Riply, West Virginia is located near Cedar Lake Conference Center. It is not far from West Virginia-Ohio border and is also located near other popular attractions including Mountaineer State Art & Craft Fair, Jackson County Courthouse, Children's Day and Jackson General Hospital. Amenities include free hot breakfast, free WiFi, free weekday newpaper, guest laundry facilities and a picnic area. Each room features a coffee maker, TV, desk, hair dryer and iron.

name: Econo Lodge
description: The pet-friendly Econo Lodge hotel in Summersville is located near Summersville Lake and Dam and the Summersville Arena and Conference Center. The hotel is also conveniently located near Interstate 79 and U.S. Route 19. Some nearby attractions include New River Gorge Bridge, Gauler River NAtional Recreation Area, Winterplace Ski Resort, Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine and Summersville Lake Marina. Enjoy free continental breakfast, free WiFi, copy, fax and print services and bus, truck & RV parking.

name: Econo Lodge – Coliseum
description: The Econo Lodge Coliseum is located off Monongahela Boulevard near West Virginia University. Other nearby sites, attractions and activities include Mountaineer Field, Cheat Lake, Coopers Rock State Forest, Seneca Center Museum and Morgantown Mall. This pet-friendly hotel offer free continental breakfast, copy, print and fax services, cold weather hook-ups and a coffee shop. All guest rooms are smoke-free and they provide a coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave and iron.

name: Econo Lodge – Harpers Ferry
description: Conveniently located at the corner of Rt. 340 and Union St, just 1 mile to historic Harpers Ferry. Also, this hotel is minutes from Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races and 30 minutes from Antietam National Battlefield. We offer a free, hot breakfast daily. Amenities include free in-room coffee, fridges/microwaves, free wireless internet access and TV/HBO in all rooms.

name: Econo Lodge Inn & Suites – Triadelphia
description: NUMBER OF UNITS: 109 rooms; FACILITIES: Clean, comfortable rooms, complimentary continental breakfast, free local calls, data ports, outdoor pool, game room, fitness center, free WIFI, cable TV and 3 HBOs. CREDIT CARDS: YES LOCATION: I-70, EXIT 11, WHEELING.

name: Econo Lodge-Bluefield
description: Conveniently located off Interstate 77, the Econo Lodge® is the place to stay when visiting friends and family. High Speed Internet, Continental Breakfast, Pet Friendly Our pet-friendly discount hotel in Bluefield provides easy access to such popular attractions and points of interest as: Mercer Mall, Bluefield State College, Bluefield Regional Medical Center, Mercer County Airport

name: Edgewater Park Campground and Marina
description: Waterfront sites w/water, sewage 20/30/50 amp electric, boat ramp and dock, toilet facilities, showers, live bait, pop, ice, and firewood. Ohio or WV Fishing Licenses are permitted on River or Lake.

name: Edgewood Country Club
description: Our deluxe facilities include an 18 hole championship Golf course, Har-tru tennis courts, double and singles Squash courts, Fitness facility and Swim complex. Our Racquets Pro, Fitness Pro and PGA Golf Pro are all available year-round, to keep you and your game in top form.

name: EH Chocolates & More / Farm Fresh Produce
description: Gourmet Swiss chocolate products made from a historic farmhouse. Choose from a variety of luscious truffle assortments, lollipops, confections, bars, and much more. So come visit and enjoy some chocolates.

name: Eidolon Preserve
description: Named for the phantom women Zeus created from mist and light, Eidolon Nature Preserve in Morgan County features dense mountaintop forests and commanding views of the Potomac River. The preserve includes three trails and walkable roads, together totaling about four miles. As Eastern Panhandle farms and forests disappear under the footprint of housing and commercial development, Eidolon helps to halts the trend on a beautiful piece of Sideling Hill.

name: Eighth Street Confectionery
description: Daily specials. Great food. Call for carry-outs.

name: EJ’s Cottages and Overnight Stabling
description: Located near the Greenbrier River Trail, EJ's Cottages also provide stabling for your horses. You can ride your horses on the trail, go fishing or just relax. Contact EJ's for information on group rides on the Greenbrier River Trail.

name: El Bandito Mexican Restaurant
description: Known for fabulous authentic Mexican food!
address: 2027 Main Street E, Oak Hill, WV, 25901

name: El Gallo Mexican Restaurant
description: Come out and try Braxton County's newest restaurant, El Gallo! El Gallo offers authentic Mexican dishes 7 days a week. Located at the Flatwoods Factory Outlet Stores just off I-79, less than a mile from Exit 67, Flatwoods. Dine in or call in your to go order today!

name: Elakala Falls
description: The gorgeous Elakala Falls is a series of four waterfalls found within Blackwater Falls State Park. With waters stained from hemlock and red spruce needles, these falls boast a distinctive red hue that pours over staggered rock steps. Beginning right by the Blackwater Falls Lodge, the Elakala Trail is your route to enjoy these gorgeous falls – and be sure to look down, as your path will take you directly above the first falls along a wooden bridge.

name: Elk Motor Court
description: Elk Motor Court features 12 comfortable Single & Family Units with color TV, circulating heat, and air conditioning.

name: Elk River Camp and RV Park
description: Elk River Camp and RV Park lies along the Banks of The Elk River in Gassaway, West Virginia. It includes two parks: Little Buffalo and Bear Run. Each park has full or partial Hookups. Full hookups include power, water, and sewer. Partial hookups include only power and water. Reservations are encouraged but are not required. 24 full hookups, 7 with Power & water, - 7 with just power, All hookup 50,30,120 Power, City water. We offer well lit sites, fire pits at every site, picnic tables at each site, pavilions available,all sites are pull through,all sites accommodate RVs of any size, swings and hammocks available for use (Seasonal). The campground also acts as a public access for the Elk River Water Trail as well as the host of one of five Flatwoods Monster Chairs! Elk River Camp and RV is a horse friendly park for travelers and clubs. Horses are welcome in the park and vicinity. Driving directions: Off I-79, Exit 62. Turn Right off the exit. Watch for yellow sign for Elk River Camp and RV. Take next left at the bridge. After crossing the bridge, watch for another sign pointing right. Arrive at camp ground in about a half mile.

name: Elk River Campground
description: Year-round RV (all sizes) camping, full hook-ups, near river access for fishing, boating, and kayaking. Montly rentals available. Short drive to local grocery store, shopping, and restaurants.

name: Elk River Get-A-Way
description: At Elk River Get-A-Way wants to help you plan your next adventure! We offer packages designed to get you, your friends, and family out on the beautiful scenic Elk River. If you are interested in kayaking, canoeing, fishing on the infamous "muskie channel", or just enjoying an afternoon paddling with your family; our premier services and equipment are right for you. Our rentals include adult and youth inflatable kayaks, canoes, family-sized paddle boats, inner-tubing and much more! Give us a call today to make your reservation and don't forget to ask about our memberships, group rates, and discount offers! If you already own a kayak, ask us about our shuttle service! Visit us at www.elkgetaway.com for more information.
address: 16544 Elk River Rd. N, Clendenin, WV, 25045

name: Elk River Retreat
description: Come for some R&R in Bergoo, WV, and enjoy sitting on the covered front porch while watching wildlife or enjoy grilling with friends on the back covered deck while soaking in the hot tub. Plus, this cabin is 26 miles away from Snowshoe Mountain if you enjoy snow skiing, snowboarding or snow tubing. After a hard day of play enjoy warming up around the wood burning fireplace. If kayaking or fishing is your specialty then you will have many local rivers to choose from. Enjoy the Back Fork of Elk, Gauley, Cranberry, Williams, and Holly, plus many trout streams. Fish miles of the Elk River within minutes of the Cabin. Elk River can be walked to within a 10 minute hike.

name: Elk River Snowboards
description: Elk River Snowboard and Ski is a family owned and operated rental & retail shop in Soaring Eagle lodge at Snowshoe Mountain resort. We offer high quality advise on winter sports in the Snowshoe resort area. Equipment demo available along with custom tuning providing by hand. Our shop is located slope side facing the general parking lot next to Top of the World. We're 400 ft from the new Soaring Eagle high speed quad servicing widow maker trails. The location is perfect for all of your needs.

name: Elk River – WMA-Braxton
description: The states oldest WMA. Excellent hunting for forest game. The area boasts mature forests with some old growth timber. Hunting trails can be enjoyed year around for hiking and wildlife viewing.

name: Elk Springs Resort and Fly Shop
description: We are a one stop fly fishing adventure destination on the headwaters of the Elk River, with lodging, restaurant, guide service and fly shop. Only 13 miles from Snowshoe Mountain Resort and other attractions. Our resort is tucked away on the banks of The Elk River near the Randolph, Pocahontas County lines in West Virginia. We offer Elk River guided trips, and also offer private lessons, group lessons and schools from beginners to advanced fly fishermen. With fourteen cabins and a 6000 square foot lodge we can accommodate the single fisherman up to families and corporate events. Only a short walk to the Fly Shop & Ellie May’s Ole Mill Restaurant for fresh trout and favorite beverage.

name: Elk Theatre
description: Visit the historic one screen theater that dates back to the 1930's. Playing films regularly every weekend as well as hosting special events the Elk Theatre entertains visitors and residents year round. Most weekends the Elk Theatre shows a movie at 7 PM on Friday and Saturday, with a 3 PM matinee on Sundays. The Elk Theatre often plays host to special events like the West Virginia FILMmakers Festival (the first Friday, Saturday and Sunday of October) and the Elk Music Festival. On top of showing new releases the Elk Theatre will also show an old classic from time to time giving movie lovers a chance to see an old favorite on the big screen. We offer movies, fresh hot buttered popcorn, sodas, water, snacks, various candies, and serve Fresh Roast Papau New Guinea Regular and Colombian Decaf Coffee. WE USE COCONUT POPPING OIL !!! We salt our corn as we pop it - not afterwards. We always have popcorn - even available to non movie-goers! After the film starts, anyone can come in and buy Popcorn! The Elk Theatre will also rent out it's facilities for special events and parties. Call 304-765-2519 for more information.

name: Elkhorn Inn & Theatre
description: Featured on HGTV, CNN Travel, & the Bon Appetit Appalachia! " foodie" map, a winner of the 2017 SCORE Business Champion Award for West Virginia, the historic "Coal Heritage Trail" Elkhorn Inn provides bed-&-breakfast lodging with 14 guest rooms, & fine dining by reservation. The Elkhorn Inn is the only "Coal Heritage Trail" property in WV providing lodging & dining. World-class area fun includes excellent rail fanning, trout fishing, & ATVing, on the Hatfield-McCoy Trails, hiking, golf, etc.!
address: 30767 Coal Heritage Road,. Landgraff, Eckman, WV, 24829

name: Elkins Farmers Market
description: Founded in 1975 with a diverse collection of vendors whose mission is to provide local farm and kitchen products.To provide area farmers with alternative opportunities through a retail marketplace; to encourage regional farming; to provide consumers with fresh, locally grown or produced items in a convenient location; to stimulate public interest in agricultural pursuits and consumption of local farm and kitchen products; and, to support the creative efforts of artists in promoting locally made, homecrafted or hand-assembled items. Elkins Town Square May through October Saturdays - 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. (noon) Elkins City Park July through September Wednesdays - 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. (noon)

name: Elkins Flea Market
description: Over 100 vendors and tables all under cover. New & used merchandise. Set up fee only $6 per 10 x 20 space. Sure dogs are fine if you clean up behind. We donate at least $200 each month to the Randolph County Humane Society. Thanks to our customers.

name: Elkins Main Street
description: Elkins Main Street’s mission is to grow a vibrant, livable downtown experience and environment. Elkins Main Street reaches these goals by leveraging available community assets, promoting public and private partnerships, supporting historic preservation, enhancing our cultural environment and embracing our heritage with a focus on investment in our future. Hours: Monday-Friday: 10am-4pm.

name: Elkins-Randolph County Chamber Of Commerce
description: The mission of the Elkins-Randolph County Chamber of Commerce is to advocate, educate, and network to enhance business opportunities in Elkins-Randolph County. Our vision is to be a positive, vibrant economic driver for Elkins-Randolph County.

name: Elkins Sewing Center
description: Elkins Sewing Center has been a source of quilting fabrics and supplies for over 26 years. In addition, fabrics for outdoor activities, clothing, home decoration and other uses are also available. Classes are offered on a wide variety of quilting and sewing topics. Elkins Sewing Center is a Premier dealer of Husqvarna Viking sewing machines and related supplies.

name: Ella and Company
description: Ella and Company, nestled in the artsy town of Thomas, specializes in vintage home goods and antiques. The store also features an event planning and wedding planning business. Ella & Company’s goal is to bring big dreams to life. Stop by and stay awhile!

name: Ellen’s Homemade Ice Cream
