description: Ellen's Ice Cream is located in the heart of Charleston, WV, in the Village District. At Ellen's you will find a welcoming, comfortable, and happy environment. All of Ellen's delicious, super premium ice cream is made on-site. In addition to award-winning ice cream, Ellen's also offers a wide variety of lunch options (all of which are made in-house) including soups, green salads, wraps, sandwiches, black bean burgers, and pasta & grain salads, with many vegetarian and vegan options. Baked goods such as cookies, brownies, and carrot cake cupcakes are available as well. At Ellen's you can also get fruit smoothies, coffee, and espresso drinks - some of which can include ice cream for a special treat!

name: Elle’s Niche
description: A retail boutique in downtown Charles Town, WV, Elle’s Niche offers each person that steps through the door a lovely collection of handmade products made by local artisans including soap-makers, seamstresses, jewelry makers, sign-makers, painters, fiber and clay artists, as well as those who up-cycle furniture and clothing and re-purpose antiques.
address: 103 W Liberty Street, Charles Town, WV, 25414

name: Elmwood Cemetery
description: The Elmwood Cemetery includes the graves of several Confederate Veterans, including Henry Kyd Douglas, Staff Officer to General “Stonewall” Jackson, and General William W. Kirkland. Shepherdstown, W.Va.

name: Embassy Suites – Charleston
description: The Embassy Suites Charleston, all-suite hotel is conveniently located in Charleston, WV within walking distance of Charleston Town Center Mall. Settle in to one of the 253 air-conditioned rooms featuring microwaves, coffee/tea makers and sofa beds. Grab dinner at the onsite restaurant or take advantage of the hotel's room service (during limited hours) and dine in the comfort of your suite.

name: Enjoyed Again Antiques
description: A most "Unique Junktique" in a cool small town!!

name: Environmental Protection, Department of
description: EMERGENCY NUMBERS: NATIONAL: 800-424-8802 STATE: 800-642-3074

name: Ernest Bowman & Brother
description: Hardware Store Is Worth Going Into Just To Experience The Spaciousness And Solid Dignity Of A Venerable Franklin Landmark. Rebecca B. Lough And Staff Can Supply You With All Your Modern Hardware Needs: Do It Best Paints, Window Glass Cut To Order, Horse Tack, Custom-cut Iron Stock, Maytag, Ge & Crosley Appliances, Wolverine Boots, Pellet Stoves, Wood Stoves, Holland Grills And More.

name: Ernie’s Acres Campground
description: Ernie’s Acres Campground, located in Valley Grove, offers 14 RV sites with 30-50 amp service and full hookups year-round. Monthly rates are available. Our campground is located on 127 acres in a beautiful country setting. We are secluded but conveniently located 3 miles off interstate 70. Amenities include: playground, fenced in dog run, common area for gatherings and campfires, oversized large sites, extra parking, gas electric, sewage, and nearby fishing lake. We are also located about 8 miles from Cabela's.
address: 266 Potomac Hill Rd., Valley Grove, WV, 26060

name: Esquire Country Club
description: The 18-hole "Esquire" course at the The Esquire Country Club facility in Barboursville, West Virginia features 6,905 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 72 . Esquire has an 18-hole course, driving range, and banquet facilities. Open to the public, the Esquire Country Club is nestled inside a hairpin bend of the Guyandotte River.

name: Ethics Commission
description: GOVERNMENT AGENCY - Administers code of conduct for public servants to avoid conflict of interests between public responsibilities and private financial interests. Also provides guidance to governing bodies of public agencies on the meaning and application of the State's open meeting laws. Provides guidance to county school board members, members-elect and candidates on eligibility to hold other public positions. Administers code of judicial conduct for state administrative law judges.

name: Euro-Suites Hotel
description: Euro-Suites Hotel is a boutique hotel nestled in the scenic rolling hills of Morgantown, WV. We are the first and only hotel in Morgantown, West Virginia that is incorporating eco-friendly practices throughout the hotel. Euro-Suites Hotel offers green certified amenities in our suites and exclusively uses non-toxic cleaning supplies. Euro-Suites Hotel has 75 two-room suites that provide all the comforts of home including a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Complimentary privileges at the Healthworks Rehab and Fitness Center. Complimentary high speed internet is available in all suites and wireless internet access is accessible throughout the hotel. Each morning we offer a full complimentary hot breakfast and each evening hot and cold hors d’oeuvres. Please visit www.euro-suites.com for driving directions and for more information.

name: Everything Cheesecake
description: Made to order gourmet cheesecake, cheesecake by the slice, pastries, and locally roasted Black Dog Coffee. We offer variety platters.

name: Everything Fiesta
description: Everything Fiesta is one of only two stores in the world where shoppers can buy factory direct, West Virginia-made, Fiesta dishes. Which includes a wide variety of factory seconds. Where's the other store? It’s all made and designed right here in Newell, West Virginia. This West Virginia made dinnerware and accessories are highly collected all over the world. Lifestyle your home with a colorful array of licensed textiles, flatware/cutlery, gadgets, drinkware and more to fulfill all of your Fiesta cravings. Everything Fiesta hosts huge tent sales every Spring and Summer where they offer factory seconds at the lowest prices you'll find. Restaurants and dealers come from all over the county to stock up on dishes, as well as die-hard collectors. Call for information on store inventory or tent sales. Everything Fiesta is conveniently located in the Flatwoods Factory Outlet Stores in Sutton, West Virginia. Just take Interstate 79 and get off at exit 67.

name: Explore WV
description: Providing kayak rentals and guided hikes in North Central WV.

name: Explore Summers County CVB
description: Scenically located in the southeastern region of West Virginia, Summers County offers a laid back atmosphere exploding with recreation. Three rivers meander their way throughout the county providing ample waterways to fish, kayak, float and explore. Between scenic state parks like Bluestone and Pipestem Resort, there are plenty of trails to hike. Experience the Hinton Historic District, a charming railroad town that sits along the banks of the New River. Explore Summers County this spring!

name: Extreme Expeditions
description: Discover family-friendly float trips through the gentle Upper New River Canyon where children as young as six years old can take part in this low impact, scenic adventure. Kids always raft for half price on this mild single day trip. Classic whitewater can be found on the playful Lower New River Gorge which is great for first time rafters age twelve and up. Each trip is guided by a professional who is patient, engaging and always eager to share their passion for adventure.

name: Fairfax Stone State Park
description: One of the oldest markers in the U.S. Marks boundary between Maryland and West Virginia and is a state park.
address: 1584 Blackwater Lodge Rd, PO Drawer 490, Davis, WV, 26260

name: Fairfield Inn And Suites – Fairmont
description: Always fresh, always clean, our guest rooms are full of thoughtful amenities, including a well-lit work desk and a remote-controlled TV with free cable. We'll get you started each day with a complimentary continental breakfast that includes hot, freshly brewed coffee.

name: Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott
description: Hotel with 95 rooms, indoor pool and hot tub, continental breakfast, and two meeting rooms.

name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Charleston
description: Travel with confidence at Fairfield by Marriott® - a hotel with outstanding service for an easy and comfortable stay at an exceptional value. We are always ready to welcome you to our thoughtfully designed guest rooms and suites with plenty of room to work and relax. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel will keep you connected during your stay and our pool and fitness center will help you stay on track. Spread out in our vibrant lobby with spaces to gather, relax and work. Jump-start each day with our free breakfast, now with more hot choices like oatmeal, sausage and scrambled eggs as well as favorites including fresh fruit and yogurt. You will always find the courteous service you deserve plus all the little things you expect from Fairfield Inn & Suites during your stay. Ask us about The Fairfield 100% Guarantee where we promise you will be satisfied or we will make it right. That is our commitment to you.

name: Fairfield Inn & Suites – Lewisburg
description: 100% smoke free facility featuring 81 guestrooms and suites. Amenities include indoor pool, whirlpool spa, meeting room, and fitness center, high speed internet, guest laundry facility and complimentary breakfast. $$

name: Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott – Beckley WV
description: Travel with confidence by checking into the Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Beckley, a Beckley hotel with outstanding service to make all of your travels easy and comfortable - at an exceptional value. With a great location near the beautiful New River Gorge, we're always ready to welcome you with amenities like thoughtfully designed guest rooms and suites that allow you to work and relax, free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel to stay connected during your stay, and fitness facilities that include an outdoor seasonal pool and exercise room. Pets are welcome with a fee in our designated pet rooms. Jump-start your day with a free breakfast, now with more hot choices like scrambled eggs, sausage, oatmeal, fresh fruit and yogurt. At the Fairfield Inn & Suites Beckley, you're our #1 priority. We promise you'll be satisfied or we'll make it right. That's our commitment to you. Ask us about the Fairfield 100% Guarantee. Guests must be age 21 or over for room rental.

name: Fairfield Inn & Suites – Princeton
description: Welcome to the Fairfield Inn & Suites Princeton, WV, where guests are treated to stylish rooms, quality services and a friendly atmosphere. Nestled against the majestic beauty of the Appalachian Mountains in Princeton, WV, the hotel's location is just off I-77 and US 460. Enjoy exceptional amenities such as free high-speed internet, a heated indoor pool, a fitness center, meeting space, corner market, connect and print center and the complimentary breakfast buffet during your stay.

name: Fairgrounds Flea Market
description: Flea market every Tuesday and Saturday in the main parking lot off Rte. 219 South.
address: 947 Maplewood Ave, Lewisburg, WV 24901 / Rte. 219 S, Fairlea, WV, 24902

name: Fairmont Avenue Antiques
description: Antiques, collectibles, furniture, stoneware, depression glass, Homer Laughlin, books, linens, quilts, coins, three floors full. Open Wed. - Sat. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m., Sun. noon - 5 p.m., Closed Tuesdays.

name: Fairmont Chamber Music Society, Inc.
description: Presents the finest classical chamber music including international artists in beautiful St. Peter the Fisherman Church in downtown Fairmont.

name: Fairmont Farmers Market
description: Fresh produce, baked goods, fresh picked berries, and honey. Find us on Facebook for more information. Hours: Every Tuesday (weather permitting) from 4-6 PM.

name: Fairmont State University
description: At Fairmont State, you'll find: * A wide range of fields of study -- 6 associate degree programs and 90 baccalaureate degree programs, as well as graduate programs. * Outstanding, friendly faculty who will know your name and care about your success. * A safe and active campus located in Fairmont, WV. Room to grow through internships, research and travel experiences. * A solid career path. More than 87 percent of our graduates find jobs within one year. Come visit us today!

name: Fairview Diner
description: Stop by for home-cooked meals and tasty desserts.

name: Falls of Hills Creek
description: A crown jewel of the Monongahela National Forest, the Falls of Hills Creek are hidden off of the Highland Scenic Highway, just 5 miles west of the Cranberry Mountain Nature Center. Consisting of three cascading falls, the Falls of Hills Creek is surrounded by lush, green foliage and blooming rhododendrons in spring. The Falls of Hills Creek Trail will take you along a 1.3-mile out and back trek, moving lower towards the last falls in a series of pathways and wooden stairs. An ADA accessible boardwalk provides views of the first falls.

name: Falls Of Hills Creek (USDA Forest Service)
description: Three waterfalls at the Falls of Hill Creek cascade over rock layers of sandstone and shale. A 3/4 mile trail provides access to the falls, including a paved, barrier-free trail to the first falls. This area is located six miles west of the Cranberry Mountain Visitor Center. A scenic forest trail leads into a narrow Gorge containing 3 waterfalls, the largest of which is 65 feet high, is the second highest waterfall in West Virginia.

name: Falls of Pendleton
description: The Falls of Pendleton stumble over a moss-covered cliff within the lush Blackwater Falls State Park. This majestic beauty is found where Pendleton Run tumbles into the roaring Blackwater River, creating the perfect backdrop for an afternoon of adventure. Enjoy views of this cascade along the Pendleton Trace Trail, hanging left towards Pendleton Lake – keeping in mind that a trek directly down to the falls will be steep and treacherous. If you don't have your hiking boots at the ready, you can also view the falls across the Canyon at a roadside overlook.

name: Family Roots Farm
description: Family Roots Farm is nestled in the hills of Brooke County, WV overlooking Brooke Hills Park. Homesteaded by Henry Hervey in 1770's, the family farm has been passed through the Hervey family for six generations.

name: Fat Patty’s
description: Located across from Marshall University football stadium, Fat Patty’s boasts a wide selection of specialty burgers. The fries are amazing, and the service has always been friendly and fast.

name: Fat Tire Cycle & Adventure Supply
description: Fat Tire Cycle and Adventure Supply is committed to getting more people outside. We strive to carry the gear you need for any outdoor adventure. If you don't see something in the store, ask and we'll get it for you. ​ Our cycling heritage is unmatched in the region. Backed by 20 years of experience and knowledge. We cater to the everyday rider out for a cruise with the family as well as top level triathletes and mountain bike racers.

name: Fayette County Chamber of Commerce
description: The Fayette County Chamber of Commerce exists for business, regardless of size or type, and serves as a spokesperson for the community. The Chamber also promotes the image, the retention and expansion of existing businesses, economic vitality and well-planned growth. The Mission of the Fayette County Chamber of Commerce is to serve as the voice for the business community, providing leadership and vision that encourages a favorable business environment and economic expansion, while adhering to principles of well planned growth that will further enhance the quality of life in Fayette County.
address: 310 W. Oyler Ave., Oak Hill, WV, 25901

name: Fayette County Farmer’s Market
description: The Fayette County Farmer’s Market is held every Saturday May through October in the parking lot of the Fayetteville Convention and Visitor Bureau. Fresh local vegetables, eggs, meat, plants, honey, baked goods, fruits, and more are available throughout the growing season. Stop in the visitor center for some free coffee and information on all that’s cool in Fayetteville ( Nearby Attractions: Thurmond Depot Glen Jean, WV (304) 465-0508 Read More Lakeside Dining Minden, WV (304) 469-2651 Read More New River Bikes Fayetteville, WV (304) 574-2453 Read More Wisteria's Gifts Fayetteville, WV (304) 574-3678 Read More Mill Creek Falls of Hawk's Nest Ansted, WV Read More

name: Fayette County Park
description: All shelters have water, grills, ice coolers, electricity, picnic tables, and trash cans. Swimming pool hours: 11: AM-6: PM. The Canteen offers variety of snacks & beverages all at an affordable price. There is also a game room and a pool table and a jukebox. Park hours:May-Sept. 8 a.m.-9 p.m. Sun-Sat. 6 p.m.-10 p.m. Christmas Lights: December 6 p.m.-10 p.m.

name: Fayetteville Historic District
description: The Indirect Artillery Firing method, later used around the world, was first used by Confederate Sergeant Milton W. Humphreys on May 19–20, 1863. During the Civil War, both Union and the Confederates came along the old Giles, Fayette and Kanawha Turnpike to attack Fayetteville. A cemetery for the Confederate dead is located at the Fleshman’s Farm.

name: Fenton Art Glass Company and Fenton Gift Shop
description: Though Fenton Art Glass Co. ceased traditional glass making in 2011, they continue to use more than a century of glass making expertise and skill to create beautiful, handcrafted art glass jewelry. A limited tour of bead making is available upon request.

name: FestivALL Charleston
description: FestivALL is a 10-day, multi-arts festival held in Charleston, WV every June, and FestivALL Fall is a 3-day weekend festival held in October. The mission of FestivALL Charleston is to create, produce and present vibrant arts experiences and entertainment opportunities and serve as a catalyst for others in the community to do the same. This year, FestivALL will be a 15-day event in celebration of 15 years in Charleston!

name: FIDO’s Backyard Dog Park
description: This 3 acre off leash area for dogs is located within the East Marion Park Complex and boasts both a wooded and open area. It also includes a separate fenced area for small dogs. Rules for pet owners are posted at the entrance and include bringing only dogs that are licensed and vaccinated with their tags showing. Dogs visiting this park are required to be at least six months old. Hours: 8 AM-10 PM
address: East Marion Park Complex, Fairmont, WV, 26554

name: The Fifth Floor
description: The Fifth Floor is home to hot pepper and hot sausage soup made with local Demus sausage, as well as fabulous martinis, a huge single-malt scotch collection, beautiful vistas of downtown Clarksburg and a manager and bartender second to none. The restaurant is located on the top floor (Fifth Floor) of the former Broida’s building, which was built in 1920s and housed fine women’s fashion, including a furrier, for several generations.

name: Figaretti’s Restaurant
description: The Art Of Italian Food A shared passion for homemade Italian cuisine and fine wine is reflected in our exquisitely prepared meals and our comprehensive wine list boasting over 40 varieties. The seasoned and professional staff ensures a memorable experience with their meticulous attention to detail, expert wine pairing, and extensive knowledge of the menu. Open 11:00 a.m. - 10:00 p.m.
address: 1035 Mount De Chantal Rd., Wheeling, WV, 26003

name: Finn’s Falls
description: In the heart of the New River Gorge region find Finn's Falls. Begin by entering ACE Adventure Resort and following signs to Waterfall Trail. Traverse this trail for around a mile until its splits off to Finn’s Falls Trail, which will quickly take you right up to these majestic falls. With a picnic table and bench nearby, you can take in the view of this outdoor beauty while enjoying the relaxing sound of flowing waters.

name: Firefly Inn
description: A contemporary four room motel in the heart of Wardensville, the Firefly Inn is the ideal base from which to enjoy the abundance of outdoor activities in an around the beautiful Potomac Highlands of West Virginia. Room No. 1 - Trout Run: Full-sized bed, private bath with walk-in shower. Trout Run is small but super cozy, like a little cocoon. Room No. 2 - Cacapon: Queen bed, private bath with walk-in shower. Room No. 3 - Lost River: Two extra-long twin beds, private bath with walk-in shower. Room No. 4 - Marlene's Room: King-sized bed, private bath with a curbless shower. Named for Ms. Marlene See, the beloved proprietress of the Firefly's predecessor, the See's Motel. This room is ADA compatible. Each room includes the following amenities: Free WiFi Touch pad combination door lock* Luxurious gel/memory foam mattress 42" flat screen Smart TV Mini fridge Bottled water USB ports Modern bathroom w/ separate heater Hair dryer Toiletries *Rooms are equipped with a touch-pad door lock. When you reserve a room online, we’ll email your 4-digit access code within 24-hours of booking. The access code (typically the last four digits of your phone number) will be the room “key” throughout your stay.

name: Fireside Grille
description: Known for great traditional American fare.

name: First Black School in Charles Town
description: In 1865, the Freedmen's Bureau, working with the American Missionary Association, established schools in Jefferson County for the newly freed slaves. The first black school in Charles Town was at the residence of Achilles Dixon, located on the corner of Liberty and Samuel Streets. Enis Wilson, a student from Storer College, became the first black teacher at the Liberty Street School.
address: Liberty and Samuel Streets, Charles Town, WV, 25414

name: Central United Methodist Church (First Father’s Day Church)
description: Central United Methodist Church - The descendant church of Williams Memorial Methodist Episcopal Church, where the first observance of Father’s Day was held on July 5, 1908.

name: Fish and Hunt WV
description: Fish and Hunt WV is a local fishing and hunting guide service in the New River Gorge Region of southern West Virginia. Their guides take pride in their work and in sharing the heritage, history and beautiful natural surroundings. If you are planning an upcoming hunting or fishing excursion to West Virginia let them help you make the most of it. Don't hesitate to give Fish and Hunt WV a call!

name: Fish Creek Covered Bridge
description: Historic Fish Creek covered bridge, ca. 1881, is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. It is the only remaining covered bridge in Wetzel County and is one of only two remaining covered bridges having the single kingpost truss design in West Virginia.
address: Rush Run Rd. near Rt. 7/250, Hundred, WV, 26575

name: Fish Hawk Acres
description: Fish Hawk Acres is a unique market, catering company and farm. We provide delicious food, sourced from local and regional vendors. We have a wonderful bakery, deli style market and provide food for one person or large groups. Food may be ordered in advance for pick-up, delivery or catering. We cater for small groups to large events, from a board room to a hay field, providing delicious food and excellent service.

name: Fisher Ridge Winery
description: Founded in 1979 and producing table wines intended for cooking and serving with food. Tours & tastings available by appointment.

name: Five River Campground
description: We offer new full-service sites with city water, 50/30/20 amp electric, sewage, wireless Internet and expanded cable TV. We offer non-service sites for self contained units. These sites include full use of our new dumping and refilling station at no additional charge. We also have primitive camping for those who prefer tent camping. Many are on the banks of Shavers Fork River, so don't forget your fishing poles! Our shower/restroom/laundry facility is open all year and is heated/air-conditioned.

name: Fizzy’s Land of Oz
description: Located at The Greenbrier Resort, Fizzy's Land of Oz is a toy store like no other. It is a delightful place inspiring fantasy and imagination for Greenbrier guests of all ages. Hours: 9:00am - 9:00pm, Friday & Saturday. 9:00am - 6:00pm, Sunday - Thursday. Location: Visit this store located in the Lower Lobby Shop Corridor of The Greenbrier. Hours: 9:00am - 9:00pm, Friday & Saturday. 9:00am - 6:00pm, Sunday - Thursday. ** Open to both overnight and day guests of The Greenbrier**
address: The Greenbrier, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Flatwoods Factory Outlet Stores
description: Flatwoods Factory Outlet Stores is located along I-79 at exit 67. Stores include: Everything Fiesta, Famous Footwear, Bulk Foods, Tools and More!, and Dress Barn.

name: Days Inn and Suites and Flatwoods KOA
description: Days Hotel Amenities including: Indoor Pool, Outdoor Pool, Visions Restaurant, Mad Annie's Tavern, Gift Shop, Sauna, Fitness Center, and Wifi. Adjacent to Outlet Shopping. KOA Amenities include: Full Hook - Up (electricity, Water & Sewer) Pull Through And Back In Sites Available Sites Available For Rv's Up To 85' Free Wi-Fi, Fire Pit And Picnic Tables At Each Site. Mountain Lakes Amphitheater with 1700 stadium seats.

name: Flowers Unlimited
description: The Art of Floral Design" says it all. Flowers Unlimited is an award winning floral design and home accessory store, located on North Queen Street, in historic downtown Martinsburg, WV. Our shop is open from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday and from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m on Saturday. We are closed on Sundays. Check us out on our Facebook Page: Flowers Unlimited Designs

name: Fly And Tie Airport
description: Fly and Tie is a camping site at the Grant County Airport. Private planes fly in, park in a field, and camp. There are rest rooms and showers. Campers can fish, hike, bike, and more. One mile southwest of Petersburg. Nearby attractions include Moorefield Historic District, sailplaning (at airport), Seneca rocks - 8 miles, smoke hole caverns - 5 miles, fish hatchery - 2 miles.

name: Flying Squirrel Ranch & Farm
description: The is a 30 acre wooded ranch and farm with a 500' zip-line, stocked fishing pond and rough-out camping. All open to the public. Free admission. Forest and Hidden Meadow Glamping sites are available with Eco-friendly outdoor hot shower and bathroom, BioLite Grill and one burner propane stove. Towels and linen, soap, provided. We have one loft cabin that sleeps 2 with a bath, ac, heating, hot water. Rustic Hostel in the barn with 3 upper loft, open-air, hot water, no ac or heat. Hours: Monday - Saturday mid-morning to dusk (May - November) or call to request special date and times. Mini-Distillery opened Monday through Saturday 10:00 a.m. to nightfall.

name: Food & Friends
description: Serving American cuisine in downtown Lewisburg. Specializing in steaks and seafood. Featured on The Food Network’s “Best of...” series. Tues-Sat 11-9 Open Tuesday-Saturday Serving Lunch: 11:00 am-3:30 pm Serving Dinner-Tues, Wed & Thur: 4:30pm-8:30 pm Fri & Sat 4:30pm-9:00pm Week day lunch delivery available.

name: Forks of Cheat Winery & Distillery
description: Home to the family-owned vineyard and winery, Forks of Cheat Winery has been in business for over 20 years producing award winning wines in many different styles. Fork of Cheat Winery has since has gone on to become the largest producer of wine in West Virginia. Along with the winery, in 2006 Jerry opened Forks of Cheat Distillery on site and now produces several distilled items. Forks of the Cheat Winery and Distillery wines are crafted from French hybrid and American varietal grapes. We offer 20+ varieties of wine, West Virginia produced products, and gift baskets. Tastings and tours are also available. Open: Mon-Fri: 9AM-5PM; Sat: 10AM-5PM; Sun: 1AM-5PM

name: Fort Boreman Historical Park
description: Located just two miles from downtown Parkersburg, the park features a reconstructed Union Civil War fortification, trenches, interpretive signage, picnic shelters, nature trail and spectacular views of Parkersburg and the Ohio and Little Kanawha Rivers. Open Everyday from 6am - 9pm.
address: Off U.S. 50, Marrtown Road Exit, Parkersburg, WV, 26101

name: Fort Edwards Foundation, Inc.
description: The Fort Edwards Foundation is an historical site dedicated to preservation of, and education about, a settler's fort built here (at the site of the visitor center) during the French & Indian War in 1755. A modern Visitor Center is open and manned for docent tours. Museum shop sells more than 200 titles, books, and also maps, period music recordings, and artwork.
address: Coldstream Road, 4/10 mi. north of US route 50, Capon Bridge, WV, 26711

name: Fort Gay Library
description: The Fort Gay Library is a one-story building next to the Fort Gay Middle School. It features one room for adults plus an additional room for child This facility is included in A Guide to Accessible Recreation in West Virginia Please check the Guide or the site for information on accessibility. Please note - a self-reporting survey was used to compile the information in this Guide; every attempt was made to verify the accuracy of the information but West Virginia Division of Tourism is not responsible for errors or inaccuracies. Mondays, CLOSED; Tuesdays 10-5; Wednesdays, 10-5; Thursdays 10-5; Fridays 9-5
address: 8608 Rear Broadway, Fort Gay, WEST VIRGINIA, 25514

name: Fort Hill Motel
description: Excellent lodging in rural West Virginia. Earthen Civil War fort within walking distance, convenient for business lodging, close to Grant Memorial Hospital, outdoor pool, laundry facility, free ice, room refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers, hair dryers, wireless Internet, basketball court, volleyball, horseshoes, sandbox. Totally smoke-free environment.

name: Fort Mulligan
description: The valley of the South Branch of the Potomac River was a middle ground, situated between the all-important middle Shenandoah Valley and the Upper Potomac region with its vital coal resources and the B&O Railroad infrastructure centered around Cumberland, Maryland. Federal or Confederate troops occupied this hill and its surrounding area beginning at least as early as August 1861, and were on the ground for at least part of every year of the war. Learn more by visiting the website!

name: Fort Spring Boat Launch
description: Canoe/kayak put-in located seven miles from Alderson. Enjoy mild whitewater along the downstream, two to three-hour journey to Alderson.
address: Rt. 63 and CR 43, Fort Spring, WV, 24936

name: Fort Tackett
description: Built near present-day St. Albans in 1786, Fort Tackett stood on land that originally belonged to George Washington, which was deeded to him for his service in the French and Indian War. St. Albans, WV

name: Fostoria Glass Museum
description: The Fostoria Glass Museum has an extraordinary collection of beautiful Fostoria Glass in its two story, handicapped accessible museum. Visitors may watch a video made in the late 1940s that shows how the glass was made in the Moundsville, WV factory. This glassware was only made in the United States from 1887 to 1986.

name: Four Points by Sheraton Charleston
description: Our hotel is in one of the best spots in town. Overlooking the Kanawha River, Four Points by Sheraton Charleston is ideally located in the city’s historic district. Just a short drive from West Virginia International Yeager Airport (CRW), the hotel is convenient to Charleston Civic Center, Clay Center for the Arts and Sciences, the State Capitol Complex, and the shops and restaurants at Charleston Town Center. Our complimentary airport shuttle is also available for trips within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. Get what you’re looking for with the style and service you want, all at a great price. We have what matters most to you like a comfortable bed, a delicious breakfast and fresh coffee. You’ll also find free Internet, free bottled water in your room, great local beer with Best BrewsTM and much more. Whether you’re in town for work or just for fun, you’re in for a great stay with us.

name: Four Seasons Antiques & Auctions
description: If you are an antique enthusiast then you must come in to see what Four Seasons Antique Mall has to offer. Over 10,000 square feet of space offers hours of searching for that special piece you have been looking for.

name: Four Wheeler Heaven–Blizzards Roost
description: This upstairs unit features 3 bedroom, 2 full baths with a full kitchen, dining room, sun room, living room and a washer/dryer. It will sleep 10 easily and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding or just kick back relax and enjoy the amenities. Trail side lodging. Hours: Seasonal

name: Foxfire Grille Bar in the Village at Snowshoe
description: Located in the Village at Snowshoe, specializing in barbecue. Hand selected native fruitwoods are used to smoke the best cuts of meat using secret "dry rubs" and homemade barbecue sauces. The Foxfire Grille is certain to add some spice to your life! Enjoy your favorite southern comfort foods as you experience the legendary Rimfire sunset from the best viewpoint in town. HOURS: Lunch - 11am - 5pm Dinner - 5pm - 10pm (Lunch menu continues after 5pm) Later hours on weekends Happy Hour - 4:30pm - 6:30pm Daily

name: Francis H. Pierpont Home
description: Governor of the Restored Government of Virginia and the “Father of West Virginia,” here he brought his bride, Julia Augusta Robertson Pierpont, in 1854. Pierpont devised plans that restored loyal Virginia to the Union and gave life to West Virginia. The marker is located at the City of Fairmont Public Safety Building parking plaza (right end as you enter), at 500 Quincy Street in downtown Fairmont.

name: Frank and Jane Gabor West Virginia Folklife Center
description: The Frank and Jane Gabor West Virginia Folklife Center on the campus of Fairmont State University is dedicated to the identification, preservation, and perpetuation of our region's rich cultural heritage, through academic studies, educational programs, festivals and performances, and publications. The WV Folklife Center is part of the College of Liberal Arts. Hours: Mon. - Fri. 8:30 - 3:30

name: Free Spirit Adventures
description: Bicycle shuttles, tours, rentals and repairs. Greenbrier River trail, indoor cycle studio, personal training, outdoor cycle school, plus opportunities for certification in Heart Zones Cycling and Heart Zones Personal Training. Cycle instructor certification and Zone X coaching.

name: Swampfox Motorsports- Princeton
description: Located on Maple Acres Road off route 460 in Princeton. We carry a wide selection of Polaris ATV's and UTV's as well as Yamaha street and dirt bikes along with their ATV and UTV lines. We are also pleased to be offering Sweetwater Pontoons. Whether in Parts and Accessories or our Service Department our staff is always eager to help you.

name: French Creek Christmas Trees
description: We are a very family-oriented Christmas Tree Farm where you choose & cut your tree! Please bring your children, grandparents, aunts, uncles and cousins to enjoy the fresh-air experience of choosing that very special tree for your home. We help create family memories. Pets are also welcome! Hours: 7 days per week from 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. beginning the day after Thanksgiving

name: French Quarter Lounge
description: French Quarter Lounge is located at the Tri-state Racetrack & Gaming Center. Your Choice for Charleston Fine Dining The French Quarter is one of the leading restaurants when it comes to Charleston fine dining. It’s the ideal Charleston fine dining venue for a romantic dinner for two or to celebrate a special occasion with a large group. From our friendly wait staff to our expertly-trained chefs-your dining pleasure is our passion. That’s what makes the French Quarter a favorite Nitro West Virginia restaurant among both visitors and locals. Hours: Sunday-Thursday: 5pm-10pm Friday & Saturday: 5pm-11pm Casual attire welcome Call the French Quarter today at 1-888-789-STAY to make a reservation. Hours: Sunday-Thursday: 5pm-10pm Friday & Saturday: 5pm-11pm Casual attire welcome Call the French Quarter today at 1-888-789-STAY to make a reservation.

name: Fresh Seafood Company
description: Capitol Market, an old train station that was converted to a farmers market in downtown Charleston, houses The Fresh Seafood Market. Known for the “big fish sandwich,” The Fresh Seafood Market is a must-visit location for any seafood lover. Hours: Mon - Sat - 10am - 6pm Sun. - 12pm - 5pm

name: Friends of Blackwater
description: Friends of Blackwater is dedicated to the promotion and protection of the Blackwater Canyon area. Organizes tours and volunteer opportunities in Blackwater Canyon including water testing, tree planting, hiking, biking and history tours.

name: Friends of Music
description: Founded in 1999, the Friends of Music is a non-profit organization that promotes musical excellence in the Eastern Panhandle of West Virginia. It pursues this mission first by supporting a professional chamber orchestra and small ensemble concerts also featuring professional musicians. The Friends of Music also provide grants and scholarships that support music education in local elementary and secondary schools. The organization is governed by a board of directors composed of local citizens.
address: Trinity Episcopal Church, Church and German Streets, PO Box 220, Shepherdstown, WV, 25443

name: Friends of Old Main
description: Nicholas County High School 1913 - 1978 and now the Old Main Arts & Heritage Center. The Old Main Arts & Heritage Center is on the National Register of Historic Places and is managed by the Nicholas Old Main Foundation.
address: 405 Old Main Drive, PO Box 782, Summersville, WV, 26651-0782

name: Front Porch Restaurant
description: We hope you'll enjoy the very casual atmosphere of The Front Porch...the food...the view! On a clear day you can have a fantastic view of Seneca Rocks and the surrounding Allegheny Mountains. The Front Porch Restaurant is located in Harper's Old General Store. HOURS: The Front Porch is OPEN (Except in the Winter) Saturday 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. Sunday - Friday 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. Harper's Old country Store is one of the oldest continuously operated businesses in West Virginia. The Old Store was built in 1902 and has been operated under the name of "D. C. Harper and Co., a general country store", serving generations. The business, situated in front of the majestic and scenic Seneca Rocks, continues to be operated by the Harper family. The interior of the store is much the same as in 1902 with many old features and antiques. The original board floor that must be oiled frequently, the antique, metal, blocked ceiling, the original shelving and counters, and numerous antiques and memorabilia give the visitor the feeling of stepping back in time. The architecture of the building along with the big front porch represents the vintage of middle and late 1800s. The Store is an antique and be truly an educational experience.

name: The Front Porch
description: We invite you to stop in, browse, and enjoy shopping in our beautiful store! We can help you select that special item and we offer free gift wrap. Just a few steps up from the center of town next to the Livery Tavern, southern hospitality starts at our Front Porch!

name: Frostmore Farm
description: Pure West Virginia Maple Syrup, Maple Products, and Honey. Our maple products include: maple cream, maple hard candy, maple soda pop, and maple nuts.

name: Frugal Frog
description: The Largest Selection Of Primitive Furniture In The Ripley Area. We are open 7 days a week. Monday - Saturday 9-6 and Sunday 12-5. We offer primitive decor, primitive furniture, Amish log furniture, Amish lawn furniture, primitive curtains, valances, shower curtains, table cloths, area rugs and much much more.

name: Fruits of Labor Cafe and Bakery
description: Offering traditional American cuisine and featuring seasonal cafe menus that showcase ingredients from on property garden. House made desserts, bread and pastries. Full Service Café and Bakery Winter Hours: Tuesday - Friday Lunch: 11am - 3pm Daily NEW Dinner: 4:30pm - 7pm Daily

name: Fujiyama Sushi & Grill
description: Serving Hibachi dinners, a variety of fresh sushi and sashimi and famous desserts including banana and cheesecake tempura. All food is prepared daily. Hours: Mon-Thurs 11-2:30 and 4:30-9, Fri 11-2:30 and 4:30-10, Sat 12-10 and Sun 12-9
address: 518 North Jefferson Street, Suite 12, Lewisburg, WV, 24901

name: Fusion
description: A Fine Dining Experience Within Lakeview Golf Resort And Spa. Offering The Best In Steaks, Seafood, Pasta And Other Tantalizing Dishes. Hours: Monday to Friday 6:30 a.m. – 10:00 a.m. Saturday and Sunday 6:30 a.m. – 11:00 a.m.

name: Future Generations University Yurt Rental
description: Stay in a rustic yurt nestled in the Allegheny Mountains and overlooking stunning Germany Valley. Located near any local outdoor recreational attractions: Spruce Knob, Nelson Rocks, Seneca Rocks, and Seneca Caverns to name a few. Located 15 minutes from the township of Franklin with a rich history and culture, known especially for its many Victorian style houses. This structure is a semi-permanent residential yurt. It is designed to be highly energy-efficient and is insulated with SIP panels to keep it toasty in colder months. Space heaters, cookware, and utensils are provided. The building (sleeps 4) consists of 1 bedroom with a queen-size bed, bathroom with a standing shower, kitchen area, and sitting area with a double size foldout futon. You will need to provide your own linens. The yurt is located on the grounds of Future Generations University global campus. During the week (M-F), the university office will be open and the hosts are happy to help with directions, recommendations, and any other needs. Hosts will be available on weekends only by email.
address: 400 Road Less Traveled Road, Franklin, WV, 26807

name: G. W. Henderson Plantation (Henderson Hall)
description: One of the few plantations left in the state is Henderson Hall in Williamstown. Built in 1836 overlooking the Ohio River, this three-story, 29-room Italianate mansion was the focal point of social and political life for almost two centuries. Period pieces are still intact and include a rosewood piano, the original wood floors, a collection of rare clocks, and a 12-foot gilt mirror, with 17th Century furnishings and portraits still in place. Hours: OPEN MARCH - DECEMBER CLOSED MONDAYS 12:00PM—5:00 PM

name: Gallery 11
description: Because it's located one block west of Leon Sullivan Way in the Capital city, Gallery 11 is a convenient place to shop for fine art with an array of media and styles represented. Established artists will accommodate you in making your fine art selection a pleasure. Gallery hours are 11:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday through Saturday. Gallery 11 is the place to enjoy the creative process. As you browse in a relaxed atmosphere, you will find original paintings, pottery, fabric art, jewelry, and stained glass along with other creative items.

name: Gandy Dancer Dinner Theatre
description: Enjoy West Virginia's ONLY Branson-style dinner shows. The Gandy Dancer Theatre features two full length dinner shows back to back. Our Premier Dinner Show has music from the 40's - present day of country, rock n' roll, gospel, Motown, patriotic and so much more. Dinner consists of lemon peppered chicken and pot roast, carrots and potatoes served with macaroni salad, dinner roll, cake and beverage. Our Tribute to Musical Legends Dinner Show features all the artists you love with comedy and amazing artists. Dinner consists of chicken cordon bleu, hamburger steak with gravy, baked potato, green beans, coleslaw, dinner roll, cake and beverage. Specialty shows throughout the year include Murder Mystery Dinner Shows, Aloha with Elvis Dinner Shows, A Mountain Memories Christmas Dinners, Christmas with Elvis and a Rockin' New Year's Eve Oldies Dinner Dance Show.

name: Gateway Restaurant
description: Family Restaurant serving homecooked meals. Stop in for our daily specials, home cooked meals, homemade desserts, and our welcoming environment. Call ahead for take out orders or what our special of the day is. The Gateway Restaurant is conveniently located at the bottom of the highest point in West Virginia--Spruce Knob.

name: Gaudineer Scenic Area (USDA Forest Service)
description: This scenic area will be managed to feature an undisturbed condition for study and enjoyment by the public. Maintaining the natural appearance of the area is essential. Approximately 50 acres of the Gaudineer Scenic Area is typical of, and considered part of, the virgin red spruce type that originally occupied large portions of the highland areas of West Virginia. The composition of this impressive timber stand consists of virgin and second growth red spruce, yellow birch, beech, red maple, sugar maple and other hardwood species. Individual trees range up to 40 inches in diameter at breast height and 300 years of age. The remaining 90 acres has had some cutting, mainly salvage of blow-down, with most of the original growth still standing. The total wood volume of the 140 acre tract is estimated at one and a half million board feet. The 140 acre Gaudineer Scenic Area is located near Gaudineer Knob of Shavers Mountain in Randolph and Pocahontas Counties. The area is located about 5.5 miles from Durbin, West Virginia. To reach the area travel west from Durbin on US 250 for 4 miles to Forest Service Road 27, then north on Forest Service Road 27 for 1.5 miles to the area. The Scenic Area is in the headwaters of Glade Run and Old Road Run, tributaries of Shavers Fork of Cheat River and West Fork of Greenbrier River, respectively.

name: Gauley River National Recreation Area
description: Gauley River National Recreation Area was created in 1988 to protect the gorges and swift, winding waters of 25 miles of the Gauley River and five miles of the Meadow River. The area offers picnicking, primitive camping at the tail waters area, hunting, fishing, and whitewater boating. The Gauley River is considered to be among the best whitewater rivers in the world by expert kayakers, canoeists, and rafters. The majority of the land within the National Recreation Area is private property. Please respect the rights of all property owners.

name: Gauley River Pottery
description: Visit our working pottery studio and gallery for demonstrations and shopping. We specialize in beautiful one-of-kind river inspired glazes and shapes for use in your home. Select from a variety of mugs, bowls, baking dishes, crocks and much, much more. Plus watch the potters at work.
address: 526 W. Mount Lookout Rd., Mount Lookout, WV, 26678

name: General Adam Stephen House
description: Stone home of the founder of the town of Martinsburg, Revolutionary War General Adam Stephen. Constructed in the late 1770s to early 1780s period and furnished in the 1750 to 1820 period, the house is open as a museum to visitors.

name: Generations Restaurant & Pub
description: Spanning four generations, Generations, formerly known as the Swing Club, has been owned and operated by the Duplaga family. All four generations have and continue to provide quality service to the people of the Ohio Valley. We are very proud to serve Ohio County and surrounding areas from our restaurant and pub in Wheeling, West Virginia. Generations is the place where you can relax, listen to music, dine inside or outside on our 1,000-square-foot deck, and always have a good time.

name: Geological & Economic Survey
description: The Geological and Economic Survey is West Virginia's information center for geologic and geographic attractions, topographic and geologic maps, highway geology (road-cut) guidebooks, field-trip guidebooks, State park geology, geologic reports and more. Journey to the past at the Survey's Museum. Fossils, minerals, and dinosaurs are items to view. One dinosaur is a 40 foot long Hadrosaur.

name: George Washington Heritage Trail
description: Established to follow the footsteps of George Washington, this trail is everything a history aficionado could ever want. The trail passes through three counties of West Virginia’s Eastern Panhandle. It includes places such as Harpers Ferry National Historic Park; the country’s first spa, Berkeley Springs; the famous Paw Paw Tunnel; and the house of Belle Boyd, a notorious female Confederate spy. Visitors on the trail can see the area that George Washington fell in love with more than two centuries ago. Towns like Charles Town and Shepherdstown have preserved their historic character so that visitors can enjoy the area’s vibrant past along the trail.
address: 229 E. Martin St., 2nd floor, Martinsburg, WV, 25401

name: Gerald R. Freeman Campground
description: This large campground offers 158 campsites. 113 sites have electric hookups and 37 sites have full hookups. Boat ramps and a marina with a snack bar are located on-site. Younger visitors love the campground's playgrounds and basketball courts. Other facilities include hot showers, flush toilets, water fountains, and two trailer water/dump stations.

name: Geraniums
description: A ladies clothing boutique offering everything from casual to cocktail including jewelry, handbags, lingerie and more. Also is a Brighton Heart store and a Pandora Jewelry Silver store.

name: Ghost Tours Of Beckley
description: Candlelight walking tour is held on Saturdays Only. Walk-by tours of Downtown Historical Beckley, Include several mansions, The Raleigh County Court House, A 1931 theatre plus several coal baron houses on Kanawha St. Tours held June - September at 8pm. Bring Your Camera! Interior tour of the Historical Soldiers and Sailor Memorial Theatre.

name: Ghost Tours Of Lewisburg
description: The original Ghost Tours of Lewisburg. Steps of the Community College on Church Street (Next to Carnigie Hall). 7pm Saturday evenings in October. Call for more info.

name: Gillum House Bed & Breakfast
description: Located in Downtown Shinnston, 50 feet from rail-trail, near museum, restaurants and shopping. Enjoy a restful night - Gillum with king bed (private ensuite bath), Harris with queen bed (shared bath with Rosi's) or Rosi's with queen bed (shared bath with Harris). Free WiFi and flat screen TVs with Cable in all rooms. Savor the complimentary low-fat full breakfast (Cook's Choice) served at your time.

name: Glade Creek Falls
description: Found along Glade Creek Trail within the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, Glade Creek Falls creates a spectacular view with its picturesque cascades rushing over sandstone ledges. There's no wrong way to tackle this gorgeous hike with its plunging mountain waters that make it a favorite destination in Almost Heaven, found just 1 mile upstream of Glade Creek Campground.

name: Glade Creek Grist Mill Falls
description: Beneath the historic grist mill at Babcock State Park, water rushes to form the Glade Creek Grist Mill Falls. With a short stone pathway leading you to the beautiful cascades, these falls are a photographer's dream – and one of the most photographed spots in West Virginia. Mark your calendar for a visit in fall, when this scenic spot transforms into a leaf-peeper’s paradise.

name: Glade Farms Campground
description: Open May 1 - Nov. 1. Twenty-five tent campsites, 65 trailer sites with full hookups. Laundry, ADA compliant and fishing. Located from I-68, exit 23, go north on Rte. 26 approximately 5.5 miles.
address: 21058 N Preston HWY, Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: Glass by Marilyn
description: Marilyn's introduction to the glass industry in 1989 marked the beginning of what has become a passion. With a background in the fine arts as a water-colorist, the focus of Marilyn's work continues to be the play of color and light. The medium continues to be a liquid, a fiery liquid called glass. Her work, both painting and glass, have received awards in many juried exhibitions and are found in private and corporate collections. By appointment only; please call.

name: Glen Dale to Moundsville Rail Trail
description: The Glen Dale to Moundsville Rail-Trail runs for 3.4 paved miles between Glen Dale City Park and Moundsville Riverfront Park. The flat trail parallels the Ohio River among the forest behind shopping plazas and neighborhoods.
address: Glen Dale Fokker Field airport (Glen Dale) to 13th St. (Moundsville Riverfront Park), Moundsville, WV, 26041

name: Glenville Golf Club
description: Glenville Golf Club is a 9-hole semi-private golf course located in the hills of central West Virginia. This course is a par 35 course boasting 2,840 yards of golf from the longest tees. Established in 1939, the course has a member base with an “Open to the Public” policy. This course is utilized by local citizens and schools as a recreational area and tournament location. Water comes into play on all holes except for 4 & 8. The course is also classified as a narrow course. The club also features: 3 sets of tees (2,300 – 2,800 yards) Putting green Practice area Cart rentals Club rentals Indoor Golf Simulator

name: Glenville Inn
description: We are a hotel conveniently located near business, government and leisure activities in Glenville, West Virginia. Our tranquil hotel offers travelers affordable lodging in a country-style atmosphere as well as great amenities including a free continental breakfast, and free high-speed wireless Internet access.

name: Glenwood Recreational Park and 4-H Camp
description: This stunning 55-acre lake is the centerpiece of the park. Enjoy picnic shelters, fishing, miniature golf-course, hiking, playgrounds, paddle boats and disc golf. The park specializes in family reunions, class reunions, weddings, receptions, outdoor training exercises and more. You could find no better place to bring your Boy or Girl Scout group; church group or class for outdoor studies, recreation and fun!

name: The Lighthouse Pub and Grill
description: We are pub and grill nestled in Point Pleasant, WV offering the tastiest food and best beer selection around. We are also the only pub and grill in the area featuring live music four nights a week! Stop by or call ahead to enjoy our awesome menu and relaxed vibe. We value our customers' experience, and we want to offer you the best food and live entertainment around. Stop on on by. We'd be happy to serve you! Bar & Grill · Sports Bar · Coffee Shop
address: 64 White Ridge Rd, Point Pleasant, WV, 25550

name: Gobblers’ Knob Guest House
description: Gobblers' Knob Guest House, perched on a peaceful mountain top at the northern end of the Shenandoah Valley near Berkeley Springs and Cacapon Resort State Park, takes its name from the wild turkeys that roam on the property. This intimate and romantic vacation retreat is conveniently located 100 miles from Washington D.C. and Baltimore, MD; 210 miles from Philadelphia; and 150 miles from Pittsburgh, PA. The secluded cottage has been authentically and lovingly restored and meticulously preserved to its 1820's roots. It is tastefully decorated with 1820-1840 period antiques and furnishings that reflect the historic charm of the period. Modern amenities have been added for comfort and convenience. Boasting a large front porch, the home begs for company to share its breathtaking view of the beautiful surrounding countryside. Gobblers' Knob has been featured in regional magazines, local newspapers, and on national television as a high-end beauty spot. The two-story, hand-hewn log home with its luxury addition provides delightful accommodations. The first floor includes a separate dining room with an immense wood-burning stone fireplace, a living room with a full-sized sleeper sofa, and a fully modern kitchen equipped with a microwave oven and other time-saving amenities. Also on the first floor and across the hall from the full bathroom is the R and R (Romance and Relaxation) room, featuring a two-person whirlpool bath. For your convenience, there is a washer and dryer in the first-floor mudroom. The second floor has a master bedroom with a king-sized bed and a second bedroom with a set of twin beds. There is also a charming sitting room between the bedrooms. Your favorite pastime may be relaxing in the hammock or enjoying the sun-bathed hills on the swing on the front porch; watching deer, raccoons, foxes, rabbits, turkeys, and other wildlife; or enjoying a meal at the picnic table in the woods. The surrounding area provides a wealth of things to do and see. Cacapon Resort State Park is five minutes away for hiking, sight-seeing, horseback riding, boating, swimming, fishing, tennis, nature walks, and golf at the Robert Trent Jones Championship Golf Course. Berkeley Springs with its charming shops, antique malls, spas, arts center, vintage theater, and numerous restaurants is just ten minutes away. DETAILS: One unit. Sleeps six. Open year round. Check-in time is 3 PM; Check-out time is 11 AM. Reservations must be guaranteed by a 50% advance deposit, and can be held with a credit card until payment arrives in the form of a personal check or money order. Balance is due two weeks before arrival date. Twenty percent discount for active military. Our rates depend on the number of guests as well as the number of nights.

name: Gold and Blue Cabin Rentals
description: Choose from 8 different cabins in a secure gated ATV friendly campground. Each cabin has AC, free WiFi, refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot and all linens and towels. There is an ATV wash station, large parking lot perfect for large trailers and each unit has it's own fire pit and charcoal grill. Located near the Pocahontas trail head of the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System.

name: Golf Club of West Virginia
description: One of the most scenic 18-hole courses in West Virginia. The watered tees, fairways and greens make it enjoyable for golfers of all skill levels. Dining room, snack bar, carts with tops.

name: Golf Shop
description: Sporting goods store specializing in golf and golf supplies. We buy, sell, and repair golf equipment.
address: 5045 W. Pea Ridge Rd., Huntington, WV, 25705

name: Good Time Farm Log Cabin Escape Rental
description: This civil war era log cabin with screened-in porch, nestled on 75 acres with a two acre pond and its own woods, surrounded by State and National forest is located in one of America's most beautiful counties- Pocahontas. Fishing, biking, birding, golfing.

name: Good Zoo at Oglebay
description: With over 50 species, 20 that are rare or endangered. Our mission is to educate our visitors regarding natural and physical sciences and to promote conservation. Other exhibits include the Outback Exhibit and Lorikeet Landing. Additional features include the cheetah, meerkats, spectacled bears, lemurs, red pandas, river otters and the Wonders of the Wetlands area where visitors can observe a bald eagle and various other plants and animals that call these fragile areas home.

name: Just The Thing Gift Shop
description: If you are looking for 'just the thing' for a special birthday, wedding, graduation or teacher appreciation gift then you must come into Just The Thing Gift Shop. They have Gourmet Foods, gifts and collectables including Jim Shore and Willow Tree. Gift wrapping is available for no extra cost.

name: GOTCHA! Archery Games
description: GOTCHA! Archery Games is a family owned and operated sole proprietorship from southern Upshur County. Offering the rapidly growing game of Archery Tag along with S.A.F.E. Archery’s Hoverball Archery, we hit the road to share the sport of archery in an all new way. No matter what type of event you are hosting, we can provide a safe, fun-filled environment with a little bit of competition and a whole lot of bragging rights at the end of the day.

name: Gourmet Cafe
description: Serving sandwiches, pastas, salads, and Italian and American dishes. Catering available. Hours: 11am - 9pm
address: 795 W. Main St., Ste. G, Bridgeport, WV, 26330

name: Governor’s Inn Bed & Breakfast
description: Step back in time at this exquisitely detailed Victorian mansion. This graceful home features four tastefully decorated guest rooms, each with air conditioning, TV, and private bath. Four guest rooms each have their own personality but all offer space for relaxing and comfortable bedding. Two suites offer special amenities for the businessman or the couple celebrating a special event.

name: Governor’s Mansion
description: Completed in 1925, this home has welcomed national and global dignitaries, ambassadors, public officials and corporate leaders. Notable features are the reception foyer's glistening checkerboard floor made with black Belgium and white Tennessee marble, the drawing room wall panels decoratively painted using a trompe l'oeil (literal translation is "trick of the eye") technique to create the illusion of raised panels. Free tours are available but by reservation only.

name: Graceland Inn – Restaurant – Conference Center
description: Poised on the hillside of the beautiful campus of Davis & Elkins College, Elkins, WV, Graceland Inn and the adjacent Byrd Center command a twenty-mile view of the scenic mountains and some of the best outdoor activities in the east. Graceland Inn is a beautifully restored Victorian mansion and is currently a premier lodging, retreat and meeting facility. The conference center provides guestrooms and three conferencing areas. The rich heritage of the Appalachian area is within easy access. Come play in the mountains and stay in history.

name: Grafton National Cemetery
description: This cemetery was established in 1867 by congressional legislation to offer a final resting place for the men who died during the Civil War. The remains of Union soldiers were removed from temporary graves in West Virginia as well as several Union dead from Kentucky. Of the 1,215 graves, 664 are unknown and some are Confederate soldiers. Notably the grave of Private T. Bailey Brown, the first Union soldier to be killed by a Confederate, is located here. HOURS: Open daily from dawn until dusk

name: Grand Pointe Conference & Reception Center
description: When it comes to your special occasion, whether a wedding reception, business meeting or planning a class reunion, you need an event center that will cater to your every need. Turn to the Mid Ohio Valley's largest event center, "The Grand Pointe Conference and Reception Center."
address: 1500 Grand Central Avenue Suite 118, Vienna, WV, 26105

name: Grandma’s House
description: If you’re looking for high quality and personal service, you’ve come to the right place. At Grandma's House we’ll give you the attention and personal service you’ll come to expect and enjoy. We offer the best in antiques, primitives, furniture, collectibles and unique gifts. Grandma's House has been located in Hinton since 2003. Let us put our experience to work for you.

name: Grandview Country Club
description: Grandview Country Club is an 18-hole golf course with rolling fairways and excellent greens. A well-groomed public course, Grandview Country Club is 6,758 yards in length and has an average green size of 6,000 sq.ft. The beautiful mountaintop setting of the course combines golfing and a panoramic view of southern West Virginia.

name: Grandview (New River Gorge National Park & Preserve)
description: Grandview provides some of the most dramatic scenery found in the park and is a popular place for hiking, picnicking, and sight seeing. Grandview is a peaceful place to relax and unwind while enjoying outstanding views of the New River. From 1400 feet above the river at Main Overlook, visitors are rewarded with one of the most outstanding views in the park. On a clear day you can see directly into the heart of New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, including seven miles of the New River and its watershed. From Main Overlook visitors can also get a glimpse of some of the gorge's unique cultural history. From here you see an active railway and the town of Quinnimont, where the first coal was shipped out of the gorge in 1873. Don't miss the views from Turkey Spur Overlook, and be sure to walk the woodland trails. Grandview is a great place to see the spectacular displays of Catawba rhododendrons that bloom here every spring. The purple Catawba rhododendrons bloom in mid May, while the white great rhododendrons bloom in July. The exact bloom times are not always consistent year to year, so check with a ranger at one of our visitor centers or check our facebook page for updates. The Grandview section of the park includes overlooks of the New River, a visitor center (open seasonally), five hiking trails, ranger-led walks and talks, summer outdoor dramas, and picnic areas with playgrounds. Information about renting picnic shelters at Grandview can be found on the Permits and Reservations page of our website. Grandview is home to Theatre West Virginia, which features outdoor drama presentations from June through August. Grandview was originally a part of the West Virginia State Park system. In 1939, the state of West Virginia purchased 52 acres of land at Grandview to develop a day use park. The Civilian Conservation Corps built roads, shelters, and a picnic area, all still in use today. Construction began in 1960 on the 1200-seat Cliffside Amphitheater. The children’s playgrounds, recreation area, and additional walkways were built from 1961 to 1964. After more than 50 years as one of West Virginia’s most popular state parks, Grandview was transferred to the National Park Service in 1990.
address: P.O. Box 246, 104 Main Street, Glen Jean, WV, 25846

name: Grant County Chamber of Commerce
description: The Grant County Chamber of Commerce is made up of businesses, government agencies, and individuals who come together for a common cause. The Board of Directors is elected by the membership and meets monthly. The Chamber holds quarterly after hours social events at member locations and an annual membership meeting. The Grant County Chamber of Commerce came into existence in 1991 and has been a vital part of the community since that time.

name: Grant County Visitor’s Information Center
description: The Visitor's Information Center is conveniently located inside the South Side Depot so it's open everyday. There are hundreds of brochures available as well as the WV State Travel Guide and the WV State Map. Stop in and see us- we'll help you get where you want to go!
address: 126 South Main St., Petersburg, West Virginia, 26847

name: Grave Creek Mound Archaeological Complex
description: The greatest monument of America's ancient people. One of the largest and most famous of the burial mounds built by the Adena people. Also on site is the Delf Norona Museum and the West Virginia's Archaeological Research Center.

name: Graves Of The Pierponts
description: Francis H. Pierpont, Governor of the Restored Government of Virginia and the “Father of West Virginia” died on March 24, 1899. He is buried here with his wife, Julia Augusta Robertson Pierpont. The marker is located at the entry to Woodlawn Cemetery Historic District, 336 Maple Avenue in Fairmont.

name: Gravity Zip Line Tour
description: Bigger, taller, faster. These are the zip lines your momma warned you about. Soar hundreds of feet above the foliage at unimaginable speeds, zig-zagging over a 1.5 mile long tour across the scenic ridge line of a mountain bowl. Two 500 foot warm-up zips lead to lines of 1800, 1600 and 1300 feet at heights up to 200 feet and speeds up to 50 miles per hour. And then you get to Adrena-Line. This monster is a whopping 3150 feet long and riders routinely hit speeds of 60-65 miles an hour.

name: Great Eastern Trail
description: The Great Eastern Trail ("GET") is an 1800-mile footpath through the Appalachians, linking Alabama to New York. Entering West Virginia at Matewan, the trail hits many of the state's most beautiful parks and picturesque towns before entering Virginia near Narrows. Whether you're interested in an hour-long stroll or a week long adventure, the GET has something for you. For completed sections and to get involved, please contact TuGuNu Hiking Club.

name: Great Outdoors Marine & Sports Shop
description: The Great Outdoors Marine's modern facility is conveniently located with a large comfortable showroom and over 50 boats inside. We have a huge selection of boats and marine accessories, an award-winning service department and product knowledge developed over 22 years in the marine business. We also have a 283-slip marina at Beech Fork Lake, with boat rentals (pontoon, fishing, bass and pedal boats, and canoes), marine supplies, bait shop, tackle, and food. Call 304-522-9374 for reservations.

name: Greater Bluefield Chamber Of Commerce
description: The mission of the Greater Bluefield Chamber of Commerce is "To provide vision and leadership for the Greater Bluefield community with a commitment to strengthen economic development, stimulate the growth of area businesses and enhance the quality of life for all its citizens." Open Monday-Friday: 9am-5pm.

name: Greater Bridgeport Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Bridgeport has a little bit of something for everyone. From incredible restaurants with their own local flavor to beautiful spots located just off the beaten path. Bridgeport is an amazing place to visit with different adventures awaiting at each corner. While here, discover the town’s rich history, delicious cuisine and one-of-a-kind adventures you’ll never forget.

name: Visit Mountaineer Country Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Whether you’re one to venture the great outdoors or stroll through antique stores, there’s something for everyone in Mountaineer Country. Enjoy surrounding yourself in spring flowers on hiking trails or shop in local stores scattered throughout this region. Watch a seasonal theater performance in Morgantown or purchase some local produce and goods at several farmers markets throughout the season.

name: Greater Moundsville Convention & Visitors Bureau
description: Indulge in aerial adventures at Grand Vue Park, test your paranormal senses with a tour at the old West Virginia Penitentiary, or take in the gold leaf architecture and colorful stained-glass windows at the Palace of Gold – all in Greater Moundsville! Visit us or plan your getaway at visitmoundsville.com.

name: Green Bank Cabins
description: 3 fully furnished rustic cabins, 1 fully furnished cottage. Our rustic cabins built in 1810 with the old hand hewn logs have been fully restored with modern amenities to give you a very unique taste of West Virginia's yesteryear.

name: Green Hill Cemetery
description: Covering all sides of a cone-shaped hill, the 1854 cemetery is laid out in circles taken from a French design. Among the graves are 30 unknown Confederate soldiers, as well as Capt. E.G. Alburits, who commanded the Berkeley Company at Harpers Ferry during the John Brown raid. Martinsburg, W.Va.

name: Greenbrier Bowling & Recreation Center
description: Make our bowling alley in Lewisburg, West Virginia, your only destination for fun-filled open and cosmic bowling. Whether you're in a league, want instruction to improve your score, or want to host a party, we have you covered. Don't forget to visit our snack bar to see all the tasty treats available to keep you nourished while you play the game. We also offer, billiards, video games, and a pro-shop.

name: Greenbrier County Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Welcome to the Greenbrier Valley! Long before English settlers claimed the region, it was largely uninhabited by anything but flora and fauna. With nearly three hundred years of progress, today’s visitors will find that many of the landmarks, first families and charm of small-town life are very much intact. The 11,000-acre Greenbrier Resort attracts guests from around the globe. Relics of the county’s past, the Old Stone Church, Carnegie Hall, Alderson’s Store and other gathering places, have maintained their prominence in this vibrant valley. And the rivers and mountains that captivated the first settlers? Their inspiring beauty remains preserved and protected for our visitors to enjoy and explore. This spring, uncover the many treasures that make the Greenbrier Valley something truly special. A place to relax and unwind, to share with friends and loved ones.

name: Greenbrier Grille and Lodging
description: Simply put, our business is food and lodging. We offer casual dining home cooked meals and a warm, friendly atmosphere. We have daily specials and homemade desserts. We have five large guest rooms above our restaurant, each with a private bathroom, for a reasonable nightly fee. Our new building was completed in November 1996. Our dining room seats 100 people comfortably, with a private room for dinner meetings and special parties. We also have a deck that overlooks the scenic Greenbrier River.

name: Greenbrier Military School Museum
description: Now the WV School of Osteopathic Medicine, this school (1875-1972) and the former Greenbrier College on Church Street had their origins in the co-ed Lewisburg Academy. Featuring museum displays and memorabilia. The museum is located beside the WVSOM Alumni Center.

name: Greenbrier Outfitters
description: Join Greenbrier Outfitters for the adventure of a lifetime. Whether you are a guest at The Greenbrier, staying at another local hotel, visiting friends, or just live in Greenbrier County sign up for an activity today and experience the wild side of West Virginia. Whether you want to learn about the ancient sport of falconry, scale our 55-foot tower, or learn to paddle a kayak down a local river, Greenbrier Outfitters is the place for you!
address: 905 Main Street E, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Greenbrier River Cabins
description: Our cabins are nestled just between the lazy flowing of the river and the excitement of the Greenbrier River Trail. Newly remodeled and completely furnished with all the amenities that will make your time on the river worry-free, their rustic wooden charm offers the perfect place for a romantic getaway or a family vacation. Relax on the spacious decks that overlook the river. Greenbrier River Cabins are also convenient to bicycle, canoe and inner tube rentals.
address: H.C. 64, Box 544, River Rd., Seebert, WV, 24946

name: Greenbrier River Campground
description: We provide campground, cabins and vintage RV rentals. We're on the river with RV and tent sites, full services including 30 and 50 amp hookups, pump out, laundry and rest rooms with showers; kayak, canoe and tube rentals with shuttle service; water, cable TV, WiFi, picnic table, fire ring; primitive sites are right on the banks of the river include fire rings and picnic tables, 10′ x 10′ sand tent pad; a limited number of sites in the tent-camping area with 20 amp electrical service that can accommodate small pop-up trailers, camp store. We also have a bathhouse, laundry and swimming area. Pet Friendly.

name: Greenbrier River Retreat
description: Offering cottages on the Greenbrier River, most cottages are four-bedroom 2 bath and 1 cottage is 2 bedroom 1.5 bath. Each cottage comes with fully equipped kitchen, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, stove, refrigerator, dishes, charcoal grill, fresh linens, towels, cable TV, VCR or DVD player, and air conditioning. Some cottages have fireplaces and Jacuzzi tubs. Please call for availability and prices.

name: Greenbrier River Trail
description: The Greenbrier River Trail is a 78-mile former railroad now used for hiking, biking and horseback riding. It is the longest trail of its kind in West Virginia. The trail provides many breathtaking views as it passes through several small towns, crosses 35 bridges, goes through two tunnels and cuts through some of West Virginia’s most remote areas. The Greenbrier River Trail is one of 50 Millennium Legacy Trails in the United States, and was rated one of the top 10 hiking trails in the country by Backpacker Magazine. Part of the Greenbrier River Trail lies within a National Radio Quiet Zone so cell phones do not work. The trail begins at Caldwell, WV near Greenbrier State Forest and passes through numerous small towns and traverses 35 bridges and 2 tunnels as it winds its way along the valley with its northern terminus at Cass Scenic Railroad State Park in Pocahontas County. Throughout much of its length, the trail is adjacent to the Greenbrier River and is flanked by peaks of the Allegheny Mountains. The surface is generally hard packed, but varies from rough to fine gravel. Several state parks and forests along the Greenbrier River Trail provide overnight accommodations. These locations include Greenbrier State Forest, Watoga State Park, Seneca State Forest and Cass Scenic Railroad.

name: Greenbrier State Forest
description: Located in the southeastern corner of the state near the border of Virginia, Greenbrier State Forest provides over 5,100 acres of heavily forested, mountainous terrain for outdoor recreation. Magnificent views of the surrounding countryside are afforded by the impressive and imposing 3,280' high Kate's Mountain. The park offers a 16-unit campground suitable for tents and trailers. The sites feature electric hookups, picnic table, on-site and central bathhouse, and a stone fireplace for grilling-out with the family. The campground is open spring through fall, weather permitting. Campsites may be reserved online at any time, by phone or at the campground office. Greenbrier State Forest has 14 cabins where you can kick back and enjoy your mountain retreat to the beautiful southeastern corner of West Virginia. These cabins have plenty of room for the whole family and the forest provides acres upon acres of rugged woodland for adventure. Designated pet-friendly cabins are available. Cabins are available April-October. Check in begins at 4 p.m., and check out is by 10 a.m. for all cabins.

name: Greenbrier Suites
description: Experience the charm of staying in an old time railroad town directly across from the historic Durbin Depot. Comfortable suites available with kitchenette, private bath, dining room and parlor. Bedrooms are furnished with queen-sized or full-sized antique beds and ceiling fans. It is a non-smoking facility. Complimentary breakfast available down the street at Station 2 Restaurant.

name: Greenbrier Valley Airport (LWB)
description: Commercial Airlines: United Express - Washington, DC (IAD), Chicago (ORD) American Airlines - non-stop daily service to Charlotte (CLT) Car Rentals: Enterprise - Phone: 304-520-3115 ext. 4 Hours of Operation - Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm, Saturday 9:00am - 12:00pm, Sunday Closed Nearby Attractions: The Greenbrier, Carnegie Hall, Greenbrier River Trail, Smooth Ambler Spirits, The Salt Cave and Spa, Lost World Caverns

name: Greenbrier Valley Theatre
description: West Virginia’s Official Professional Theatre. Presenting theatrical productions, musical concerts, literary events, youth education programs, art exhibits and more throughout the year. Visit them online for their full performance schedule. With something going on over 165 nights a year, there's no reason to miss out on arts experiences. Call our box office or visit our website for information on upcoming evens!

name: Main Dining Room
description: Located at The Greenbrier Resort, experience the epitome of Grand Southern Resort dining in our elegant Main Dining Room - celebrating over 100 years of service! Dazzling custom-made chandeliers, stately columns and magnificent arched windows bring the ambiance of a dignified Southern mansion to life.
