In 2018, the Main Dining Room at The Greenbrier Resort won a prestigious Wine Spectator Magazine award.
address: The Greenbrier, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Greenhaven
description: We offer four bedrooms, two baths, combined living room, dining, kitchen, T.V. room, laundry room, and two double front porches, all fully furnished to make your stay complete. Within a short driving distance are excellent restaurants, golfing, fishing, skiing, rafting and water sports. If relaxing is more your style, be sure to check out nearby luxurious spas and spend your afternoon unwinding and relaxing in pure bliss.
address: 1443 Mount View Road, Cool Ridge, WV, 25825

name: Greenhills Country Club And Lodge
description: Greenhills Country Club, built in 1959, offers one of the areas more challenging layouts. We have the best greens in the area and the course is always in fine condition. We are a full service golf club with the abilities to properly handle all your golf desires. The Lodge has six rooms only steps away from the golf course and restaurant. We offer group dinners and golf outings with advance reservations. We are 1 1/2 miles off I-77 at the Ravenswood exit.

name: Greenland Gap Preserve
description: Grant County’s Greenland Gap Preserve is ringed by Oriskany Sandstone cliffs, which rise 800 feet above the cool, clear waters of the creek below. Visitors to the 250-acre preserve will find plants typical of higher elevations, including Canada yew and red elderberry. Animals found at the preserve include Allegheny woodrats among the rocks, migrating hawks (mid-August through October), and breeding birds normally found at higher elevations, including Blackburnian warblers and winter wrens.

name: Griffith and Feil Soda Fountain
description: Griffith and Feil Soda Fountain in Kenova serves up a wide assortment of sandwiches, salads and burgers in addition to classic ice cream sodas. The soda fountain offers a variety of milkshakes, malts, sundaes and floats. There are old-fashioned hand-mixed sodas called "phosphates" in a wide variety of flavors. The pharmacy was originally established in 1892 by the Williams family. The drugstore moved twice in 1903 and later in 1914 to its current location on Chestnut Street.

name: Gritt’s Farm Mother’s Day Brunch
description: At Gritt’s Farm, we pride ourselves on being fresh, growing local, and embracing family. Join us for a Sunday of celebrating the most special women in our lives! Enjoy Mother’s Day Brunch, a four-course meal prepared by guest Chef Jesse Lyons at Gritt’s Farm. Delight in tasty a bite with Mom or Grandma while surrounded by Spring florals. Menu & table information available here: https://tickets.grittsfarm.com/#/event-details/mothers-day-brunch

name: Gritt’s Farm
description: Since 1927, Gritt’s Farm has been a working farm in Buffalo, WV. Beginning as a homestead farm, the farm has seen many different faces over the years. The early years were all about eggs and at its peak saw 15,000 chickens on the farm. The eggs were delivered door to door around the Kanawha Valley. The 70s and 80s saw a lot of grain farming along the Kanawha River in Buffalo and Winfield. In the mid 1980s, the visionary 2nd generation farmer, Lee Gritt, moved farming indoors and begin building greenhouses. Lee and the 3rd generation farmer, Bob Gritt, became the first in West Virginia to grow hydroponic tomatoes in 1985. Tobacco was a large part of the farm as well from the 1980s until the early 2000s. Present day the farm is a three-season farm with hydroponic produce, garden center, summer outdoor produce, wedding venue, CSA, and Gritt's Fun Farm in the fall. There is also an assortment of animals on the farm with grass fed beef, goats, rabbits, chickens, and two dogs. Throughout all the years and still present day, our focus has always been on providing locally grown, farm fresh products.

name: Guest House Lost River
description: There's the beaten path and then there's the road less traveled... to the Guesthouse Lost River! Rustic yet refined is what you will experience at the Guesthouse Lost River, an award winning Bed & Breakfast and Inn. The Guesthouse is located in Hardy County, WV (approx. 2 hours from Washington DC and 3 hours from Baltimore, MD). The Inn has been a relaxation getaway destination for over 35 years. Open year round with on-site fine dining restaurant and lounge. Reservations recommended.
address: 288 Settlers Valley Way, Lost River, WV, 26810

name: Guest House
description: Family Restaurant, good food from Spaghetti to Steak!

name: Guyan Golf & Country Club
description: Whether you are looking for unhurried golf on an immaculate canvas or gracious dining with spectacular food, the Guyan experience is sure to wow you. Founded in 1922, Guyan Golf & Country Club continues to follow the grandest of traditions of private clubs, offering full service amenities and activities for all ages.

name: Guyandotte Campground
description: Guyandotte Campground at R.D. Bailey Lake has 94 first-come, first-serve sites along the scenic Guyandotte River. All sites are paved with 50amp electric service, picnic tables, and fire rings. Five sites have full water and sewer hookups. Other amenities include playgrounds, flush toilets, hot showers and an RV dump station.

name: Haddad Riverfront Park
description: Haddad Riverfront Park hosts special annual events and concerts, along with the occasional private gathering. The amphitheater seats up to 2,500 people with lovely views of the river and downtown Charleston. Boaters can dock at the riverfront park and watch the city activity from the peace of the water.

name: Hampshire County Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: As West Virginia’s oldest frontier county, Hampshire County has an incredibly rich history as well as scenic beauty. Visitors can discover historic sites, enjoy festivals, visit charming farmers markets, try delicious restaurants and more. While here, climb aboard a vintage train at Potomac Eagle Scenic Railroad and enjoy beautiful scenic sights along the way. Hampshire County is the perfect place to experience a new spring adventure.

name: Hampshire County Arts Council
description: The Hampshire County Arts Council seeks to foster the creation, presentation and enjoyment of the arts in our community. HCAC sponsors an Art in Public Places program in Romney and Sunrise Summit. 6-week exhibits by local artists are installed in local banks and the Romney Library around the year for the enjoyment of our community. These exhibits help showcase the enormous amount of talent and creativity in the Hampshire County arts community. A Spring Fine Arts Show is usually held at the Romney Library, with professional judging and cash prizes.

name: Hampshire County Public Library
description: The Hampshire County Public Library is a public institution dedicated to providing equal, uncensored access to information in a wide variety of formats to serve the educational, recreational, cultural and informational needs of all Citizens of Hampshire County. The Hampshire County Public Library includes a genealogy reference room, meeting room, small stage, monthly displays and monthly art shows.

name: Hampshire Park
description: 11 acres. Fully furnished kitchen & dining hall, seats 200. Dining hall has air conditioning available. 7 pavilions, large BBQ pit, 4 tennis courts, basketball court, sports field, sand volleyball court, Playground equipment, restrooms & shower house.

name: Hampton Inn – Barboursville
description: For a hotel that puts you at the center of the action in Barboursville, WV, check in to the Hampton Inn Huntington/Barboursville hotel. Centrally located just off I-64, and only 20 minutes from downtown Huntington, you are within easy reach of a range of local businesses, restaurants, and attractions.

name: Hampton Inn – Beckley
description: The Hampton Inn Beckley, WV hotel is located minutes from Tamarack, Ace Adventure, Burning Rock Outdoor ATV Park, Exhibition Coal Mine, Hatfield/McCoy ATV trails, Grandview Outdoor Theater, Lake Stephens and Winterplace Ski Resort. We are conveniently located near Interstates 77 and 64. Our hotel is your launching pad for outdoor excursions for any season Visit Tamarack, a community of artisans and craftsmen who create hand-blown glass, pottery, and furniture available for purchase.

name: Hampton Inn – Bridgeport
description: We are a newly renovated Hampton Inn located in Bridgeport, West Virginia. We are a neighboring town to Clarksburg, located approximately 25 miles south from West Virginia University in Morgantown. We are one exit south from the FBI Center located off exit 124. We have several restaurants within a 5 mile radius.

name: Hampton Inn – Buckhannon
description: The Hampton Inn Buckhannon is located in the foothills of the majestic Allegheny Mountains. Two miles east of downtown and 3 miles south of West Virginia Wesleyan College. We offer complimentary continental breakfast, free local calls, free newspaper, in-room coffee maker, and 25'' TV with cable. We have suites with microwave and refrigerator. We also offer connecting rooms, cribs, iron, safe deposit box, indoor pool, exercise gym. Meeting/banquet facilities are available for a nominal fee.

name: Hampton Inn – Charleston Southridge
description: The Hampton Inn Charleston Southridge offers free on-site parking, wi-fi throughout the hotel, and complimentary breakfast each morning when you stay with us! We're located at the area's largest shopping center, where guests enjoy many options for dining, shopping and recreation! Plus, the hotel features an indoor pool, a fitness room, free coffee, and the excellent service you expect from Hampton. Rooms and Suites with jacuzzi tubs are available.

name: Hampton Inn – Downtown Charleston
description: The Hampton Inn in downtown Charleston provides complimentary shuttle to and from West Virginia International Yeager Airport from 6 a.m. - 10 p.m. on weekdays. Appreciate the special amenities in all of the guest rooms, such as free high-speed Internet access, a lap desk and a clean fresh Hampton bed. Select rooms with a sofa bed, refrigerator and microwave to feel right at home.

name: Hampton Inn – Elkins
description: Situated in the heart of West Virginia on a river bank that overlooks the Tygart River Valley, Hampton Inn Elkins is two miles south of downtown with scenic views of the Appalachian Mountains. Enjoy shopping, dining, theatres, community art galleries, and outdoor recreation. See a live production at the American Mountain Theater or the Gandy Dancer Theater. Ride a steam-driven locomotive at Cass Scenic Railroad State Park. Go hiking or mountain biking at the Monongahela National Forest. Visit the National Radio Astronomy Observatory. Our hotel in Elkins, WV is within two miles of Durbin & Greenbrier Valley Railroad, and within five miles of local corporations such as Davis Health System, Clorox, Armstrong World Industries, and United Coal/Carter Roag. Unwind in an 81-room Elkins hotel, offering guest rooms and accessible rooms with one king-sized bed and double queen-sized bed options. Lounge on the sofa bed while watching cable television on the 32-inch LCD HD TV. Sit in the ergonomic chair and be productive from the work desk with adjustable lamp. Prepare food in the microwave while keeping drinks cool in the refrigerator. Send emails to friends using free high-speed internet access. Start your day at our hotel in Elkins, WV with Hampton’s free hot breakfast, or grab a free Hampton On the Run Breakfast Bag®, available Monday to Friday for a quick, healthy meal to go. At the end of the day, get a great night’s sleep in a clean and fresh Hampton bed®.

name: Hampton Inn by Hilton
description: Situated in the heart of West Virginia, Hampton Inn Elkins is two miles south of downtown with scenic views of the Appalachian Mountains. Enjoy shopping, dining, theatres, community art galleries, and outdoor recreation. See a live production at the Gandy Dancer Theater or ride a steam-driven locomotive at Cass Scenic Railroad State Park.

name: Hampton Inn – Winfield/Teays Valley
description: Welcome to the Hampton Inn Winfield/Teays Valley hotel. Nestled between Winfield and Teays Valley, our hotel is located in Hurricane. Explore the choice of restaurants within walking distance from our hotel. Take a shopping trip to Liberty Square. Spend a thrilling day sampling the water slides at Waves of Fun, just ten minutes away.

name: Hampton Inn – Inwood
description: At the Hampton Inn Inwood, all of our guests enjoy our On the House hot complimentary breakfast, high speed internet in each room along with coffee maker and coffee, iron and ironing board and a microwave and refrigerator. The Front Desk is available 24 hours a day to assist you as needed with your stay and reservations. This 65 room property has an outdoor season pool, fitness room and a business center to use during your stay. Check in time is 3:00 pm and check out is 12 pm and guaranteed reservations can be cancelled up to 6pm the day of arrival. No pets permitted and parking is complimentary. AAA and AARP discounts available and must show proof of current membership at check in. The Hampton Inn Inwood is located just off I-81 at exit 5.

name: Hampton Inn – Lewisburg, WV
description: Many visitors to the Hampton Inn® hotel in Lewisburg can't get over the Civil War cannonball hole in the church steeple. Like much of downtown, it has been preserved as a valuable piece of Lewisburg history. That preservationist spirit extends to much more than just history, however. You'll see it in our antique shops. We're proud of our architecture, too. Our entire downtown, in fact, has been put on the National Register. It's just a few minutes from our hotel in Lewisburg. We've also preserved much of the nature around our town. You'll find gorgeous state parks as well as the second-longest commercial cave on the East Coast. Lastly, we've even preserved our games around here—you can still play a round of golf as it was played in 1884, with hickory sticks and leather balls, just 10 miles from our hotel in Lewisburg. So come visit us at the Hampton Inn hotel in Lewisburg—where history is not only alive, but thriving. Proudly offering 60 guestrooms and suites, friendly customer service, complimentary high speed internet, indoor pool & whirlpool spa, fitness center, meeting room and “Hot” continental breakfast. Complimentary airport shuttle.

name: Hampton Inn – Martinsburg
description: When you check into the Hampton Inn Martinsburg, we pride ourselves on knowing every guest’s name even if they’re staying for the first time. During the early evening, make sure you grab a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie near our cozy fireplace. Our rooms feature fresh, modern decor, a lap desk, and a coffee maker. Try one of our rooms with a mini-fridge and microwave to savor late night snacks, or take a well-deserved dip in the private whirlpool tub. Enjoy a Hampton free hot breakfast every morning, or pick up a Hampton On the Run® Breakfast Bag and eat on the go. Stay fit using the latest Precor fitness equipment in our fitness center, and cool off with a swim in the outdoor pool during the summer. Enjoy free WiFi, local calls and a business center at our hotel in Martinsburg, WV. Right off Interstate 81 in charming Martinsburg, West Virginia, the Hampton Inn Martinsburg hotel is close to exciting shopping, dining, and local businesses. The hotel is conveniently located within a five-minute walk to the Martinsburg Mall. You’ll find many restaurants and shops surrounding the hotel to make planning lunch and dinner easy. Unwind at a nearby golf course or watch a film at the movie theater across the street.

name: Hampton Inn – Morgantown
description: Here at Hampton Inn Morgantown, we're eager to make your stay pleasant. Our 107 inviting guest rooms offer access to our modern hotel fitness center. Set in the mountains of West Virginia, our hotel in Morgantown offers the ideal location, close to all our region has to offer. Start with our beautiful and historic downtown. Situated next to the main campus of West Virginia University, this hotel is near Morgantown's vibrant nightlife. Dine out at a variety of delicious restaurants or treat yourself to an afternoon of shopping. Admire the Romanesque and Queen Anne buildings that grace old Morgantown. Within minutes of our hotel in Morgantown, guests can be hiking a scenic canyon. Try rafting or fishing on the nearby lake or enjoy cross-country skiing through the woods. For more local advice on what's near our hotel in Morgantown, just ask our friendly staff. Catch up with work in our professional business center and make use of a range of professional facilities and free printing services. Lounge in the cozy lobby with free 24-hour tea and coffee, and stay connected with free high-speed internet access throughout the hotel. Join us each morning for Hampton's free hot breakfast and savor a delightful variety of your favorite morning treats. Even if you're in a rush, simply grab one of our free Hampton On the Run® Breakfast Bags, available Monday through Friday, for a quick, healthy meal to go.

name: Hampton Inn – Parkersburg/Mineral Wells
description: Welcome to the Hampton Inn Parkersburg hotel located five minutes south of downtown Parkersburg and situated near popular entertainment and shopping attractions. Spend an afternoon at Grand Central Mall and discover over 100 stores, shops and restaurants. Feel at home in a comfortable guest room with a range of thoughtful amenities at our hotel in Mineral Wells, WV. Relax on a clean and fresh Hampton bed® and stay entertained with free internet access and a selection of premium TV channels.

name: Hampton Inn – Princeton
description: At the Hampton Inn, enjoy close proximity to state parks, uncover our abundant history, and discover fantastic skiing and shopping opportunities — all located just a few minutes from our Princeton, hotel. Stay connected in our free business center, or discuss business in our meeting room. Enjoy a swim in our indoor pool or work out in our free fitness center. Start your day right with the free hot breakfast. If you don’t have time to join us, make sure you take a free On the Run® Breakfast Bag.

name: Hampton Inn & Suites – Charles Town
description: Nestled in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, just an hour away from the Baltimore/Washington DC metro area, the Hampton Inn & Suites® Charles Town hotel is surrounded by history, entertainment and the great outdoors! Immerse yourself in our town's rich history and culture at popular attractions like Harpers Ferry National Historical Park, Antietam Battlefield, Happy Retreat (home of Charles Washington, the youngest brother of George Washington) and Historic Downtown Charles Town.

name: Hampton Inn & Suites Morgantown University Town Center
description: Our hotel’s convenient location puts you just minutes away from West Virginia University and in walking distance of many retail and dining options. Get a good night’s sleep on your clean and fresh Hampton bed®. You’ll enjoy the convenience of having a microwave and a mini-refrigerator in your room. All rooms and suites include an HDTV with satellite channels and ample work space. Upgrade for a suite for a sofa bed and a wet bar. With free hot breakfast daily, start your day energized. Hampton’s On the Run™ Breakfast Bags are available Monday through Friday for a meal to go. Our beautiful hotel contains 1,000 sq. ft. of on-site meeting space as well as the capacity to host larger events at the adjacent Loft Conference Center. The Loft Conference Center is an excellent choice for meetings, conferences, social events and group retreats. With over 3,000 sq. ft. of meeting space, on-site banquet rooms can accommodate between 10 and 110 attendees.

name: Hampton Inn – Wheeling
description: Beautifully renovated, one of a kind hotel, located just a few miles from Oglebay Park, Cabela's and the Wheeling Island Casino. Features a truly unique indoor-outdoor Aquatic Center with indoor pool, two hot tub spas, steam rooms, waterfall and tipping bucket tree. There is Teak garden with a fire pit, fountain, and outdoor kitchen.

name: Handley- WMA-Pocahontas
description: Open year-round Campsites: 13 tent or trailer $10 for a group of six or fewer and $2 for each additional person. Lake for fishing and non-motorized boating, hiking trails, hunting. Location: 8 miles off Route 219 north of Marlinton.
address: Handley Wildlife Viewing Area - 2783 Handley Rd, Marlinton, WV, 24954

name: Hank Williams, Sr. Memorial Bridge
description: The Bridge Carries Traffic Across The Bluestone River On Route 19 At Spanishburg. This Is Where Hank Crossed Shortly Before His Death On The Night Of December 31, 1952.
address: Off I-77, Athens Exit 14, 4 1/2 Miles, Spanishburg, WV, 25922

name: Hans Creek Outfitters
description: Hans Creek Outfitters is a hunting and shooting range that offers deer, turkey, boar and pheasant. More interested in fishing? There's also a 13-acre lake with catfish, bass and more. Start making memories today at Hans Creek Outfitters.

name: Happy Garden – Clarksburg
description: Happy Garden Chinese Restaurant offers delicious dining, takeout and delivery to Clarksburg, WV. Happy Garden Chinese Restaurant is a cornerstone in the Clarksburg community and has been recognized for its outstanding Chinese cuisine, excellent service and friendly staff. Our Chinese restaurant is known for its modern interpretation of classic dishes and its insistence on only using high quality fresh ingredients.

name: Harding’s Family Restaurant
description: Family style restaurant located on I-79 Exit 1 serving Dinner, Lunch and Breakfast all day. Gift shop located within restaurant. Plenty of free parking. Truck and bus parking available. Banquet room available for private parties.

name: Hardly Able Carriage Co.
description: Horse drawn wagon rides at North Bend State Park on the rail trail also overnight wagon train camping trips for groups. Horse drawn wagon rides with a narrative tour of the grounds at Blennerhassett Island Historical State Park. Horse drawn carriages available for weddings or other functions. Horse drawn wagons or carriages for hire for other special events, such as reunions, corporate events, weddings, church functions ect... call for fares.

name: Hardman’s Hardware
description: Enjoy a step back in time where you will find...Stone Crockery, Cast Iron Cookware, Grain Mills, Copper Apple Butter Kettles, Ice Cream Freezers, Bee Keeping Supplies, Wagons, Pumps, Wood Cook Stoves, Garden Tools, Canning Supplies, Oil Lamps, Heating Stoves, Candles, Gravely Tractors, Stihl Chainsaws, Apple Peelers, WV Food Products, Antique & Collectables, Unique Gifts, Hand Tools, Hardware Hours: M-F 8 AM-5PM SAT 8 AM-4PM Closed Sundays

name: Hardy County Convention & Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: "Experience the Hardy Effect" - Located amid the broad valleys and high ridges of the eastern Appalachian Mountains, Hardy County is an ideal getaway where visitors can take great scenic drives, hike and bike trails and back roads, or paddle and fish in rivers, runs and lakes. Follow an adventurous day with a delicious meal then stay the night in the comfort of a local inn or camp under the stars.

name: Harmony Ridge Gallery
description: American Art & Craft and Design Inspired Gifts

name: Harmony Ridge Gallery
description: Featuring the most unique in American Art and Craft in a 5,000 square foot gallery. Fine and hip jewelry, whimsical garden art, wall sculpture, ceramics, woodwork, blown glass and contemporary furniture. Recognized as a Top Retailer of American Craft in the country. Don’t miss our in-house wine bar.

name: Harpers Ferry Campground
description: River Riders offers primitive waterfront campsites, RV sites and rustic cabins on the beautiful Potomac River. All RV sites are back-in (no pull-through) and have electric and water hookups. Due to high water pressure, it is recommended RV campers use a water pressure regulator. We offer 20, 30 and 50amp electric sites. Some sites have a concrete patio and fire ring. Our camping sites are pet friendly. Our handicapped accessible bathhouse features 3 separate rooms for privacy with sink, commode and shower. Our rustic riverfront cabins are equipped with heat, AC and full bathrooms.

name: Harpers Ferry Event Barn
description: Located in the peaceful setting of historic Harpers Ferry, WV, The Barn sits in the tri-state area of West Virginia, Virginia and Maryland; only one hour from D.C. and Baltimore metro regions. The Barn hosts a variety of events . We also host in-house events at The Barn, bringing together the local community! Built in 2006, The Barn is equipped with heating and air conditioning, indoor bathrooms and an upstairs apartment space.
address: 1062 W Washington St, Harpers Ferry, West Virginia, 25425

name: Ghost Tours of Harpers Ferry
description: The Ghost Tours of Harpers Ferry by "O’ Be JoyFull" is a 'Family & Dog Friendly' walking tour appriopriate for most people of all age. The tour is approximately 1&1/2 to 1 & 3/4 hours in length and takes you around several blocks of the historic "Lower Town" section of Harpers Ferry to view a number of sites and buildings that have had ghostly phenomenon reported in, or around them, over the years. You will be told about the unexplained, or ghostly phenomenon that has, or is still occurring, as well as stories of both legends and/or historical events, which may account for such unexplained ghostly happenings and encounters . Of course, with Harpers Ferry’s violent past, especially during the American Civil War, many of the stories will tell of death, and some background history of Harpers Ferry is also an element of the tour. Although the tour has often been described as "spooky," it is not especially scary. We have found that the tour is appropriate for all age groups and that most children are perfectly fine with the tour and its stories.* * - Note: Although most all children of all ages have been fine with our ghost tour and its stories, if your child is especially sensitive, or especially scared of ghost stories, or stories about unexplained phenomenon, including ghostly experiences, and if your child expresses serious reservations or concerns about taking the tour, we ask that you respect his or her concerns and to carefully consider whether the tour would be appropriate for that "little person." Open Year Round. In season: April - September, tours Monday through Saturday 8 PM, reservations required Monday through Thursday.Off season: October - March, reservations required for all tours. Available Monday through Saturday 8 PM. Extra tours during October at 6 PM and on Sundays. Call for more information.
address: P.O. Box 1148, 175 High Street, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Harpers Ferry Historical Association
description: The association operates the Park Bookshop located on Shenandoah St. in Harpers Ferry Park. The bookshop is open seven days a week and offers books and media about the history and natural history of Harpers Ferry including the Shenandoah Valley region, the Civil War, industrial and transportation history, 19th century African American history and history of the national parks. It also has a large children's section. Proceeds from all sales benefit park programs.

name: Harpers Ferry KOA
description: Our camping facilities provide a range of accommodations and facilities for a complete family-friendly camping getaway. Located adjacent to the Harpers Ferry National Historical Park in eastern West Virginia, just minutes from Maryland and Virginia, the Harpers Ferry KOA offers a variety of camping experiences. We offer both RV and tent camping, Camping Cabins, Deluxe Cabins and a group bunkhouse that can accommodate up to 20 people. 50 max amp, RV and Tent Camping, Camping Cabins, Deluxe Cabins, group bunkhouse, cable tv, propane, pavilion, 65' max length, pool, mini golf, bike rentals, wifi, snack bar, firewood, dog park, laundry facilities, indoor and outdoor basketball, junior olympic pool, arcade game room, and much more. Open year-round.

name: Harpers Ferry Toy Train Museum
description: Museum features a collection of antique electric trains and other toys prior to 1938. The joy line railroad is an outdoor miniature train ride for adults and children. The railroad station is an original B&O railroad section car house. Locomotives and various rolling stock always in use or on display. There is an antique hodges hand car ride for children's enjoyment. Hours: open weekends April thru October (weather permitting) Saturday, Sunday and holidays 9:00am- 5:00pm.

name: Harpers Ferry Zip Line / Canopy Tour – River Riders
description: The Harpers Ferry Zip Line / Canopy Tour will bring you breathtaking scenery as you soar among the trees and along the beautiful Potomac River. This 2 to 2 1/2 hour guided tour has you flying high above the ground along various length zips. This tour is geared toward those approximately 10 years of age and older and between 70-250lbs. Fly through the air, as you immerse yourself in the pristine beauty of our historic waterfront location.

name: Harpers Ferry
description: A visit to this quaint, historic community, at the confluence of the Potomac and Shenandoah rivers, is like stepping into the past. The charming town of Harpers Ferry is known for its rich history and scenic beauty. Step back in time and stroll the parks picturesque streets, visit exhibits and museums and hike the trails and battlefields. Discover the scenic and historic C&O Canal or for a more challenging climb hike the Appalachian Trail for stunning views of the Blue Ridge Mountains and Potomac and Shenandoah river valleys. Endless adventures await in Harpers Ferry including whitewater rafting class-III rapids or simply visiting the towns lovely shops and incredible restaurants.

name: Harper’s Old Country Store
description: Harper's Old Country Store is one of the oldest continuously operated businesses in WV. The Old Store was built in 1902 and has been operated under the name of D. C. Harper and Co., a general country store, serving generations. The business, situated in front of the majestic and scenic Seneca Rocks, continues to be operated by the Harper family. The interior of the store is much the same as in 1902 with many old features and antiques. The original board floor that must be oiled frequently, the antique, metal blocked ceiling, the original shelving and counters, and numerous antiques and memorabilia give the visitor the felling of stepping back in time. The architecture of the building along with the big front porch represents the vintage of middle and late 1800's.
address: Jct. of Rtes. 33, PO Box 9, Seneca Rocks, WV, 26884

name: Harrison County Chamber Of Commerce
description: The Harrison County Chamber of Commerce promotes a vibrant business climate and community by fostering business growth with active and engaged members. Representing the businesses of Harrison County, West Virginia, for over 98 years, our Chamber has an aggressive business plan, an outstanding group of volunteers, and remarkable support from the business community. Our community businesses get connected at Chamber programs and events, through publications, media opportunities and more.

name: Harveytown Park
description: Harveytown Park was designed to bring a little "Life On The Farm" into the city! From the tall red barn to climb and play in to the pig pen area, there's plenty of fun to be had! Complete with a great picnic shelter, accessible restrooms and a pair of great shade structures, Harveytown Park is a great place for a family reunion or any kind of get-together for families and friends.

name: Hatfield and McCoy Moonshine
description: Hatfield and McCoy Moonshine – Drink of the Devil. Our moonshine is 90 proof (45% volume) premium hand crafted, handmade, hand bottled, hand labeled. Experience a slice of history with a behind the scenes tour of the Hatfield & McCoy Moonshine distillery. Situated in the southern mountains of Gilbert, West Virginia, this moonshine has been hand made following a family tradition passed down for generations. ​

name: Hatfield & McCoy Airboat Tours
description: Hatfield & McCoy Airboat Tours operate from a dock directly adjacent to downtown Matewan. There are few ways to experience the beauty and history of the area more exciting than from the seat of an airboat propelled by a 550-horsepower engine. During the tour, riders will see the area’s rich history, speeding by historic locations of the famous Hatfield-McCoy feud. Length of tours is catered to requests; a tour can last anywhere from 20-80 minutes and are usually available Tuesday-Saturday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., but visitors are strongly advised to call for reservations.

name: Hatfield and McCoy ATV Trail – Pocahontas Trail
description: The Hatfield McCoy trails offer more than 800 miles of off-road adventure as they wind through these southern mountains. It all begins with Mercer County’s Pocahontas trailhead in historic Bramwell. This convenient access point to 1-77 has a spacious parking lot and rest area. Best of all, it’s open year round. The Pocahontas Tailhead is the Southern Gateway to the Hatfield McCoy Trail system.

name: Hatfield McCoy House
description: 5 Room Inn with a Historic Theme showcasing the Hatfield McCoy Feud Participants. Owned by the GGG Granddaughter of Preacher Anderson Hatfield and the GGG Granddaughter of Aunt Betty and Uriah McCoy. Free Wifi, Long Distance, Spotless Clean Rooms, Flat Panel TV's in every room, a continental breakfast room, Private Bathrooms in Rooms, laundry area, porches with a fire pit and BBQ Grill, walking distance to town, A block from the Hatfield McCoy ATV Trailhead for the Buffalo Mountain trail and center of the sites of the Hatfield McCoy GeoTrail and an official pickup spot for the GeoCoin and special promotions for cachers where you can earn 3 FREE trackable Geocoins during your stay !! Cozy, Comfortable and meets all your needs. Also now offering a bunkhouse with three bedrooms, a bath and a large living room for families or groups up to 10. Come stay with us and make yourself at home while in Williamson, WV. The House is the 2nd oldest structure in Mingo County, the home of Devil Anse Hatfield. Decorated to tell the story of the historic Hatfield McCoy Feud. Each Room takes you back to the life of 5 of the most important people in the story. 79.95 Rates

name: Hatfield McCoy Resort
description: 7 Room Hotel with Restaurant on 1st floor. Court Yard out back and 15 feet from the Hatfield McCoy Trails, Buffalo Trail Head parking lot and adjacent to The Real McCoy Dual Sport Adventure Motorcycle Trail Head. Owned and operated by direct descendants of The Hatfield and The McCoy's. We offer fun for the whole family! We welcome you to come stay with us at the Hatfield-McCoy Inn located in Historic Downtown Matewan. You can relax in the Courtyard, enjoy some fresh smoked Pork BBQ, some entertainment and mingle with the other guest. The rooms lead to a front street overlook and a back street observation deck above the courtyard with views of scenic mountains, the Matewan Floodwall, and The Matewan Buffalo and The Devil Ance Connector ATV Trail Head. If you're coming to ride The Hatfield and McCoy Trails you can park your trucks and ATV trailers here and head straight for the mountains!

name: Hatfield-McCoy Trail Systems
description: Known for its adrenaline-pumping excitement, the Hatfield-McCoy Trails guarantee endless adventures around every twist and turn. Spanning across southern West Virginia, the Trails boast over 1,000 miles broken up by 10 systems. There are trails for beginners and experts alike. This spring, take to the mountains of West Virginia for an adventure like no other. wp:heading {"textAlign":"center"} [if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif] https://wvtourism.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/03.11.24-Hatfield-McCoy-Listing-Video-Compressed.mp4 /wp:paragraph /wp:genesis-blocks/gb-column /wp:genesis-blocks/gb-columns

name: Hattie and Nan’s Antique Market
description: Hattie and Nan's Antiques, located on 14th Street, is an antique shop with an eclectic collection. Browse through books, furniture and nick-knacks which are mainly sourced from estate sales from the surrounding localities.

name: Haunted Parkersburg Ghost Tours
description: Haunted Parkersburg is a haunted and historical walking tour of downtown Parkersburg. Stories cover areas of ongoing hauntings as well as tales of local folklore. These include the Ghost of Silver Run, the strange story of the alien Indrid Cold (which was covered in “The Mothman Prophecies”) Civil War hauntings, the smoking gentleman, Quincy Hill hauntings, Van Winkle’s haunted mansion, shadow people ghosts and more. The Tours were created and led by paranormal expert, Susan Sheppard, for more than 20 years. The Tours are now run by and led by her friends and family. Tickets may now be ordered on line through Fare Harbor, accessible at the website.
address: 320 Market Street (This is Blennerhassett Hotel's address and is subject to change), 4th, Parkersburg, WV, 26101

name: Hawk Knob Hard Cider and Mead
description: Come try Hawk Knob's Appalachian hard cider and mead in the rolling hills just outside of Lewisburg. Tours and tastings available for a truly unique yet traditional mountain specialty. Offering several styles of locally grown artisanal hard cider and featuring several fine meads. All hand crafted by growers and producers that believe in quality, tradition, and the time it takes to make truly craft beverages. Come enjoy the Taste of Tradition.

name: Hawk Recreation Area
description: Open seasonally with 15 tent or trailer sites, 10 picnic sites. Facilities: hand-pumped drinking water, vault toilet facilities, hiking trails. No trash service - Pack OUT all trash. Directions: Take exit 296 from I-81. Turn west on VA 55. Drive 14.5 miles and cross into WV at top of mountain (VA 55 becomes WV 55). Descend for 1.0 mile and make a sharp right turn onto Forest Road 502 (gravel road). After 2.7 miles, turn left onto Forest Road 347. Camp entrance is on the right.

name: Hawks Nest State Park
description: Nestled in the heart of whitewater rafting country, Hawks Nest State Park encompasses 276 acres bordering a rugged section of the New River Gorge National River. Long known for its panoramic views, the park offers a 31-room lodge for the comfort of overnight guests, on-site restaurant and an aerial tramway (seasonal). Below the lodge, the New River forms peaceful Hawks Nest Lake. Above the lake, the narrow canyon and rushing water create one of the most challenging whitewater boating waterways in the nation. The lodge and restaurant is open year-round. Online reservations are available. Park map, hours of operation and special rates are maintained on the state park website.
address: 49 Hawks Nest Park Road, PO Box 857, Ansted, WV, 25812

name: Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham – Bridgeport
description: We are a non-smoking, pet friendly hotel with plentiful services and amenities including a free hot breakfast buffet, weekly evening social hour and fitness center. Our all-suite hotel provides guests with a full kitchen, dining area and a 49” HDTV with streaming services such as Netflix and Hulu. We are conveniently located off I-79 just minutes from local attractions such as the Bridgeport Convention Center, United Hospital Center, and downtown Bridgeport & Clarksburg.

name: Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham – Wheeling Triadelphia at the Highlands
description: We are a nonsmoking pet-friendly hotel with plentiful services and amenities including a free hot breakfast buffet, weekly evening social hour and 24hr fitness center. Our all-suite hotel provides guests with a full kitchen, dining area and a 49” HDTV with streaming services such as Netflix and Hulu. We are ideal for business guests since we are located near local companies such as Steptoe & Johnson, US District Courts, Cardinal Health, Wheeling Hospital and the Ohio Valley Medical Center.

name: Health & Human Resources, Department Of
description: Government Agency.

name: Health Naturally
description: Sensible solutions to get well and stay well including organic food, herbs, vitamins, supplements and much more. Personal health consultants. Tues., Wed. and Fri. 11 a.m. - 5 p.m., Thurs. 11 a.m. - 6 p.m., Sat. 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.

name: Healthberry Farm and Honey River Meadery
description: Healthberry Farm is a small family farm producing honey, honey wine and beeswax products. At Healthberry Farm, we believe in the importance of working with nature to produce the finest products possible. Our varietal honeys are raw and come to you straight from the hive, without pasteurization or processing. Honey River meads are aged for two years so they can be bottled without sulfites. Our salves and candles are made with simple ingredients that are good for your body and the air you breathe. We do not add any chemicals, preservatives, colors or additives to any of our products, as they are unnecessary and often harmful. Healthberry bees forage on plants in a wild setting, a safe distance from sources of toxic contamination, and are never moved for pollination services. Our practices give you an opportunity to support eco-friendly, small-scale farming while treating yourself to delicious varietal honey products made by healthy, happy bees. Farm Tours available by appointment only. Please call with 24+ hours notice for the best chances of catching us.

name: Heart Of Gold Diner
description: Wonderful service, very friendly. You walk in as stranger and leave as family. We feature home cooking all day long. You can order to go or stay and dine. We serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner all day long. Big portions at a great price-- if you leave hungry something is wrong!
address: 1550 Main St. E, Oak Hill, WV, 25901

name: Hearth
description: Hearth is a private club available for guests and members of the Soaring Eagle Lodge. Soaring Eagle Lodge is Snowshoe Mountain's newest and most luxurious lodging accommodations. The private club is the perfect location for spectacular Grande Mountain Weddings. Enormous hand crafted timbers, spectacular mountain vistas and beautiful furnishings make this the perfect spot for your next mountain soiree. Beautifully landscaped terraces are also available for outdoor events.

name: Heath Studio Gallery
description: The Heath Studio Gallery, located on the main street at the north end of town, features the original paintings and prints of Jonathan and Jan Heath. It is a gallery space and a working studio, open weekends 11-5 and by appointment or by chance.
address: 327 N. Washington St., Berkeley Springs, WV, 25411

name: Heatherfield’s Restaurant and Lounge
description: Located in the Holiday Inn at Martinsburg. Restaurant serves a wide variety of foods. Breakfast: 6:30am-11am Lunch: 11:30am-2pm Dinner:5pm-9pm Credit cards: MasterCard, Visa, American, Express, Diners & Discover Discounts: Senior discount offered on Sunday only for lunch buffet (11:30-2) DIRECTIONS: I-81, Exit 13 to the first light, take first right to the Holiday Inn.

name: Heavens Landing Retreat
description: We invite you to a unique fly in lodging experience high in the mountains of West Virginia. Just Plane Adventures at Heavens Landing Retreat has been described as “a peaceful mountain oasis” a place where you can get some rest. Whether it’s for a few days or an extended stay, we offer a medley of accommodations providing you with a “like home” experience.

name: Hefners RV Park & Campground
description: 9 sites available year-round, water electric and sewer, cable & phone available for monthly up renters- camping season: year-round $30 night or $600 monthly camping season: year-round 5 miles from Weston off I-79 exit 99 to Route 33 east. Turn on Berlin Road off Route 33, located between Wal-Mart and Sheetz. Approximately 3 miles on the right at the top of the hill (at the 18 mail boxes).

name: Heldreth Motel & Restaurant
description: We would like to take this opportunity to introduce you to our motel which features 67 guest rooms with affordable lodging rates.

name: Hellbender Burritos
description: If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, you've come to the wrong place. But, if you're looking for unique, West Virginia inspired, meal-sized burritos filled with homemade ingredients, Hellbender Burritos is for you. Barbeque Burrito? Frito Pie Burrito? Buffalo Burrito? Yes, yes and YES! Meat-eaters and vegetarians alike will find a menu full of choices. Our draft beer is a rotating selection of high quality beers, usually featuring West Virginia breweries.

name: Hello House B&B
description: 1 queen bedroom and 1 bedroom with king/twin with adjoining bath. Rates: $85.00 per room per night on weekends and holidays. Monday through Thursday: $75.00 per room per night. Extra charge for use of kitchen. Rates subject to change without notice. Reservations are required in advance Restrictions: Smoking outside only. Two people per room. Children are conditional upon having their own room. No pets. Breakfast: Full breakfast included with room.

name: Helvetia Hutte Restaurant
description: Known for its original recipes brought from Switzerland over a century ago. Menu items include a rosti, sauerbraten, chicken, homemade bread and onion pie. Make sure you sample everyone’s favorite – the peach cobbler.

name: Hemlock Haven Luxury Cabins
description: Hemlock Haven Luxury Cabins offers 6 exceptional lodging options. Four cabins have 3 bedrooms and 2 full baths which can sleep 8 guests. One cabin (Bingo’s Bungalow) is larger and has a game room with foosball, pool, air hockey and darts. Bingo’s Bungalow can sleep 12 guests. Newly finished in 2017 is Serenity Lodge. This property has 14 private acres and boasts 5 bedrooms, 3 full baths, a recreation room, a bar and a fishing pond. The lodge can sleep 18 guests. All properties Dog Friendly.

name: Heritage Craft Center of the Eastern Panhandle, Inc.
description: The Heritage Craft Center is dedicated to the preservation and promotion of heritage crafts. The learning center offers craft classes taught by professional artisans. The marketing center sells a wide array of high quality handcrafted works of art by West Virginia artisans.

name: Heritage Grille & Wits End Lounge
description: Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner all week with your favorite beverages, light meals, and snacks served in the lounge. Ladies night every Saturday and comedians every Friday. Located in the Ramada Inn.

name: Heritage Port
description: Heritage Port is a waterfront park that reconnects the city of Wheeling with the Ohio River. Complete with an amphitheater, an entry plaza and a river-edge walkway, this spot is a hub for many events. Heritage Port is the site of the city’s annual Fourth of July fireworks, Italian Festival, as well as weekly concerts and movies. This linear, three-acre park provides the perfect outdoor space for the public.

name: Heritage Towers (Exhibit Facility/Museum)
description: This historic exhibit, titled "From Slavery to Statehood," tells the story depicting African-American contributions in West Virginia. The historic event created an opportunity for the interpretive history on the role of African Americans before, during and after emancipation from slavery. The exhibit continues with the formation of West Virginia, blacks in the coal mines and the building of the railroad system, to the establishment of black schools and renowned people of African heritage from West Virginia.
address: 612 Virginia St., E., Ste. 202, Charleston, WV, 25301

name: Heritage Towers
description: Heritage Towers exhibits were created as a special tribute to a time-honored African American tradition nationally celebrated as Black History Month. Heritage Towers Museum is a place of learning and a place to experience African and American culture in the heart of Charleston, West Virginia. The facility provides a series of exhibits, lectures, concerts, cultural celebrations, festivals and programs designed to preserve the past, honor the present, and strengthen the future.

name: Heritage Village
description: Heritage Village includes shops, offices and local historical buildings.  This facility is included in "A Guide to Accessible Recreation in West Virginia." Please check the Guide or the site for information on accessibility. Please note - a self-reporting survey was used to compile the information in this Guide; every attempt was made to verify the accuracy of the information but West Virginia Division of Tourism is not responsible for errors or inaccuracies.

name: Herns Mill Covered Bridge
description: This historic covered bridge (c. 1884) provided access to the S.S. Herns Mill and is one of only two covered bridges remaining in Greenbrier County. Follow signs from Rt. 60 West, 2.6 miles out of downtown Lewisburg.

name: Hertz Rent A Car – Bluefield
description: If you are in need of a rental car Hertz Rent A Car is Located at the Mercer County Airport just off Rt. 123 in Bluefield, WV. They have a wide variety of cars to fit all your needs, from full-size SUV's to compacts.

name: Hewitt House B&B
description: Picturesque bed and breakfast located in the charming town of Historic Bramwell, the home of the millionaires. Stay the weekend in a cozy carriage house that was once occupied by the famous Hewitt family.
address: S. River and Main Street, Bramwell, WV, 24715

name: Hiawatha’s
description: Begin your Elkins adventure at Hiawatha's, a destination within itself. Many items are handcrafted by Native Americans--quivers, arrows, peace pipes, and pottery--along with Native American music, dolls, and moccasins. Select from western boots, oilskin dusters, hats, silver and turquoise jewelry, Aigner leather, Annie Oakley fragrances, W. Va.-made jams and jellies, postcards, T-shirts, and souvenirs. It is not your usual store. Just look for the statue of Minnehaha!

name: Hickory Hill Cabins and RV Park
description: Hickory Hill Cabins has 4 cabins. We have 2 cabins with kitchens and 2 without kitchens. We now have RV parking available. Water, electric, and sewer hook ups.

name: Hidden Acres
description: Corporate event center with overnight accommodations. Available for private parties up to 200 people, special events including weddings, picnics and secure meetings.

name: Hidden Cove B&B
description: Welcome to Hidden Cove Inn, located in historic Bramwell. Nestled in a lush cove of the mountain at the entrance of Jones Hill Road, the Inn was built in the 1890s as a foreman's house by Caswell Creek Coal and Coke Company--one of the pioneering coal companies in southern West Virginia. Your visit to the Inn is an opportunity to experience a way of life in early Pocahontas coal field history. The Inn is your home away from home, cozy and inviting.

name: Hidden Trails Stables
description: Hidden Trails Stables is located in Lost River State Park, Mathias, WV. We offer guided trail rides on horseback from April through October. Calm, gentle horses, friendly guides. Reservations accepted, but walk-ins are welcome. See our website for hours. We accept cash, check or credit cards.

name: High Falls of the Cheat
description: Winding through Shavers Mountain in the Potomac Highlands off Route 44, the High Falls of the Cheat is one of the Mountain State’s most distinctive waterfalls. Though these falls are short in height, their signature feature is an impressive width, with cascades roaring across the mountainsides over a horseshoe bend of rocks. Find this spot along the High Falls Trail, which provides a beautiful – yet challenging hike.

name: Highland Scenic Highway (USDA Forest Service)
description: From the Cranberry Mountain Nature Center at Cranberry Glades to North of Edray on U.S. 219, the Highland Scenic Highway is a beautiful corridor through the National Forest. Extending 43 miles from Richwood to US Route 219, it has four developed scenic overlooks. The highway is not maintained for winter use and snow usually prevents winter travel.

name: Highland Springs Golf Course
description: Located in Wellsburg, West Virginia, Highland Springs Golf Course features 6,853 yards of golf from the longest tee for a par of 72. The course rating is 72.4 and has a slope rating of 118. Designed by James Harrison ASGCA, the Highland Springs opened in 1961. The property was purchased in 2006 by Vaughn Hone Sr. along with Mark Hone and was completely renovated to the magnificent gem it is today.

name: Hill and Holler
description: Wood-fired pizzas and sandwiches, salads with fresh local ingredients. Local craft beer and wine. Featuring live music and outdoor seating. Open for lunch and dinner.

name: Hill and Hollow
description: Hill & Hollow specializes in creating global cuisine from locally grown ingredients and is dedicated to the essential concept of sustainable agriculture and the belief that natural ingredients simply taste better.

name: Hillbilly Cycle Sales
description: Sales, service, parts, accessories for all brands of motorcycles. Keys cut, OEM parts, power equipment, pre-owned bikes, ATVs, cruisers/v-twins, dirt bikes, scooters, sidecars, trikes, street bikes, snowmobiles.

name: Hillbilly Grill
description: Come and enjoy our restaurant, bar & outside deck that's heated in the winter with glass windows for outside, scenic views. There's a playground for children, too! We also have space for RV hook-ups.

name: Hillbilly Heaven Campground
description: We have 3 log cabins, 2 cottages and a 28' camper ready to rent. In addition, we have 7 RV spots with 50 amp hook ups, water, sewage, WiFi and a bathhouse for your convenience. We are located one mile from Devil Anse Trails that run into either Buffalo Mountain Trail or Rockhouse Trails. You can hit the trails right from our campground!! We also have Hatfield-McCoy Trail permits, snacks, drinks, ice and souvenirs at our store.

name: Hillbilly Hotdogs
description: Hillbilly Hot Dogs serves gourmet hot dogs, hamburgers and sandwiches with down-home charm and is famous for its “Homewrecker” and “The Doublewide.” The unique decor and friendly wait staff make your experience at Hillbilly Hotdogs one you’ll want to come back for.

name: Hillbilly Proud
description: We are a West Virginia based company aimed at promoting mountain living and creating videos that highlight our state, history, culture, and sports. Most of our videos focus on off-road motor sport events including mud bog competitions, sand drag racing, rock crawling competitions, trail riding, hill climbing, and more. We also offer a line of high-quality merchandise and promote the West Virginia Day Festival. It's so much more than that though, it's a way of life.

name: Hillcrest Wildlife Management Area
description: This 2,212 acre Hancock County Wildlife Management Area is hunting grounds for ring-necked pheasant, rabbit, turkey, morning dove, and deer. A 100-yard handicapped accessible shooting range is available. Open fires are not permitted. Camping is available nearby at Tomlinson Run State Park. Hillcrest WMA accessed off State Route 8 via County Route 19 (Gas Valley Rd), County Route 14 (Middle Run and Orchard Roads) and County Route 42 (Smith Road).
address: From State Route 8, Gas Valley Rd., New Cumberland, WV, 26047

name: Hillsboro House Bed & Breakfast
description: Lovely Victorian home built in 1891 surrounded by the scenic mountains in Pocahontas County, West Virginia. It is located minutes from the Pearl Buck birthplace, Droop Mountain State Park with its lookout tower, Bear Town State Park and Watoga State Park . The area abounds with great hunting and fishing spots. It is a short drive from Cass Scenic Railroad, Snowshoe Resort and Cranberry Glades. It is also just minutes from the Greenbrier River trail, where you may enjoy hiking and biking.

name: Hillbilly Hide Away ATV Resort
description: Five houses are offered for renting out, also tent sites and plenty of parking. Fully equipped with everything needed for an enjoyable time (except bath towels!) and conveniently located close to the Pocahontas trail head, a gas station, cafe, grocery store, Dollar Store, Tudor's Biscuit World/Gino's Pizza, Advance Auto, and ATM machines are all within close driving distance.

name: Hilton Garden Inn – Clarksburg
description: At Hilton Garden Inn hotels you'll find everything you need to be self-sufficient and productive, right where you need it. Designed for the individual business traveler and the weekend leisure guest, Hilton Garden Inn provides the finest quality of essential services and amenities. It's value engineered from the ground up and dedicated to guest comfort. To you it's a hotel, to us it's an obsession.

name: Hilton Garden Inn – Morgantown
description: Located in the new Suncrest Towne Center, Hilton Garden Inn Morgantown offers great accommodations for both the corporate and leisure traveler in Morgantown, WV. This property features five floors, 118 rooms, complimentary parking, shuttle service, and an on site restaurant serving breakfast, dinner and room service.
address: 150 Suncrest Towne Centre Drive, Morgantown, WV, 26505

name: Hinton Elks – Willow Wood Course
description: Local to Hinton, West Virginia, Willowwood Country Club offers terrific views and play for golfers of every skill level. Well-groomed fairways and greens keep Willowwood Country Club challenging yet friendly, and the staff is available to offer tips and helpful hints to players who want to play their best round. Willowwood is a terrific choice for regular rounds or as a new destination for those visiting Hinton. Holes: 9 Par: 36 Length: 2965 yards Slope: 113 Rating: 33.4.

name: Historic Bramwell
description: Bramwell is a West Virginia Historic Town situated on a peninsula of the Bluestone River. Founded in 1888, the town reflects large fortunes amassed by local coal barons and is renowned for an abundance of well preserved Victorian and Tudor style mansions. During the town's heyday around the late 1800s to early 1900s, 14 millionaires resided there. Bramwell offers self-guided walking tours, pre-arranged group tours, and Spring and Christmas historic home tours.
address: Main Street, P.O. Box 338, Bramwell, WV, 24715

name: Historic Cabin at Gobblers’ Knob
description: Gobblers’ Knob, perched on a peaceful mountain top at the northern end of the Shenandoah Valley near Berkeley Springs, takes its name from the wild turkeys that roam the property. An intimate and romantic setting less than two hours from Washington, DC and Baltimore, MD and 2 ½ hours from Pittsburgh, PA, this secluded cottage is tastefully decorated with antiques and heirlooms reflecting the historic charm of the period, having been professionally preserved to its 1820’s roots.

name: Historic Fayette Theatre
description: A restored theatre located in Fayetteville, Historic Fayette Theatre offers a murder mystery in January, a musical in the spring, a summer play in July and August, a play in October, a Christmas play over Thanksgiving weekend, and other plays and concerts throughout the year. Please call or check the web site for a full schedule.

name: Historic Matewan House Bed and Breakfast
description: The Historic Matewan House Bed and Breakfast is located in one of the most famous small towns in West Virginia, Matewan, the setting for Hatfield-McCoy feuds and the Matewan Massacre. Within walking distance of the Buffalo Mountain trail head, Matewan Depot museum, Mine Wars Museum, Wingos Barbeque restaurant), Mi Pueblito Mexican restaurant, the walk path along the Matewan flood wall and the Tug River.

name: Historic Morris Harvey House Bed and Breakfast
description: Treat yourself to an unforgettable stay at the Historic Morris Harvey House Bed and Breakfast. Nestled in the quiet, historic downtown of Fayetteville, West Virginia, the Morris Harvey House is a charming place to unwind and take a "Step Back" to a time when life was simpler and less hectic.

name: Historic National Road
description: The National Road (also known as the Cumberland Road) was the first major improved highway in the U.S. built by the federal government between 1811 and 1837. The 620-mile road connected the Potomac and Ohio Rivers and was a main transport path West for thousands of settlers.

name: History Center Museum
description: The History Center Museum is open from June through September on Sunday afternoons from 1:00-4:00 pm. The History Center Museum is an historic structure built in 1856 and is the oldest existing building on Main Street in Buckhannon. It was listed on National Register of Historic Places in 1992.

name: HMSHOST
description: The vendor for three West Virginia Turnpike travel plaza facilities at Burnwell (Morton), Beckley and Princeton, featuring fuel, gift shops and popular chain restaurants such as Starbucks, Burger King, Pizza Hut, etc.
address: M.M. 18 N. /WV Tpk., Camp Creek, WV, 25820

name: Hokes Mill Covered Bridge
description: One of only two covered bridges remaining in Greenbrier County, the Hokes Mill Bridge (c. 1897-99) provided access to Hokes Mill. From Ronceverte, travel Rt. 219 S to River Road (Secondary Rt. 48), then approximately 3.6 miles to Hokes Mill Road (Secondary Rt. 62). Bridge is located on Hokes Mill Road, about 1 mile past Hamilton Road on the left. This 12-foot-wide, 81.5-foot-long Long truss, built in 1899, carries Greenbrier County 62 over Second Creek. Renovated in 2001 at a cost of $391,646.

name: Hole ‘N Run
description: Hole 'n Run is a retail shop specializing in pro-line golf equipment, athletic shoes and apparel. Family owned and operated for over 20 years, Hole n' Run is a one stop shop for all your sporting needs. Full service screen-print and embroidery on site. Ask about our team specials.

name: Holiday Inn Express – Charles Town
description: Tucked away along the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains in the Shenandoah Valley, the Holiday Inn Express® Charles Town hotel offers the finest accommodations in the area. Consistently rated Four and Five-Star Staff and Service, Room and Comfort, Value, Cleanliness, Breakfast offerings and relaxing atmosphere.

name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites Southridge
description: Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites Southridge, featuring 84 guest rooms on five levels, is located in a beautiful mountain setting only four miles off I-64. Surrounded by two shopping plazas and dozens of restaurants, in-house amenities include an indoor pool, hot tub, fitness center, two meeting rooms, high-speed Internet access, free local phone calls, complimentary continental breakfast, and a business center for guest use. Plenty to see and do, and only five miles from downtown Charleston.

name: Holiday Inn Express – Charleston Civic Center
description: With beautiful views of the riverfront, located directly across the street from the Charleston Civic Center and within walking distance from the Town Center Mall, Holiday Inn Express Civic Center offers guest rooms with hair dryers, coffee service, ironing boards, telephones with dataport and voicemail, exercise and laundry facilities, daily newspaper delivery, express check out, free parking, free local calls and long distance access, continental breakfast and courtesy van transportation within a 10-mile radius including Yeager Airport.

name: Holiday Inn Express – Logan
description: Pets Allowed, You Must Make Arrangements At Time Of Reservation. Amenities Include: Indoor Pool, Complimentary Breakfast, Business Center With High-speed Internet Access, On-site Guest Self-laundry Facilities, Health/fitness Center On-site, Hairdryer And Iron/ironing Board, Coffee Maker, Rt. 119 North Just Past Logan Airport Exit, Turn Right In To Fountain Place Mall, Take An Immediate Right On To George Kostas Drive, Hotel Located On Left.

name: Holiday Inn Express – Morgantown
description: We are a 68 room hotel that features many amenities such as a complimentary deluxe breakfast bar, indoor pool, spa, and exercise facility. We also have meeting space for 40 classroom style or 60 theater style and a small boardroom for smaller business meetings. All rooms are accessed through interior corridors and feature a microwave, refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker; speakerphone, hair dryer, iron, ironing board. Free high-speed wireless internet access available throughout the hotel will keep all your devices connected. An elevator is available for access on upper floors. We are located within 3 miles of WVU. Area attractions include Cooper’s Rock State Forest, WVU Football Stadium, WVU Coliseum, Mononghalia County Ballpark host of WVU Baseball & WV Black Bears , Frank Lloyd Wright’s Falling Water’s, Ohio Pyle, Forks of Cheat Winery, Cheat Lake, Rails and Trails.

name: Holiday Inn Express Newell-Chester WV
description: The hotel is located on Route 2, minutes from Mountaineer Resort and Homer Laughlin China Co. Standard discounts apply and rates may increase during special events. Priority Club Rewards offered. Rates include expanded continental breakfast. All rooms have irons, ironing boards, microwaves, refrigerators, coffee pots, hairdryers and high-speed internet. The hotel has an elevator, indoor pool, hot tub, exercise room, guest laundry, business center and a meeting room that seats 30.

name: Holiday Inn Express – Princeton
description: Fully renovated with a fresh up to date appearance, a stay at the 70-room Holiday Inn Express Princeton includes a hot buffet style breakfast, both a business and fitness center, indoor heated pool, hot tub, and free in room WiFi. Located off I-77 Exit 9 Princeton to US Rt. 460 West with easy on/off Interstate access, the property is convenient to several restaurant choices amidst the verdant scenery of the Appalachian Mountains.

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites – Bridgeport
description: The Holiday Inn Express & Suites in Bridgeport has all of the amenities of the HIE brand, plus a well trained and organized staff to make for the most pleasurable of stays. Start your day with the many choices of the Express Start Hot Breakfast Bar. Our amenities include a heated pool & spa, 24 hour fitness & business center, microwave and mini fridge in every room, WIFI and meeting facilities. The Holiday Inn Express and Suites is conveniently located right off I-79, Jerry Dove Drive exit 124.

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites – Cross Lanes
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites conveniently located near the Mardi Gras Casino. The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites is located just off I-64 in Cross Lanes, WV. We are located just 15 minutes from Downtown Charleston, Clay Center for the Arts, Charleston Civic Center, Charleston Area Medical Center and the West Virginia State Capitol Complex. While enjoying your stay with us, you can visit the Mardi Gras Casino, Blenko Glass Company, and the Charleston Town Center. Golf Courses, Nature Trails, Picnic Area and Fishing are all within minutes from the Hotel. The Holiday Inn Express Hotel is jam packed with amenities that guests just love! They offer a Manager's Reception every Monday - Thursday which includes a free beer, snacks, and freshly popped popcorn! Upon arrival, guests get to spin their famous IHG Rewards Wheel, allowing them to win even more free prizes! Enjoy free hot breakfast and wifi while staying there. Customer service is their top priority! Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites is conveniently located to many of the area businesses, such as Union Carbide, WV State University, Toyota, and Dupont. Whether you are traveling on business or personal, you can enjoy our Free High-Speed Internet Access, Business Center, Fitness Center, Indoor Heated Pool or get your day started Smart with our Express Start Hot Breakfast Bar. Meeting space is also available for your meeting. The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites staff looks forward to welcoming you to our brand new Hotel.
address: 410 New Goff Mountain Rd, Cross Lanes, WV, 25313

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Elkins
description: Lodging with us at the Holiday Inn Express® Hotel & Suites Elkins means you are near companies like Armstrong, Kingsford Charcoal and Southern States, as well as Davis & Elkins College. Staying at our Elkins hotel also gives you access to our 24-hour Business Center and 1,000-square-foot meeting room, perfect for a sales meeting or social gathering. Our hotel is intent on providing you comfort and convenience, and our great amenities prove it. You'll enjoy our indoor pool, a whirlpool and the free Express Start hot breakfast. When you stay in a standard room at our hotel in Elkins, WV, you can use the free high-speed Internet access, relax in an easy chair while you watch the cable TV with HBO and use the fridge and microwave. You can also work at the desk and then get a great night's sleep in a king or queen bed. If you seek a hearty breakfast during your stay in Elkins, West Virginia, our hotel delivers. Our complimentary Express Start hot breakfast features goodies, such as warm cinnamon rolls, eggs, bacon, fruit, yogurt, cereals and coffee. Additional amenities include: Indoor Pool Heated Indoor Pool Indoor Whirlpool Indoor Pool Hours of Operation: 7am - 11pm Complimentary Fitness Center Hours of Operation: 12am to 12am Fitness Center Type: LIMITED Fitness Center Equipment: Treadmill Elliptical Machines Stationary Bicycle Last Renovation of Fitness Center Equipment: 2006 HOUSEKEEPING & LAUNDRY Daily Housekeeping On-site Guest Self-Laundry Facilities Hours of Operation: 12am - 12am *Wake Up Calls

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites – Fairmont
description: 71 Room hotel completely non-smoking. Pool, fitness center, business center, and guest laundry all complimentary. Also, a complimentary hot breakfast from 6-10am.

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites – Lewisburg
description: Featuring indoor pool and whirlpool, fitness center, meeting room, complimentary high speed internet and free Express Start Breakfast. Family and fireplace suites available. $$$

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Parkersburg – Mineral Wells
description: Every hotel room in our Mineral Wells Hotel near Parkersburg is decorated to feel like home. You will be able to relax on king or queen size beds that are triple-sheeted with four pillows a piece. Rooms include a microwave, a refrigerator, expanded cable channels and free high-speed wired and wireless internet.
address: 80 Old Nicholette Road, Mineral Wells, WV, 26150

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites – Weston
description: Our Weston hotel offers first-rate amenities and an ideal location near area attractions including Stonecoal Lake, Jackson's Mill, Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum and Appalachian Glass, where you can watch experienced craftsmen create unique glass products. For the adventure seekers, our Weston hotel in central West Virginia is situated at the gateway to many ski resorts, such as Canaan Valley and Snowshoe, as well as beautiful state parks with many hiking trails. Business travelers will enjoy a stay at our hotel in Weston, WV due to its close proximity to area businesses including Halliburton, Schlumberger, Viking Pool, Dominion Gas, Leader Energy, Worldwide Equipment, and Pittsburgh Tube. Located right off I-79, our Weston hotel provides a business center, flexible meeting space, and premium business services in a convenient location near Harrison Regional Airport in Clarksburg, WV. During your stay in central West Virginia, enjoy all our Weston hotel amenities, like the heated indoor pool, whirlpool and fitness center. Also, take advantage of our complimentary hot breakfast bar, which can be taken to-go for your convenience. Check out our great Weston hotel deals, and start planning your trip today.

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Wheeling
description: Guests can come to expect a wide variety of amenities that are offered including our Fresh Start Express Start Breakfast Bar that has a variety of delicious foods both hot and cold. After a long day of work or leisure, you can relax in our indoor pool and hot tub. We also offer a 24/7 fitness center to keep you healthy as well as a business center to print off that important document. There is also a guest laundry on site. Last, but not least, you can experience our enhanced WiFi upgrade for that faster internet connection. The Holiday Inn Express & Suites in Wheeling, West Virginia is conveniently located off I-70 at Exit 10, Cabela Drive, and close access to many delicious restaurants like The Texas Roadhouse, Cheddars, Primanti Brothers and Quaker Steak and Lube to name a few. We are located at The Highlands and minutes from WesBanco Arena, home of the Wheeling Nailers, and also very close proximity to the Wheeling Hospital. During the Holiday Season, people from all around come to enjoy the Wheeling’s famous Festival of Lights-a very popular event. Located just minutes away is Wheeling Island Casino where you can enjoy a gambling night of fun!

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites New Martinsville
description: The Holiday Inn Express and Suites New Martinsville is situated on the West Virginia/Ohio border along the Ohio River with close proximity to major businesses such as, Statoil, ORMET, Jericho Land and MRIE. Complimentary amenities include high-speed Internet access, a 24-hour Business Center, 1,000 square feet of flexible meeting space, hot breakfast bar, 24-hour Fitness Center, 24-hour heated indoor pool and whirlpool.
address: 1202 N State Route 2, New Martinsville, WV, 26155

name: Holiday Inn – Martinsburg
description: The Holiday Inn® Martinsburg is located just off of Exit 13 from I-81 in Berkeley County, West Virginia. Five floors and 120 rooms of smoke-free and pet-friendly accommodation with renovations under way in 2017 - 2018. Guest rooms feature microwave, refrigerator, triple-sheeted bedding, pillow menus, WIFI and well-lit workstations.

name: Holiday Inn & Suites Charleston West
description: Whether you visit on a weekend getaway for two, a week-long vacation for the whole family, a business stay, or a group event, the Holiday Inn & Suites Charleston West, should be your choice when traveling to Charleston, West Virginia. Located near downtown Charleston and area attractions, our hotel's amenities include: Indoor pool, hot tub, splash pad and fitness center Free onsite ground-level parking Free wireless and wired high-speed internet Complimentary airport courtesy van/local shuttle 24 hour Business Center Mosa's Cafe and Grille (on-site restaurant and lounge) Guest laundry facilities Pet-friendly (pet fee per night) We offer a wide range of room types with services and amenities including: Refrigerator and microwave in every room Keurig coffeemaker Iron and ironing board 42-inch television with DirecTV services and HBO Suites available

name: Holiday Inn & Suites
description: When looking for premier lodging, think of Holiday Inn, the only full service hotel located in Beckley. As a family friendly hotel, we feature a full-service restaurant where kids under 12 eat for free, a large heated indoor pool and hot tub, two fitness rooms, and a Manager’s Reception every Wednesday evening. Ask us about our extensive catering menus, meeting space, and local hotel packages. Guest Rooms During your mountain vacation in Beckley our hotel rooms will make your family feel at home with free, high-speed Internet access and a convenient microwave and refrigerator. These spacious rooms also offer work desks, free local calls and flat panel TVs with HBO for your enjoyment. Suite Overview Combining the traditional with a modern sense of style our hotel in Beckley offers you well-appointed suites. You'll enjoy a separate bedroom and living area with a sleeper sofa and two TVs along with all the great amenities of a standard room. For longer stays ask about the Dwyer Kitchen suites. Adjacent to the Mountaineer Conference Center with an additional 3,100 sq. ft. of meeting space. Whether reunion, meeting, wedding or traveling, the Holiday Inn & Suites can meet your traveling needs. Just off exit 44- I-64/77 in Beckley, WV.

name: Holler: Contemporary Art Gallery
description: Holler shows and sells the work of Appalachian artists in multiple genres, from traditional folk craft (such as pottery, quilting, and glasswork) to contemporary visions of the region. Contemporary art includes painting, sculpture, installation, video work & film, performance, and experimental media.

name: Holly Gray Park
description: A family outdoor recreation center with rustic camping sites, bathhouse and restrooms nearby. Resident camp facility with sleeping quarters for up to 125, a council circle, plus Holly Gray Center dining facility with seating for up to 150. Picnic area, shelters, pavilion, horse show ring, and two ponds stocked for fishing. County fairground. Call today for rental options!

name: Holly Meadows Golf Course
description: The nine-hole municipal golf course Holly Meadows in Parsons, West Virginia features 2,997 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 36. The course rating is 34.7 and it has a slope rating of 116.

name: Holly River Restaurant
description: The Holly River Restaurant, located in Holly River State Park, has been included as one of the "101 Unique Places to Dine in West Virginia" several times. Featured menu items include homemade bread, blackberry cobbler, lasagna, rhubarb pie and roast beef sandwiches.
address: 680 State Park Rd, Hacker Valley, WV, 26222

name: Holly River State Park
description: With 8,101 acres of dense forest, Holly River is West Virginia’s second largest state park. Recreational opportunities in this park include camping, hiking, swimming and tennis. Amenities include picnic shelters, the Holly River Restaurant and corrals for campers with horses. Holly River State Park’s campground has 88 units with electric hookups, picnic tables and cooking grills. A dumping station and four-centralized bathhouses are available as well as two coin-operated washers and dryers. Only one tent or trailer is allowed per site. The campground is open spring through fall, weather permitting. Campsites may be reserved anytime online, by phone, or at the campground office. Holly River State Park’s 10 cabins are the definition of cozy. Constructed of natural stone and logs, these cabins are surrounded by a dense forest of rhododendron and sturdy hemlock. These cabins are set up to accommodate either two or four people. Designated pet-friendly cabins are available. Cabins 1 through 9 are available from April through November, and Cabin 10 is available year-round. Cabins 6, 9 and 10 are pet-friendly. Check in begins at 4 p.m., and check out is by 10 a.m. for all cabins.
address: 680 State Park Rd., Hacker Valley, WV, 26222

name: Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races
description: Just a one-hour drive from the Baltimore and DC beltways, Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races offers visitors 2,500 slot machines, 87 table games, 24 poker tables, and both live and simulcast thoroughbred horse racing. Amenities include a luxury hotel, a 1,200 seat Event Center featuring national acts, and the award-winning Final Cut Steakhouse.

name: Homer Laughlin China Company
description: Home of world famous Fiesta Dinnerware, tours of the Homer Laughlin China Company Factory can be reserved at 1-800-452-4462 (Option #1). The factory tour takes approximately one hour and includes a visit to the company museum, featuring displays from 146 years of Homer Laughlin China history.
