name: Homestead Inn Motel
description: The Homestead Inn Motel in Petersburg, West Virginia features large (14x26) rooms with refrigerator, microwave, coffee service, cable, WIFI, Continental breakfast and daily maid service. This Two-Star AAA rated motel also features a small craft shop, available tourist information, and a beautiful landscaped farm view.

name: HoneyBaked Ham of Huntington
description: Locally owned and operated, HoneyBaked Ham of Huntington offers dinner options, freshly made sandwiches, box lunches, spiral-sliced ham, tender turkey breast, side dishes and gourmet desserts perfect for everything from picnics to board meetings.
address: 6007 US Route 60 East, Suite 222, Barboursville, WV, 25705

name: Hoot’s Bar and Grill
description: This slopeside, casual bar & restaurant is located at the Top of the World Complex at Snowshoe Mountain. It’s great place to grab a quick breakfast or smashed burger during the day. At night, you can catch great tunes from the area’s favorite DJs.

name: Horseshoe Creek Riding Stable
description: Horseshoe Creek Riding Stable offers one, two and three hour scenic trail rides as well as half day, all day and overnight excursions around the New River Gorge and the Gauley River. Horseshoe Creek also features pony, carriage and specialty rides by request.

name: Horseshoe Recreation and Campground Area
description: There are 25 single sites. Sites 6 -10 are reservable, but all other sites are on a first come, first serve basis. Each campsite has a parking spur, table, fire ring, tent pad, and lantern holder. Most campsites are suitable for both tent and trailer camping and can accommodate a 53 foot tow vehicle combination. Sites 9 and 10 are more wheelchair accessible than other sites. There is a large open field for horseshoe games and field sports. We have a small and a large picnic pavilion available for rental. The large electric pavilion has an occupancy limit of 75, and the small non-electric pavilion has an occupancy limit of 10. Additionally, we have drinking water, vault and flush toilets, electric and non-electric sites, as well as walk-in sites.

name: Hospice Care Thrift Shop
description: A non-profit business with all proceeds benefiting patient care. Open Monday through Friday 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Hospice Care Thrift Shop provides estate sales, gift wrapping, and estimates to customers.

name: Hostetler’s Country Store
description: Hostetler's Country Store in Bruceton Mills, West Virginia features a wide variety of West Virginia gourmet food and wines, WVU souvenirs and made in West Virginia products including Fenton Glass, pottery, soap, etc.
address: P.O. Box 142, Morgantown St., Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: Hot Stuffed Pizza
description: Hot Stuffed Pizza is located in Franklin With a Drive Thru.

name: Hovatters Wildlife Zoo
description: Featuring an assortment of both exotic and West Virginia wildlife, Hovatter's Wildlife Zoo allows visitors to feed animals like black and grizzly bears, monkeys, raccoons and several farm animals. Baby animals for sale when available. Photo opportunities taken with exotic baby animals when available.

name: H&S Sporting Goods
description: We are a sporting goods dealer in Princeton WV. If you are from around the area, you may have been by the shop. We are the area’s largest tackle store. If you want it we probably have it or can get it for you. We stock A full line of Browning clothing, knives, firearms and safes. We have been a PSE authorized dealer for over 27 years and also have a bow shop to tune your new bow. We stock Triton Bass Boats and Alumacraft Jon Boats. Owned and operated by Howard Hill.

name: HST Group Travels
description: HST offers a special selection of hotels in select areas, working with people, attractions, restaurants, and hotels to offer customized entertainment and special meal options for group tours.

name: Huffman House
description: The Huffman House is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood just outside of Parkersburg, West Virginia. Family owned for 65 years, it's a quaint country setting only two miles from town. The first-floor has been renovated into an executive suite with all necessities and is a great setting for a wedding party, businessperson or vacationer. Rented for extended stays by the week or month.

name: Hughes River – WMA
description: Hughes River Wildlife Management Area is a public hunting and fishing area located off of WV State Rt 47 east of Parkersburg, or West Virginia Rt. 53 which borders the southern portion of the area. Terrain ranges from river bottoms to steep slopes with mature oak or hickory and a patchwork of young pine-hardwood stands. Fishing opportunities include muskie, spotted bass, small mouth bass, channel and flat-head catfish, rock bass, and several species of sunfish. Hunting prospects include deer, grouse rabbit, squirrel, turkey. Camping is not permitted.

name: Hungry Beech Preserve
description: The Hungry Beech Preserve is open to the public for hiking and nature study. A loop trail will take the visitor through a variety of habitats, and the best way to begin the trail is to walk through the ridgetop fields to the barn. At the barn you will see the trail head sign and the trail then descends into woods, where dramatic sandstone outcrops can be seen. Although there is not a trail to the oldest stands of trees, it is a brief woodland walk to explore the site. The main trail then ends back in the ridge meadow.

name: Hunter Company of WV
description: Hunter Company of West Virginia is a Land Subdivider and Developer of residential, business and industry real estate located in Hedgesville, West Virginia.

name: Hunting Regulations
description: Please refer to the West Virginia Hunting Regulations handbook published by the West Virginia Division of Natural Resources or contact the DNR for specific information on required hunting licenses and regulations. Contact number: 304-558-2771. Please visit our website for more information.

name: Huntington Ale House
description: Huntington Ale House features steaks, burgers, seafood and craft brews, as well as an extensive Mac & Cheese menu. Catering available. Forty-eight (48) beers on tap; over 90 varieties in all.

name: Huntington High Renaissance Center
description: The Huntington High Renaissance Center is a multipurpose community building that is a hub for visual and performing arts, YMCA activities, and provides residential units for senior citizens of Huntington. Formerly Huntington High School, the structure is a 4 1/2 story buff brick building in the Classical Revival style with 155,512 square feet of space. Built in 1916, the Renaissance Center is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

name: Huntington Holiday Inn & Suites – Civic Arena
description: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites in Huntington, West Virginia is located in the heart of downtown adjacent to the Big Sandy Superstore Arena and Pullman Square. Offering 135 guest rooms, including 21 two-room suites with microwave, refrigerator, wet bar, coffee service, ironing boards and WIFI, Huntington Holiday Inn & Suites also features a fully equipped business center and meeting room accommodations for up to 25. Also available are an indoor pool, well-appointed fitness center, The River Cafe, room service, complimentary parking and Huntington Airport shuttle service.

name: Huntington Mall
description: The Huntington Mall is the region's premier retail and entertainment destination with over 150 stores under one roof! Listed as the 2018 Best Shopping Mall in West Virginia by Business Insider and as the 2017 Best Place to Shop for Black Friday by USA Today.

name: Huntington Museum of Art
description: The Huntington Museum of Art features permanent displays of glass, British silver, portraits, antique firearms, Near Eastern artifacts, a tropical plant conservatory and nature trails.

name: Huntington Symphony Orchestra
description: The Huntington Symphony Orchestra was founded the 1930's, sometimes disbanding for several years, and sometimes reconstituted as a smaller chamber orchestra. Some of the musicians original with HSO through the 1950s remain today. HSO presents an average season of six classical and three pops concerts, held at the Keith Albee Theater in downtown Huntington and outdoor venues in the area.

name: Huntington Tri-State Airport (HTS)
description: Commercial Airlines: Allegiant - Orlando (SFB), Tampa Bay/St. Petersburg (PIE) SEASONAL: Myrtle Beach (MYR), Punta Gorda/Ft. Meyers (PGD) American Airlines - Charlotte (CLT) Car Rentals: Avis - 800-831-2847 Hertz - 800-654-3131 Enterprise - 800-325-8007 Nearby Cities/Attractions: (WV) Huntington - Marshall University, Keith-Albee Theatre, Shops at Heritage Station, Pullman Square, Ritter Park, Heritage Farm Museum & Village, Camden Park Nearby: Blenko Glass Factory, Gritt’s Farm, Ona Speedway

name: Hurricane Valley Community Center
description: In 2017, a $15 million renovation project is under way for new ball fields, a new playground, a community garden, and a new 30,000 square- foot community center and park shelters. A grand opening is scheduled for May 2018.

name: Huttonsville – WMA – Randolph
description: Huttonsville Wild Life Management Area is located in Randolph County just south of Huttonsville proper. This 2,720-acre area ranges across valley farmland and forested mountain slopes and can be accessed from State Route 219 or via State Route 250. Game hunted in the management area includes bear, deer, turkey, mourning dove, and waterfowl. The Huttonsville Correctional Center is located within the boundary, and safety zones encircling the center are strictly enforced by security patrols. Camping is prohibited.

name: I-64 Eastbound Welcome Center
description: Stop in and speak to our knowledgeable Welcome Center staff about all your Almost Heaven travel needs. Staffed hours are from 8:00am – 6:00pm. We have free highway maps, travel guides and brochures available to you on site. If the Welcome Center is closed and you need more information, go to wvtourism.com or call 1-800-CALL WVA. For highway information, please dial 511 or go to wv511.org. Amenities include: • Free WiFi • Restrooms (Open 24/7) • Vending machines • Picnic tables • Grills • 82nd Airborne Memorial • Pet area
address: I-64 Eastbound Mile Marker 10, Huntington, WV, 25701

description: Stop in and speak to our knowledgeable Welcome Center staff about all your Almost Heaven travel needs. Staffed hours are from 8:00 am - 6:00 pm. description: Stop in and speak to our knowledgeable Welcome Center staff about all your Almost Heaven travel needs. Staffed hours are from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. name: I-77 Speedway
description: I-77 Speedway is a 3/8 mile clay, oval stock car racing track located in Jackson County, WV. I-77 is excited to bring you a fun and exciting upcoming race season. Our goal is to provide family-oriented entertainment, while maintaining the integrity of a top-rate race track. Come see some of the tri-state's top drivers kick up dirt and battle it out for the finish.

name: I-79 Southbound Welcome Center
description: Stop in and speak to our knowledgeable Welcome Center staff about all your Almost Heaven travel needs. Staffed hours are from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. We have free highway maps, travel guides and brochures available to you on site. If the Welcome Center is closed and you need more information, go to wvtourism.com or call 1-800-CALL WVA. For highway information, please dial 511 or go to wv511.org. Amenities include: • Free WiFi • Restrooms (Open 24/7) • Vending machines • Picnic tables • Walking trail • Unobstructed views of mountains and foliage • Geocaches on site • RV dump station

description: Stop in and speak to our knowledgeable Welcome Center staff about all your Almost Heaven travel needs. Staffed hours are from 8:00 am - 6:00 pm. description: Stop in and speak to our knowledgeable Welcome Center staff about all your Almost Heaven travel needs. Staffed hours are from 8:00 am - 6:00 pm. address: Interstate 81 Southbound Mile Marker 25, Falling Waters, WV, 25419

name: Ice House Art Center
description: The Ice House is home to the Morgan Arts Council, the site of concerts, gallery exhibits, lectures, community theater, art & movement classes for adults and youth, and various community special events. The Ice House Co-op Gallery offers the work of more than 30 local and regional artisans.

name: Ice Mountain Preserve
description: Ice Mountain gets its name from the refrigeration effect that takes place inside its talus — a sloping mass of boulders at the foot of the mountain. In cooler months, dense, cold air sinks deep into the talus, and ice masses form inside. As the weather warms up, the cooler air flows out of vents among the rocks at the bottom of the slope. The preserve protects a collection of boreal plants usually found much further north. Sustained by the cool air flowing from some 60 small holes and openings at the base of the talus, species such as twinflower, dwarf dogwood, Canada mayflower, and bristly rose all can be found here. The 149-acre preserve also provides habitat for breeding neotropical birds such as warblers, vireos and thrushes, as well as a collection of birds and animals that are typical of the Central Appalachians.
address: CO Route 45/20, North River Mills, WV, 26711

name: Ichiban
description: Ichiban Pan American restaurant features sushi, steaks, seafood and an elegant bar and wine list with an upscale Asian flare.

name: Ihlenfeld Dining Room
description: Overlooking Schenk Lake and offering a commanding view of the surrounding countryside at Oglebay is the Ihlenfeld Dining Room in Wilson Lodge . Diners in November and December will see the Festival of Lights transform the hillside into a magnificent display each evening. Private dining rooms are also available.

name: In-Fusion
description: In-Fusion is a dining venue exclusively for adults 21 years and older located in the the Casino Club at The Greenbrier offering a variety of small plates from various parts of China, Japan, Korea and Thailand designed to allow the entire table a sampling of Pacific Rim cuisines.
address: The Greenbrier, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Indian Water Maple Company
description: Producers of pure West Virginia maple syrup and sugar maple products. Off season please call: 304-788-1831.
address: 1761 Burgess Hollow Rd., New Creek, WV, 26743

name: Inn at Mountain Quest
description: The Inn at Mountain Quest has been welcoming guests since 1892, when it was built by Samuel Gibson and quickly became an important social gathering spot for the community. Today, the Inn continues this long tradition of supporting the community, offering special events throughout the year and travelers a peaceful place to relax in a nostalgic setting.

name: International Mother’s Day Shrine
description: The small railroading town of Grafton was the birthplace of Mother's Day, founded by Miss Anna Jarvis May 10, 1908, at Andrews Methodist Episcopal Church. This historic building, erected in 1873, now serves as a monument to Mother's Day, and is a Registered Historic Landmark.

name: Irish Pub on Washington St.
description: America's coolest small town's favorite pub! Authentic Irish experience featuring live Celtic music, homemade food and a great variety of premium beers and spirits. Smoke-free, family friendly atmosphere. Céad míle fáilte!

name: Muddy Creek Falls
description: Home to the historic Virginia Furnace, Muddy Creek is a roadside park along Route 26 that can be found on the National Register of Historic Places. While the furnace is an impressive heritage site, it also boasts rapids known as Muddy Creek Falls. With a small parking lot along with access to a picnic area, the falls offer a stunning snapshot when the water is running just right.

name: Iron Horse Tavern
description: The Iron Horse Tavern specializes in West Virginia craft beer, specialty cocktails and unique pub fare. Located at the bottom of High St. across from Hotel Morgan. Join us for one of the best selections of local craft beer in West Virginia! Open 7 days a week + brunch!

name: Iron Road Inn & Lodge
description: The Iron Road Inn is independently owned and operated to host a pleasant, clean and comfortable stay! Newly renovated Railroad-themed Inn and Lodge located in Elkins, West Virginia, near Durbin & Greenbrier Valley Railroad. Iron Road Inn features 45 Inn interior rooms and 18 Lodge rooms with exterior entrances. All are non-smoking, some handicapped compliant and pet friendly. All rooms offer WiFi, cable with HBO, micro-fridge, coffee maker, monitored smoke and CO2 detectors. Most units have private bathrooms with separate vanity. Front desk is open 24/7. What we have to offer: *Connecting rooms available at the Inn and in the Lodge * Spacious double and queen rooms, some with kitchenette suites – many rooms have separate in-room vanity with a full bath – 3 handicap rooms w/ spacious baths! * A special king suite named in honor of Marilyn Monroe (With the perks she would expect; Balcony, Jacuzzi and Kitchenette!) *PET FRIENDLY ROOMS AVAILABLE! *Complimentary Continental Breakfast * Ample parking for automobiles and tour buses * The “Station Room,” decorated with original murals by a talented local artist, offers space to meet, greet and relax. Station Room exits to a nice private patio for cool evening. * Adjacent to the Gandy Dancer Dinner Theater and Western Steer Steakhouse; close to the American Mountain Theater, the Durbin & Greenbrier Valley Railroad, the Monongahela National Forest, and available to the popular vacation sights in Randolph, Pocahontas, Pendleton and Tucker County.

name: Isaiah Morgan Distillery
description: An Appalachian tradition turns legal. Small batches of Corn Whiskey, crafted beyond the watchful eyes of 'revenuers', is part of the lore of the region. Today tourists can observe the crafting of the Southern Moon, Rye, and Grappa at the distillery and purchase a souvenir of their personal glimpse of mountain history and culture. No visit to the area can be considered complete without a visit to this historic site. 100ml and 750ml Bottles of Southern Moon, Rye and Grappa spirits can be purchased on-site! Small batches of Corn Whiskey, crafted beyond the watchful eyes of ‘revenuers’, is part of the lore of the region. Rodney Facemire brought the business into the daylight when he obtained the license for the nations smallest still in 2002. Isaiah Morgan products were available in state licensed spirits retailers, but couldn’t be sold at the site of their creation, disappointing many tourists. Rodney conceived the vision of mini-distilleries, formed a team of government and business leaders and created what can become a new industry for the state. Today tourists can observe the crafting of the Southern Moon, Rye, and Grappa at the distillery and purchase a souvenir of their personal glimpse of mountain history and culture. The winery is located 1/2 miles off Rt. 19 North of Summersville on Phillips Run Road. 1 Mile off of Rte. 19 in the beautiful rolling farm land of Phillips Run. We produce 35 different wines. Our gift shop is open daily from 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. and Sundays from 1 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. Tastings are free. Tours available upon request.

name: Island Campground (USDA Forest Service)
description: Adjacent to Long Run and the East Fork of the Greenbrier River, this primitive campground is a favorite among fisherman. Campground Camping: There are 10 small-sized drive-in tent sites and two walk-in tent sites. Each campsite has a table, lantern holder, fire ring and one vault toilet. RV Camping: There are 10 small-sized drive-in RV sites. Each campsite has a table, lantern holder, and fire ring. There are no electric or water hook-ups available. There are no waste stations on site. Located approximately 5 miles north and east of Bartow, West Virginia.

name: Italian Grille & Deli
description: The Italian Grille and Deli, located in Putnam Village Shopping Center, is a family-owned and operated restaurant specializing in homemade Italian Cuisine. All dishes and pizzas are made to order using the healthiest and freshest ingredients available. The Meatballs, Stuffed Peppers, Eggplant Parm, and Grandma's Italian Cream Cake are among the many dishes made from scratch. Our Salmon and Steak are also customer favorites. Come be our guests for dinner - homemade takes a little longer, but it's worth the wait.
address: 17 Putnam Village Shopping Center, Hurricane, WV, 17 Putnam Village Shopping Center

name: Jack Horner’s Corner
description: Last minute convenience and gift shop, bike and canoe rental. Some fast food and pizza available.

name: Jackson Cemetery
description: The family plot is the final resting place of Gen. Thomas “Stonewall” Jackson’s great-grandparents, father and sister. Clarksburg, W.Va., (between Cherry St. and Charleston Ave.)

name: Jackson Rose Bed & Breakfast
description: Circa 1795. "Stonewall" Jackson's first Civil War headquarters. An elegant Federal-Style home with modern-day comforts but the quiet grace of long ago. The perfect retreat from your daily hassles. Enjoy gas fires in cold weather, the front porch and gardens in fair and a lavish breakfast year-round. All three of our guest rooms are equipped with queen-size beds, private baths, A/C and the warmth of home.
address: 1167 W. Washington St., Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Jane Lew Dairy King
address: 100 Hackers Creek Rd., Jane Lew, WV, 26378

name: Jane Lew Restaurant
description: Serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.

name: Jane V. Jewelers Direct Jewelry Outlet
description: Some of the lowest prices on fine diamonds, gemstones, and gold jewelry. Open Mon. - Fri. 10 a.m. - 6 p.m. and Sat. 10 a.m. - 3 p.m.

name: Jason’s Antiques
description: Antiques, crafts, collectibles.
address: 1343 W. Washington St., Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Jay’s Daily Grind
description: The finest Italian coffee and espresso, plus one of Morgantown's best sandwiches, served with a smile and a front-row seat to WVU's downtown campus. Open Mon. - Fri.: 7:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.; Sat. 9 a.m. - 3 p.m.

name: Jefferson Arts Council
description: Our Mission: Maximize the impact of the Arts in our community. Create Arts based cultural alliances. Provide direct grants to promote Arts education and projects. JAC promotes the arts by creating cultural partnerships that enhance the quality of life in Jefferson County, WV.

name: Jefferson County Courthouse
description: Built on land donated by George Washington’s youngest brother Charles, this 1836 Greek Revival brick building was the site for the famous trial of John Brown in 1859. During the Civil War it served as a barracks for Union troops.
address: 100 East Washington St., Charles Town, WV, 25414

name: Jefferson County CVB
description: With scenic beauty, outdoor adventure, history, relaxation and luxury, Jefferson County offers something for everyone. From the excitement of the Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races to River Riders Family Adventure Resort – you can define your own adventure. If strolling small towns is more your speed, visit the historic cities of Harpers Ferry, Charles Town and Shepherdstown. After all the excitement and adventure, relaxation will come easy while staying at one of the county’s luxury inns, cozy B&Bs or boutique hotels.

name: Jennie’s Bed and Breakfast
description: Built in 1910 and located just blocks away from downtown Parkersburg, Jennie's Bed and Breakfast is a cozy spot in Almost Heaven.

name: Jenny Lind Antiques Collectibles & Pretty Things
Jen’s Southern BBQ, LLC
description: Featuring BBQ Ribs, Hand Pulled Pork, Wings, Daily Specials, Family Deals, Desserts, and Much More! Catering available. Dine in or Carry Out. Call ahead or Fax your carry out orders and we will have it ready for you. Jen’s Southern BBQ is independently owned and operated. All of our food is specially prepared by the owner. Open 10:30AM - 8:00 PM

name: Jerico Bed & Breakfast and Pre-Civil War Cabins
description: Jerico offers nine pre-Civil War log cabins with private outdoor hot tubs, fireplaces, outdoor fire pits, gas grill, cable TV with VCR/DVD, all of which are handicap accessible, 1/2 mile from the Greenbrier River Trail and 22 miles from Snowshoe Ski Resort. Also available are five bed and breakfast rooms with private bathrooms, cable TV, hot tub access and WIFI. Room rates include a full hot breakfast. Motorcycle & Pet Friendly. Group Rates. River or Mountain views available. Open 24/7, 365 days a year. Office hours 9:00 am - 5:00 pm. Drive-ins welcome.

name: Jerry Run Summer Theater
description: Rustic indoor music venue located in rural northern Webster County near Holly River State Park. Features live, mainly acoustic music on most Saturday (and occasionally Friday) evenings beginning at 7 p.m. from late April through early October. Concession stand, no alcohol, family friendly.

name: Jerry Stout Cabins
description: Jerry Stout Cabins are located between Stonecoal and Stonewall Jackson Lake on 34 acres of Lewis County, WV, offering fishing, boating, swimming, and golfing opportunities, as well as access to a public hunting area, antique shops in Weston, WV, and the West Virginia Wildlife Center at French Creek. Two night minimum stay. Directions: Take I-79 to exit 99 to Route US 33. Go East toward Buckhannon. At Georgetown Road turn right and go four miles to Linger Run Road. Go 1/4 mile, and turn left on Hershman Run. For reservations: Tuesday through Friday 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. Saturday 8:00 a.m. - noon; closed Sunday and Monday.

name: Jerry’s Flies
description: Jerry's Flies designs, field tests and produces top quality in-line spinners and fly combinations for people who enjoy fishing. Open Monday - Friday 8:00 am - 6:00 pm; Saturday 8:00 am - 4:00 pm; Sunday - closed. DEALERS WELCOME
address: PO Box 1215, 150 Lake Road, Bridgeport, WV, 26330

name: Jerry’s Sporting Goods
description: Jerry's Sporting Goods offers an indoor shooting range, a bow and arrow range, a snack bar, and a large selection of Carhartt clothing as well as hunting and fishing supplies. Also offers three cabins for rent on a weekend, weekly or nightly basis. Open Monday through Sunday 8:00 am - 10:00 pm.

name: Jersey Subs
description: Making only the best hot and cold subs. At Jersey’s Subs & Pizza, we use ONLY Boars Head brand meats and cheeses, the finest in the delicatessen industry. We insist on only the freshest products which is why we will always make your order in front of you to your specifications. Nothing is ever pre-sliced or frozen. Enjoy our salads, sides, pizza & specialty pies, desserts, and our famous subs! Open 7 days a week from 11 a.m. - 9 p.m.

name: Jess Judy Group Campground
description: The campground has three primitive group sites that can accommodate up to 40 people each. No drinking water is available, so please bring your own supply. Accessible vault toilets are provided. Open late May - late October.
address: Smoke Hole Road, County Route 2, Upper Tract, WV, 26866

name: JesterLine Gaming
description: JesterLine is WV's FIRST eSports & Virtual Reality center, located in downtown Buckhannon. JesterLine is a family-friendly gaming center located in downtown Buckhannon. We offer several gaming platforms for all ages and all skill sets. From our interactive Lumo area to our competitive eSports, there is something for everyone. What you will find at JesterLine: 20 - MSI gaming PC's 6 - HTC Vive Pro's 4 - Nintendo Switches 4 - PS4's 3 - Lumo interactive game stations An event room or parties, meetings, or other events Free WiFi Come check out WV's FIRST eSport & VR center!

name: Jim Surkamp Tours
description: Jim Surkamp Tours offers tours of Harper's Ferry, Charles Town, Shepherdstown, and Antietam National Battlefield.

name: Jimmy’s Diner
description: Feel like one of the family when you stop at Jimmy’s. Specialties include all the Italian favorites and the Rosi—a homemade sausage sandwich served with your choice of peppers.

name: Jim’s Camping & Storage
description: Jim's Camping and Storage offers primitive and RV campsites on the Mud River. We have 98 sites available for all types of campers including folding tent campers and tent camping. 52 sites are full hookups available year-round. Facility includes a shower house, coin operated laundry, LP fill station, dump station, RV storage, WiFi at every site, WiFi at park supports mobile devices, 2 devices supported per Overnite Site, firewood for sale, and a pavilion. Both full and seasonal hookups offered nightly, weekly and monthly.

name: Jim’s Drive In
description: Drive-up restaurant with an old-time drive-in feel. Hamburgers, homemade chili, BBQ, English style hotdogs and ice cream brought right to your car. Car service or take-out. Mon-Tues & Thurs-Sat 10:30-5, Wed 10:30-2:30 As seen on Food Network's Southern Fried Road Trip.

name: Jim’s Steak And Spaghetti House
description: Jim's Steak and Spaghetti House of Huntington offers its famous spaghetti, haddock fish sandwiches, and homemade pie by the slice in a family atmosphere that has traditionally served as a meeting place for Huntingtonians and out-of-town visitors for decades. Children's menu available. Open Tuesdays through Saturdays 11:00 am - 9:00 pm. Closed Sundays and Mondays.

name: JM Catering LLC
description: Full Service Catering and Event Production for private parties, the film industry and weddings or corporate functions-we also offer a cabin provisioning service as well as private chef services. Culinary Adventures and Feast in the Field (meals created using sustainable and local foods) programs offered seasonally. Accommodations available.

name: JoDia’s Country Kitchen, Inc.
description: Old Style Country Cooking

name: Joe Fazio’s Restaurant
description: Dine in true Italian atmosphere at Joe Fazio's Little Italy. Pizza, pasta, spaghetti & meatballs, steaks and chicken. Carry out available, seating for 250, all legal beverages.

name: Joe N’ Throw Co-Op
description: Coffee Shop and Pottery Studio committed to quality coffee and craft beer in downtown Fairmont, WV. Coffee is roasted a block away at our coffee roaster, Stone Tower Joe. 2015 WV Living Magazine Best Coffee Shop.

name: John Brown Fort
description: On the National Register of Historic Places, this site is where John Brown, his sons, and at least five black men attempted to seize the federal arsenal at Harpers Ferry October 16, 1859 in an effort to instigate an armed insurrection of slaves and abolitionists. John Brown and his men were captured in the building and Brown was hanged in Charles Town on December 2, 1859.

name: John Henry Statue
description: According to legend, "Steel-Drivin' Man" John Henry was seven feet tall and could do the work of 30 ordinary men. Henry was said to have died shortly after proving he could outwork the new steam-powered drill in cutting the Big Bend tunnel of the C&O Railroad in Talcott, West Virginia. In 1996, the U.S. Postal Service memorialized this legend by dedicating a postage stamp in his honor. A statue of Henry towers atop the mountain on Route 3 through which the railroad tunnel runs.

name: John Mathias Homestead
description: John Mathias House, also known as Mathias Homestead, is a historic home located at Mathias, Hardy County, West Virginia, consisting of two sections, one built about 1797 and the second about 1825. The two hewn-log sections are joined by a frame "dog trot," or what has been referred to locally as the "entry." The older section is two stories with a double porch and slightly taller than the newer section. It was home to the Mathias family for 165 years before being deeded to the Mathias Civic Center Association in 1974. This home is open for tours only during certain times of the year. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1978.
address: State Road 259 & Howards Lick Rd., Mathias, WV, 26812

name: John Wesley Methodist Church
description: John Wesley Methodist Church in Lewisburg, West Virginia is a circa 1820 colonial- Greek Revival style brick church featuring a cupola belfry, high ceilings and slave galleries. Additions were made to the front in 1835. In May 1862 during the Battle of Lewisburg the John Wesley Church was struck by a cannonball fired from Confederate artillery, striking the outer wall of the church near the gallery stairs. Following the battle the church was used as a hospital treating wounded from both sides of the conflict. Today, the John Wesley Church is listed on the National Register of Historic Places and is still used as a house of worship.

name: Jones Cabin Run Winery
description: Jones Cabin Run Winery is a boutique vintner producing dry, semi-dry, sweet table and dessert wines. Limited production of Norton, Chambourcin, Vignoles, Late Harvest Vignoles, Ice Wine, Elderberry And Black Currant varieties.

name: Jug
description: A casual eating establishment in Middlebourne, West Virginia featuring hot dogs, hamburgers and fries.

name: Jules Enchanting Gifts
description: Jules Enchanting Gifts carries a unique selection of gifts and collectibles from around the world.

name: Julia-Ann Historic Square District
description: Step into the past with a self-guided tour of Victorian grandeur. These were the homes of some of the most influential figures in West Virginia's early history. Garden and Christmas home tours take place annually.

name: Julio’s Cafe
description: A family-owned restaurant offering a fine dining or casual atmosphere featuring delicious old-world recipes handed down through generations. Offers gourmet and Italian cuisine from fresh veal and steak to fresh seafood and all types of pastas, soups and desserts, as well as a children's menu.

name: Junction Restaurant & Saloon
description: Experience Snowshoe Mountain’s most unique dining experience! Take a step back in time to an old rail yard and logging town. History of the area adorns the walls while the chefs cook up some homestyle delights.

name: K & K Music
description: K&K Music designs, delivers and sets up home game room products, including pool tables, lamps, bar stools, shuffleboard, college, NFL and NBA items, jukeboxes, pinball, air hockey, foosball, ping pong and retro arcade favorites.

name: Kalico Kitchen
description: Saturday nights are “rib nights” at Kalico Kitchen. Enjoy your ribs with all the fixings, and while you’re there be sure to try the homemade biscuits and some of the best blackberry cobbler in the state. Stop in for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Open Monday - Saturday 6:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. and Sunday 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.

name: Kanawha County Public Library
description: The state's largest public library system has one Main Library, one bookmobile, nine branches and one affiliate. Residents from all 55 West Virginia counties are represented among our 100,000 patrons. The library maintains more than 600,000 items in the collection -- 350,000 items are housed at the Main Library, and the rest are distributed throughout the system. Each year our libraries experience nearly 1 million patron visits, and more than 1 million items are checked out. Resources offered to the public include: Books; Music; Research Tools and Resources; Magazines; Video E-books; Audio Books; Downloadables; Learning Lab; Business Resource Center; Classes. Main Library Hours: SUN: 1 p.m. – 5 p.m. MON: 9 a.m. – 9 p.m TUES: 9 a.m. – 9 p.m. WED: 9 a.m. – 9 p.m. THUR: 9 a.m. – 9 p.m. FRI: 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. SAT: 9 a.m. – 5 p.m.

name: Kanawha Falls Public Fishing Access
description: DNR wildlife resources public fishing access site. Ramp: Concrete 1-Lane Car Parking: 35 spaces Lot Type: Asphalt Restrooms: Portajohn Lighting Potable Water Handicap Parking Handicap Fishing Access for all boats. Location: US 60 W 9.5 mi. to Montgomery site is on Montgomery side of US 61 bridge. Contact Office: Wildlife Resources 2006 Robert C. Byrd Drive Beckley, WV 25801 (304) 256-6947

name: Kanawha Falls
description: Easily viewable from scenic Route 60, just below the junction of the New and Gauley Rivers, Kanawha Falls awaits. Though these shelves are short, the falls stretch out along the length of the Kanawha River, creating an impressive sight. Kanawha Falls provides the perfect backdrop for a day of fishing or canoeing in Almost Heaven.

name: Kanawha Players
description: KP is the one of the oldest, continuously operating amateur theatre company in the country. It has produced a season of live productions since 1922. The mission of Kanawha Players is to produce quality theater in a nurturing community environment, while providing a place for education, training and encouragement to those interested in participating in the dramatic arts. So come play with us and enjoy the opportunities that the theatre can bring, you’ll meet new friends and make memories that last a lifetime! Unless otherwise noted (i.e., Briefs and Shorts), all performances take place on stage of the Charleston Civic Center Little Theater at 8:00 p.m.

name: Kanawha State Forest
description: The 9,300-acre forest is noted among naturalists for its diverse wildflower and bird populations. Rich cove forest sites provide nesting habitat for 19 species of wood warblers, a feature which draws birders from as far away as Canada. The forest offers some of West Virginia’s best special hikes in winter, spring and fall. A playground attracts families during the summer season and the fully equipped campground is one of the few in the Charleston area. 46 Sites, 25 of which have electricity and water hookups, cater to camper units of 26-feet or less, pop-up and tent camping. Each campsite has a fireplace and picnic table The campground has two bathhouses and a coin operated laundry. Campers can enjoy hiking, playground areas, fishing, biking and more. Firewood and ice are available. A dump station is available for campground guests. The campground is open April to December, weather permitting.
address: 7500 Kanawha State Forest Drive, Charleston, WV, 25314

name: Kanawha Watersports
description: Nestled between the scenic mountains and located on the Kanawha River, Kanawha Watersports offers everything you need for a day of waterskiing, wakeboarding, tubing or stand-up paddleboarding. Whether you are a beginner looking for lessons, or an experienced skier or boarding looking for a tow, Kanawha Watersports is your one stop destination.
address: Located on the Kanawha River, Winfield, WV, 25213

name: Kathy’s Riverside Diner
description: Local diner serving home cooked meals, desserts and sandwiches.

name: Kazaam’s Family Entertainment Center
description: Located Across The Street From Red Lobster. Admission Is Always Free. Giant Soft Play Center With Tubes And Slides, State-of-the-art Arcades With Great Prizes & Redemption center, Toddler Play Area, Food Menu, 4 Spacious Birthday Rooms. Hours: Sunday - Thursday 11:00 Am - 9:00 Pm. Friday & Saturday 10:00 Am -10:00 Pm. Private Party Rentals Available. Group and Field trip rates.

name: Kegler’s
description: Kegler’s is the premiere location for Sports in Morgantown. Our smoke-free facility features more than 20 Hi-Definition TVs, including three 80 inch LED TVs, covering Major League Baseball, NFL Football, NBA Basketball, NHL Hockey, UFC Ultimate Fighting and NCAA Sports. We feature a full menu from our award-winning wings to our New York Strip, 10 Appetizers, Burgers, Salads, Wraps, Kegler’s Specialties, 8 beers on tap and 39 bottled selections. Hours: Mon-Fri: 11 a.m. - 1 a.m.; Sat-Sun: 11 a.m. - 2 a.m.
address: 735 Chestnut Ridge Rd., Ste. A, Morgantown, WV, 26505

name: Keith-Albee Theatre
description: Regarded as one of West Virginia’s most distinctive landmarks, Huntington’s Keith-Albee Theatre was built by the Greater Huntington Theatre Corporation in 1928. Thomas W. Lamb, one of America’s foremost theatre architects, designed the Keith-Albee in the ornate Spanish Baroque style. The remarkably well-preserved structure includes a four-story dressing room tower and fully equipped, “fly-system” theatrical stage as well as a gigantic retractable motion picture screen and a top quality theatre organ. When completed, the “atmospheric” theatre seated 2,633 patrons in a simulated courtyard beneath a starlit sky. Today, the theatre is owned and operated by the Keith-Albee Performing Arts Center Foundation. The Keith-Albee’s importance to the community and region remains enormous as it continues to feature a range of outstanding national and local productions and film festivals. It is also a popular setting for benefits, conferences and weddings. Box Office is located in Marshall University's Joan C. Edwards Performing Arts Center, open 12:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. Box Office at Keith-Albee open day of show one hour before show time.

name: Kenco Farms Meadery
description: Our five tasty wines are: Blackberry, Blueberry, Raspberry, Cyser, and of course MEAD!

name: Kenova’s Famous Griffith Pumpkin House
description: The centerpiece of the Ceredo-Kenova AutumnFest is the famous Pumpkin House, which has become one of the favorite tourist attractions of West Virginia. In 1978, the Pumpkin House began with only 5 pumpkins carved for a Halloween display. Since then, the number of hand-carved pumpkins has grown to 3,000. Each year Ceredo and Kenova welcome nearly 30,000 visitors to the Pumpkin House. Over the years, we have watched children that have visited the Pumpkin House grow to have children of their own that they now bring to see the display. Be sure to take advantage of the food vendors located at the Pumpkin House on Beech Street in Kenova.

name: Keyser Inn
description: Clean affordable lodging one and a half miles south of Keyser. 44 guests rooms including: complimentary WIFI & HBO, microwaves & mini refrigerators in every room, large truck parking, free local calls, free continental breakfast & guest computer! Laundry facilities are also available. We are a smoke free facility!

name: Kimball ATV Hideaway
description: Kimball ATV Hideaway is owned and operated by ATV enthusiasts. Their goal is to provide you with a comfortable place that feels like home. With five cottages carefully placed near the trails you won’t have to travel far to have fun. All locations have direct access to all the local trails with no trailering needed.

name: Kimball World War I Memorial
description: The Kimball World War Memorial was the first memorial built in the United States to honor African-American veterans of World War I. The Classical Revival style building, designed by noted West Virginia architect Hassel T. Hicks of Welch, was completed in 1928 and listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1993. The War Memorial became the headquarters of the nation’s first all-black American Legion Post and hosted some of the state’s first NAACP meetings. Originally, the building housed an auditorium with a small stage, a library, meeting rooms, kitchen facilities, a billiard room and a trophy room, with displays of plaques dedicated to veterans, and wartime memorabilia. It was a multi-purpose facility, hosting such diverse activities as American Legion meetings, high school proms, wedding receptions, and performances by Cab Calloway and other well-known entertainers of the day. The Kimball War Memorial was a focal point of community life for decades, serving as a cultural and social center for all residents of McDowell County. Presently, The Kimball World War Memorial was serves as a living community resource and is available for a wide variety of functions, including tours, training sessions, classes, organizational meetings, organizational dinners and receptions as well as social events.

name: Kimono Japanese Seafood
description: Observe traditional Japanese hibachi and hand rolled fresh sushi prepared at the grill or sit at an intimate table for two.

name: Kin Ship
description: Kin Ship Goods is a brand of apparel, accessories, and home goods designed by Dan Davis & Hillary Harrison, based in Charleston, West Virginia. Our goods are inspired by starry nights, peeling paint, vintage keepsakes, imperfections, labors of love, and early mornings. You may have seen our work featured by Country Living Magazine, Apartment Therapy, Mod Cloth, and Design*Sponge.

name: King Tut Drive-In. Inc.
description: A Drive-In Restaurant dating back to the 1940's. Family owned since 1955. We focus on serving good food and make many of our menu items at the restaurant. Our recipes date back to the 1930's for some items. Homemade bread, pies, BBQ, Meatloaf, and other dinner items are popular. We serve hot dogs on English buns for which we have won multiple "people's Choice" awards over the years.

name: Kirk’s
description: Located in Hinton, Kirk's features an open-air patio overlooking the New River. A family restaurant, Kirk’s offers a full breakfast, lunch and dinner, three daily specials and homemade desserts. If you’re in the mood for home-style cooking then Kirk’s is the place to be.

name: Kirkwood Winery & Isaiah Morgan Distillery
description: Kirkwood Winery and Isaiah Morgan Distillery have a store where West Virginia made products are sold. You can purchase and taste wine and whiskey. You can see the Moonshine still and see the process of bottling our wine one at a time. We are a farm winery. Operating Schedule: Monday – Saturday, 9:00 am – 5:00 pm; Sunday, 1:00 pm – 5:00 pm Tours and Tastings Available
address: 45 Winery Lane, Phillips Run Road, Summersville, WV, 26651

name: Kissel Stop Cafe
description: Pleasant staff and inviting atmosphere are just two reasons the Kissel Stop Cafe is a great gathering place. The third is the delicious food, including the restaurant’s well-known homemade chicken salad. Here you will find a great assortment of Flavored Coffee, Loose Tea, Espresso, Smoothies and Cafe Style food. We offer complimentary WiFi for our customers. Housed in the original 1896 Opera House, the Kissel Stop Cafe is an Elkins must-see location.

name: Kitchen’s Orchard
description: We are only minutes from I-81 and between the communities of Hagerstown, MD and Martinsburg, WV. Because of our popularity and the quality of our products, we also serve many customers from the Winchester, VA area and parts of Western, MD and PA. We offer fruits and vegetables when in season grown on the farm and harvested from our orchards. Check out our fruit recipes on our recipe page. We also offer natural grown beef from our farm and seasonal flowers, plants, pumpkins, mums and other decorative items such as corn stalks, hay bales and gourds. Deer apples are available every Fall season! We are open seasonally featuring apples and peaches when available.

name: Kitten’s Korner Gift & Custom Frame Shoppe
description: State-of-the-art custom frame shop with signature Larson Juhl designer moldings and more. P. Buckley Moss and other outstanding regional art; engraveable Heartstrings jewelry and gift ware.
address: 159 Ingleside Ave., White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: KJ Associates
description: Your connection to group friendly West Virginia destinations.
address: 12 Brick Lane Ct, Cross Lanes, WV, 25313

name: Knapp’s Creek Trout Lodge
description: Knapps Creek Trout Lodge is a lodge and guiding service specializing in trout fishing and family-oriented outdoor adventures. Amidst the Monongahela National Forest in the Appalachian Mountains, it is our passion to help you enjoy all the area has to offer.

name: Knights Inn – Ghent
description: Number of units: 55 Facilities: AC, TV, cable, telephone, non-smoking rooms, handicapped facilities, truck parking, electric hookup for diesel, continental coffee and donuts, restaurant nearby. Credit cards: Yes. Location: i-77, exit 28, hotel is located right beside i-77 on the southbound side.

name: Knights Inn – Martinsburg
description: Limited service motel, we except pets. Pet rate $10/pet.

name: Knights Inn – Parkersburg
description: 51 rooms. Easily accessible to I-77, all ground-floor rooms with convenient parking. Meeting rooms, Jacuzzis, free local calls and data ports. Restaurants nearby.

name: Knotty Pine Lodge
description: The Knotty Pine Lodge located in Frazier's Bottom, West Virginia is a great place for weddings, reunions, retreats, company picnics, and parties. The Knotty Pine Lodge offers twelve beautifully decorated bedrooms and two master suites, all with private baths and beautiful scenic views. Three covered porches, fireplaces, kitchen with bar, dining and great room. Abundant space inside and out for your occasion.

name: Koolwink Hotel
description: The Koolwink Motel has been a family-owned business for 70 years. It first opened its doors to the traveling public as a tourist home in 1936. At present, the Koolwink Motel is a modern facility with a retro feel. This summer, step back in time and stay at this unique location.

name: Koolwink Motel
description: Romney's finest motel with modern amenities and retro 70's decor.
address: Rte. 50 East, HC Box 410, Romney, WV, 26757

name: Korner Shop Cafe
description: Experience the small town flavor of the place and the attention to the customer that makes a stranger feel welcome. Stop in to try their breakfast, lunch or dinner specials, including homemade soups, sandwiches and entrees in Franklin's oldest eatery.

name: Krodel Park Campground
description: The Campground, open from April 1 through October 31, has full hookups available at 64 sites. Fourteen winter sites are available. All have concrete runners and a patio with picnic table. A private bathhouse is in the camping area. Limited RV supplies and souvenirs are available at the office. Laundry facilities are available.The 22-acre lake is stocked each year by the West Virginia Department of Natural Resources.A playground located adjacent to the campground contains an obstacle course, swings, and a wooden climber and activity center. A clubhouse with kitchen and rest rooms facilities are available for rental. Also, five picnic shelters are available for rental. Located from I-77, exit 146 to State Rte. 2.

name: Kumbrabow State Forest
description: Located on top of Rich Mountain along the western edge of the Allegheny Highlands, Kumbrabow State Forest in Randolph County is West Virginia’s highest forest. With 9,474 acres of forest at an elevation of more than 3,000 feet above sea level, Kumbrabow is used for recreation, watershed protection, commercial forestry and wildlife management. Kumbrabow State Forest features six completely furnished pioneer cabins, open from April to the first week of December. The cabins are equipped with cooking utensils, dishes, flatware, bed linens, towels and outdoor charcoal grills. Mill Creek Campground offers 13 primitive sites and one large RV site, in pristine settings, near patches of Rhododendron and a native brook trout stream. The camp sites include a fire pit and picnic tables. Firewood can be purchased at the campground or at the office. The campground is open mid-April through the first week of December. Campsites may be reserved anytime online, by phone, or at the campground office. West Virginia State Park campground reservations are available from Memorial Day through Labor Day each year. Campgrounds are open on a first-come, first-serve basis after Labor Day.

name: L.G. Lamp Company
description: Specializing in handblown glass components created into striking lamps by local artisans. L.G. Lamp Company also carries Hinkle, Blenko and Pilgrim glass, and specializes in glass-shade replacement for other lamps and fixtures. Hours: Monday - Friday 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturday 10 a.m. to Noon, Closed Sundays Directions: Take Interstate 79 to exit 155, Star City. Cross Star City Bridge and turn left at stop light. Travel one block to stop sign and then proceed through intersection. Located on right.

name: La Famiglia
description: Southern Italian Trattoria wood-fired pizza, fresh made pasta, meatballs, sausage, Paninis, and mozzarella. Our pastas feature our special La Famiglia sauce, the same recipe brought from Petilia Policastro almost 100 years ago! We use only imported Italian flour and tomatoes in order to maintain the quality and taste comparable to no other!

name: La Paix Herb Farm
description: La Paix is an organic herb and produce farm near Weston. Many gardens feature lavender plants, medicinal and culinary herbs and organically grown produce. Tours: (304)269-7681. Workshops (April - September) include Complimentary herbal luncheon: www.lapaixherbfarm.com - register online. Victorian Farm House, log cabin, root cellar, woodland paths, essential oil distillery, labyrinth. Lavender Fair and more. Crafts, gourmet luncheon, demonstrations, workshops. Shop features herbs products and books.. Plants. Major Credit cards accepted. Contact us by phone or online. www.lapaixherbfarmproducts.com
address: 3052 Crooked Run Rd., Alum Bridge, WV, 26321

name: La Pasta Bella
description: Italian restaurant with homemade pasta in Victorian Era setting. Nice wine selection. Homemade desserts. Gift shop attached. Closed Sundays. Hours: M-Th: 10 am - 8 pm, F-S 10 am - 9 pm

name: La Trattoria
description: We are a family-owned and operated restaurant in Martinsburg, WV and have been rated the #1 restaurant in the local area for the past four years. At La Trattoria, we pride ourselves on high quality food at affordable prices. We offer traditional Italian cuisine made from real homemade recipes passed down through the generations of our family.

name: Lake Shawnee Amusement Park
description: There’s something unnatural about this Mercer County attraction. A Native American burial ground. Violent deaths. Freak accidents. Who knew a simple amusement park could have such a dark past? Explore this creepy (maybe cursed?) land— ”one of the world’s most haunted places". Paranormal investigators now frequent this park. It has also been featured on the Discovery Channel’s “GhostLab,” the Travel Channel’s “The Most Terrifying Places in America,” and the National Geographic series “The Watch.”

name: Lake Sherwood Recreation Area
description: Campsites: 104 individual tent or trailer sites and 10 group sites. Each site has a parking spur, fire ring and lantern post. All camping areas have access to the restrooms with running water, flush toilets, hot showers and electricity (available during summer season only). In the spring and fall, vault toilets and hand pump well are available. Additional amenities or activities include swimming beaches, boating, hiking, fishing, hunting, a playground, picnic shelters and volleyball courts. Location: i-64, exit 175 (eastbound), exit 181 (westbound), take Route 60 toward White Sulphur Springs to State Route 92, go 18 miles to Neola, turn right onto State Route 14, go 11 miles to entrance. For reservations call 877-444-6777 or visit www.reserveusa.com.
address: Lake Sherwood Rd., White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Lake View Cabins
description: Overlooking the beautiful shore of Stonewall Jackson Lake this is the retreat from everyday live you are looking for. Located nly 100 yards from the closest boat ramp and 1.25 miles from Stonecoal Lake, home to the states best muskie fishing, we have fully equipped kitchens, air conditioning, TV/VCR, barbeque grills and bed linens/blankets. We do not furnish personal linens or food.

name: Lakehouse
description: Great food and fun on the lake. Dine inside or on the deck. Open year 'round. Offering steak, seafood, sandwiches, pastas and pizzas. Children's menu available.

name: Lakeside Dining
description: The Lost Paddle: When it’s too early for speaking in complete sentences, we’ll get your engines running with made-to-order eggs, pancakes or French toast, apple-smoked bacon, sausage, home-fried potatoes, pastries, fresh fruit – and let’s not forget FRESH COFFEE. Dinner: Get ‘yer grub on! Relax and refuel with these fine feasts… Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday will be heaping bowls of foods straight from “Mom’s” kitchen… fried chicken, pulled pork BBQ, country ham, with sides of green beans, mashed potatoes, homemade coleslaw, fried apples, and buttermilk biscuits. Vegetarian options are always available. Monday, Wednesday and Friday will have an Italian theme with roasted seasonal vegetables, pasta, and house-made sauces. Garlic bread and an endless salad bar are always available. Saturdays will be a full-on buffet. Think, Thanksgiving dinner on steriods. We’re talking beef, bork, seafood, potatoes, pasta, veggies, salad bar, and delicious homemade desserts! WOODY’S PATIO GRILL: Woody’s Patio Grill offers award winning wood fired pizzas, burgers & dogs, grilled or deli sandwiches, and kids meals. Find us on the patio overlooking Wonderland Waterpark! Open everyday Memorial Day – Labor Day: 11:00 am – 6:00 pm. Resort guests and Walk-ins welcome! Advanced bookings not required but it might save you a little.

name: Lakeview Golf Resort & Spa
description: Situated on 500 pristine acres sits two championship West Virginia golf courses (Lakeview Course and Mountainview Course) featuring great accommodations, unforgettable weddings, productive meetings and fun for the whole family. We offer a variety of West Virginia's Best Stay And Play Golf Packages including golf, accommodations and dining. Lakeview Resort offers two unique dining venues for guests. Fusion: our full service restaurant, offers ala carte and buffet dining options for both breakfast and dinner. Our prime rib buffet is featured on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights (seasonal). Legends: our sports bar, features towering sandwiches, Pittsburgh-style salads, and thick, juicy steaks. Enjoy an ice-cold brew or a frozen concoction on the Tiki Deck, while enjoying the live entertainment on weekends (seasonal). Conveniently located just off of I-68 in Morgantown, Lakeview Golf Resort & Spa offers easy access to all travelers and is a place like no other.

name: Lakin House
description: This historic house located in beautiful Preston County features 13 room, 3 full baths and 2 half baths, 6 bedroom, Sleeps 12-20, dining-room, living room, large kitchen includes stainless steel appliances (dishwasher, microwave, refrigerator), washer & dryer, basement theatre, fitness room with view of home theater (weights, bench, treadmill, bike, punching bag, 2 bicycles), 3 TVs with DVD players, pets considered, no smoking, mountain views with 6-acre hiking trail to explore on property, stereo with surround sound player throughout home, mountain views, outdoor volleyball, basketball and bon-fire pit, propane gas grill & wrap-around patio furniture with porch swing. Excellent destination for your church groups, Couples Retreats, Family Getaways, Summer Vacation, Thanksgiving and Holiday parties, events, and more

name: Lambert’s Vintage Winery
description: Lambert’s Winery was established in 1992 by, Jim and Debbie Lambert. This winery is constructed from hand cut stones gathered from various parts of West Virginia with multiple fireplaces surrounded by rocking chairs and amazing grounds throughout the winery. Along with the winery, catering is offered for weddings/events hosted on site. As one of West Virginia’s best wineries, we would like to welcome you to do a tour and tasting of this beautiful and relaxing winery or purchase some WV pottery.

name: Lambert’s Vintage Wines
description: Take a tour to see how Lambert's West Virginia wine is produced, sample their fine selection and check out a large selection of West Virginian made crafts.

name: Land Baron Outfitters
description: Land Baron Outfitters is one of the best West Virginia hunting farms in the area. As a West Virginia hunting lodge, Land Baron Outfitters provides whitetail deer and turkey hunts with exclusive access to over 236 acres of property in Wirt County, West Virginia. Surrounded by farmland and mountains, this area possesses the natural habitat required to produce quality hunts. Plan a stay in our furnished non-smoking cabin today and discover Wild and Wonderful West Virginia for yourself. Free wi-fi and cable are provided in the cabin for our visitors to enjoy. Firewood is also provided by Land Baron Outfitters for the fire pit behind the cabin. *During hunting season the cabin is available for 3-night or 5-night hunts. A 50% deposit is required at the time of booking.

name: Landes Ruritan Club
description: The Landes Ruritan Club is a local community service organization dedicated to 100% return to the community. This organization dedicates many hours to the community and offer scholarship opportunity to outgoing seniors. Join the organization today and help give back to your community!

name: The Landing on the Shaver’s Fork
description: Located on the banks of the Scenic Shaver's Fork River, The Landing offers a launching point for boundless outdoor recreational opportunities in all of West Virginia's Four Magnificent Seasons. Whether you wish to ski, fish, hunt, hike, bike, kayak, board a scenic train, trek on your URV, or just relax relax in a hammock by the rolling cool water of the Shaver's Fork, or the cozy warmth of our gas log fireplace, we are waiting to indulge you. Guests can enjoy free Wifi both inside and out.

name: Lantz Farm and Nature Preserve – WMA – Wetzel
description: 555 acres of self-guided walking trails and fishing ponds. Various habitats with diverse flora and fauna. Great for birdwatching. Restrooms on site.
address: Rt. 20 and Buffalo Run Road, Jacksonburg, WV, 26377

name: Lantz Farmhouse
description: The Lantz Farm and Nature Preserve Wildlife Management Area is located in Jacksonburg, east of Blacksville in Wetzel County, West Virginia. Part of the site is operated as a retreat for the farm's owner, Wheeling Jesuit University.

name: Larobi’s at Southridge Golf Range
description: Known for pizza, sandwiches and wings. We have cornhole and a golf range for more family fun.

name: Larry Joe Harless Community Center
description: This state-of-the-art facility features 65,000 square feet of fun and excitement.
address: 202 Larry Joe Harless Dr., Gilbert, WV, 25621

name: Last Chance Outfitters
description: Please use (304)573-2281 In state Only Last Chance Outfitters offers professionally guided hunting and fishing trips. There are full and half-day fishing trips taken on the Greenbrier and New Rivers. Our hunting trips will be taken on 3000 acres of private land. In addition, a fully modern cabin is available. Call for a free brochure.

name: Later Alligator
description: Atmosphere and great food can be found at Wheeling’s Later Alligator. This former saloon is located in city’s Centre Market Historic District, and specializes in crepes, sandwiches and homemade soups. You’ll keep coming back for more.

name: Laura Anderson Lake
description: Anderson Lake is a 7-acre lake located within the City of Dunbar’s Wine Cellar Park in Kanawha County. The lake has a maximum depth of 33 feet and an average depth of 18 feet. Parking is 0.5 miles from the lake with a paved walking trail provided for those who like a short hike. By contacting Parks & Recreation, handicapped persons may acquire a key to open the gate to drive to the lake. Paths surrounding the lake provide good bank fishing access; or there is a Handicap accessible fishing pier. The lake provides fun for the young and old while fishing for trout, large-mouth bass, channel catfish and bluegill. Boating, camping, and the use of live minnows as bait are prohibited.

name: Laurel Fork Campground (USDA Forest Service)
description: There are 14 single unit sites available on a first come, first serve basis. Campsites are suitable for tent or trailer camping. Sites are located in an open area with little vegetative screening. Each campsite has a parking spur, table, fire ring, and lantern holder. Day hiking and backpacking opportunities are available leaving from this campground as well as through the Laurel Fork North and South Wilderness. Open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week during open season, Mid-April - beginning of December. Location: Located along the Laurel Fork River between Laurel Fork North and South Wilderness areas, this primitive campground offers visitors to the Middle Mountain area a nice camping opportunity.

name: Laurel Fork North and South Wilderness (USDA Forest Service)
description: These two wildernesses are located next to each other in Randolph County, West Virginia. They are separated only by a road and a campground, and are usually thought of and managed like one unit, commonly called "The Laurel Forks". The Laurel Forks lie between Middle Mountain and Rich Mountain, along the Laurel Fork River. They are the least visited of the Forest’s five wildernesses and provide great opportunities for solitude, although the long, thin nature of both areas does not provide for loop hikes that stay within the wildernesses’ boundaries. Elevation ranges from 2900 feet to over 3700 feet.

name: Laurel Highlands River Tours & Outdoor Center
description: Experience some of the best whitewater rafting in the east on the mighty Cheat River. The largest uncontrolled watershed in the Ohio River system. This watershed stretches over 1,000 square miles. During the spring months the Cheat generates unbelievable whitewater for 11 miles. We conduct trips from April until July on the Cheat, and then our trips are based out of Ohiopyle, PA on the Youghiogheny River. Come and enjoy nature at her very best away from the maddening crowds. Visit us online or call today.

name: Laurel Hill Civil War Battleground
description: Site of the longest battle in the Tygart Valley Campaign. Union forces ousted the Confederate army and protected important turnpikes, securing safe passage to Wheeling for the founding fathers to plan the statehood of WV. In fleeing to Beverly, Confederate General Garnett was the first general to die in the Civil War. Annual battle reenactment is staged during the third weekend in July. The Battlefield is open to the public year-round and walking trails are marked with interpretive signage.

name: Laurel Lake Wildlife Management Area
description: This facility is included in "A Guide to Accessible Recreation in West Virginia." Please check the Guide or the site for information on accessibility. Please note - a self-reporting survey was used to compile the information in this Guide; every attempt was made to verify the accuracy of the information but West Virginia Division of Tourism is not responsible for errors or inaccuracies.

name: Leatherman’s Falling Waters Campsite
description: Leatherman’s Falling Waters Campsite is a 50-site RV park that has been family owned and operated since 1962. We are primarily oriented to RV travelers looking for safe, quiet place to spend the night. We are BIG-RIG friendly and have 20, 30, 50 amp power at all RV sites, as well as cable TV and free Wi-Fi. Over half of our sites have sewer hookups and are pulll-through. Tent sites are available in a shady area near a small stream. There’s a self-serve laundry on-site and climate controlled bathhouse for tent campers. In order to best accommodate our traveling customers, we offer “Call Ahead Camping” system in lieu of advance reservations. Call us within 24 hours of your expected arrival time and we will put your name on an available campsite. We are able to accommodate campers 99% of the time using this system. We are a full service Good Sam Park campground.

name: The Ledge House B and B
description: Enjoy incredible views of the world famous Harpers Ferry Gap from our decks and balconies. The Ledge House B&B sits atop the historic town of Harpers Ferry overlooking the Potomac and Shenandoah Rivers as well as the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal. Breakfasts are made from local produce, farm fresh organic eggs, and free-range hormone free pork. The B&B is within walking distance of all points of interest inside Harpers Ferry National Historic Park. Hike the Appalachian Trail, Bike the C&O Canal, or Raft the Shenandoah and Potomac Rivers.
address: 280 Henry Clay St, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Legacy Inn and Conference Center
description: The Legacy Inn and Conference Center provides 14 luxurious rooms and meeting space for up to 200. We are ideal for small businesses and relaxing getaways. We are located directly on the North Bend Rail Trail and we love to accommodate bikers, hikers, travelers and passersby. We can provide you and/or your group first class service in a beautiful and relaxing environment. Open year round 24-7.

name: Leisure Time Campground
description: We have 42 sites with 30 and 50 amps and full hook-up. We have Internet service and a modern bath house. We are located in historic Jacksons Mill across the road from WVU conference center. We are open year-round and can accommodate any size camper. We have water, sewage and electric hookups. Rates are $20.00 per night. Stay 6 nights get the 7th free. Monthly rates also available. Check in is at the Corner Mart next to the campground. There is a public golf course one mile away and a winery 2 miles. There is a grocery store, gasoline and diesel within walking distance.

name: Lewis Brothers Orchard
description: Season of operation: July 15 - Jan 31. Products are peaches and apples.

name: Lewis County Chamber Of Commerce
description: The Lewis County Chamber of Commerce is a proactive partnership between businesses and professional people in a working effort to expand the economy of an area. It is an avenue through which members can accomplish collectively what would be difficult to do individually. The Chamber's strength lies in attracting the greatest number of individuals and firms to form a pool of resources to be utilized by its membership to assist with the growth and development of the business climate. The Lewis County Chamber of Commerce is a vital part of this community and is committed to the success of its member businesses, to the economic growth of Lewis County and the preservation of the quality of life as well as promoting the efforts of its members toward the accomplishment of common goals.

name: Lewis County Convention & Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Explore all Stonewall Country has to offer by shopping in unique antique shops, visiting Appalachian glass artists and museums, stopping by Lambert’s winery, taking a tour of the Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum or enjoying some old-fashioned home cooking in one of the many restaurants Lewis County has to offer. Experience some of the best Musky fishing in the state at Stonecoal Lake. After an eventful day, rest easy in a comfy hotel, cozy B&B, or a four-diamond resort. Come experience where heroes were raised, legends were born and memories are made. [if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif] https://wvtourism.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/Stonewall_FeaturesDestination_Headercompressed.mp4

name: Lewis County Park
description: County Park offering swimming, miniature golf, tennis, volleyball, basketball, playground, pavilions (to rent), and many other features starting Memorial Day weekend thru Labor Day weekend.

name: Lewis Wetzel Wildlife Management Area WMA
description: Wildlife management area with over 13,500 acres of moderate to steep slopes with 30 miles of trails through pristine hardwood and hemlock forests. Area is great for hunting, fishing, birding, and hiking. Basic campsites available.
address: Rt. 82 (Buffalo Run Rd.) 1 mi S of Rt. 20, Jacksonburg, WV, 26377

name: Lewisburg Cemetery (Dick Pointer grave)
description: The cemetery surrounding Old Stone Church was established in 1797. Across the street is the grave of Dick Pointer, a black slave who distinguished himself at the Indian attack on Fort Donnally on May 29, 1778. He died a free man in 1827.

name: Lewisburg Diamond and Gold
description: Forever 10 Diamond – 10 Hearts, 10 Arrows. Largest bridal selection. Custom-made jewelry. Pandora – unforgettable moments. Antique and estate jewelry. Rolex, Citizen and Bulova. Gold, sterling and coin buyers. Jewelry and watch repairs and appraisals. Mon-Sat 9:30-6:00.

name: Lewisburg Elks Country Club
description: The course dates back to the 1930's when the first nine holes were constructed (presently the back nine). The second nine holes were added in the1960's. The front nine is shorter than the back, but its fairways are narrower. Water comes into play on five holes over the course. The greens are small but undulating. The course is short by modern standards but it is deceptively tough. The golf course, restaurant, and pool are open to the public. Golf tee time reservations are encouraged and can be reserved by calling the golf pro shop @ 1-304-645-3660. Many fine hotels and motels are conveniently located just minutes from the course.

name: Lewisburg Farmers Market
description: Weekly market featuring a wide variety of in-season fruits, vegetables, meats, eggs, plants and fresh flowers, all grown locally in the Greenbrier Valley. Special events throughout the season. Open: Sat 9-1, May-Oct.
address: Next to the Lewisburg Post Office, Lewisburg, WV, 24901

name: Lewisburg Historic District
description: Dating from the 18th Century, this quaint town was the site of a Civil War battle on May 23, 1862, when Union forces attempted to sever railroad communications between Virginia and Tennessee. There is a Confederate cemetery in town, a library that was used as a hospital with Confederate graffiti on the walls, a church with a cannonball hole and a monument to the Confederate dead. The North House Museum also offers Civil War enthusiasts artifacts and documents from that era, including a packsaddle used to break Robert E. Lee’s famous horse, Traveler.

name: Lewisburg Maple Street Historic District
description: Maple Street Historic District is a relatively small grouping of individual houses that have historically served the black population of Lewisburg. The area is significant as the only architecturally intact area that serves as the focal point of black history in Lewisburg. Located atop the highest residential hill, known as "Gospel Hill," it contains the highest concentration of intact "worker's" housing. It overlooks the older, more established buildings of the Lewisburg Historic District and also represents a small, intact working class neighborhood from Greenbrier County's turn-of-the-century boom period. On the National Register of Historic Places.

name: Liberty Street Carryout
description: If you’re going to Liberty Street Carryout, be sure to go early; the lunch crowd is standing-room only. Once there, you’ll find some of the best diner food in the area, including the restaurant’s famous homemade soup. The restaurant also has a unique location: It’s built atop one of the only entrances to the underground lake that lies beneath the historic town of Charles Town.
address: 110 W. Liberty St., Charles Town, WV, 25414

name: Library Commission
description: WV Library Commission Reference Library located in the Culture Center on the Capitol Complex offers wireless internet, public internet computers and friendly assistance. The Library serves state agencies and employees as well as the public. The library is a federal documents depository and offers 55 databases on numerous research subjects. The Library specializes in West Virginia material and offers work-related, research-related, and recreational books, references works, audiobooks and DVDs.

name: Lifestyle Fitness Center
description: Lifestyle Fitness Center is a full service fitness center and pool located in Keyser across from WVU Potomac State Campus. Besides their regular memberships, they offer single day passes to visitors to the community. They have a full range of services including indoor pool, hot tub, cardio, strength, and personal training as well as group fitness classes. They also accept Silver Sneakers members. A great place to work out while on the road!

name: Lightburn’s
description: Inspired by the creativity and detail that Mr. Arnold Palmer designed into the surrounding golf course, we are proud to serve you handmade courses crafted with the freshest, regionally-sourced ingredients. The stunning views from atop the Arnold Palmer Signature Golf Course are a delicious accompaniment to the elegant dining experience afforded here. Located in the resort’s club house, Lightburn's provides an intimate atmosphere and a delightfully enticing menu. Our culinary and service team are well-versed on the entrées and wine selections and truly enjoy introducing you to our premier restaurant and its unique and memorable offerings.

name: Lil’ Bit of Heaven Cupcakes LLC
description: Lil' Bit of Heaven Cupcakes features Cupcakes, Cheesecakes, Gourmet Cookie Sandwiches, Pepperoni Rolls, Muffins and other amazing treats made with only the finest ingredients, baked fresh daily!!
address: 95 Olde Main Street, St. Albans, WV, 25177

name: Lil’ Moe’s Restaurant
description: Frequent customers agree that Lil Moe’s has become the “most unique gathering place in Philippi.” This is due in no small part to the great wings, steamed shrimp specials and stacked sandwiches piled high with meat, slaw and fries. You’ll also find a full array of beer, ale, wines, coolers and other products from Mountaineer Brewing Company.

name: Lillian’s Antique Shop
address: 204 W. Main St., White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Lily Garden B&B
description: Lily Garden Bed & Breakfast has two private suites: the Carriage House Suite and the Trundle Suite. The Carriage House has two bedrooms, including a sleeper loft, as well as a full bathroom, full kitchen, dining room table, living room, and is ideal for families and larger parties. The Trundle has a large bedroom, full bathroom and kitchenette, and is perfect for individuals and couples. Each suite has private entrances, and both offer access to our outdoor space. The shared yard includes a picnic table, covered swing, and water lily garden. Our homely amenities include a daily country breakfast, hot showers, Internet access, cable TV, and much more. Harpers Ferry is home to numerous sites of importance in American history. The area around the town includes Civil War landmarks, hiking trails, natural wonders, vineyards, biking along the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal, the Appalachian Trail and so much more.
address: 701 West Washington Street, Harper's Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Limousines By A Touch Of Class
description: For a Corporate or Personal traveler, Limousines by A Touch of Class is devoted to offering luxurious, safe transportation to your destination. Attention to the smallest detail, the highest quality customer service and our courteous, professional chauffer.

name: Lincoln Theater
description: Historic Lincoln Theater was built in 1920 and is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The theater has been beautifully restored and hosts traveling and local performances. Contact Artslink for more info.

name: Linda’s Country Kitchen & Pub
description: Little Country Family Style Restaurant with a full Menu of some good home country cooking where you never leave hungry. Serves breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks and coffee. Multi-cuisine options.

name: Linwood Lodge and Campground
description: Offering primitive campging, Linwood Campground is located at the foot of Snowshoe Mountain in West Virginia.

name: Little Beaver State Park
description: 562-acre Little Beaver State Park near Beckley, West Virginia features an 18-acre lake open for bass, crappie, channel catfish, and trout fishing year-round.
