Little Beaver State Park campground features 30 sites with electric and water hook-ups and 16 sites with water hook-up only, for a total of 46 sites this is the newest campground in West Virginia's state park system. The park also offers reservable picnic shelters, youth playground, geocaching, an activities building with game room, and over 20 miles of hiking/biking trails.

name: Little Black Box Lingerie
description: Little Black Box Lingerie is a specialty boutique featuring fine lingerie, bras, panties, corsets, novelty items and more. Featuring a 10’x9’ dressing room, professional bra fittings and bra solutions for evening wear. Mon-Thurs 10-7, Fri & Sat 11-8

name: Little Coal River Campground & Cabin
description: The 16'X18' cabin has an 8'X16' covered front porch. It will sleep 6 people in two bedrooms. The larger bedroom has twin size bunk beds and one full size bed. The other bedroom has twin size bunk beds. Sheets and country quilts are provided. The bathroom has a 4' walk-in shower stall supplied by an eighty gallon hot water tank. Towels are provided. The kitchen area has a table, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker w/complimentary coffee. There is a fire ring out front for the true camping experience. The 36'camper has a front and rear bedroom. The front bedroom has a full size bed and the back bed room has twin size bunk beds. All sheets and blankets are provided. The bathroom has a tub w/shower. Towels are provided. The kitchen has a refrigerator, stove, microwave, toaster and a coffee maker w/complimentary coffee. All cooking and serving utensils are provided. There is a fire ring out front as well as patio furniture on the "NEW" 14'X26' deck. The campground has 17 RV sites with a large amount of primitive camping available. The RV sites have water, sewer and 20/30/50 amp power hookups. We have a large heated and air conditioned bathhouse. The vending machine room has a microwave for your convenience.
address: 101 Tunnel Road, Mile Marker 60.5 US 119 South, Julian, WV, 25529

name: Little Creek Park
description: Your next adventure awaits at Little Creek Park, located off of Spring Hill Avenue on the west side of South Charleston, West Virginia. The expansive park has ten picnic shelters available for rental – all are equipped with restrooms, electricity, grills and various recreational equipment. Some of the sights to see while hiking at the park are a natural rock formation known as “Devil’s Tea Table,” the old saw mill and a natural spring. Frank A. Mullens, Jr. Athletic Complex with 2 baseball, softball, football and 2 soccer fields with new field turf Additional fields – 1 turfed softball field, 2 natural baseball/softball fields, and 5 natural soccer fields 2 basketball and 2 tennis courts Soap box derby racing facility 18 hole disc golf course Picnic shelters with grills and electricity Hiking trails and playgrounds
address: 1 Little Creek Park Road/ PO Box 8597, South Charleston, WV, 25309

name: Little Indian Creek WMA – Monongalia County
description: 1,036 acres. Terrain: gently rolling to moderately steep slopes ranging in elevation from 900 feet to 1,330 feet. Primarily covered with mixed hardwood forests and open fields. Little Indian Creek WMA exhibits diverse habitats, including reclaimed mine areas, oak-hickory ridge tops, ponds and wetlands. These support many types of wildlife associated with recreational opportunities such as wildlife watching, hunting, fishing and trapping. Hunting prospects: deer, grouse, squirrel, and turkey. Accommodations and facilities: camping is not permitted. Location: Monongalia County off of state Route 19 near Arnettsville. Access via County Routes 34 and 45/1.
address: WV DNR Wildlife Resources Section, Farmington, WV, 26571

name: Little Sorrel – Stonewall Jackson Lake
description: Stonewall resort offers yet another relaxing way to take in the surrounding scenery. As the only excursion boat operating on an inland lake in West Virginia, the new 125-passenger lake cruise boat—named Little Sorrel—is perfect for private groups, family vacations, group meetings or romantic getaways, with a variety of excursions to choose from. Ideal for cocktail parties, private parties and wedding receptions, guests will also enjoy breakfast, lunch or dinner cruises for up to 60 people, pleasure lake tours and fall color tours. Cruises available for people staying at stonewall resort. Available for private rental.

name: Little Studio
description: Artisan's workshop and showroom, featuring handcrafted gemstone jewelry and silk florals. Open Mon-Sat: 10am-6pm; Closed Sunday

name: Livingood Lodging of Gilbert
description: "Gilbert’s Best Kept Lodging Secret.” Our in town locations allow ATV riding on the streets and police protection. Our five units, Creekside, The Chalet, The Laid Back, The Gilbert House and Nana’s Place, can accommodate varied occupancy...up to 22 guests in some units. All units are equipped with Central Heat/AC, satellite TV, wireless internet, queen sized bedding, fridge, microwave, coffeemaker w/coffee, all utensils, high thread count linens, towels, pillows, etc. Three units offer full kitchen/dining rooms. Free long distance calling and other “freebies” are included along with a huge parking area, large 21 x 45 deck spanning Stafford's Creek, with covered shelter, gas grills, picnic tables and fire pit. The lodges are convenient to the Hatfield-McCoy Rockhouse Trail access and within walking distance of the LJH Community Center, Hardees, McDonald’s, Wise Guy’s Pizza, a pharmacy, gas station/convenience store, an ATV shop, hardware and grocery stores. Two ATV friendly car washes welcome your business.
address: Rt. 80, 3rd Avenue, P.O. Box 428, Gilbert, WV, 25621

name: Liz Spurlock Amphitheater at Chief Logan State Park
description: Located in the beautiful Chief Logan State Park in Logan sits the Liz Spurlock Amphitheater. The Liz Spurlock Amphitheater is the site for outdoor theater performances arranged by Aracoma Story, Inc. Each Summer they perform the historical drama “The Aracoma Story,” which is about Shawnee tribal members who lived at the present-day location of the town of Logan. While you are at Chief Logan State Park, explore the 4,000-acre recreational area, which has hiking trials, swimming, mini golf, fishing, a museum and more.
address: 1362 Little Buffalo Creek Road, Logan, WV, 25601

name: Lizzies Attic
description: Largest Boyds Bear dealer in the tri-state area. Bean pod candles, primitives, gift baskets, crocks. Open Mon. - Tues. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m., Wed. - Fri. 10 a.m. - 8 p.m., Sat. 10 a.m. - 3 p.m.

name: Lloyd’s Restaurant
description: Fun family restaurant with casual atmosphere. Offers great home cookin' at great prices. Lloyds is known for their home-made pies. Everything made from scratch! Breakfast served all day. The country hospitality is FREE!
address: (Just off Flatwoods exit 67 on I-79), 4284 Sutton lane, Sutton, WV, 26601

name: Loafer’s Glory B&B and Campground
description: Stay at your own private 130 acre nature preserve! LG has a variety of lodging - private luxury apartment, private queen rooms, rustic camping cabin, acres of tent spaces as private as you wish. Visit our website for room and tent spot rates. Hike our trails, fish in the ponds (for kids), relax on one of the porches or around a fire pit, or pick a porch for relaxing and wildlife watching. We're on a scenic motorcycling and bicycling route, and close to rock climbing, caving, festivals in Monterey VA, etc. We are a little over an hour from Harrisonburg VA, 3 hours from Richmond or the D.C. area. We can host your small rustic wedding or special party in an indoor or outdoor space. Our party barn is available for outdoor dining, small weddings and other events! Please inquire about our budget friendly a la carte pricing. ​​A full breakfast is included for the apartment guests and $5 for camping cabin and tenting guests. ​Please inquire about dinner and lunch, especially if you are bringing a group. Dogs may be allowed, please inquire.

name: Locust Creek Covered Bridge
description: Built in the 1870's, the Locust Creek Covered Bridge at Denmar, near Hillsboro, West Virginia, in Pocahontas County, spans Locust Creek near its mouth on the Greenbrier River. The span over Locust Creek was 13.5 feet (4.1 m) wide and 114 feet (35 m) long. It is the only remaining covered bridge in Pocahontas County. The bridge employs a Warren Double-Intersection truss, now rare in North America. Its interior was rebuilt after 1904. The bridge is now for pedestrian traffic only. It is located on Secondary Route 31 South approximately 6.3 miles (9.7 km) outside of Hillsboro .

name: Locust Hill Inn, Cabin, and Pub
description: Known for Chef Dave's fresh breads.

name: Locust Hill Inn, Cabin and Restaurant
description: Located in the center of Pocahontas County in Wild and Wonderful West Virginia, Locust Hill Bed & Breakfast has four bed & breakfast rooms and one cabin which sleeps six. Offering shuttle service to several access points along the Greenbrier River Trail, Locust Hill serves a very large breakfast every morning at 8:30 am. Activities offered on the on the 20 acre grounds include croquet, volleyball, fishing, kayaking, paddle boats, horseshoes, badminton, birdwatching, and Bocce.

name: Log House Homestead B&B
description: Log House Homestead Bed and Breakfast is a 1820 log house replica with two bedrooms and one and half bathrooms with air conditioning and central heating. Visitors enjoy a hearty country breakfast. Children over 12 are welcome and the facility is pet, telephone, and television-free. Located near the North Bend Rail-Trail, reservations embrace a 4:00 pm check-in and 12:00 pm check-out. Personal checks and cash payment are accepted. Follow US Route 50 to the Cairo, WV exit and take Route 31 to State Park Road; proceed 1.5 miles and turn left on Homestead Cove Lane. Go one half mile on gravel to the cabin.

name: Logan County Chamber Of Commerce
description: Today's Chamber consists of approximately 200 area business and professional firms working together to improve the quality of life and the business climate in the Logan County area. The Chamber works to attract new business to our communities, while retaining existing businesses and industries and helping them to expand. Membership in the Logan County Chamber of Commerce opens the door to many exciting functions. Whether business, educational or social in nature, the activities provide Chamber members with opportunities to meet new clients or customers for their firm's goods or services. We are open Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. We close for lunch from 12:00 noon to 12:30 p.m.

name: Lola’s Pizza
description: We are located inside of a cute little house in the South Hills area of Charleston, West Virginia! We serve handmade, Neapolitan-style pizzas that come piping hot out of our stone hearth oven. As well as specialty pizzas, salads, sandwiches, specialty drinks and more! Come dine with us here at Lola’s! Dine in or carry out.

name: Long Point Grille & Bar
description: Welcome to the BEST food at Summersville Lake! Stop by to see us today! Also, be sure to "like" and check us out on Facebook for daily specials and features!
address: 1289 Summersville Lake Rd, Mount Nebo, WV, 26679

name: Los Hermanos
description: Come join us in St. Marys, WV for some authentic mexican cuisine! Serves lunch, dinner and drinks. Good For Groups Good For Kids Outdoor Seating Takes Reservations Take Out Waiter Service
address: 1419 N Pleasants Hwy., St. Mary's, WV, 26170

name: Lost Forest B and B
description: Welcome to the Lost Forest Bed and Breakfast. We offer access to literally thousands of acres of beautiful forest, mountains and trails. We are nestled in the beautiful Shenandoah Mountains with our 64 acres of forest, backing up to more than 18,000 acres of the George Washington National Forest. If you enjoy the wilderness, there is hunting, fishing, hiking, bird watching and nature walks right out our doors. Horseback riding, swimming and more hiking, is just a few miles away at the Lost River State Park. The Lost Forest B&B is a perfect romantic getaway, family vacation, wilderness adventure, or hunting expedition. We have chickens and goats we care for on a daily basis and guests can assist with the daily feeding and care of our animals if they wish. We serve a full gourmet breakfast each morning with fresh baked breads, organic ingredients and meats with every meal. Lost Forest offers lunch and a variety of supper services. Be sure to check out Lost Forest Supper Club Meal Packages. We can assist you with any special plans or requests if you make your desire known prior to your visit--picnic, honeymoon or anniversary.
address: 1609 Lower Cove Run Road, Mathias, WV, 26812

name: Lost River Bed & Breakfast
description: The Lost River B&B is a renovated 1920s farm house with four lovely bedrooms. Each room has a queen size bed and private en-suite bath. Enjoy the two screened porches, the cozy living room and a bountiful continental breakfast. The B&B is best suited for guests over the age of 18, no children are permitted. We're sorry, but due to allergen concerns, no pets are permitted in the B&B. The B&B is a non-smoking facility.

name: Lost River Campground
description: Welcome to Lost River Campground located in the beautiful Lost River Valley of Hardy County West Virginia. Open year round, we offer the following amenities: tent and RV Sites, pemanent sites, full hookups, water & electric, dumping station, bath house with hot showers, grills, picnic tables, fire rings, swimming pool, horse shoes, and volley ball. You can enjoy the amenities or you can "rough it" if you so desire. *Quick & easy access to fishing at Kimsey Run Lake, Trout Pond, & in The Lost River Stream. For nightly, weekly reservations call 304-897-8500; for long term/permanent sites contact JOYCE TEETS at 304-703-0831.
address: 985 Kimsey Run Rd., Lost River, WV, 26810

name: Lost River Farmers Market
description: If you haven’t made it to the Lost River Farmers Market yet, you are really missing out. Pick up some fresh fruit, bread, meats, pies, scones or pastries for a delicious picnic basket or great meal at your cabin. We also have pottery, dog toys and much more!
address: 1089 Mill Gap Road, Lost River, WV, 26810

name: Lost River General Store and Cafe
description: Find fantastic food at Lost River and ice cream that’s out of this world. For breakfast, enjoy muffins, sticky buns, bagels or scones and a rich cappuccino, coffee, latte or herbal tea. Salads, homemade soups, or sandwiches and paninis are available for lunch and carry out. Pulled pork is smoked on the premise

name: Lost River Grill And Motel
description: The Lost River Grill & Motel is open for dinner seven nights a week; lunch Tuesday through Sunday; and breakfast on Saturday and Sunday. Enjoy classic comfort foods like our home-made meatloaf, hand-cut steaks, seafood and our famous cream pies. The Lost River Motel is a warm, welcoming, vintage Motel. The knotty pine-paneled rooms have two double beds or one queen size bed, all rooms have free Wi-Fi, air conditioning, private bathroom, refrigerator, coffee maker and satellite TV. Small pets are permitted at an additional charge.

name: Lost River State Park
description: Located in the wooded mountains of Hardy County in West Virginia’s Eastern Panhandle, Lost River State Park provides cabin lodging and an abundance of outdoor recreation. The park’s quiet 3,934 acres of woods provides a secluded getaway for nature lovers. Lost River is known for its Cranny Crow overlook on top of Big Ridge Mountain, which offers a commanding view of five counties. The park features 26 cabins (Legacy and Classic styles), hiking trails, an activity building, and outdoor swimming pool (seasonal). The abundant wildlife includes deer, bear, other woodland creatures as well as multiple songbirds and raptors. There are two primitive campsites accessible by hiking 1.5 miles on White Oak Trail to the top of Big Ridge Mountain. A public shelter, campfire ring, picnic table and latrines are on site. No potable water is available. Campsite 1 is horse friendly. Site rental is fee-based and includes firewood. Three campsites are available near the upper shelter No. 2 area of the park, close to the ball field. Sites include a fire ring, picnic table and use of the public shelter. Restrooms are located nearby, and showers are available during pool hours (seasonal). Parking is available in the ball field parking lot adjacent to the camping area. Site rental is fee-based and a reservation is required. The area can also be rented as a group camp area. Reservations are required.

name: Lost River Trading Post & Grasshopper Gallery
description: Located in an historic, old feed store near where the long-gone Winchester+Western Wardensville Railroad station and Lost River Railroad tracks converged, we feature over 150 local artisans, crafters, woodworkers and consigners that allow us to fill every corner of our 5,000 sf. showroom with stuff you want and covet. We offer: Rustic cabin furnishings, furniture and old stuff (antiques) Local artists and folk art All new products made in the USA Locally roasted coffee/espresso bar Homemade from scratch baked goods and food Natural gourmet dry goods Weekend provisions Outdoors and explorer supplies Organic and local produce Grasshopper Gallery

name: Lost World Caverns
description: Descend 120 feet below the Earth's surface into a vast wonderland of stalactites and stalagmites. Lost World Caverns, discovered in 1942, is a truly magical place for both young and old. It takes approximately 45 minutes to walk through. We offer self-guided tours, so you can take your time to explore the cavern at your own pace. Just remember to stay on the trail. A guide sheet is provided to tell you about the many different formations that make up this 1/2-mile loop. No matter what the temperature on the outside, the cave always remains a constant 52 degrees. A light jacket and good shoes are recommended. You'll see formations such as The Snowy Chandelier, a 30-ton compound stalactite, presumed to be one of the nation's largest. The Bridal Veil is a beautiful column of sparkling white calcite. And of course, there is the War Club, a 28-foot stalagmite made famous when Bob Addis sat on it for nearly 16 days, just to get his name in the Guinness Book of World Records. These are but a few of the formations you'll see when you visit Lost World Caverns. Bring your camera to show your friends and family the beauty of this cave when you tell them about the great time you had. Thanksgiving-March 10 a.m.-4 p.m.; April-May 9 a.m.-5 p.m.; May 15-Labor Day 9 a.m.-7 p.m.; Labor Day-Thanksgiving 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Two miles north of Lewisburg on Fairview Road (N. Court Street)

name: Lot 12 Public House
description: A Dining Destination in the heart of downtown Berkeley Springs, serving upscale, seasonal, comfort cuisine by local Chef Damian Heath. Situated in a circa 1913 renovated home, relax in our intimate dining room, our small eclectic bar, our serene veranda or reserve our private dining room located on the second floor for groups. Open for dinner only at 5pm, Thursday through Sunday. Closed January and winter hours may vary. Reservations suggested. Also serving "Market Fresh Fare," a gourmet local lunch "to go" style at the Berkeley Springs Farmers Market, April through September. For more information, call 304.258.6264. Lot 12 Public House accepts Visa, MasterCard, and Discover.

name: Lotito City Park
description: For years Lotito Park (also known as Bluefield City Park) has provided families and outdoor enthusiasts, a picturesque backdrop for fun and activities. It features four pavilions, a picnic table, playgrounds, hiking trails, mountain biking trails and more.

name: Louis Bennett House (Public Library)
description: Public Library

name: Lower Cheat Land Management Co.
description: Vacation rentals located on the scenic Shavers Fork River outside Elkins, WV. Trout fishing, tubing, hiking, biking, & kayaking are just a few of the fun things you can do right outside your door. Come relax at your own private cabin in the mountains and enjoy nature at its finest. Spend a week, spend a weekend, any time of year, you'll like our lifestyle on the river.

name: Lower Greenbrier River Byway
description: The Lower Greenbrier River Byway travels 27 miles along the railroad through scenic countryside, wooded areas and the charming town of Alderson before the river empties into the New River in Hinton, WV.

name: L R BBQ and Custom Catering
description: Great Barbecue and fresh homemade sides. Friendly service in family style restaurant. Custom catering services available for all occasions. Carry out is also available.

name: Lucky Rivers Café and Catering
description: Lucky Rivers Café and Catering provide an Appalachian community local, health-conscious cuisine that tries to bridge new cultures to a small community. This restaurant is a unique culinary experience inspired by the wonder of West Virginia and the beauty of its people. Lucky Rivers offers fresh ingredients and weekly specials available to the public from Wednesday to Saturday between the hours of 11 am - 5 pm.

name: Lyin’ Bill’s Pizza & Subs
description: Italian fast food: Lyin' Bills Pizza & Subs.

name: Lynn’s Drive-Inn
description: Step back in time and cruise into the only drive-in left in Mercer County for a nostalgic taste of cheeseburgers, fries, milkshakes and more! If you want a blast from the past, come to Lynn's Drive-Inn!
address: 3705 Coal Heritage Road, Route 52, Bluefield, WV, 24701

name: MacFarland-Hubbard House
description: The MacFarland-Hubbard House, a National Register of Historic Places property, is the third oldest house in Charleston and home of the West Virginia Humanities Council since 1999, serving WV through grants and direct programs in the humanities. The MacFarland-Hubbard House, at 1310 Kanawha Boulevard, was built in 1836 by Norris Whitteker for Isaac Noyes. The house, an example of Greek Revival architecture, was first occupied by Henry and Julia MacFarland and later occupied by the Ruby, Crowley and Hubbard families. The house took a direct hit from a cannonball during the Battle of Charleston in September 1862, and served for a time as a hospital for federal troops. Both the home and the adjacent carriage house have been restored.

name: Magic Island
description: The flat five-acre island - connected to the mainland - includes a walking trail and beach volleyball courts, and is conveniently located close to hotels, shopping and dining. The island gained its name due to the rise and fall of the river level in the Kanawha, which caused the island to slip underwater, as if by "magic." The park hosts such events as SportsFEST, WV Games, family movie nights and many others. While more popular during the warmer months, Magic Island is open year-round.

name: Magnuson Hotel – Parkersburg / Marietta
description: 100 rooms. Three years in a row Highest Quality Award-winning hotel featuring free deluxe continental breakfast, high-speed wireless Internet, newspaper, local calls, hair dryer, 70 channel cable TV, pool, horseshoes, barbeque pits, exercise/fitness room, bus/truck parking, restaurant adjacent. Pet-Friendly.

name: Main Street Antiques
description: We are an antique store in the center of downtown Buckhannon, here to take you down memory lane! Browse every nook and cranny of our store. We also have the most extensive wine & specialty beer selection!

name: Main Street Cafe & Grill, Jane Lew
description: A small cafe located in Jane Lew, WV, with a new outside patio and two big TV's to watch your favorite sports teams! We have a big variety of menu options with something for everyone! We offer build-your-own burgers, hoagies, salads, turkey and ham sandwiches, grilled chicken sandwiches, reuben sandwich, flat iron steaks, chicken alfredo, steak alfredo, whiskey glazed salmon, and the best wings in town with a variety of homemade sauces!

name: Main Street Fairmont
description: Fairmont is known as “The Friendly City” and home of the pepperoni roll. The city of Fairmont is ripe for growth for both commercial and residential development. Main Street Fairmont has a solid relationship with many local and statewide community agencies dedicated to revitalizing different aspects of West Virginia’s landscape. Main Street West Virginia’s annual awards ceremony has honored MSF over the last several years with the outstanding Design, Promotion, Organization and Economic Restructuring Committee awards. Intricate historic architecture and the preserved High Level Bridge are visual treats. Pricketts Fort State Park, Marion County Historical Society Museum and the Telephone Museum are rich with history. The Italian street festival, Feast of the Seven Fishes, takes place in December. You don’t have to be Italian to celebrate Christmas with good Italian cooking, arts and crafts, music and entertainment. The Chocolate Tasting Tour is a delicious reason to visit participating Main Street businesses in February. The Mon River Trail connects Fairmont with Morgantown and is reserved for walking, jogging, cycling and cross-country skiing.

name: Main Street Kingwood
description: Welcome to Kingwood... Cornerstone of West Virginia Main Street Kingwood is a non profit organization dedicated to the revitalization and economic development of Kingwood, West Virginia while preserving its rich history. Kingwood offers a mix of shopping, dinning, cultural and historical experiences for area residents and visitors in a scenic setting. Stroll through our historic Main Street program area and take a step back in time. Start the day with a hearty West Virginia breakfast at any of the town restaurants. Then spend a leisurely morning browsing through the unique storefronts along Main and Price Streets featuring antiques, appliances, dry goods, unique gifts, and much more. Hovatter's Wildlife Zoo, also known as the West Virginia Zoo, is a zoo in Kingwood. The zoo is open seasonally from April to October, and on weekends in November. Opening and closing dates vary from year to year. For lunch or dinner, enjoy American and café style cuisine at one of our conveniently located restaurants. Afterward, plan time to visit the old Esso gas station with Mae West pumps, or stroll the grounds of the historic McGrew House.
address: 130 S. Price St., Ste. 201, PO Box 357, Kingwood, WV, 26537

name: Main Street Martinsburg
description: This community’s small-town friendliness and historic past thrives in harmony with new industry. • The Downtown Historic District encompasses the majority of the original town as designed in 1773, with several architecturally and historically significant buildings. This Main Street community offers 10 blocks of shopping, featuring jewelry, antique, flower, book and chocolatier marts.  • The Baltimore and Ohio (B&O) Roundhouse, rebuilt in 1866- 1872 after being burned by Thomas “Stonewall” Jackson’s Confederate troops during the Civil War, now serves as a designated National Historic Landmark and community center for public events.  • The Belle Boyd House, home of a notorious female Confederate spy, now houses the Berkeley County Historical Society.  • The Berkeley County Historical Society and Landmarks Commission offers self-guided walking and driving tours and guided trolley tours of Martinsburg and Berkeley County.

name: Main Street Morgantown
description: Main Street Morgantown (MSM) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to the continued revitalization of downtown Morgantown and the Historic Wharf District. Downtown Morgantown is an attractive, clean, safe center of commerce, government and education. Since its founding in 1984, MSM has been involved in the creation of 1,300 new jobs, the opening of more than 200 new businesses and over $126 million dollars in investments. Main Street Morgantown is a “grass-roots” organization which works primarily in the areas of historic preservation and economic development. Our downtown district features more than 30 distinct restaurants, pubs and eateries. We have an eclectic blend. With everything from fine dining, to Japanese fusion, to pizza by the slice, Morgantown’s got you covered. Our historic downtown has served as a shopping destination for over century. With the increase in off site chain complexes, the downtown has shifted to satisfy more niche markets. While this shift has seen an increase in the number of boutique shops (carrying many high end and hard to find products), ‘downtown’ doesn’t always equal ‘pricey’. The Wharf District has become one of the best portals to the Caperton Trail. What was once an old warehouse district, is now a revitalized growing commercial and residential center. Located next to the Monongahela River an the Caperton Trail, the Wharf District area is growing rapidly. Public and private investments have combined to include street and trail improvements, restaurants, retail, professional services offices, and high-end loft apartments.

name: Main Street Point Pleasant
description: Main Street Point Pleasant is an entergetic and vital part of the Revitalization Program of Point Pleasant, WV. Main Street Point Pleasant's Vision is to see Main Street Downtown, a street full of history, once again bustling with business and activities of the city's centeral business district. Our Mission is to be an active part of the city's leadership in organization, design, economic restructuring, and promotion of a positive image downtown and the full community. The organization involves getting everyone working toward the same goal and assembling the appropriate human and financial resources to implement a Main Street revitalization program.

name: Main Street Ripley
description: Main Street Ripley exists to support and enhance our local business district and encourage community engagement and pride. Ripley provides persons of all ages the opportunity to experience many artistic endeavors. Painting, dance, music, theatrical performances as well as traditional art forms such as quilting, weaving and pottery are abundent in this region. Main Street Ripley organization continues to encouraging their development by providing venues such as the historic Alpine Theatre and events to promote the arts.

name: Main Street Ronceverte
description: This friendly, casual community along the Greenbrier River grew up around the clustered historic homes built by railroad and lumber workers during the latter 1800s and early 1900s. Incorporated in 1882, Ronceverte derived its name from the French “Ronce verte”, which means “brier green.” The town sits on the north bank of the Greenbrier River on US Route 219. Attractions: • Area attractions include Ronceverte Walking Tour, a historic walking tour highlighting the downtown and community area, including lovely gothic style churches and other unique buildings. Signature events: • Ronceverte River Festival in June features the Great Rubber Ducky Race and live musical entertainment. Other activities include both one mile and five mile fun runs, the “Fire on the River” Chili Cook-Off and the Grand Fireworks Finale. • Riders of the Flood Outdoor Drama stages likable characters and family-appropriate stories based on history before an audience relaxing on the banks of the beautiful Greenbrier River. The plays are presented the first and second Thursday, Friday and Saturday of September. • Since 1926, the Annual Christmas Parade has kicked off the holiday season in Ronceverte on the first Monday of December

name: Main Street Station
description: Sports bar-Pub that serves lunch and dinner. Offering ten different flavors of wings. Pool tables and darts available for your enjoyment.

name: Main Street West Virginia
description: Main Street West Virginia and West Virginia ON TRAC are downtown revitalization programs that follow the National Main Street Center’s community-based approach to preservation and development. A subsidiary of The National Trust for Historic Preservation, Main Street is a successful community development model used in thousands of communities across the country. West Virginia Development Office staff provide training, technical assistance, and ongoing support to designated West Virginia communities in implementing Transformation Strategies using the Main Street Four Point Approach. This comprehensive method uses local and regional market data and meaningful community engagement to assist communities in getting started with revitalization, and then grows with them over time.

name: Mallow’s Roadside Cafe
description: Experience home cooking unlike any other at Mallow’s Roadside Cafe. Enjoy breakfast, lunch and dinner at this quaint restaurant in Cabins.
address: 4869 North Fork Highway, Cabins, West Virginia, 26855

name: Maloney’s Sports Pub & Grill
description: Watch your favorite team and enjoy our delicious food! Sit back and enjoy our 8 HD TV'S, local musicians, and family friendly atmosphere. We are open for lunch and dinner, serving all your favorite beers. Known for great wings and buffalo shrimp.

name: MannCave Distilling, Inc.
description: MannCave strives to make spirits that can be enjoyed right out of the bottle. Their products are smooth, flavorful and have a clean finish. You can tour the facility and taste samples on Saturdays from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. They currently sell their international award winning top shelf spirits on location, and in WV stores.

name: Mannette Steel Drums
description: There was only one family of instruments created in the last 150 years: the steel drum instrument of the Caribbean. Tour the only facility in the world that allows you to see, hear and experience the building, tuning and history of the Caribbean steel drum and the workshop of steel drum creator and innovator, Dr. Ellie Manette. Small or large groups can arrange tours from 45 minutes up to two hours. By appointment - $8 per person, per hour. By using Ellie's legendary techniques, our handcrafted steel drums are setting the industry standard with superior sound quality and craftsmanship along with unprecedented service.

name: Mannington Main Street
description: Old Town, New Friends” is the motto of this Main Street community of about 3,000 residents. As a member of the National Trust for Historic Preservation, Mannington Main Street, Inc. is working hard to boost the downtown business community, to promote greater educational opportunities for residents, and to generate participation in exciting local events. Mannington Main Street, Inc. sees the downtown as a focal point of life and community pride. Main Street works to inspire an appreciation of rich heritage and a warm family-oriented community. There is potential for a vibrant and prosperous business district, surrounded by historic and architecturally interesting neighborhoods.

name: Maple Leaf Motel
description: The Maple Leaf Motel, established in 1998, has been updated to stay current but remains homey. It is centrally located in Bruceton Mills, WV. This gives guests the best of both worlds. Although it is a quiet rural town, it offers plenty to do and see within a small radius. Each of our spacious rooms include: *separate dressing area & bathroom *individual heating/cooling unit *refrigerator *microwave *coffee pot (including cups, coffee, creamer & sugar) *flat screen TV with cable *FREE telephone *FREE WIFI. However, if you need a larger city to meet your needs (department stores, chain restaurants, movie theaters, etc.) while visiting: *Kingwood is about 15 miles south on Rt 26 *Morgantown is about 20 miles west on I-68

name: Marble King
description: Marble King manufacturers close to a million marbles each day for use in industrial applications, toys and games, decorative purposes and drainage or filtration systems. Marble King has been making marbles in America since 1949. Our Marbles are made with 100% lead free glass.

name: Mardi Gras Casino and Resort
description: The service and amenities set Mardi Gras Casino and Resort apart from other hotels in West Virginia. These amenities include a personal chef that will prepare a personal breakfast, luxurious bath amenities from London, a boardroom featuring leather bound executive chairs and hardwired Internet capabilities, complete business center, and 24-hour room service. It’s always a party at Mardi Gras Casino & Resort! Our convenient, friendly and exciting atmosphere offers great customer service, a variety of entertaining slot machines, popular table games, several dining experiences and a 150-room upscale resort hotel. With more than 1,000 slot machines, you’re sure to find a favorite—the 90,000 square foot casino features a diverse array of video, reel and progressive jackpots. You can spin, roll and hit big with over 30 tables playing Blackjack, Roulette, Craps, Big Six and more. Test your skill in our Big Easy Poker Room, where you can play beginners and experts alike in Texas Hold’em, Omaha Hi-Lo and 7-Card Stud. In addition, visit them year round to catch live greyhound and simulcast racing action! Hungry? Enjoy a variety of unique dining experiences, from intimate gourmet to grab-and-go cafes. Even dine while watching the live greyhound races at our First Turn Restaurant – there’s something for everyone at Mardi Gras! Experience a full-scale entertainment and resort lifestyle by reserving a room at our luxury hotel. Guests have full access to a complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast, valet parking, room service, saline pool, hot tub, fitness room, Wi-Fi and much more. Exit 47 or 47A off I-64. Open 24 hours a day. Racing schedules vary. Visit our website for more information.

name: Maria’s Garden & Inn
description: The Perry Family has been serving residents and visitors since 1971. Maria's Garden offers guests a quaint and comfortable Bed & Breakfast Inn. Amenities range from claw-foot tubs, hardwood floors, front porch with swing, cable TV, air conditioning, whirlpool tubs, private showers, and fireplaces. Guests enjoy a full country breakfast served in the Garden Room where you will enjoy the Garden in the spring and fireplaces in the winter. Peg Perry's culinary talents have become world renowned and are just the answer to excite your taste buds. You may choose from three separate dining rooms to partake of the many delectable dishes. So whether it's her famous red pasta sauce or homemade apple dumplings, everyone leaves with a full tummy and a smile. Maria's Garden is centered on three Grottos depicting apparitions of the Virgin Mary from three countries. Guests continue to bring relics, icons, pictures, and statues from the world over. These precious gifts are displayed throughout the dining rooms and inn, thus creating the Marian Museum. After hours contact number for Inn guests: 304-676-6822

name: Marion County Chamber of Commerce
description: Marion County, West Virginia, offers businesses and residents the best of both worlds. Here the friendly atmosphere and close-knit spirit of small town life combine with the forward-thinking ideals of a community poised for prosperity in the 21st century. Located where North Central West Virginia’s rolling hills meet the thriving I-79 High Tech Corridor, Marion County is an ideal place to do business and a beautiful place to live. Open Mon.- Fri. 8:30am - 4:30pm
address: 110 Adams St. / P.O. Box 208, Fairmont, WV, 26555

name: Marion County Convention & Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Experience Almost Heaven in historic Marion County, which is home of the pepperoni roll. Visit Prickett’s Fort, a recreation of an 18th century refuge fort. Enjoy craft brews at Short Story Brewery in Rivesville. If you’re crazy about delicious desserts, stop at the Poky Dot, a local hangout that specializes in massive milkshakes, incredible ice cream sundaes and spectacular banana splits. Take advantage of the spring weather and enjoy exploring some flowery hiking trails.
address: 1000 Cole Street, Suite A, Pleasant Valley, WV, 26554

name: Marion County Genealogical Club
description: Genealogy Room, Marion County Public Library. The club provides a collection of family histories, census records, vital statistics, cemetery records, county histories and more from the local area, West Virginia and surrounding states. Mon. 10am - 1pm ; Tue. - Fri. 10am - 2pm; Sat. 10am - 2pm

name: Marion County Vietnam Memorial
description: Located at the entrance to East Marion Park, exit 136 off I-79, the memorial consists of a 6-ton monument with the 27 names of the men from Marion County who died in Vietnam, and a Huey Helicopter which actually flew in Vietnam.
address: East Marion Park--EXIT 136 OFF I-79, Fairmont, WV, 26554

name: Mario’s Fishbowl
description: Mario's Fishbowl is a historic bar and grill filled with signs all over the walls marking breaking records and memorable times enjoyed by friends and families. Whether you're a local customer, alumni, or student this is a place where you can enjoy wings, appetizers, sandwiches, and all different beers ranging from local IPAs, craft beers, and domestics in a frosty goblet (the fishbowl)! We hope you can come make Mario's part of your tradition.

name: Mark’s Antiques
description: Antique store located in Old Central City. Open Thur-Sat: 12pm - 5pm.

name: Marlinton Motor Inn
description: Located just a few miles out of the city of Marlinton, the Motor Inn offers an on-site restaurant, bar and a seasonal outdoor pool. With amazing mountain views and close proximity to West Virginia’s most scenic natural destinations and tourist attractions, we look forward to hosting you on your next outdoor adventure! We offer services for all travelers and tourists, and will be happy to accommodate weddings, parties, reunions and group tours!

name: Marriott Charleston Town Center
description: This welcoming Charleston, WV hotel is located in the heart of downtown Charleston and features 352 state-of-the art guest rooms with luxurious bedding, a large work desk and high-speed Internet access. Enjoy full service amenities from fitness center with indoor pool and sauna to onsite business center and complimentary wireless Internet access in the lobby & restaurant areas.  With excellent service, great culinary at the Brick Salt restaurant, and an abundance of event space, including a rooftop tent, the Charleston Marriott Town Center is the perfect choice for dinner reservations, business travel, grand events, or simple weekend getaways.

name: Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott (Weirton)
description: Award winning Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott (Weirton). Amenities include: Complimentary breakfast; spacious guest rooms with a well-lit work desk, two phones and Wi-Fi; Fitness Center; Pool; Free High Speed Internet Access; in-room coffee; in-room hair dryer, iron and ironing board; Microwave and Mini Fridge in every room. Pets not allowed. 380 Three Springs Drive, Weirton WV 26062 as the GPS address of the hotel.

name: Marshall Artists Series
description: The Marshall artists series is a 72 year old arts and entertainment center affiliated with Marshall University. We present a variety of entertainment each year at the Historic Keith- Albee Performing Arts Center, as well as other venues in the Huntington area. Past performances have included: Hairspray, Rent, Bill Cosby, Martin Short, Whoopi Goldberg, and Willie Nelson. Check out the website for more information and show dates and times.
address: One John Marshall Dr., Huntington, WV, 25755

name: Marshall County Chamber of Commerce
description: The Marshall County Chamber of Commerce is organized for the purpose of promoting and advancing the economic, industrial, professional, cultural, and civic welfare of the county and surrounding area. Named for John Marshall, who served as Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court for 34 years, Marshall County was formed in 1835. Marshall County covers 307 square miles in the Northern Panhandle of West Virginia, and the city of Moundsville serves as the county seat. Moundsville takes its name from the largest Indian burial mound in the world built by people who lived in this area nearly 2,000 years ago. It is believed to be a burial place for important people in the tribe.

name: Marshall University
description: Marshall University is located in Huntington, WV and Home to the Thundering Herd. Facilities are available for meetings, wedding receptions, banquets, conferences. On campus housing available from mid May through mid July.

name: Martin & Jones Building
description: Consisting of hand-hewed beams, maple hardwood floors and a four-story original freight elevator, this building was constructed in 1900 and first served as the Greenbrier Produce Company. Having been in Ronceverte since 1904, Martin & Jones moved into the building in 1917.

name: Martinsburg Roundhouse
description: Martinsburg’s railroading history dates back to the 1840s with the presence of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company. Engine and machine shops were used to expand the company. During the Civil War, railroads played an important part in transporting supplies and troops. On May 22, 1861, Thomas “Stonewall” Jackson’s troops halted trains traveling east at Martinsburg and Point of Rocks. Locomotives and cars, as well as tracks, bridges, telegraph wire, “Colonade” Bridge, B&O roundhouse and machine shops were destroyed. In 1866, the B&O began efforts to rebuild the roundhouse and associated machine chops for servicing locomotives. Used until the mid-1980s, the Martinsburg Roundhouse is the only cast iron-framed structure of its kind still standing today. It was also the site of the First National Labor Strike of 1877 and was a key site early during the Civil War.
address: 100 East Liberty Street, Martinsburg, West Virginia, 25401

name: Mary B’s Diner
description: Mary B's Diner offers home cooked food. They are known for their homemade pies.

name: Mary Conrad Park
description: Overlooking the beautiful shore of Stonewall Jackson Lake. Only 5 miles from I79 exit 91. This rentable location has a shelter, fireplace, restrooms, and grills available. Contact Dave Stutler at 304-677-5528.

name: Mash Brewing Company
description: Mash Brewing Company in Charles Town, West Virginia, is a local micro brewery offering a rotating list of craft beer for tastings and growler fills.
address: 122 N. George St., Charles Town ​, WV, 25414

name: Mash Fork Falls
description: Home to Camp Creek State Park, Mash Falls lies within the forest of Mercer County along Mash Fork – which empties into Camp Creek. Standing at 8 feet tall, this outdoor gem plunges over a sandstone ledge and is located next to the parking area. Take a short walk on the gravel road, and you’ll discover a second waterfall. Reach the perfect viewing platform as you travel Mash Fork Falls Trail – arriving at the optimal vantage point.

name: Mason County Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Whether your passions include history, mystery, nature and the outdoors, or anything in between, Point Pleasant and Mason County have something to excite you and your entire family. Come on down - we look forward to welcoming you! We promote local attractions, festivals, events, and provide visitors with information and brochures not only about our area, but from around the state and our neighboring state of Ohio.

name: Mason Dixon Historical Park
description: The publicly owned, 295-acre Original Mason-Dixon Historical Park was established in the 1970s to commemorate the great achievement of Charles Mason and Jeremiah Dixon, the English astronomers who surveyed the Mason and Dixon Line. Brown's Hill is a National Historic Landmark and the Mason and Dixon Line is a National Civil Engineering Landmark. This location has been so honored because it was on Brown's Hill that Mason and Dixon were obliged to end their survey, 23 miles short of their goal. The Park has two pavilions, amphitheater, playground, ball courts, dining room, museum, gift shop.

name: Mason Jar Antique & Craft Mall, The
description: Huge craft and antique mall with a large variety of primitives, antiques, candles and Amish made furniture. New items everyday! We offer layaway and we deliver furniture locally.

name: Matewan Depot Replica Museum
description: The Matewan Depot Replica Museum is a replica of the train depot that stood across the railroad tracks from downtown Matewan until the 1960s. It houses artifacts and info from the Hatfield/McCoy Feud as well as the Matewan Massacre. It also has a gift shop. Visitors can explore and experience the Matewan Depot Replica Museum at their own pace. The Depot also functions as a welcome center, so feel free to stop by and ask for tips about where to go and what to do.

name: Matewan Floodwall
description: The town of Matewan has a unique feature that surrounds the entire downtown area – a floodwall. The exterior of the wall tells the history of Matewan through carefully placed vertical fluting that forms an etched mural. This feature is a must-see in town. Visitors walking the path see the art on the floodwall while enjoying the Tug Fork River. The floodwall may spend the majority of its time as a piece of information art, but it also serves an important function. According to the former mayor of Matewan, Robert McCoy, the town was once described as having the most severe flooding problem in the United States. This label was well earned, as according to McCoy, by 1984, the town had faced severe, property damaging flooding in 33 of the prior 35 years. The most catastrophic floods occurred in 1957, 1963, 1977 and 1984. You can see the heights that these floods reached on the steps that lead to the river, and even as high as the floodwall. Relief came in 1992 when the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers began constructing the 2,350-foot long floodwall. Since the construction of the wall, there hasn’t been an instance of significant flooding within the downtown Matewan area.

name: Matoaka Mountain ATV Resort
description: Matoaka Mountain ATV Resort has cabin and campground sites for ATV riders looking to enjoy the Hatfield-McCoy ATV Trails. Each of our cabins hosts amenities, such as heating, air conditioning, bunk beds, a futon, a mini-refrigerator, a microwave, a coffee pot, cooking utensils, dishes, and a dining area. Each cabin also has a fire pit, outside grill, and picnic table. Remember to bring your own sleeping bags, blankets, and pillows.

name: Mavis Manor
description: 1897 Queen Anne Victorian Manor, located on 33 acres in southern WV. Family friendly, with Wi-Fi, Disc Golf, hiking and fishing. I-77 and Winterplace Ski Resort only 5 minutes away. Perfect for a weekend getaway with friends. Check in time 4pm – check out 11ish. 4 lovely guest rooms, or the entire manor (sleeps 14). All major credit cards accepted. Rt. 19, Flat Top. "Why stay anywhere else?""

name: Maybeury ATV Resort
description: Whether you have a small group or a large group of 18 people, our spacious lodge is perfect for your needs. Conveniently located near the Hatfield-McCoy system of trails, our lodge is truly a haven for beginning and expert ATVers. A few of the features and amenities of our resort include: *2,000 Square Feet of Living Space *4 Bedrooms and 9 Beds *2 Bathrooms and 3 Showers *Flat Screen TVs in All Rooms *Satellite TV *Great Rooms with AC *Full-Size Kitchen *Large Paved Parking Lot *Next Door to a Gas Station Nearby Trailheads: Pocahontas Trailhead: Distant from Resort: 1.7 miles Indian Ridge Trailhead: Distance from Resort: 2.5 miles Warrior Trailhead: Distance from Resort: 8 miles Check in after 3pm Check out before 11am

name: McColloch’s Leap
description: In September 1777, during a Native American siege on the fort, Major Samuel McColloch arrived at the fort with 40 mounted men from Short Creek. The gates of the fort were thrown open to allow the men entrance. Major McColloch lingered behind to guide and protect the men. The Indians attacked, and all of the men except McColloch made it inside before they were forced to close the gates. McColloch found himself alone and surrounded by Native Americans, and he rode immediately towards the nearby hill in an attempt to escape. McColloch had earned a reputation as a very successful "borderer" (one who protected the frontier borders from the Native Americans) and was well known to both the frontiersmen and the Indians. The Indians eagerly pursued McColloch, and drove him to the summit of the hill. As he rode along the top of the hill, he encountered another large body of Indians. He now found himself surrounded, with no path of escape. He knew, because of his reputation and history against the Indians, he would be tortured and killed with great cruelty if he were to be captured alive. With all avenues of escape cut off, he turned and faced the precipice, and with the bridle in his left hand and his rifle in his right, he spurred his horse over the edge to an almost certain death. The hill at that location is about 300 feet in height, and in many places is almost perpendicular. The Indians rushed to the edge, expecting to see the major lying dead in a crumpled heap at the bottom of the hill. To their great surprise, they instead saw McColloch, still mounted on his white horse, galloping away from them. As legend of this famous "leap" became known, the place where it occurred became known as McColloch's Leap. A historical marker now memorializes the site of his daring feat.

name: McCoy’s Grand Theatre
description: The McCoy's Grand Theatre and Museum is a historical treasure located on North Main Street in Moorefield, W.Va. Formerly used as a movie house, the theater has been remodeled and now acts as a showcase for community theater productions. The theater also is available for rent and frequently hosts local events. Please click the appropriate tab above for more information on our upcoming shows, college scholarship, and more. We hope to see you soon at McCoy's Grand!

name: McLure Hotel and Conference Center
description: Welcome to one of the first hotels in America, the McLure Hotel and Conference Center is located in Wheeling, WV, once the state's capital. The property consists of 170 guest rooms including a honeymoon room and Jacuzzi room, complimentary parking, limited continental breakfast, and free WIFI.

name: McNeel Mill
description: The McNeel Mill has been a fixture in Pocahontas County since 1868. It is a beautiful example of the ingenuity and craftsmanship of that time and served as a functioning mill--grinding corn, flour, and buckwheat up until 1947. Its valuable service to the community for seventy-nine years assured its spot in history. Located along Rt 219 in Mill Point.

name: McNemar House
description: McNemar House is a house show venue cultivating music and the arts in the foothills of the Allegheny Mountains. Hosts Bronson and Heather McNemar invite you to discover new acts in an intimate setting where you can see a show as well as meet the musicians. McNemar House also offers overnight accommodations.

name: Meadow River-WMA-Greenbrier
description: Wild life management area located in Greenbrier County.
address: 2006 Robert C. Byrd Dr., Beckley, WV, 25801

name: Meagher’s Irish Pub
description: Irish Pub featuring a menu of traditional Irish dishes and American gastropub fare. A warm inviting atmosphere to reconnect with family and friends over great food and drinks. We have a heavy focus on craft beer, and to prove it, we offer over a 100 different choices! 21 drafts and the rest in bottles and cans. We are always looking for new craft beers to showcase on draft or in bottles/cans. Not a beer lover? Never fear, we've got you covered with a selection of wines and a fully stocked bar featuring a large selection of Whisky's, Scotches and Bourbon, to appease everyone's taste buds. We feature live music on most weekends, along with many special events throughout the year including St. Patrick's Day, Hoptoberfest (our halfway to St. Patrick's Day and Octoberfest celebration rolled into one), Beer pairing dinners and tap take overs! Like us on facebook to stay up-to-date on upcoming events. Private room to accommodate special events and meetings. Meagher's Irish Pub is "Your Social Gathering Place".

name: Mecklenburg Inn B&B
description: Number of units: 3. Facilities: ac, TV available, children allowed, full breakfast, private & shared baths, non-smoking rooms, pets allowed, lounge, outdoor garden (in-season). Nestled in the National Historic District of Shepherdstown, the Inn was built when George Washington was President and is furnished in fine antiques. An English Style pub where locals come to relax and visit and sometimes dance til they drop! We feature a lovely courtyard for outdoor enjoyment as well as lodging above the bar upon reservation. We are a 21 and over ONLY establishment, so please bring your I.D. All of our service is bar service, meaning we do not offer table service, but the bar is lovely and a smiling face usually awaits your request. :) Our kitchen offers quality pub style dishes from Thursday through Monday. Our Pub hours are: M-F: 3pm-close, Saturdays 12-close, and Sundays 1:00- close. Closing hours between 12am and 2am, roughly. ***For Music bookings/bands please call Audra Costlow (703) 994-2287

name: The Meeting Place
description: A restaurant, convenience store, and fuel stop conveniently located just off interstate 64. The restaurant is closed on Mondays and major holidays. Home style cooking in a casual atmosphere. Breakfast is served until 11 a.m. Daily specials and homemade desserts are also available.

name: Memorial Park
description: Memorial Park is often considered an extension of Ritter Park due to its linear design, and continuance of the crushed limestone walking path. Located west of the Veterans Memorial Arch, the park has an array of activities including outdoor exercise equipment and a kids play area complete with a tilted sky rider, zip line and swings. The outdoor exercise equipment makes the walk even more physical enabling you to stretch or complete a full workout! Follow the walking path westward to the picnic shelter, or take the Paul Ambrose Trail For Health connector to Harveytown Park.

name: Mercer County Airport
description: Mercer County Airport is located in Mercer County, WV. We are a General Aviation Airport and we are open to the public. We have Jet A and AV Gas available Jet A $3.65; AV Gas $5.00 per gallon, full service or self serve Jet A $3.50, AV Gas 4.85 per gallon. We are open 7 days a week from 6a.m. to 10p.m. We encourage anyone with an interest in aviation to come check us out. We have a new Pilot's lounge with a New Flight Simulator. And for teens with an interest in learning to fly come check out the Civil Air Patrol on Tuesday Nights at 6:30. If you would like to learn more about the airport, airplanes, or flight instruction come see us. Clint Ransom Airport Manager Office Hours 830-430 Mon-Fri. Office located upstairs in main terminal building.

name: Mercer County Railroad Museum
description: The Princeton Railroad Museum is a must see when visiting Mercer County. They feature the Virginian Railway, but other railroads are represented including the N&W. The museum houses exhibits of railroad artifacts plus artwork, books, and photographs. A restored #308 Virginian caboose is available for people to explore as well as an area for children where they can build a track. There are puzzles, books and a gift shop. Tours available for school groups, scouts, and 4H.

name: Mercer Springs Farm
description: Training and Show facility for American Saddlebred horses. We also have riding lessons.

name: Metropolitan Theatre
description: “West Virginia’s most beautiful playhouse” Listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1984, the Metropolitan Theatre is a contributing structure in the Downtown Morgantown Historic District, and is one of the better surviving examples of neoclassical revival architecture in the region.

name: Mi Pueblito Mexican Restaurant
description: Mi Pueblio is a Mexican restaurant in downtown Matewan. Customer favorites include guacamole and chili rellenos. They also serve tacos, burritos, fajitas and quesadillas. Mi Pueblito provides a friendly, upbeat dining experience with great service.

name: Mi Pueblo
description: A family-owned restaurant with the experience and tradition of the authentic Mexican cuisine.
address: 2708 White Hall Blvd White, White Hall, WV, 26554

name: Mi Rancho Mexican Restaurant & Grill
description: Serving authentic Mexican cuisine in a family-friendly atmosphere.

name: Mia Margherita Coal Fired Pizzeria
description: Known for Neapolitan-style pizza cooked in a coal-fired oven, bringing you an Appalachian-Italian experience.

name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham-Bridgeport
description: Welcome to our top ranked hotel in North Central West Virginia. Enjoy friendly hospitality and top-notch amenities at our award-winning hotel for business and leisure. Each morning a continental breakfast buffet is served in the lobby. Guests can access high-speed Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and get a workout in the fitness room. We also offer on-site laundry facilities and a business center for your convenience. If you are looking to host a special occasion, our Bridgeport Conference Center is the area's top choice. Clarksburg Regional Airport and United Hospital Center are close, and guests can walk to local restaurants. We live up to our motto: "Designed for a better hotel stay."

name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Buckhannon
description: Buckhannon Microtel is a 63-room hotel offering guests single, double and suite accommodations. Property features include complimentary expanded hot breakfast and business center. Rooms feature free local and long distance calling, free high speed wireless internet,flat screen television,refrigerator/microwave,coffee makers,pillow-top mattresses and iron/ironing boards. From a great complimentary breakfast to comfy beds and free Internet access, we love offering guests everything needed!

name: Microtel Inn & Suites By Wyndham Charleston South
description: With our modern design and exceptional comfort, we make it easy to get settled so you can do more, see more, or just relax more. Upgrade to one of our suites and enjoy plenty of extra space, with extras including a pull-out couch, additional workspace, and a kitchenette that provides the conveniences of home. Start your day right with a free continental breakfast each and every morning. Choose from fresh muffins and bagels, a healthy selection of hot and cold cereals, and much more. Enjoy a cup of our fresh brewed coffee or tea while staying connected to our free WiFi, and you've got the perfect morning routine. Fitness & Pools--Just what you need while you're on the road! Being away from home doesn't mean you have to give up your routine. Enjoy fitness centers and pools at select locations to help you stay on track and refreshed during your stay. When you stay at Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham, you can earn Wyndham Rewards points redeemable for FREE NIGHTS, flights, gift cards and more. Free WiFi Free Breakfast Onsite Parking Fitness Center Business Center Laundry Facilities

name: Microtel Inn & Suites – Hazelton/Bruceton Mills
description: All rooms include: 27-inch TV, free long distance and local calls, hair dryers, coffee makers, irons and ironing boards. Free deluxe continental breakfast, free high-speed wireless Internet and onsite guest laundry. Government rates available. Directions: from Morgantown follow I-68 east to exit 29, Hazelton Road. Turn left off exit, then right onto Casteel Road. Hotel is located ahead on the right, in the beautiful and scenic Allegheny Mountains.

name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham-Keyser
description: Microtel Inn and Suites is now open in Keyser, WV. Located approximately 17 miles off I68 on 220 south, adjacent to Walmart. Featuring 61 guest rooms, with microwave and refrigerator in every room. Free expanded breakfast and fitness room.Free local and long distance phone calls within the continental U.S.Free wireless or wired internet in every room as well as public areas.

name: Microtel Inn & Suites By Wyndham Mineral Wells/Parkersburg
description: The Microtel by Wyndham is just off of I-77 and within easy reach of the West Virginia Motor Speedway, Little Kanawha River, restaurants and shops. The downtown Parkersburg business district and hospitals are also nearby, and the Wood County Airport is 15 miles away. Wake up to a complimentary continental breakfast and enjoy the fitness center and complimentary wireless Internet any time. This hotel also offers laundry facilities, dry-cleaning, a business center with computer access and fax service, and car parking. The inviting, modern guest rooms feature flat-screen TV, refrigerator and microwave, ideal for longer stays.
address: 94 Old Nicolette Road, Mineral Wells, WV, 26150

name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham – New Martinsville
description: Welcome to our Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham New Martinsville hotel, which offers easy access to New Martinsville Downtown Historic District and Lewis Wetzel Wildlife Management Area. We are ideal for business guests since we are located near local companies. Our location is 100% non-smoking with convenient services and amenities including free breakfast, an on-site micro mart, and free WiFi internet access. Stay on track with a trip to our onsite business center, a workout in our 24 hour fitness center, and free daily hot breakfast buffet as well as weekly evening social to brighten your stay. Look your best with the use of our guest laundry and same day dry cleaning services. All of our clean and accommodating rooms offer free WiFi, 43 inch HDTV with streaming services such as Netflix and Hulu available for a nominal fee, microwave, mini-refrigerator, as well as a coffee and tea maker. Free parking is available onsite and meeting space can be reserved. Whether you are traveling for business or leisure you will feel right at home in our New Martinsville hotel.
address: 410 N State Route 2, New Martinsville, WV, 26155

name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham- Wheeling Triadelphia at the Highlands
description: Our Award Winning Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Wheeling/ Triadelphia at the Highlands is the ideal fit for value conscious travelers who do not want to sacrifice comfort. Each one of our guest rooms comes equipped with a microwave, refrigerator and 32’’ HDTV. Greet the day with a free hot breakfast buffet, work out any time of day in our 24- hour fitness center and check email with free Wi-Fi. We also feature an onsite Micro Mart, guest laundry as well as a weekly manager’s reception to brighten your day. We are located at The Highlands, just off I-70 and minutes from downtown Wheeling West Virginia as well as other local attractions, restaurants and colleges such as West Liberty University, Wheeling Jesuit University & Bethany College.

name: Microtel Inn and Suites
description: Rooms feature complimentary Wi-Fi and cable TV. Suites add separate living rooms, as well as mini fridges, microwaves and coffeemakers. Kids age 17 and under stay at no cost with a parent. Freebies include parking, and continental breakfast served in a casual dining area. Pets are welcome by prior arrangement.

name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham
description: Enjoy a wild and wonderful vacation at an appealing rate when you stay at Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Princeton hotel, near Winterplace Ski Resort. With a convenient location off of Interstate 77, our non-smoking hotel puts fantastic local attractions at your fingertips.

name: Mid-Ohio Valley Regional Airport (PKB)
description: The Mid Ohio Valley Regional Airport serves the WV counties of Wood, Pleasants, Wirt, and Ritchie as well as Washington County, OH and provides commercial service to Washington DC twice daily and full service to business jets. Contour Airlines is servicing the Mid-Ohio Valley Regional Airport with service to Charlotte, N.C. and Tampa FL. Gateway to the U.S.A. and beyond! The 6,781 ft. main runway can accommodate all forms of business traffic and charter traffic up to 150,000 lbs. while the 4,000 ft. crosswind runway keeps general aviation traffic flowing smoothly. The FAA contract control tower is the only one in the area. Give us a try. Free Parking! No long security lines!
address: 543 Airport Rd., off Rte. 31, Williamstown, WV, 26187

name: Middle Mountain Cabins (USDA Forest Service)
description: The Middle Mountain Cabins are nestled in a small grassy opening, near a small pond and Camp Five Run. These rustic, secluded cabins offer a quiet retreat for all who visit. One cabin has kitchen and beds and the other two are furnished with beds. The cabins are intended for groups that rent them all at one time. The cabins are located off Forest Road 14. Cabin season: April 1 - December 15th. Reservations are required. Reservations can be made online through recreation.gov or by calling (877) 444-6777. Check-in time is 2pm, check-out time is 12pm.

name: Middle Ridge Campground
description: Our campground features 18 large wooded campsites (for RVs or Tents) with picnic tables & fire-rings, Full Hook-Up & Pull-Thru Sites, Swimming Pool, Bath House (Closes November 28th and Reopens April 15th), 2 Ponds (Catch and Release Fishing), 2 Pavilions, Hiking Trails, Swings, Horseshoes and Dump Station. Pet Friendly. We welcome groups! We also have one camping cabin which includes water and electric in the cabin, picnic table and fire-ring with Adirondack chairs.

name: Midland Trail National Scenic Byway
description: The Midland Trail stretches border to border across West Virginia, following U.S. Route 60 from Kenova at the Kentucky border through the capital city of Charleston and Hawks Nest State Park to White Sulphur Springs on the Virginia border. Take a curvy road car trip for 180 miles to see eye-popping scenic vistas; world-class outdoor adventure; rich history; and antiques, art, and artisans.

name: Midway Drive In
description: Established in 1939, Midway Drive-In has been a staple on the west side of Huntington, WV. The Midway Drive-In experience is more than just delicious hot dogs, crispy fries, amazing cheeseburgers, & decadent homemade milkshakes. Midway is a slice of history, a dream, a passion, and a family. Cory & Bill hope you love Midway as much as they do! As Seen on the Food Network: Guilty Pleasures

name: Mill Creek Cabins
description: Nestled in the beautiful West Virginia mountains in the heart of the New River Gorge, your cabin comes equipped with many amenities, which will help make your time here a pleasant adventure! While you are relaxing as our guest in Mill Creek’s fresh mountain location, take time to enjoy the many area attractions; including the world renowned New River Gorge Bridge and the Gauley River National Recreation Area. You may also choose to enhance your leisure time with world-class white water rafting, golf, hiking, horseback riding, mountain biking, rock climbing, fishing and hunting, as well as a pleasant visit to several nearby West Virginia State Parks. Notably, just a short drive away is Summersville Lake, which offers Pontoon rentals; and Winterplace Ski Resort is only one hour south of Lansing. Mill Creek Cabins are located in the beautiful West Virginia mountains in the heart of the New River Gorge 1/2 mile off Rt.19, a couple miles from the New River Gorge Bridge in Lansing, WV. Entrance is located at 1163 Milroy Grose Road.

name: Mill Creek Falls of Hawk’s Nest
description: Mill Creek Falls can be spotted while hiking along the Hawks Nest Rail Trail. With waters falling in a 20-foot drop, these falls are the largest of several found along the trail. This beautiful spot offers gorgeous views all year round, so your one-mile hike to this treasure will be a treat no matter when you pass by.

name: Mill Creek Falls of Kumbrabow
description: Within the woods of the Kumbrabow State Forest, Mill Creek Falls is a hidden gem of the Allegheny Highlands. Standing at just 20-feet tall, this small cascade pools into the mountain streams that lie below. Perched within West Virginia's highest forest, Mill Creek Falls is also a popular swimming hole and fishing spot for anglers. Once you are in Kumbrabow State Forest, follow the signs to a parking area just off the road, where you can access the wooden steps down to Mill Creek Falls.

name: Miller’s ATV
description: Shop Miller’s for all of your ATV and dirt bike riding needs. We provide a wide selection of parts, accessories and machines. We even have an onsight garage if you should need repairs. Miller's also carries Hatfield McCoy Trail tee shirts as well as other riding clothes.

name: Milleson’s Walnut Grove Campground
description: We are a seasonal, family campground. We have 200 tent/trailer sites, 20 RV sites, 30/50 amp electric, bath house with hot showers, handicap accessible restrooms, laundry room, camp store, public phone, fire rings and picnic tables on all reservation sites, pavilion, small playground, pebbled beach, horseshoe pits, volleyball court, basketball court, and large grassy field for other outdoor activities. Milleson's offers a variety of lots for overnight and weekend camping, as well as seasonally leased sites. Our lots are all unique in size, shape, and amenities. Our campers enjoy access to a diverse section of the South Branch of the Potomac River, and also a variety of family friendly activities throughout the entire camping season. Lease customers enjoy camping from April 15th through October 31. Reservation camping begins in May and ends September 30th. Call ahead to schedule an appointment or make a reservation. We are located off the beaten path 30 minutes North of Romney, WV; 45 minutes South of Cumberland, MD; and about 10 minutes from the small town of Springfield, WV. Our campground is situated 3 miles down a country dirt road, on a working livestock farm, along a bend in the South Branch of the Potomac River.

name: Milton Flea Market & Halfway Market
description: The Milton Flea Market is open year round Fridays - Sundays. It attract hundreds of vendors and thousands of visitors from around the country. The flea market features a large variety of personal items, vintage and collectible items, as well as produce and fresh baked goods. You'll find bargains galore in the climate-controlled interior of the Milton Flea Market! The Halfway Market was established in 1970 by Boyd and Betty Meadows. It was originally a produce market, however over the years it has evolved into a market of specialties. Not only is there a large selection of fresh produce, we also carry Amish jams and canned items, Amish furniture, and Amish cheese. We also carry quilts, handbags, fudge, dried fruit, trail mixed, bulk spices, bulk foods, homemade apple butter, Amish made sorghums, and honey. Don’t forget to check out the great greenhouse that is stocked with perennials, and seasonal annuals. We also have a location at 3717 Teays Valley Road Hurricane, WV 25526 304-757-6444

name: Minard’s Spaghetti Inn
description: Minard's, since 1937, has offered a real home-cooking style restaurant, affordable prices, and the best quality ingredients in our foods. Make Minard's a family tradition for dinning, parties and receptions. Info, please call 304.623.1711. Spaghetti is in the name and it’s what we're famous for! The homemade salad dressing is also a must. The perfect place for home cooked Italian food!

name: Mingo Bottom Golf Club
description: Mingo Bottom Golf Club is a beautiful 18 hole Golf Club located only 1 mile from Elizabeth on the Little Kanawha River. The golf course features 180 acres of rolling greens, ponds, and breathtaking views. The Club includes a complete practice facility with driving range, practice green, Club Car gas carts, available golf lessons, pro shop, and an expanded Club House menu. The outdoor shelter gives you a beautiful view of the course and seats 120. It's a scenic 20 minute drive from I-77 exit 170 south on WV 14.

name: Miracle Mountain Wilderness Park
description: The Miracle Mountain Wilderness Park exists to promote and provide a social and recreational area for the citizens of the local communities of McDowell County. The park hosts reunions, weddings, picnics, dances and private parties. All visitors are welcome to come to Miracle Mountain to enjoy the beauty and relaxation of this wonderful mountain retreat nestled deep in the heart of the Appalachian woodlands.

name: Miss Blues Restaurant
description: Hometown diner and local favorite located just across from historic Fish Creek Covered Bridge. Open daily Mon-Fri: 6am to 8pm; Sun. 6am to 3pm.

name: Miss Blues
description: Miss Blues has been open since 1950. Serving breakfast all day long, Miss Blues is a must visit destination for any food enthusiast. Nestled in the hills of Hundred, Miss Blues specializes in homemade pies and cakes.

name: Modern Homestead Guest House
description: Comfort on a budget can be found at Homestead Inn, located 12 miles outside of Morgantown in the town of Reedsville. Our five immaculate guest suites are newly renovated and comfortably furnished with fully-equipped kitchens, laundry, private baths and private parking. Be sure to visit our gift and coffee shop at Modern Homestead for unique gifts and delicious house made pastries and handcrafted drinks. You will be close to area attractions including WVU Stadium & Coliseum, Arthurdale Heritage, Kingwood, river rafting and Deckers Creek Rail Trail. West Virginia native Lucas Tatham and New Orleans native Trellis Smith redeveloped and restored this historic property dating back to the 1930s. Check-in time is after 3pm. Checkout by 11am.
address: 52 South Robert Stone Way, Reedsville, WV, 26547

name: Moncove Lake State Park
description: Moncove Lake State Park is tucked away among the hills on the southeastern edge of West Virginia. With all park facilities located within easy walking distance, this is the place to enjoy the simple things in life. The campground offers 48 tent and trailer sites, 34 of which have electric hookups. There are picnic tables and fire rings with grill surfaces, drinking water, dump stations and a central bathhouse with showers. Firewood is available for purchase. Three picnic shelters take reservations which can be made by calling the park office. There are also picnic areas for groups of varying sizes with grills and tables at each area and restroom facilities, water nearby, and two playground areas in the picnic area. The campground is open spring through fall, weather permitting. Campsites may be reserved anytime online, by phone, or at the campground office. The outdoor activities include camping, fishing, boating, swimming, bird watching, and hiking.
address: 695 Moncove Lake Access Rd / County Road 4, Gap Mills, WV, 24941

name: Monongahela National Forest – Cheat Ranger District Office
description: U.S. Forest Service Office is located in the Monongahela National Forest and home of the Northern Research Station. The Cheat Ranger District is located in Parsons, WV. Some of the district’s highlights include: Otter Creek Wilderness - Solitude-filled wilderness adventure for those looking to be a self-reliant traveler. Canaan Mountain Backcountry - Gorgeous scenic recreation hub filled with trails that will transport you into a rhododendron-filled fairy tale.
