description: Tee times are made on Wednesday by telephone only from 11:00 a.m. until 1:30 p.m. The only number available for tee times is 304-295-7000. After 1:30 p.m. on Wednesday, the golf shop will take walk-in-requests.

name: Parkette
description: Since the 1950s, the Parkette has been a Bridgeport/Clarksburg area staple. Enjoy what generations of locals have enjoyed: great Italian and diner food.

name: Parkway Drive-In
description: Known for genuine drive-in menu with great milkshakes, hot dogs, cheeseburgers, fries, etc.

name: Pasquale’s
description: For over 55 years, Pasquale’s has been delighting our customers with the finest Italian cuisine in the area. Specializing in both intimate dining and group events, our warm and relaxed atmosphere has made us a year-round favorite with local residents and travelers. Join us in our casual dining room, our intimate formal dining room, our relaxing sunroom with televisions or relax on our outdoor patio.

name: Paterno’s at the Park
description: Paterno's at the Park is known for great Italian dishes including stuffed peppers and the colossal meatball. We also feature steaks and seafood. We always strive to offer the best in casual fine dining with our extensive wine list, made to order menu options, and exceptional service. Our certified angus beef steaks cannot be matched by any other Charleston WV Restaurants, and our bar offers the perfect environment for that casual meal or meeting any time of the day.

name: Pathfinder of WV
description: Since 1973 Pathfinder of WV has been West Virginia's foremost supplier of all things outdoors. We have West Virginia's largest selection of bicycles, kayaks, skis and snowboards, climbing equipment and hiking gear...all under one roof!

name: Pathfinder Of WV
description: Bikes, skates, skis, snowboards, paddling, camping and climbing.

name: Peacock Pub
description: We are a friendly neighborhood Pub featuring 14 taps with a rotating beer selection, great food and live music most weekends. Trail Riders Welcome!

name: Pegasus Farm Campground
description: Pegasus Farm Campground is the region's nicest and most relaxing camping facility just one miles South of Elkins. Amenities include: Full Hookups, 50 amp service, new bathhouse, large open sites, pond, grass maze, perfect for weddings, gardens, 20 acre tent camping area- creek side and meadow. Class A Friendly and a rating of 5 stars.

name: Peking House – Morgantown
description: Peking House is a cornerstone in the Morgantown community and has been recognized for its outstanding Chinese cuisine, excellent service and friendly staff. Our Chinese restaurant is known for its modern interpretation of classic dishes and its insistence on only using high quality fresh ingredients. We offer delicious dining and takeout to Morgantown, WV.

name: Pete Dye Golf Club
description: Pete Dye Golf Club is #60 on Golf Digest's ranking of America's 100 Greatest Courses and #13 on Golfweek's ranking of the Best Modern Courses. Spread out over 250 acres amidst the Appalachian Mountains, the fairways bob and weave through wildly rugged terrain and Dye’s graceful earth sculptures.

name: Petersburg Trout Hatchery
description: The water at the Petersburg Trout Hatchery is supplied by an underground spring–water temperatures stay between 52 and 56 degrees all year! The trout are part of the West Virginia Division of Natural Resources stocking program.

name: Philippi Covered Bridge & Historic District
description: The city of Philippi was the site of the first land battle of the Civil War on June 3, 1861. Built in 1852, the bridge was heavily utilized by both armies during the Civil War. During the battle, Union troops took control of the bridge and used it as a barracks. Severely damaged by fire in 1989, the bridge has been restored to its original appearance. It is one of the few such covered bridges still in use as a part of the federal highway system.

name: Pho Vinh Long
description: Each Vietnamese dish has a distinctive flavor which reflects one or more of these elements. With the balance between fresh herbs and meats and a selective use of spices to reach a fine taste, Vietnamese food is considered one of the healthiest cuisines worldwide.

name: Pickin’ In The Park Opry House
description: Hailed as West Virginia's own OPRY, and devoted to honoring real country, gospel and bluegrass music’s rich history, Pickin' In The Park showcases a mix of classic country, bluegrass, gospel and the contemporary real country sounding music that has have followed in their footsteps.

name: Pierpont Community & Technical College
description: Pierpont Community & Technical College shares a campus in Fairmont, West Virginia, with Fairmont State University. With an enrollment of more than 2,800, Pierpont offers more than 40 associate degree programs, skill sets, and certificates at sites throughout North Central West Virginia, including the Pierpont Center in Monongalia County, the Caperton Center and the Byrd National Aerospace Education Center in Harrison County, and the Braxton County Center in Sutton.

name: Pies and Pints – Charleston
description: The pizza crust is hand-stretched and baked on a stone hearth. Veggies are straight from the garden,pork is slow-roasted daily and chicken is cooked fresh. Pork and pepper nachos get the meal off to a great start, then split a pie—choices include Thai, black bean, Cuban pork and grape.

name: Pies & Pints – Fayetteville
description: Pies & Pints claims to have the “best pizza on the planet.” Our pies are hand stretched and baked directly on a stone hearth. We prepare our own tomato sauce from scratch! Here you’ll find unusual combos, great salads, an extensive imported beer list, top-notch service and great ambiance.

name: Pike Knob Preserve
description: Secluded amid a 3,600-acre string of protected peaks on North Fork Mountain lies The Nature Conservancy’s Pike Knob. This 1,600-acre preserve boasts some of the finest views in the state. Spruce Knob intercepts weather systems, causing storms to drop much of their rain and snowfall before they hit North Fork. As a result, the mountain is one of the driest in the East-making Pike Knob Preserve one of the most ecologically significant areas in the Central Appalachians.

name: Pine Hill Campground
description: SEASON: APRIL 1 TO NOVEMBER 1. Facilities: electric/water/sewer hookups, restroom facilities, showers, RV dumping station, picnic tables, fire rings, 3 miles of nature trails for hiking, two ponds and Beaver Creek for fishing, softball field, volleyball, bird watching, Extra charge for playground/firewood/ice.
address: 32 Pinehill Campground Drive, Bruceton Mills, WV, 26525

name: The Pines Country Club
description: This 18-hole championship course was laid out by pro designer Edmund Ault, and shaped by the rolling hills of West Virginia. In addition to its course, the Pines offers a driving range and putting green, a winter simulator, heated swimming pool, clubhouse facilities with lockers and showers, a restaurant that serves lunch and dinner, and banquet facilities for your special events. The restaurant, Clubhouse Grill & Catering, is open to the public. With all these amenities, plus Men's, Women's, and Junior tees, the Pines is a great gathering point for friends, business associates, and families.

name: Pinnacle Drive-Inn
description: This long-established Pineville eatery may be best known for its hoagies and hot dogs. The Pinnacle Drive Inn never ceases to draw first-time visitors as well as its loyal clientele. Located within minutes of Twin Falls Resort State Park.

name: Pinnacle Rock State Park
description: Pinnacle Rock State Park is a 396 acre day use park with a large stone outcrop with scenic overlooks, picnic areas, and a reservable stone picnic shelter with fireplace. The 7 miles of trails welcomes hiking and biking. Find directions, history and more at the park web link below.

name: Pipestem Drive-In Theater
description: We are open during the spring and summer and can fit more than 200 cars into this nostalgic drive-in theater. We have added radio, along with the speaker option. So, there are now two means of listening to the movie. Bring your lawn chairs, set up in the bed of the truck and have a grand old time!

name: Pipestem Resort State Park
description: A year-round facility, Pipestem Resort features two lodges, 26 cottages, 82 campsites, two golf courses, mini-golf, fling golf, foot golf, gift shops, restaurants, conference facilities, aerial tram, indoor and outdoor pools, nature center, riding stables, lake, tennis and game courts, hiking trails, amphitheater, picnic shelters and more. The web link includes park map, special rates, online reservation options, operating hours and a complete list of special events.

name: Pipestem RV Park and Campground
description: Our campground offers everything from 35 level, shaded, full hookup RV sites (includes water, electric, cable, internet), Coin Laundry Mat, and 7 primitive tent sites. We have a convince store for your basic needs and a playground for the kids.

name: Pipestem Spa, Event Center and Mountain Chalets
description: Pipestem Spa has been offering luxurious spa treatments in Southern West Virginia for a decade. The gorgeous, state of the art chalets on the property make this an ideal get-away for couple's or families. Pipestem Spa & Event Center also plans and executes elegant weddings, fun company picnics, reunions, birthdays, and more.

name: Pizza House
description: Family Restaurant specializing in Pizza, Sandwiches, Salads, Pasta, and Dinners. Serving lunch and dinner for dine in or carry out. Also feature a collection of over 800 pieces of Coca Cola memorabilia.

name: The Pizza Station
description: Positioned along the railroad tracks that run through the center of town, The Pizza Station’s newly remodeled facility continues the train theme throughout the restaurant. As its name suggests, it is best known for its pizza and nice, family-friendly atmosphere.

name: Pizzas & Cream
description: WV's best woodfired pizza and fresh frozen desserts!! We invite you to take part in a one-of-a-kind dining experience in our mountainside backyard. With custom brick oven specialty pizzas, homemade ice cream, gelato, and Italian ice, our award winning food will make you feel right at home. Carry out only. Cash or check, no credit cards.

name: Plants Etcetera
description: WV handcrafts, pottery, baskets, woodwork, candles, toys, crystals, cards and fossils.

name: Plateau Tree Farm & Nursery
description: Choose and cut Christmas Tree Farm. Directions: I-77 Exit 14 Toward Athens (4 Miles North Of Princeton) Go 1 Mile; Farm On Left On Mercer Springs Road. Products: White Pine and Canaan Fir. Mon - Sat: 9 a.m.- 6 p.m.; Sun: 1 p.m. - 6 p.m.

name: Pleasant Creek WMA – Barbour/Taylor
description: 3,030 acres. Deer, turkey, waterfowl, grouse, squirrel and rabbit species. Tygart Lake offers excellent fishing. Pleasant Creek and Doe Run Impoundments provide good bank fishing. Forty tent/trailer sites/fireplaces, picnic tables, well water and pit toilets. Rifle range (200 yard) - (physically challenged accessible). Nominal fees charged: $10 for a group of six or fewer and $2 for each additional person.
address: WV DNR RR 3 Box 180, Philippi, WV, 26416

name: Pleasant Valley Farms Retreat
description: Lodging has evolved away from the B&B to individual cottages and cabins but remains pet friendly! Surrounded by the Monongahela National Forest, even a short hike from our back door can be an unforgettable experience. The seasonal migration of the golden eagles promises a view of this most magnificent creature. Waterfalls and incredible rock formations located near the house are always interesting to explore. Family oriented, your children will have lots of room to play and explore.

name: Plum Orchard Lake Wildlife Management Area
description: The 2,953-acre Plum Orchard Lake Wildlife Management Area is located 5 miles north of Pax in Fayette County. It is accessible from Pax and Mossy via County Routes 23 and 23/1. Camping permit required from area manager. Plum Orchard Lake provides an excellent warmwater fishery for largemouth bass, bluegill, crappie, and channel catfish. It is one of the top producers of trophy size largemouth bass, bluegill, and channel catfish in the state. Large bluegill are abundant and can be caught easily on worms and small spinners. Fishing for channel catfish has been excellent after dark using natural baits. Largemouth bass are taken as early as the end of March on spinners, deep-running lures, and worms. The lake often remains clear when most impoundments in the state are muddy.
address: 1156 Plum Orchard Lake Rd, Scarbro, WV, 25917

name: Pocahontas ATV Resort
description: We have 11 cabins and two RV spaces. One RV site has water and electric hook up and the other has 50 amp electric hook up. 30 amp converters are available in the office. There are picnic tables and fire pits at both sites; a bathhouse and a lodge where your entire party can get together after a day on the trails and share your adventures! The resort is very spacious with plenty of room for trucks and trailers.

name: Pocahontas Cabins
description: Whether your plans call for biking the 70 or just 1 mile of the Greenbrier River trail, horseback riding in Watoga State Park, visit to Beartown, history lesson at Droop Mountain, railroad train ride on the Cass Scenic Railroad, hiking or hunting in the Cranberry Wilderness, white water rafting at New & Gauley, Skiing at Snowshoe, fishing for trout and bass in the Cherry or Elk rivers, or just sit back to listen to the roar of the Falls of Hills Creek... we have a property nearby!

name: Pocahontas Campground (USDA Forest Service)
description: This campground includes 8 rustic campsites located in a beautiful grove of white pine trees. Each campsite has a parking spur, picnic table, fire ring with a grill and a lantern hookup. Waste receptacles are provided. Several campsites also have a tent pad, although all sites are suitable for tent or trailer camping. Vault toilets and a hand pump well are located in campground. No hook-ups available. Located on Highway 92, approximately 14 miles south of Marlinton, WV.

name: Pocahontas County Artisans Co-op
description: Located in Marlinton, we showcase the original work of artists and craftspeople from Pocahontas County and the surrounding region. We are across the street from the Train Depot.

name: Pocahontas County Chamber Of Commerce
description: The Pocahontas County Chamber of Commerce promotes a progressive and sustainable business climate for our members through development, networking and education. We strive to enhance both our business and residential environments as we preserve our unique culture. The Chamber maintains a directory of businesses available to all citizens of the area, and with an updated website streamlines the processes of establishing a business in Pocahontas County, giving them the contacts they need, and will work with them to foster and grow their business.

name: Pocahontas County Convention & Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Nestled in the Allegheny Mountains, Pocahontas County is nature’s mountain playground. Whether you’re looking for epic outdoor adventures, family fun, inspiring views and sunsets or mountain music and unique festivals – Pocahontas County has a little bit of something for every explorer this winter. Nestled in the Allegheny Mountains, Pocahontas County is nature’s mountain playground. Whether you’re looking for epic outdoor adventures, family fun, inspiring views and sunsets or mountain music and unique festivals – Pocahontas County has a little bit of something for every explorer. [if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif] https://wvtourism.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/03.07.24-Pocahontas-CVB-Listing-Video-compressed-1.mp4

name: Pocahontas County Country Club
description: The Pocahontas Country Club, located just south of Marlinton, is a challenging 9-hole course noted for rolling terrain and unmatched scenic surroundings. A good score here demands accurate approach shots and a deft touch around the green. The challenging signature hole is a 201 yard, elevated tee, par 3 that requires a long accurate tee shot over water.

name: Pocahontas Fish & Game Adventures, LLC
description: This secluded half-mile of improved spring creek trout stream, four ponds and a restored log cabin caters to the fly fishing enthusiast. The private, lush surroundings create a serene haven for individual or family relaxation, but is only a few miles from Marlinton. The entire facility can be rented for a day or an extended period of time. Guide services are available.

name: Pocahontas Hide-a-Way
description: The view from the front porch is the Greenbrier River and the Greenbrier River Trail is in the back yard. We offer a fully-furnished three bedroom cabin with cable TV, extra nice kitchen, a back deck with a charcoal grill, and a picnic area on deck. We are just a short walk away from Jack Horners Store. Please call for specific directions.

name: Pocahontas Memorial Hospital
description: Pocahontas Memorial Hospital is committed to excellence in delivering compassionate health care and promoting healthy life styles. We are a Critical Access Hospital with Level IV Trauma Center and Rural Health Clinic.

name: Pocahontas County Opera House
description: The Opera House is Pocahontas County’s premier performing arts center. An intimate venue, with seating for about 250, the Opera House is part of the West Virginia Historic Theatre Trail. Its annual performance series brings more than a dozen performances on its stage each year, ranging from bluegrass to jazz, folk to musical theatre and everything in between.

name: Point Pleasant Bike Trail
description: The Point Pleasant Bike Trail currently consists of nearly 5 miles of clearly marked safe bike routes that stretch along Point Pleasant's historic streets, as well as a dedicated biking/walking trail along the banks of the Ohio River. You'll ride past beautiful murals along Point Pleasant Riverfront Park, get up close and personal with the Mothman statue, see where Point Pleasant gets it's name at Tu-Endie-Wei State park, and much more!

name: The Poky Dot
description: This 1950's-themed diner has the perfect retro atmosphere right down to the Formica tables and 1950's music. The Poky Dot is best known for its homemade potato chips. The Poky Dot has been the heart of good friends, good fun and great food.

name: Poling’s Dairy King
description: We offer casual dining options with carry-out. Our menu includes: ice cream, cheeseburgers, hamburgers, milk shakes, french fries , onion rings, pepperoni rolls, steak hoagies, etc. We are open seasonally.
address: RR 5 Box 680 (Rt. 19 South of Clarksburg), Clarksburg, WV, 26301

name: The Ponderosa Lodge Farm
description: The Ponderosa Lodge is the premiere organic farm stay for large groups in the Eastern United States. In the morning, learn about farm life by joining us as we feed and water farm animals and pick fresh, organic fruits and vegetables from the gardens. With ten bedrooms and bathrooms accommodating up to 32 people, The Ponderosa Lodge is ideal for large group events.

name: Portabella’s Italian Restaurant
description: We are an Italian family restaurant with homemade pizzas, pastas and more. Try our amazing garlic knots! Kid and ATV friendly.

name: Possum Holler Pizza
description: Pizza, burgers, sandwiches and Italian specialties. Local delivery, take-out and dine-in.

name: Possum Tail Farm, LLC
description: Possum Tail Farm is a family-owned and -operated farm in Terra Alta, WV. We raise Certified Naturally Grown Livestock. We strive to make discerning use of inputs, maintain excellent land stewardship practices, and produce high-quality products that people can feel confident eating. We take pride in producing quality meat by treating our animals well and feeding them organic feed and forages. We also host local family “Barn Dances” a few times a year.
address: 1771 Oak Grove Rd, Terra Alta, WV, 26764

name: Post House B&B
description: The Post House has spacious country bedroom accommodations - 1 guestroom with private bath and two with a shared bath. The large gathering room is perfect for socializing or relaxing boasting a warm fireplace, television, and VCR. Come and visit and sit on the front porch or lounge in the park-like backyard with a children's playhouse.
address: 306 Robert E. Lee Ave., Elkins, WV, 26241

name: Potomac Eagle Scenic Railroad
description: Your excursion begins at Wappocomo Station, situated next to a charming homestead and amidst grand mountain landscapes. Enjoy the sounds of vintage diesels as they lead you through beautiful pastures and farms dating back to the 1700s. As you journey along the South Branch of the Potomac River, you’ll enter a visually striking gorge known as the Trough. One of the most scenic spots along the South Branch, the Trough is home to American bald eagles. [if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif] https://wvtourism.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/Potomac-Eagle-Scenic-Railroad-Listing_Spring_2023.mp4

name: Potomac Highland Winery
description: The relatively warm climate at the vineyard site near Keyser enables us to grow vinifera and French-American hybrids, allowing us to make wines very unique to West Virginia. We offer tours, tastings and sales by appointment or take a chance. We are open most days and non-festival weekends.
address: 1493 Fried Meat Ridge Road, Fried Meat Ridge Road, Keyser, WV, 26726

name: Potomac Highlands Recreation Center
description: Visitors will discover a 12-lane bowling alley, roller skating rink, exercise room with 20 Nautilus machines, complete game room, big screen TV, bumper bowling for small children, and a full-menu snack bar with soft serve ice cream. A new attraction is the outdoor putt-putt golf course.
address: P.O. Box 1170 / Confederate Rd., Franklin, WV, 26807

name: Potomac Ridge Bed and Breakfast
description: The Potomac Ridge Bed and Breakfast is in the Harpers Ferry Historic District and overlooks the scenic Potomac River. Its ideal location gives guests walking access to all that Harpers Ferry has to offer whether it’s a stroll through our local shops, museums, and Civil War sites; a walk on the Appalachian Trail; or a bike ride on the C&O Towpath. Shepherdstown and the Antietam Battlefield, both within a short drive, are experiences not to be missed.l
address: PO Box 1003, 821 East Ridge Street, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Potomac Valley Audubon Society
description: The Potomac Valley Audubon Society was founded in 1982. We are a Chapter of the National Audubon Society. Our membership area includes Jefferson, Berkeley and Morgan counties in West Virginia and Washington County, Maryland. We offer an extensive range of programs and activities aimed at promoting greater understanding and appreciation of the natural world. It maintains four nature preserves that total more than 500 acres.

name: Precision Rafting
description: The Precision family is a close knit group of devoted Class V white water specialists. Each individual guide brings an abundance of river knowledge and skill to every fun and action-packed adventure. Precision Rafting Expeditions utilizes all safety measures and available precautions to help insure an incredible river experience. And to help move our trip along smooth and safe we have a well trained safety kayaker along every Class IV-V trip.

name: Preston County Country Club
description: Preston Country Club offers golf and dining to the public as well as its members. As one of West Virginia's longest golf courses at 7001 yards from the tips, PCC has hosted the Men and Women's Tri-State for over 20 years, the Senior Tri-State and other area tournaments. It is our pleasure to host civic groups, corporate outings, weddings and parties for various occasions.
address: 1 Camp Dawson Road/PO Box 2020, Kingwood, WV, 26537

name: Pretzel Arena
description: Facilities include sand arena with lighting, bleacher seating, announcers booth, cattle chutes, sorting & penning fencing available, covered pavilion with stage and concession stand. An open arena used for equestrian events, bull riding, barrel racing, cattle penning, mutton-busting and more. We have events open to the public often on the weekends.

name: Prickett’s Fort State Park
description: Prickett's Fort State Park is a 188-acre West Virginia state park north of Fairmont, W.Va. near the confluence of Prickett's Creek and the Monongahela River, and two miles from Interstate 79. The park features a reconstructed refuge fort and commemorates life on the Virginia frontier during the late 18th century. The original fort was constructed in 1774 to provide early settlers protection from Native American attacks. It was built within 10 miles of three major Indian trails. The fort was named after Capt. Jacob Prickett. In addition to the fort, the park also has an awesome visitors center, numerous events and activities, a boat launch, birding observation deck and is the trail head for the Mon River Trail. Pricketts Fort gift shop, orientation gallery and administrative offices are open year-round, Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. - 4 p.m.

name: Prime 44 West
description: Located at The Greenbrier Resort, Prime 44 West honors NBA legend and West Virginia native Jerry West. It is the ultimate classic steakhouse. The restaurant features an exquisite atmosphere of dark and natural woods that is both upscale and inviting. Nothing but the finest aged beef is served with extraordinary local ingredients, fresh seafood and a world-class list of wines. Signature tableside preparations along with house specialties such as the Jerry West 44 Ounce Porterhouse, Cathy Justice’s “Best of Show” Blue Ribbon Cornbread, Karen’s Italian Cream Cake and center court seating at the Private Dining Room are a few of our distinctive dining highlights.
address: The Greenbrier, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Prime on 4th
description: Located in downtown Huntington in the historic West Virginia building, Prime on 4th features an ultimate dining experience in an elegant but casual atmosphere. We offer an Appalachian inspired seasonal menu graced with contemporary cuisine. Prime on 4th marks the spot for an impressive wine list, creative cocktails, and an extensive bourbon selection. Guests can enjoy all of this in an intimate but upbeat atmosphere! Our 56 seated restaurant makes the perfect place for any occasion!
address: 910 4th Ave Suite 100, Huntington, WV 25701, Huntington, WV, 25701

name: Princeton City Park & Recreational Center
description: Thirty-five acre city park with exercise trail, olympic-size swimming pool with waterslide and picnic facilities.

name: Princeton Elks Country Club
description: "The Princeton Elks Country Club is a 9 hole facility which is conveniently located between Princeton and Bluefield just off of RT 460. With majestic pines lining the fairways, water hazards, and smooth rolling greens the course offers a challenge to players of all skill levels. With 5 sets of tees there is sure to be a yardage that will allow you to enjoy your round and still get there in 2. Our facility also has a practice green and driving nets to allow you to work on your game. If you live locally, and would like to get involved in a daily game, we have a group of members that play a friendly match Monday through Friday. Our friendly staff will make sure you have what you need to enjoy your round and all this comes at very affordable rates."

name: Princeton Powersports
description: We are family-owned and operated and conveniently located in Princeton, WV. Princeton Powersports can provide you with the latest and best in powersports products to make your outdoor living more enjoyable. From the most recent in ATV technology to the hottest new snowmobiles, we can help you find the recreational vehicle that’s made for you.

name: Princeton Public Library
description: The Library not only responds to, but also seeks to anticipate the informational, educational, and cultural interests and needs of Princeton and the surrounding areas. Princeton Public Library is a community resource center that enriches the lives of everyone.

name: Princeton Railroad Museum
description: Exhibits of railroad artifacts, artworks, lanterns, books, photographs, the Virginian Caboose#308 built in 1949 and corporate railroad material from the Virginian and Norfolk-Southern Railroads. The museum's newly acquired possession is an 1894 Sheffield Velocipede, one of the few in the whole nation.

name: Princeton Speedway
description: Watch the race under the lights every Friday night. Different models will race around a dirt track with cash prizes. Every year, the UBB 29 Miners Memorial race draws a huge crowd. Dirt track racing is a tradition in southern West Virginia. Drivers come from all over the East Coast.

name: Princeton Speedway
description: Track Type: Four-tenths mile, clay oval Racing Every Saturday Gates open at 5p.m. Heats at 6 p.m. Race at 7 p.m.  Admission: General - $10 / Pits - $20 / Children (12 and under) - Free Visit our Web site for more information.
address: I-77 Exit 14, Cornbread Ridge Rd., Princeton, WV, 24740

name: Princeton WhistlePigs
description: Watch the Princeton WhistlePigs play Appalachian League baseball every summer. Batter up!

name: PRO River Outfitters
description: We offer a variety of custom raft support guided fishing adventures on the rivers of southern West Virginia-the New, the Greenbrier, the Elk, and the Gauley. These fertile waters boast Smallmouth Bass, Walleye, Musky, and several species of Trout. From the first timer to the most fanatical fisherman, we have something for all anglers. We customize your trip to best fit with your vacation itinerary. We have two 4 bedroom vacation rentals available that will accommodate groups from 2 to 22.

name: Probst Furniture Makers
description: Family owned and operated, Probst Furniture Makers specializes in beautiful fine wood furniture. With over 30 years of experience, our contemporary wood furniture will delight you. Our handcrafted office furnishings are the perfect addition to any office space. We offer three beautiful collections: Meander, Dora and Otto.

name: Pullman Plaza Hotel
description: Huntington's only full service hotel in the heart of downtown dining and entertainment district. Two on-site restaurants, 202 rooms, outdoor pool, fitness center with massage therapist, high-speed Internet, meeting and banquet facilities, on-site full-service catering, handicap facilities and motorcoach parking available. Most major credit cards accepted.

name: Pullman Square
description: At Pullman Square, you'll find a variety of shopping and fun exciting adventures. We are constantly expanding our dining options to please all palates. For entertainment, enjoy a movie at the theater year round and our free outdoor Summer Concert Series from June through August!

name: Purple Fiddle
description: The Purple Fiddle is a family-friendly, non-smoking music venue, bar, and deli-style restaurant. We are located in the old DePollo General Store in historic Thomas, WV, in the beautiful Allegheny Mountains. Every week, and always on Friday and Saturday nights, the Purple Fiddle presents a touring professional, high-quality band. Our diverse music lineup includes: old-time and traditional bands, rock n’ roll, jazz, funk, reggae, old-country, Celtic and folk.

name: Purple Moon
description: Nestled in the heart of downtown Charleston, The Purple Moon is West Virginia's only shop specializing in mid-century modern design. with an ever changing inventory of vintage mid-century items, The Purple Moon strives to bring you the best of the period from Heywood-Wakefield, Russell Wright, Eva Zeisel, Paul Mccobb, Herman Miller, George Nelson, and many others.

name: Putnam County Chamber of Commerce
description: Putnam County Chamber of Commerce provides general information on Putnam County and aggressively promote, support and retain business in the county. Putnam County, WV is located in the second-fastest growing region of West Virginia. Conveniently situated along Interstate 64 between Charleston and Huntington, the state’s two largest cities, the area has undergone a period of rapid suburbanization.

name: Putnam County Parks and Recreation
description: Parks and recreation provides the community with: volleyball, tennis, baseball, softball and soccer fields, pools, walking trails, mini-golf, fishing ponds, picnic areas and shelters. Call for more information.

name: Putnam Farmers’ Market
description: The Putnam Farmers Market was established in 2009. The Putnam Farmers Market provides area farmers with alternative opportunities to sell their produce, meats, eggs, baked goods and crafts through a community retail marketplace. We provide consumers with fresh, nutritious, locally-grown produce in a convenient location. We offer educational forums for consumers to learn the value of supporting their community farmers to enhance food security.

name: Quality Hotel & Conference Center – Bluefield
description: 118 room facility, full service bar and restaurant on sight. Accommodations include full breakfast, all rooms have WiFi, 24 hour fitness center and spa. Limited pet rooms available, 2 suites, non-smoking and smoking rooms available. Newly remodeled in 2010, microwaves and refrigerators in some rooms. We offer a large ballroom and two other meeting facilities with catering services available.

name: Quality Inn – Beckley
description: Our Beckley Quality Inn hotel is suited for both family vacations and business travel, and includes a business center. All our guest rooms have TVs, coffee makers, hair dryers, recharge devices, irons and ironing boards. Some rooms also include microwaves, refrigerators and whirlpools. Hotel amenities include a seasonal outdoor heated pool, fitness room, free WiFi, and coin laundry facility. Discounts available for AAA, Seniors, Corporate travelers, many other Travelers Clubs.

name: Quality Inn & Conference Center – Lewisburg
description: Historic Lewisburg’s largest hotel offering free wireless high speed internet, seasonal outdoor pool, fitness center nearby, hot continental breakfast, restaurant and lounge. Suites, accessible rooms and complimentary airport shuttle service. When you’re ready to settle in for the night, our guest rooms feature TVs, hair dryers, coffee makers, irons and ironing boards. Select rooms offer kitchenettes, balconies and whirlpools.

name: Quality Inn – Fayetteville
description: Quality Inn New River Gorge is the closest and most complete full service motel in the area. Complete with its own bar and grill as well as an outdoor pool, lighted tennis, volleyball and basketball courts. Smoking and non-smoking rooms are available. High-speed Internet is provided free of charge. HBO, cable TV, guest laundry and plenty of parking. Pet friendly with plenty of area to walk/play with your pet. Banquet meeting space available. Yard games such as cornhole onsite.

name: Quality Inn – Princeton
description: Get mentally and physically refreshed in one of our guest rooms, all of which include refrigerators, coffee makers, hair dryers, irons, ironing boards and TVs. Select rooms also feature microwaves, free local calls, complimentary coffee and deluxe continental breakfast. Our leisure hotel offers fax and copy services, as well as a meeting room that can accommodate most events.

name: Quality Inn – Shepherdstown
description: Our Quality Inn is centrally located in Historical Shepherdstown, WV. Your guest room features a coffee maker, TV, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. Some rooms also offer a sofa sleeper. Your Q Bed features a comfortable, premium mattress and linens, a generous supply of fluffy pillows and a soft, plush blanket. We are pet friendly.

name: Quality Inn Spring Mills – Martinsburg North
description: Each smoke-free guest room offers a refreshing shower, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker and sofa sleeper. Your Q Bed features a comfortable, premium mattress and linens, a generous supply of fluffy pillows and a soft, plush blanket. Break a sweat in our exercise room or take a dip in our seasonal outdoor pool. Business guests will appreciate our business center—complete with copy, print and fax machines. We are located near Harpers Ferry National Historical Park and the Hagerstown Premium Outlets.
address: 1220 T J Jackson Dr, Falling Waters, WV, 25419

name: Quality Inn & Suites
description: Each guest room offers a refreshing shower, refrigerator, microwave, meeting space, a sundeck and copy, print and fax machines, coffee maker and hair dryer, along with an iron and ironing board. Your Q Bed features a comfortable, premium mattress and linens, a generous supply of fluffy pillows and a soft, plush blanket. The Value Qs deliver professional, responsive and friendly service and amenities like a free hot breakfast.

name: Quality Inn – Summersville
description: The Quality Inn hotel in Summersville, West Virginia is located near Summersville Arena and Conference Center, and is smoke-free. Guest rooms are modern and spacious and feature irons, hair dryers, and premium cable TV. We offer microwaves and refrigerators in most rooms. It is located right off of U.S. Route 19 and offers proximity to attractions like Summersville Lake, Carnifax Ferry State Park, New River Gorge Bridge and Kirkwood Winery. Amenities at the pet-friendly hotel include free full breakfast, free WiFi, business center, exercise room and outdoor heated pool.

name: Quality Inn
description: You can depend on us for affordable hotels with all of the amenities you expect and genuine service from people who are professional, responsive and friendly. All guest rooms come equipped with TVs, relaxing Q showers and cozy Q beds. Your Q bed features a comfortable, premium mattress and linens, a generous supply of fluffy pillows and a soft, plush blanket—because we know you deserve a good night’s sleep. Some rooms also feature microwaves, refrigerators and whirlpools.

name: Queen Street Gallery
description: Eclectic gallery, custom picture framing and antique shop featuring original rare and vintage posters (art, movie, travel and music), antique prints and maps, paintings to African artifacts and our many antiques of many different eras you are sure to find a one of a kind piece to create a focal point or compliment your décor.

name: Queen’s Point Coffee
description: An eclectic Coffee Shop with a Community oriented Vibe! Offering Espresso, and other coffee drinks as well as local teas, pastries, a light menu and lots of smiles! Queens Point Coffee celebrates the local heritage and outdoor attractions! Hours: Mon-Fri: 6am until 4pm; Sat-Sun: 7am-4pm

name: Quinet’s Restaurant
description: As New Martinsville’s oldest restaurant and best buffet around, we operate on of the largest and finest catering services in the Ohio Valley, serving all industries, organizations, and others, from large formal affairs down to small private parties. Our restaurant is known for its home-cooked foods and homemade desserts. Everything is prepared here in our kitchen with no preservatives, just like mom used to make.

name: RC Marshall Antiques and Barbershop
description: The RC Marshall Hardware Store was built in 1902 and served residents of the oil boom town of Cairo as a hardware and general store through the 1970s, selling everything from wood screws to baby dolls, to checkerboards and ceiling fans and kitchen tables. Original from its tin ceilings to authentic and hard-to-find supplies. In 2013, the RC Marshall Building reopened as an antiques store and classic barber shop. The building itself remains almost exactly as it was in the early part of the 20th century, including the tin ceilings.

name: Rail Explorers
description: Rail Explorers Elk River offers the freedom of the outdoors and the magic of the railroad unlike anything you’ve done before. This 12-mile round trip along Buffalo Creek and Gauley Railroad follows the twists and turns of the creek though the magnificent forest and passes two beautiful waterfalls. This is accessible to all ages and abilities. You’re on track for an unforgettable railbike adventure.
address: 867 Buffalo Creek Road, Buffalo Creek, West Virginia, 25043

name: Rail & Trail Store
description: No visit to the WILD HEART OF WEST VIRGINIA is complete without a stop at THE RAIL & TRAIL STORE, our distinctive retail shops, now in two locations. These may be found on the historic Staunton-Parkersburg Turnpike in downtown Durbin and at the new "Railyard Restaurant" located adjacent to the Depot in the heart of downtown Elkins. Here you will find a unique collection of odd, off-the-wall, strange, and unusual gifts and souvenirs, including hats, T-shirts, books, and many different types of rail and outdoor-related items. For those with a larger-than-usual appetite, the now legendary "BIG SCOOP" hand-dipped ice cream cone is a required feature of the Durbin experience.

name: Raleigh County Memorial Airport (BKW)
description: Commercial Airlines: Via Air - Daily flights to and from Charlotte Douglas International Airport (CLT) Car Rental Info: Avis - 304-255-0447 Hertz - 304-252-3841 Enterprise - 304-929-3905 Nearby Cities and Attractions: Beckley (6 mi.) - Tamarack, Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, Glade Springs Resort Fayetteville (33 mi.) - New River Gorge Bridge, white water rafting, hiking, biking, climbing, etc. Lewisburg (48 mi.) - Carnegie Hall, The Greenbrier, Greenbrier River Trail, Smooth Ambler Spirits

name: Ramada Limited – Huntington
description: Each of our rooms have free WiFi and a 37-inch flat-screen TV. Our indoor pool, sun deck, whirlpool spa, and fitness center make relaxation on the road easier than ever. Join us for our deluxe continental breakfast. Suites and efficiency rooms, as well as accessible and non-smoking rooms, are available. With 4000 square feet of event space, our hotel features 3 meeting rooms, which can be arranged to accommodate 200 conference guests or 200 banquet guests.

name: Randolph County Community Arts Center
description: Built in 1928, the former St. Brendan’s Catholic Church, served the Catholic community until 1999. Walter F. Martens, the architect who designed the Governor’s executive mansion in Charleston, designed the church using a Romanesque Revival style. The building features locally quarried sandstone blocks on the outside with a border of stone relief angels around the entire building. In 2000, the Randolph County Community Arts Council purchased the building, renovating and reopening it in 2001. The original nave has been transformed into “The Great Hall,” retaining the beautiful original lighting fixtures and religious icons. The Arts Center hosts exhibits, concerts and more than 100 art and music classes each year. (Listed NRHP 2006)

name: Randolph County Museum
description: The Randolph County Historical Society opened the Randolph County Museum in 1973 at the Blackman-Bosworth building located in Beverly, West Virginia and has been presenting the history of Randolph County residents ever since. The Randolph County Museum is housed in the Blackman-Bosworth Store, and also includes a Subscription Schoolhouse, and the Jacob Stalnaker Cabin. The Society also owns the Mt. Iser Confederate Cemetery located in Historic Beverly. The Randolph County Museum has a fairly substantial collection of artifacts from various time periods including the pre-historic era, the American Civil War, World War I, and the not so distant past. The items throughout the museum are used to tell stories about the residents of Randolph County as displayed in the exhibits.

name: Ranson Convention and Visitors Bureau
description: Perfectly placed in the heart of Jefferson County, West Virginia sits Ranson, a quaint town known for its culture, historic locations, and activities. Whether you are into browsing through museums, visiting historic battlefields, or having a blast at the horse races, each experience is memorable for everyone. From a relaxing tubing ride down the Shenandoah River, to watching a thrilling race at the Summit Point Raceway, Ranson is just the place to do it all. Ranson stands out whether you are looking for adventure, history, excitement or a quiet weekend trip.

name: Ranson Hollows
description: Ranson Hollows holds rustic- chic weddings, baby/bridal showers, reunions, or any occassion you’d want to celebrate Mountain State- style. Get married inside or outside of their red barn, sit down to dinner in their pavilion, then celebrate the night away in one of the most peaceful spots in Jackson County.

name: The Ravenswood Inn Bed and Breakfast
description: The Ravenswood Inn Bed & Breakfast is a lovely restored Late Victorian Era Folk Style house with an interior exceptionally appointed by nationally known interior designer Kim Quillen of Ravenswood. We have three comfortable rooms. The Inn is adjacent to downtown Ravenswood, and is walking distance to antique stores, restaurants, and parks.

name: Raymon’s Catering & Restaurant
description: Raymon's Restaurant in Harrison County is about the family. It's a family-run business and the most popular dishes come from family recipes. Since 1980, Raymon's has offered catering parties for wedding, anniversary, Christmas parties, class reunions, and other events. Raymon's also sells our popular Italian Dressing. After 35 years, we are still going strong!

name: Rebecca’s Touch
description: As vendor in the Blue n Gray Antique Mall, we are a lovely little retail shop filled with all kinds of different merchandise. A great place to look for items to add to your collection, find a gift for that wedding or anyone's birthday, and of course local souvenirs. We have a selection of jewelry, quilts,furniture, glassware, etc. for sale.
address: 26 E. Main St., White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Recovery Sports Grill
description: Recovery Sports Grill is more than just a sports grill and bar—it’s a family and fan friendly restaurant with great food and drink, and a casual atmosphere tied together by both local and professional sports. We feature wings and tenders, kids menu, healthy options, soups, salads, burgers, steaks, prime rib, seafood, and sandwiches.

name: Red Caboose
description: Traditional Italian American food, family friendly, great prices. We can accommodate large groups and we offer take out.

name: Red Creek Campground
description: There are 12 sites available on a first come, first serve basis. This campground is usually full every week-end. Season: Mid-April - early December. Campground users should bring their own water or be prepared to treat any water. Accessible Vault Toilets. Directions: From Petersburg, WV, go south on 28/55 to State Route 4 (Jordan Run Road). Follow SR 4 for one mile and turn left onto Forest Road 19. Follow FR 19 for 6 miles and turn right onto Forest Road 75. Follow FR 75 for 7 miles to the campground.

name: Red Roof Inn – Fairmont
description: When you check in, check out the fantastic new amenities in our newly-renovated rooms! The rooms at this 100% smoke-free inn feature new, comfy Rest Suite beds by Serta, new high-end bedding, new flooring and a large, flat screen TV.

name: Red Roof Inn – Huntington
description: Red Roof Inn Huntington features newly-renovated rooms with free Wi-Fi and a flat screen TV and offers On Command Video with a selection of free TV channels, pay-to-view premium channels, movies, music and games. Select rooms offer microwave and mini-refrigerator units. Free coffee and tea available in the lobby. One well-behaved family pet per room is welcome. This 100% smoke-free hotel is close to I-64 near Huntington Mall, Marshall University, St. Mary’s Hospital, Cabell Huntington Hospital, Huntington Civic Center, Blenko Glass and Camden Park.

name: Red Roof Inn – Parkersburg
description: Red Roof Inn Parkersburg features selected rooms with free high speed wireless internet access and a conference room (please inquire). One well-behaved family pet per room is welcome. We offer such amenities as; superior king rooms with in-room coffee, mini-refrigerators, free long distance, free fax service for up to 10 pages, hair dryers, iron and ironing boards.

name: Red Roof Inn
description: Welcome to Red Roof Charleston, WV: Red Roof Inn Charleston - Kanawha City, WV is 100% smoke-free and offers a completely remodeled and upgraded experience! Our location offers a variety of great amenities for our guests. Enjoy our Verified WiFi, and expanded cable package. Check out the fantastic new amenities in our Next Gen® design rooms! The rooms feature a boutique design and have all new furniture, spa-inspired bathrooms with modern vessel sinks, new comfy Rest Suite beds by Serta, plush high-end bedding, modern design flooring, comfortable new seating and a large, flat-screen TV. Enjoy our free coffee and tea available in the lobby.

name: Redeemer Lutheran Church
description: Redeemer Lutheran Church (redeemerwv.org) is a member congregation of The Lutheran Church – Missouri Synod and is located off Corridor G/Hwy 119 in the South Hills area of Charleston. Founded in 1953, Redeemer Lutheran Church is known in the community for Redeemer Park, its 27-hole disc golf course (discgolfsportscenter.com), its outreach programs such as the Feed My Sheep feeding program at Alum Creek Elementary School, and its presence at and support of Live on the Levee.

name: Reed’s Mill
description: Reed's Mill is a historic grist mill and national historic district located at Secondcreek, Monroe County, West Virginia. It was one of the original mill complexes of Secondcreek. The main mill building was built about 1791, and is a mortise and tenon frame structure held together with wooden pins, and sits atop a raised cut stone basement. A tall three-story section with basement was added in 1949. The district also includes the mill dam, wing-dam, mill race lined with rock and ending in the mill pond, and concrete mill race that carries water to the turbine (1872) which operates the grinding wheels in the mill. It remains an operating mill.

name: Reel Catch
description: We strive to create a relaxing atmosphere. For your convenience there are benches, fishing pole holders, and trash bins are placed all around the lake. We also have a snack bar for those unexpected hungers you may work up reeling all those big fish in! You don't have a pole but would like to fish? No worries, we will have poles for rent and a bait and tackle shop. Families and fishermen will enjoy this catch and release fishing lake. Cash tournaments are held on the weekends.

name: Relax Inn and Getaway B&B
description: Built in 2002, this lodge-like log structure is located on a 350-acre farm, just 2 miles from I-79, Weston exit. Hike or bike the trails, swim in the in-ground heated pool, fish in the stocked ponds, or just relax and enjoy the majestic views from one of the six porches or decks. The back patio is equipped with a stainless steel, natural gas grill and picnic tables. If the weather keeps you indoors, exercise on the equipment located in the loft and balcony sections; play pool on the solid maple, regulation-size table; or watch TV on the flat screen.

name: Remax Old Spruce Properties & Snowshoe Properties Management
description: Snowshoe Mountain Resort Real Estate. If you’re looking for land, homes or condos, RE/MAX Snowshoe Resort covers all of Snowshoe and Pocahontas County and we will show you all listings that work for you, not just our own. We specialize in luxury home and condominium vacation rentals at Snowshoe Resort. From cozy studios for 2, to homes large enough for 5 families. The area's largest real estate and property management company, selling land, homes, condos and commercial property.

name: Renaissance Weirton Corp.
description: Dedicated to improving the quality of life for the citizens of Weirton by working in conjunction with the City of Weirton and other community agencies on events and projects that foster cultural and economic revitalization.

name: Residence Inn – Morgantown
description: Extended-stay travel is our specialty at Residence Inn Morgantown. After an action-packed day, unwind in our suites featuring free Wi-Fi, full-size kitchens and flat-panel TVs. Large workstations and comfortable sofas help balance work with play. Guests can also get a dose of energy at our complimentary breakfast, available daily. Alternatively, to-go snacks and beverages can be found at The Market. Offering the ideal home away home, our hotel hosts The Residence Inn Mix™, an evening social hour with free beer, wine and appetizers on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday nights. Maintain your workout routine in our fitness center, start a game on the Sports Court®, and take a refreshing swim in the indoor pool.

name: Restored One-Room Schoolhouse
description: Lower Drawdy One Room Schoolhouse was built in 1917. It is reminiscent of the era of small, utilitarian community schools. The history of this school begins with a one-room structure built in Andrew in 1906. It was made of logs and damaged by a flood in 1916. A new school was then built in 1917. During the 1920's, a new highway was planned for construction on the property near the new school, so the school had to be moved from that area. Mr. Windrield Kinder used oxen to move the building approximately 100 feet away from the original site. Children attended this school until 1959, then were transferred to Peytona Grade School after the school closed. The school property was then sold by the Board of Education to a Mr. Workman. After the school was sold, the building remained empty on the property from 1959 until it was relocated to its present location in the John M. Slack Coal River Memorial Park at Racine, WV 1.
address: John M. Slack Coal River Memorial Park / 151 John Slack Circle, Racine, WV, 25165

name: RetireWV
description: Our goal is to market West Virginia as a retirement destination. There are currently seven areas of West Virginia recognized by the Office of the Governor as Designated Retirement Communities (DRC).

name: Rich Mountain Battlefield Civil War Site & Visitor Center
description: Site of the July 1861 Civil War battle for control of the Staunton-Parkersburg Turnpike. This early union victory catapulted Gen. George McClellan to leadership of the union army and gave the north control of western Virginia leading it to eventual statehood. This site, five miles west of the town of Beverly, WV, features interpretive signs, walking/hiking tours and picnic area. The Beverly Heritage Center (located on Main St., Beverly) serves as the interpretive center for the site with "The 1st Campaign of the Civil War" exhibit and research facilities. Group and guided tours by appointment. The Battlefield is open year round from dawn to dusk. Visitor Center open is open daily in season and weekdays through the winter.

name: Rich Mountain Battlefield Foundation
description: Rich Mountain Battlefield Foundation is a non-profit foundation dedicated to the preservation of the Rich Mountain Battlefield Civil War Site and associated Civil War Sites. The Rich Mountain Battlefield is the site of the July 11, 1861 battle at the Hart Farm on Rich Mountain that led General George B. McClellan to leadership of the Army of the Potomac and gave the Union a foothold and control of western Virginia for the bulk of the Civil War. The site is 5 miles west of the town of Beverly, atop Rich Mountain. The Beverly Heritage Center is located at 4 Court Street in Beverly. With the help of all its members, the dedicated STAFF and DIRECTORS of the Foundation have gotten the site of the battle, Camp Garnett, and the portion of the original turnpike which connects the two sites recognized on the National Register of Historic Places. This historic district, together with some important supporting property, is now the Rich Mountain Battlefield Civil War Site.
address: P.O. Box 227 / 4 Court St., Beverly, WV, 26253

name: Richmond’s Meadow Creek Hideaway
description: Private home and a garage sized apartment over looking the New River. Fully furnished living room/kitchen combo; bathroom with shower; and bedroom. Sleeps two to four comfortably. Includes a deck and patio over looking the river. Rent separately or in addition to the house. We also have three fun sized camps that are fully furnished with a kitchen/living room combo; loft and sofa beds; bathroom with shower; satellite TV; and large decks.
address: 71 N Riverside Road, Meadow Creek, WV, 25977

name: Richwood Chamber of Commerce
description: The Richwood Chamber of Commerce is a group of business owners and citizens working together to make Richwood a better place to live and do business. Our mission is to advance the welfare and prosperity of Richwood and the surrounding area so that its citizens and all areas of its business community prosper, with particular emphasis on economic, civic, commercial, and educational interest of the area.

name: Rider Pharmacy Cards, Gifts and Collectibles
description: Family owned and operated since 1967, Rider Pharmacy is located in the historic downtown river district of Fairmont, West Virginia. We are more than just a drugstore. Our collection includes West Virginia souvenirs, Dept. 56, Lenox, Fenton, custom gift baskets, floral arrangements and so much more. Come experience hometown hospitality with a little touch of class. Ask for the Riders.

name: Ridge Top ATV Hideaway
description: Ridge Top ATV Hideaway is located atop a scenic mountain setting at Windmill Gap, West Virginia. It is ½ mile from the Indian Ridge and Pocahontas trails of the Hatfield-McCoy System, and near the Pinnacle Creek Trail System. The house sleeps 11 and has a full kitchen.

name: Ridge View Barbeque
description: Known for great BBQ, pulled pork, and porky cheese fries. Our menus feature hickory smoked favorites, burgers, salads, homemade sides and more.

name: Riff Raff Arts Collective
description: Composed of performing, literary, healing & visual artists, the collective is based in a creative zone in downtown Princeton, WV. The space features a live performance venue, recording studio, artist studios, fine art gallery & more. The Collective offers open stage night on the first Monday of each month in the room upstairs.

name: Riffle Run Campground
description: Riffle Run Campground offers 60 sites: 54 three-point hookups (water, sewage, and electric) and 6 primitive / tent sites. Shower / restroom facilities, two playgrounds, sewage dump-stations, and fresh water fill-up stations are also located within the campground. Riffle Run campground is on a first come-first serve basis--NO RESERVATIONS ACCEPTED (You must have all of your camping equipment on arrival). Amenities: RV sites, tent sites, primitive sites, 50 AMP electric hookups, water and sewer hookups, restrooms, shower facilities, drinking water, dump station, lake swimming, mountain view. Pets are allowed. Meets ADA. Boating, hiking, fishing, hunting, and picnicking are available. For information about the lake, call 304-853-2371. For the campground host during camping season call: 304-853-2583. Driving Directions: I-79, Exit 79, turn toward Exxon Station, then right at stop sign and travel approximately 3 miles to campground. Contact by email, fax, or phone for more information.
address: Burnsville Lake, 2550 South Main Street, Burnsville, WV, 26335

name: Ripley Convention & Visitors Bureau
description: Ripley’s Convention & Visitors Bureau informs the traveling public about the lodging, meeting, dining, shopping, and recreational amenities found in the heart of Jackson County. The town is located directly between Charleston and Parkersburg – making this an ideal stop to break up your traveling across Almost Heaven. Add Ripley to your list of West Virginia destinations this winter.
address: 115 N. Church Street, Suite 4, Ripley, WV, 25271

name: Rippling Waters Campground
description: Campground owned and operated by the General Assembly of the Church of God in WV. Open year-round to public (Dec. - Mar. is limited to one night only). RV camping and full hookups. Facilities for Reunions, Youth Camps, etc. No smoking or alcohol on campground. DIRECTIONS: I-77 Exit 116 follow signs. Rt 21 north 1 mile, go right on Middle Fork Road. Facilities: 39 overnight/monthly/ weekly trailer sites, and a total of 102 pull through and back in sites available, electric, water and sewer hook ups, paddleboat rentals, fishing, pets allowed on leash and cleaned up after. No tenting.

name: Ritchie County Tourism & Visitors Bureau
description: The county’s small towns and villages offer charming shopping, dining, lodging, and outdoor recreational experiences. The nation’s oldest 5 & Dime store is found here, and a 72-mile rail trail for hiking, biking, and horseback riding that stretches through 13 tunnels. Ritchie County offers a peaceful and friendly environment, which makes it perfect for visiting, retiring or relocating.
address: c/o Pennsboro Public Library, Pennsboro, WV, 26415

name: Ritter Park
description: Ritter Park is located in Huntington, West Virginia. It is a public park maintained by the Greater Huntington Park and Recreation District. It consists of numerous lengthy walking trails along Four Pole Creek, restroom facilities, picnic tables, shelter with grills and electrical outlets, a children's playground including the "Dinosaur Dig", and a 1,000 seat amphitheater that can be used for small concerts and plays. It is well known for its Rose Garden, including the "Room with a View" that can be reserved for weddings and special occasions. It also is the location of the Ritter Park Tennis Center. This facility is open to the public and has eleven outdoor tennis courts and four indoor courts. Playground and restroom facilities are available. Shelter and restroom are accessible.
address: Located at 12th Street and 13th Avenue., Huntington, WV, 25701

name: River and Rail Bakery
description: River and Rail Bakery makes fresh bread, European-style pastries, coffee and espresso drinks from locally roasted coffee, and a diverse breakfast and lunch menu (including vegan and vegetarian options).

name: River Cities Symphony Orchestra
description: The River Cities Symphony Orchestra strives to create a “musical bridge” between communities on both sides of the Ohio River by presenting symphonic and chamber concerts featuring professional musicians, music educators, and regional musicians. One major goal is the promotion of music education especially among string programs for our Adventures in Music Education Program in elementary and middle schools.

name: River City Restaurant & Banquets
description: River City Restaurant is a full service restaurant, bar, and banquet facility located in the Beautiful Artisan Center in the heart of downtown Wheeling, West Virginia. The 250 seat restaurant & bar on the first floor offers a first class dining experience and a great selection of 24 draft beers, wine, and liquor. The menu offers a wide selection of hand cut choice steaks, fresh seafood, gourmet salads, pasta and more. With a welcoming and unique atmosphere, small parties can enjoy privacy in the Victorian Room, Window Room, or the Bar Room for groups of up to 20 people. The bar offers a taste of big city nightlife with two tournament pool tables, 9 large flat screen LED TVs, a game room, and a stage area for local, regional, and national acts. The 80 ft. high atrium and historical dining area offers an exquisite dining atmosphere. Groups may order from the standard menu or choose a classic buffet (50+) from our bus tours menu, consisting of three entrees, various side dishes, dessert and non-alcoholic beverages. An absolute breath-taking and spacious 10,000 sq. ft banquet hall can be found on the 3rd floor. It features a beautifully decorated 25 ft. high ceiling, 15 ft. windows, hard wood floors, and elevator access. Take a walk across the 60 ft. high bridge while enjoying the beautiful skylight and surroundings that holds up to 400 people. Ideal for wedding receptions, proms, reunions, banquets, and conferences, it is one of the largest event halls in the tri-state area.

name: River Expeditions
description: Experience history, nature, culture and adventure in West Virginia’s New River Gorge National Park. Discover whitewater rafting, scenic float trips, zipline tours, rock climbing, mountain biking, horseback riding, stand-up paddleboarding, bridgewalk tours, escape rooms and other unique adventures offered by River Expeditions Adventure Resort. River Expeditions, voted the area’s best outfitter, is family-owned and operated delivering a level of service and distinction that only a family brings to their own business. Create an all-inclusive vacation package including lodging, meals and activities based on your schedule, budget and interests. Choose from diverse accommodations like luxury cabins to tent camping, plus get the fourth consecutive night free. Explore family-friendly float trips through the gentle Upper New River Canyon where children as young as six years old can take part in this low impact, scenic adventure the entire family will love. Kids always raft for half price on this mild single day trip. Classic whitewater can be found on the playful Lower New River Gorge - great for first time rafters age twelve and up, as well as veteran paddlers, as no two river trips are ever the same. The Gauley River enjoys world class designation and also offers trips for beginners to advanced paddlers. River Expeditions professional guides are patient, engaging and always eager to share their passion for adventure. Amenities at River Expeditions include a complete campground with RV sites, luxury cabins, leisure cabins, deluxe cabins, rustic cabins, safari tents, bungalows and lodge with complimentary Wi-Fi, massage studio, meeting space, Red Dog River Saloon & Grill, outfitters store, restaurant, outdoor pool/hot tub, hiking trails, disc golf, cornhole, sand volleyball, horseshoes and more great extras. Experience West Virginia’s zipline adventure, The Ridges, at River Expeditions. This 2-hour treetop tour includes a cargo net climb to the first of four ziplines and and skybridge span. Descend on an auto belay system following the longest zipline on the tour. River Expeditions is open daily from April through October for rafting and ziplining and year round for lodging - save 50% November through March. Special events and discounts are available online and corporate outings and groups, including Scouts and youth, are always welcome. Stay connected their social media channels.

name: River House Lodge
description: The lodge is tucked away in a small town in Cheat Valley 30 miles south of Morgantown. It brings back to life the River House of the early 1900's when Rowlesburg was a great railroad center. Guests walk into a motif of railroading that once dominated the historic town of Rowlesburg--on the Jones-Imboden Civil War Trail. The town is virtually surrounded by Cheat River, great for boating, white water, fishing and swimming. Rowlesburg stands at the crossroads of two National Byways.

name: River House
description: This lovingly renovated 1935 four square home is located on the Elk River. Original wood work, restored antiques, and artwork add interest to the home. Whether you enjoy reading on the back porch glider, playing scrabble in the game room or kayaking a local river, River House is the perfect spot. Guests must be able to climb stairs as bedrooms are on the second story and there are stairs at both entrances. Back yard views gazebo and river. Located in the geographical center of West Virginia, most WV destinations are a day trip away. You can hike Bulltown Battle Ground in the morning, or kayak Sutton Dam in the afternoon. Rental includes Wifi, 70" tv, NetFlix, and Amazon Prime. Access to Elk River on property for easy kayaking, canoeing, or fishing. A total of 8 guests can be accommodated at one time; 3 bedrooms total; 4 beds; 2.5 baths.

name: River Riders, Inc.
description: Only one hour from the DC and Baltimore Metro Regions, River Riders Inc. offers white water rafting, tubing, canopy tour/zip lining, aerial forest adventure parks, kayaking, canoeing, mountain biking, lodging options and fishing adventures on the beautiful Shenandoah and Potomac Rivers (class I-III) in Harpers Ferry, West Virginia, where Maryland, Virginia and West Virginia come together. Using our expertise and the best adventure equipment available, we run all trips in a professional, personable manner.
address: 408 Alstadts Hill Rd., Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: River & Trail Outfitters
description: River & Trail Outfitters offers a variety of trips for your outdoor fun! For over 44 years, River and Trail Outfitters has offered whitewater rafting, tubing, kayaking, canoeing, ziplining, biking, camping, team-building, hiking trips, climbing, cross-country skiing and food & drink paddling tours. River trips and lessons take place in Maryland, Virginia and West Virginia on the Potomac and Shenandoah Rivers and Antietam Creek. River Trail & Outfitters also sells new and used canoes, kayaks and paddling accessories.
address: 99 Cary Lu Cir #108, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Riverchase Campground & Cabins
description: Riverchase is a private campground & cabins located in the beautiful mountains of northern Summers County, West Virginia, along the upper New River. Our tent campground is private and quiet. All sites are located along the upper New River (riverfront), some sites are grassy and some sandy. Electricity is available at some sites for an additional charge. Table and campfire ring are provided with each site. Tent sites allow the erection of two(2) tents per site with a limit of four(4) persons on a site. Tent sites are permitted two (2) vehicles parked at the site. Riverchase also offers two cozy, rustic cabins on-site for your convenience. Enjoy shelter from the elements plus the comfort of a soft bed in a beautiful setting. We provide separate men and women's shower facilities, and men and women's bathrooms. We are open April to October weather permitting.

name: Riverfront Antiques & Thrift
description: A unique shop with a piece of history offering antiques, furniture, jewelry, tools, handcrafted WV items, candles, WV wines, gifts and more! Stop in and see us!

name: Rivers Edge Scenic Campground
description: The camp currently consists of 249 full service sites, but also offers a variety of other amenities, social activities, and entertainment. Amenities include: two bath houses, two laundromats, Sugar Shack/Camp Store, in-ground pool, game room, boat access, playground, basketball court, picnic shelter, stage, 1/4 mile of water front for fishing, walking/running paths, outdoor fitness course, numerous grass common ground areas for activities. Just a short 20 to 30 minute drive from Huntington and Charleston, WV as well as Gallipolis and Chesapeake, OH. Please call or email anytime. Office hours will vary by season and work schedule.

name: Rivers Resort
description: Rivers Resort, voted the area’s best outfitter, is also family-owned and operated. Our basecamp covers 100+ acres including tent camping, RV park, rustic to luxury cabins, bunkhouses, etc. Amenities include outdoor pool, lodge, Wi-Fi, saloon, hiking trails, zipline, souvenir shop, restaurant, massage studio, conference room, arcade and more. Let us host your amazing vacation in the New River Gorge. Kids raft for half price every day. Plus get the 4th night free with any lodging purchase.

name: Rivers Studio and Gallery
description: Rivers Studio & Gallery showcases distinctive, regional sculptural and functional fine art in clay, metal, and wood. Its member artisans seek to cultivate community by offering hands-on classes and workshops in the studio.
address: 1346 West Washington Street, Harpers Ferry, WV, 25425

name: Riverside Cabins & RV Park
description: Riverside Cabins is a rustic mountain resort located along the banks of the beautiful South Branch of the Potomac River. We pride ourselves in being a family-oriented, "kid friendly" site. Riverside has many cabins on the river bank of the Potomac River. Kitchens are fully equipped including major appliances, microwave, utensils, plates and cookware. All you need to bring are your sheets, towels, blankets, paper products. In addition to our cabins, Riverside also offers RV and Tent sites at our river location. The RV sites are fully equipped with water, electric and sewer hook-ups. The tent site are primitive-no hook-ups. The shower houses are conveniently location near the tent sites. Free Wi-Fi is available throughout Riverside.

name: Riverside Golf Club
description: We have an 18 hole course along the Ohio River. Comfortable atmosphere with high quality food and daily lunch specials. Banquet room with a full catering menu. Gaming.

name: Riverside Retreat
description: The cottage, approx. 700 sq. feet, boasts two living areas – a bedroom and great room that can accommodate up to six people. The completely renovated Riverside Retreat has a full kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, cookware, dinnerware, dish towels and utensils. The bathroom has a shower and the bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed. The great room has an alcove with bunk beds and a comfortable pull out queen size sofa bed. A TV with cable connection, DVD player, several games and telephone are all provided. The dining area seats six easily and there are stools along the kitchen counter. On the 360 sq. foot deck overlooking the river, there are chairs, a table and charcoal grill. The Retreat is fully heated for winter and air conditioned for summer occupants. Sheets, pillows, blankets, and towels (for bathroom use only) are provided. It is the responsibility of the lessee to provide all food, condiments, paper products, towels for outside use and charcoal for the grill. Minimum stay is at least two nights - longer on holiday and festival weekends. Suggest calling to discuss reservations.
address: Route 1, Box 59-1, Old Route 33, Elkins, WV, 26241

name: Riverside RV Park
description: We have 16 sites with full hook up and dump station. We also have a ladies retail store, grocery store, car wash and a beauty shop serving men, women and children. Enjoy being close to the Greenbrier River - fish, watch birds, hike the Greenbrier River Trail. Located in downtown Marlinton on Rt 219 close to shopping and easy access to Snowshoe Mountain and Cass Scenic Railroad.

name: Riversong Spa
description: Riversong Spa offers facial treatments, skin care consultations, full-body waxing services, makeup lessons & application. Retail lines include: Eminence Organics Skin Care, gloMineral Cosmetics, exclusive Riversong Spa body care products.

name: Riverview Motel
description: Riverview Motel is an American family owned small business in the charming town of Alderson, WV. We have 15 rooms that overlook the Greenbrier River, all of which are non-smoking. We offer free wifi and TV cable, and each room is equipped with a coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer, ironing board, and iron. Maid service is offered daily.

name: Roane County Chamber of Commerce
description: The Roane County Chamber of Commerce is an organization of people, businesses, and associations who have the common goal of improving the local business climate, including retail, service, industrial, health and welfare. At the Chamber Information Center, you can obtain information on local events, maps, directions, and much more.
address: 216 Market St. Ste. 100 / P.O. Box 1, Spencer, WV, 25276

name: ROBERT H. MOLLOHAN, JEFFERSON ST. BRIDGE
description: Reopened on October 27, 2000, after undergoing a $23.5 million dollar restoration, this "Million Dollar Bridge" originally opened to traffic in 1921. Crossing the Monongahela River, rail lines, and city streets, the 1,266 foot structure is three graceful arch rings designed by the Concrete Steel Engineering Company of New York. It was built by the John F. Casey Company of Pittsburgh. It is currently listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

name: Robert Newlon Airport RV Camping and Fly In Cafe
description: Accommodations include: 30 RV pull throughs, full hook up sites, 30-50 amp available, water and sewer every site. We also have a bathhouse and laundry, walking path, pet friendly, primitive beach campsites for boaters. A hidden gem, Fly In Cafe offers a dining and drinking experience unlike any other. Enjoy original menu items and a full service bar at a fair price and in a warm, nostalgic atmosphere. Come in for our weekend dinner seafood specials while surrounded by authentic World War II and aviation memorabilia. Located on Robert Newlon Airport, Fly In Cafe patrons can experience a view of small planes taking off a grass strip or even catch a glimpse of WV Skydivers landing close by. The airport offers bi-plane rides by appointment; Live music on the patio every Saturday night from Memorial Day weekend to Labor Day weekend.

name: Robert W. Craig Campground at Jennings Randolph Lake
description: Our campground is hosted by four full time park attendants and two volunteer hosts that are dedicated to make your stay with us at the Robert W. Craig Campground as enjoyable as possible. This family oriented campground is spaciously located on the hills above the lake. The campground has 68 campsites, all of which have electrical services. The facility has hot showers, water hydrants every third or fourth site, and flush toilets at the washhouse and in the back loop comfort station. The campground also features a playground for children, campground store, horseshoe pits, and an amphitheater for evening programs presented by the ranger staff on Saturday nights. A large group picnic shelter with electricity, potable water, a full basketball court and horseshoe pits is also available. A public pay phone is located at the washhouse. Pets are permitted anywhere in the campground, except in the restroom facilities, however, they must be physically restrained at all times by either being in a pet cage or on a leash no more than six feet long. Properly dispose of your pets waste while camping and before leaving.
address: 1075 Robert Craig Lane, Elk Garden, WEST VIRGINIA, 26717

name: Robert’s Antiques
description: Robert’s first opened its doors in March of 1990 and has become a staple among the locals as well as a destination among the tourists. Period furniture, porcelain, glassware, oriental rugs, a Medical Museum full of medical antiques, and a few hidden eccentric structures (a guillotine and stocks) are housed within the 10,000 square foot building. The wine shop is one of the largest in West Virginia and houses over 600 labels of wine.

name: Robey Theatre
description: The Robey Theatre is the longest continuously running theatre in West Virginia. It was built by Hamond Robey in 1911 specifically for the exhibition of films. Robey moved his theatre operations several times within Spencer before he erected the 1911 building; he decided to expand and remodel this theatre in the summer of 1926. Completed by the architectural firm of Carmichael and Millspaugh, this $100,000 remodeling, with the exception of a few later minor changes, remains intact today. The remodeling, changed the facade and enlarged the stage and the theatre was reopened with much pomp and ceremony.
