In the late 1920’s the Robey was one of the first theatres in the area to install sound equipment. Listed National Register of Historical Places-1989. It is open to the public at 7 p.m. 364 days a year.

name: Rocco’s Ristorante
description: The gold standard for Italian food, it’s a slice of the Old Country in the Mountain State. People come back again and again for favorites such as spaghetti, lasagna, and crab-stuffed ravioli. Take home the leftovers—you’ll enjoy them just as much!

name: Rock N Roll Rafting
description: Rafting on the New and Gauley Rivers offers something for everyone, age six and up, from leisurely float trips to thrilling whitewater runs. Rock N Roll Rafting headquarters features camping, luxury cabins, leisure cabins, deluxe cabins, rustic cabins, tents on platforms, RV Sites, The Red Dog River Saloon, The Ridges Zipline Adventure, outdoor pool and hot tub, Fire Creek Lodge & Conference Center, Outfitter Store, Dining Area, massage studio, arcade and more. 4th night lodging is free.

name: Rock Ridge Rentals
description: Come relax in the peaceful mountains of Summers County. Amenties include: 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, full kitchen, living room, 50"HDTV with Directv, including the NFL Sunday Ticket, DVD with movie rentals available, linens included, and fire pit. Resort amenitites: in-ground pool, covered picnic area and play area, bath houses, laundry mat, hiking and 4 wheeler trails. We are located directly across Rt. 20 from Pipestem State Park.

name: Rockhaven LLC
description: We are open for tours of our facility that show how we make syrup. Learn about tap lines, reverse osmosis, cooking and canning of our syrup. We are weather dependent, so please call ahead. Syrup making last week of January thru April.

name: Rockhouse Lodge & The Depot Lodge
description: Rockhouse Lodge & The Depot Lodge in Man, are setup for riders of the Hatfield-McCoy Trails. Park your rig and ride the town streets directly to the Trailhead--about a mile. Rockhouse Lodge has 4 efficiency type units and sleeps 18 adults. The Depot Lodge has units with 33 individual beds. All units have mini kitchens, A/C, Cable TV, washer and dryers on site, grills, picnic tables, and a pressure washer at The Depot. Enjoy an evening campfire at The Depot on the Banks of the Guyandotte River. THE DEPOT LODGE is a large Brick Building that used to be a train station. Six units inside The Depot, as well as a small cabin (12' x 18') sitting on the same property, provides a total of 33 individual beds. There is a 2-night minimum stay on all reservations.

name: Rodeway Inn
description: We offer the basics for traveling on a budget, with the reliability and security of a national brand that you can trust—so you can get the rest you need for wherever travel takes you in West Virginia and beyond. Amenities include: Free breakfast Meeting space Guest laundry facilities Free coffee every morning Copy, print and fax services All of our fresh, clean guest rooms feature coffee makers, irons and ironing boards, along with free premium movie channels and a nice, hot shower to wake you up. Select rooms come with hot tubs and microwaves, and refrigerators are available for rent. This pet-friendly hotel is located off State Route 10 and U.S. Highway 119.

name: Rodeway Inn & Suites
description: We will provide a fresh, clean room for a good night’s sleep; a nice, hot shower to wake you up and a good cup of coffee to jump start your day, as well as amenities like refrigerators, microwaves, hair dryers, coffee makers and 42-inch TVs. Some rooms feature living rooms and sofa sleepers. This hotel offers free casino shuttle service and amenities like, free continental breakfast, free WiFi, business center, picnic area and free parking. The Rodeway Inn hotel in Charles Town, West Virginia is located near Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races, Appalachian Trail, Harpers Ferry National Historical Park, Summit Point Raceway, Charles Town Farmers Market and Historic Shepherdstown.
address: 741 E Washington St, Rodeway, Charles Town, WV, 25414

name: Rodeway Inn
description: A good night and great savings await you at the smoke-free Rodeway Inn® hotel in Mineral Wells, WV. Business travelers enjoy our business center, meeting rooms and copy and fax services. Relax in the seasonal outdoor pool, or grab a snack from our popcorn machine. Other full-service amenities include: Free continental breakfast Free WiFi Exercise room Free coffee Our fresh, clean rooms offer the amenities you need to unwind. Each room offers a TV with extra stations, mini-refrigerator, hair dryer, iron, ironing board and electronic lock doors.

name: Rollins Lake
description: Rollins Lake is a 41-acre impoundment located 2 miles west of Ripley in Jackson County. It is accessible from I-77 by taking State Route 62 west 1.5 miles and then turning south on Route 87. Constructed during 1956, this lake was in private ownership until 1987, when the Wildlife Resources Section of the DNR purchased the area. It has a maximum depth of 11 feet and an average depth of 6 feet. A paved road provides access to approximately half of the lake. A boat ramp is available and electric motors only are allowed. Live minnows cannot be used as bait and camping are prohibited. Rollins Lake provides warmwater fishery for bluegill, largemouth bass, and channel catfish. The lake is stocked with trout once each month from January through April. National Forest Stamp is not required; No camping allowed; Stocked once each month January through April; Does not receive Fall trout stocking. Located off I-77 at the Ripley Exit (138). Take Rt. 33 west 1.5 miles, then take Rt. 87 south for one-half mile.

name: Romney Farmers’ Market
description: The Romney Farmer's Market takes place in historic Romney, the oldest town in West Virginia. We provide a variety of local fresh vegetables, baked goods, jams and jellies, sheep and goats milk soaps, flowers, farm fresh eggs, local honey, artisan goods, jewelry and even local meats. Fridays: June - September 4 pm - 7pm

name: Ronceverte Historic District
description: Ronceverte Historic District is a 120-acre historic district in downtown Ronceverte. The oldest building dates back to 1810, but most of the building came about during the town’s lumber heyday in the 1870’s to 1890’s. Ronceverte’s rich lumber and railroad history is found everywhere from the historic depot and coaling tower located in the heart of the downtown, to the vast array of historic homes built to accommodate railroad and lumber executives, and medical and education professionals.

name: Ronceverte Island Park
description: A 20-acre park located along the Greenbrier River featuring three ball fields, horseshoe pits, basketball and tennis courts, picnic areas, playground, walking path, amphitheatre and the largest area skateboard park.

name: Ronceverte Train Depot
description: Built in 1914, this is the only craftsman-style building remaining on the railroad line. The first year of its opening, more than 65,000 passengers passed through its doors. The original passenger canopy and baggage building are still intact. Passenger service ceased in 1974.

name: Ronceverte Walking Tour
description: Self-guided walking tour of historic Ronceverte. The brochure chronicles the town's unique lumber and railroad history and captures tales of the town's founders and architecture. Brochure can be picked up at the Greenbrier Valley Visitiors Center.

name: Rosby’s Rock
description: The inscribed bolder marks the spot, where on Dec. 24, 1852, the rails of the B&O were joined forming a railroad link between Baltimore (the Atlantic Ocean) and the Ohio River. This site is the original Promontory Point linking the two water drainages. Construction of the railroad was started on July 4, 1928, and its completion represented one of the major milestones in United States history and development. The railroad aided commerce and westward expansion. The town, best reached from Moundsville via County Road 54 and by following the signs, is located up a hollow along Big Grave Creek. The Rosbys Rock community of today, however, bears little resemblance to the prosperous railroading and farming hamlet in which Dorothy was reared. Very few of the “old-timers” who made their livings off the land or the railroad are alive. The new crop of residents are retirees, factory workers, or coal miners who drive to Moundsville or beyond for their livelihoods.

name: Roshell’s Antiques & Collectibles
description: Roshell’s Antiques & Collectibles, LLC opened in 2005, in downtown Weston, and has been expanding ever since. The store now houses thousands of treasures ranging from the 1700’s to modern day; including many custom made one-of-a-kind items.

name: Route 60 American Bar and Grill
description: Deli items, soups and sandwiches, burger and salads. We have a pool table, Wii, five slot machines, touchtunes jukebox, and three TV's.
address: 12 W Main St, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: RSA Flight Training
description: RSA Flight Training is North Central West Virginia's premier flight training provider. Our staff is dedicated to providing top quality, comprehensive flight instruction from Private Pilot through Certificated Flight Instructor. Our team of instructors are available 7 days a week and will work around your schedule. In addition to our 3 airplanes, RSA Flight Training also has an FAA approved flight training device. So, when it comes time for to get your instrument rating or an Instrument Proficiency Check we can save you time and money by logging some approaches in our Simulator. The RSA "Introductory Flight Lesson" YES, You will fly the plane! Come spend an hour with one of our FAA Certified Instructors. This lesson is ideal for someone who has always been curious about flying, or as a unique gift idea. During the lesson, you will fly for 45 minutes in the plane and get a 30 minute ground lesson. You will sit in the pilot's seat and actually manipulate the controls as you soar through the air! You will get to try each of the basic flight maneuvers - climbs, descents, turns, and straight and level flight. After the flight, you will get to taxi the airplane back to the ramp.
address: 82 Hart Field Road, Suite 241, Morgantown, WV, 26505

name: Ruby Rooster Antique Mall
description: Filled with antiques, collectibles, handcrafted furniture, decorative items and primitives. The Ruby Rooster Antique Mall is located at Miller's Country Mall on Rt. 219, 3 miles north of I64 (exit 169) in Lewisburg, WV.
address: Rt. 219 N. HC37 Box 319, Maxwelton, WV, 24901

name: Ruby Tuesday – Lewisburg
description: Simple, fresh American dining. Specializing in fresh steaks, chicken and burgers. Featuring a fresh garden bar, as well as a full service bar with handcrafted beers, wines and spirits. Also offering Curbside TueGo.

name: Rumsey Tavern
description: Rumsey Tavern, featuring mouth watering sandwiches and entree selections to satisfy even the most particular diner, is located inside the Clarion Hotel and Conference Center. Tuesday Trivia: 7 p.m. - 9 p.m. and Wednesday Karaoke 7 p.m. - 10 p.m.

name: Rustic Ravines
description: Rustic Ravines is West Virginia’s cabin rental and ATV headquarters. We’re the perfect destination for a family vacation, romantic getaway in the woods, exciting hunting trip or an ATV ride of a lifetime.

name: Ruttenbucks Bar & Grill
description: Ruttenbucks Bar & Grill is a Country Western atmosphere with the best BBQ Ribs in the state of West Virginia. We offer a wide variety of delicious Barbeque & Steaks for Lunch and Dinner. The menu also includes: Hillbilly Hollers (two burgers with Jalapeno's and BBQ sauce, The Smokey Mountain Burger, The Blue Mountain Burger and much more to get your belly full. Whatever you're in the mood for, you can find it here! The bar stays open until 1 a.m. or later.
address: 141 West Alexander Rd, Valley Grove, WV, 26060

name: Ryan’s Family Steakhouse – Clarksburg
description: Great tasting, fresh-made food, made just for your family. Help yourself to a wide variety of choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Appetizers, entrees, sides, salad, desserts -- it's all just one low price. At Ryan's Buffet, we asked our guests what their favorites are, and that's what we serve most. Classic flavors and new favorites -- at Ryan's Buffet, there's always something delicious waiting for you.

name: Sagebrush Round-up Country & Western Music
description: The Sagebrush Round-Up provides Country and Western music. Come early and try one of our home cooked dinners just like mom used to make! If you would like to perform on the open stage, arrive early and sign up with the MC. Sagebrush Round-up is located on Bunner Ridge near Fairmont, WV, just six miles east of I-79 at exit 139. We are smoke and alcohol free. Open year round except the last two Saturday's in December. New Year's Eve Event should be a special night! Admission is $5; Children 12 and under are free!

name: Sam Black United Methodist Church
description: Sam Black Church is located on the Midland Trail at its junction with Interstate 64. A small bell tower rises above the hipped roof of the picturesque white frame structure. The church was erected in 1902 in memory of Samuel Black, a Methodist circuit rider. Mounted on his horse, Shiloh, Black traveled the back roads of a half-dozen West Virginia counties, organizing congregations and building churches with the money he obtained from selling socks, gloves, and other items handmade by church women. The church, a spiritual landmark, became an established name on highway maps even without an established post office.
address: Rt. 60 East at the I-64 Sam Black Church Exit, Smoot, WV, 24931

name: Sam Snead’s at The Golf Club
description: The décor and ambiance reflect the important role that Sam Snead, our first golf professional emeritus, played in The Greenbrier’s illustrious golf history. It is a relaxed, yet lively atmosphere every bit as entertaining as its legendary namesake. The spacious dining area offers a great dinner option with an open show kitchen where guests watch our expert chefs prepare tantalizing entrees in a wood-burning oven.
address: The Greenbrier, White Sulphur Springs, WV, 24986

name: Sam’s Uptown Cafe
description: Sam's Uptown Cafe has been calling 28 Capitol Street home for over 20 years. People have been coming through the doors time and time again for some of the best food, service, live music, private parties and fun for over a decade! Join us for lunch, happy hour, dinner and stay for a live show! See you soon!

name: Sand Springs Camping Area
description: Sand Springs campground has been around for 50+ years and sits in the beautiful woods of wild and wonderful West Virginia. NOW OPERATING UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP! It is our goal to continue creating a fun, clean, family-friendly atmosphere. We will also be continuing to make improvements and upgrades where needed to enhance our beautiful campground. With our Olympic size pool, game room/arcade, hiking, and Coopers Rock State Forest near by, you won’t run out of things to do! We are located just minutes from Cooper's Rock where you can enjoy rock climbing, hiking, biking, and more. We now have Limited Wi-Fi. We are located just outside of Morgantown WV. I-68, exit 15 - Cooper's Rock, to Old Rt. 73 E., go .25 miles turn left onto Chestnut Ridge/Sand Springs Road, continue for 2.5 miles. Campground on the left.

name: Sanders Antiques
description: We buy antiques, gold and silver. We sell military items, stoneware crocks, fountain pens, straight razors, antiques, mining and railroad memorabalia, and many other items!

name: Sandstone Falls
description: Found within the nation's 63rd national park, Sandstone Falls is the largest waterfall in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve. Spanning over 1,500 feet wide, this large series of falls is divided by a collection of small islands. Take a quick walk along the boardwalk to view the rushing waters that carved out this slice of Almost Heaven – and continue your adventure in this area known for its wide variety of wildflowers. The scenic views at this falls are ADA accessible.

name: Sarah Jane’s Family Restaurant and Bakery
description: Bringing new and exciting fresh food and recipes to the Nicholas county area and any passers by! We are a family restaurant offering home cooked meals and fresh bakery items.
address: 13 Tioga Road (Intersection of Rt 55), Craigsvile, WV, 20205

name: Sargasso Morgantown, LLC
description: Almost ten years ago Sargasso started a food revolution in Morgantown, bringing fine dining to a city that had previously not seen anything like it. Locally owned and operated, we strive to provide the premiere dining experience in the region by utilizing ingredients of the highest quality from local to international with each season. In 2018, Sargasso won a prestigious Wine Spectator Magazine award. During dinner service, we offer both a multi-course upscale dinner menu and a bistro menu with plates under $15.
address: 215 Don Knotts Boulevard, Suite 110, Morgantown, WV West Virginia, 26501

name: Savannah’s
description: Located in a restored Victorian mansion that was built in 1902, Savannah’s offers a varied menu of the finest steaks and fresh seafood. Savannah’s has received the Wine Spectator Award of Excellence every year since 1999 and also earned a five-diamond award of excellence by the North American Restaurant Association.

name: Sawmill Restaurant
description: The Sawmill Restaurant is located within the Alpine Lodge in historic Davis, WV. We open at 6 a.m. with our famous Mountain Top Breakfast and close at 8 p.m. with the Sawmill Hot Fudge Cake. We offer a variety of generously-portioned home cooked meals including daily specials.

name: Scarlet Oaks Country Club
description: Long recognized as one of West Virginia's best courses, Scarlet Oaks has made the best even better by offering lush fairways, impeccably manicured greens, a state-of-the-art irrigation system and a challenging eighteen hole, par 72, championship-caliber course. Nestled in a beautiful surrounding with rolling hills and serene lakes, Scarlet Oaks has the perfect location for your office staff, company, family, church or non-profit group to enjoy. Our friendly staff will treat you like one of the family in our relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Give us a call to schedule your next event and we will make it a fulfilling success with great service, food, and facilities. Scarlet Oaks Country Club offers you 18 holes of challenging play, a driving range, putting greens, a full service Pro Shop, a comfortable restaurant in which to relax and a banquet facility for your business party, church banquet, wedding or social event. All this in a quiet, relaxing atmosphere just minutes from Charleston, WV.

name: Scots Marketplace
description: We are a family owned business who grows our own beautiful flowers and believes in supporting our local community of farmers and artisans! When we decided to expand our greenhouse and garden center to create a quality foods marketplace, we knew we couldn’t settle for anything less than the uncompromising quality that has been a hallmark of the Scots name for more than 30 years. So, we set out to harvest the freshest vegetables and fruits from local and regional farms, unique, hard-to-find specialty items, and quality packaged foods from names not only praised for their deliciousness, but also for the quality of their ingredients. Our standards are high. Each time you visit Scots Marketplace, you’ll discover a harvest of fresh produce and a growing lineup of delicious, quality foods. Visit our 1890 grist mill and enjoy our unique gift items, everything for your lawn and garden, plus a visit to "The Sugar Grove" for hand dipped ice cream.

name: Screech Owl Brewing
description: The first fully licensed brewery in Preston County West Virginia's 198 year history -- located in the mountains of Preston County, West Virginia about 6 miles off of I-68, exit 29. In the ancient tradition of farm breweries --when each community had it's own brewery- we are hand crafting real beer from mountain water, malted grain, hops and yeast. We are in the true sense of the word a craft brewery--3.5 barrel brewing system producing 200 to 300 barrels of beer a year. We sell from the brewery 64 oz. and 32 oz. growlers for take home consumption. You can also enjoy our beer in Morgantown, Fairmont, and Davis by the glass along with a meal a several locations. Stop by the brewery and try a 2 oz. sample of fresh beer, all natural ingredients, no preservatives, not shipped and stored for months and see if we can make you a believer in local beer and what real beer should taste like. CHEERS!

name: Sarge’s Dive Shop
description: Sarge's Dive Shop is West Virginia's #1 premiere scuba diving facility located on beautiful Summersville Lake in Nicholas County, WV. Sarge's offers lake tours, swimming, snorkeling and diving charters, and kayak and paddelboard rentals. Sarge's Dive Shop is a full-service TDI, SDI, ERDI, and NAUI dive center providing air, rental gear, scuba sales, and repair services. Sarge's Dive Shop also offers NAUI & SDI scuba certification classes, ERDI Public Safety Dive training and ERDI / TDI drysuit and full-face mask training. You can drive up to Sarge's in your car or in a boat because it is the only floating dive shop in the USA! (#scubawv #sarges #divewv)

name: Second Creek Campground
description: Second Creek Campground is a family business run by Barabara Hunter and family. The campground offers a safe location for families to come and enjoy a quite weekend or short vaction. For entertainment we have a volleyball net, horseshoe pits, basketball hoop, swimming and fishing areas. We offer 96 units with water and electric hookups, bathhouses with hot showers and flush toilets, and dumping station. We are only a half mile to the Greenbrier River and six miles south of Ronceverte.
address: 213 Billy Hunter Lane / 365 RR 1, Ronceverte, WV, 24970

name: Second Creek
description: Stocked in April, this fly fishing only creek offers a 1.5-mile section at Rodgers Mill. Accessible by WV Secondary Rts. 219/3 and 3/7 from U. S. Rt. 219 approximately 5 miles south of Ronceverte. Located on the Greenbrier, Monroe County line. (Fly-Fishing-Only).

name: Second Street Station
description: The Second Street Station is known for its excellent service, good value, and of course, its great food. Don’t leave without trying the restaurant’s signature sandwich, the “Choo Choo burger.”

name: Second Tyme Around
description: In my shop, you will find country items, primitives, antiques, collectibles, shabby chic, linens/textiles, books, home décor like lamps-pictures-mirrors, small furniture, kitchen stuff, cookbooks, costume jewelry, sterling jewelry, kid's books & toys, dvd's, vhs's, cd's, etc.

name: Second Ward Negro Elementary
description: This elementary school represents African-American history in Monongalia County from 1938 to 1954, the years during which it functioned as a school for African Americans and as a community center for Morgantown's black population. It looks much the same today as it did in 1938. Built with a grant from the Works Progress Administration (WPA), First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt attended the school's dedication in 1940. The school closed in 1955 following integration. On the National Register of Historic Places.
address: White Ave. and Posten Ave., Morgantown, WV, 26501

name: Secret Sandwich Society
description: Sandwiches filled with delicious toppings and homemade spreads, burgers that will blow your mind, plus we even make our own pickles, chips, and ketchup! The best thing between two pieces of bread. Delicious, creative combinations leaving you hungry for more.
address: 103 1/2 Keller Ave, Fayetteville, WV, 103 1/2 Keller Ave

name: Seneca Creek Falls
description: Located in the Monongahela National Forest, Seneca Creek Falls is one of Pendleton County’s most secluded spots. Hidden at the base of the highest point in WV, Spruce Knob, this waterfall is a nature lover’s dream. The cool waters and large rocks make it a picturesque location, with several beautiful camping spots nearby. Be sure to come prepared for a 5-mile hike along Seneca Creek Trail, passing several creeks to reach these breathtaking falls.

name: Seneca Rocks Climbing School
description: Seneca Rocks Climbing School has been offering climbing instruction since 1971 and is the oldest continuously operated climbing school in the Mid-Atlantic. Whether you're just starting out or have been climbing for many years, Seneca Rocks Climbing School will make you a better and safer climber. Come discover the SRCS difference in climbing instruction. Register Online to Climb Seneca Rocks!
address: 27 Allegheny Drive, Suite B, Seneca Rocks, WV, 26884

name: Seneca Rocks Discovery Center
description: The Seneca Rocks Discovery Center is located at the base of Seneca Rocks. It has an outstanding and majestic view of the vertical wall of Seneca Rocks dominating the scene. It is a great place to start your visit of the area. The tourist center for Seneca Rocks offers a gift shop, classrooms and art displays.
address: Monongahela National Forest, PO Box 13, Seneca Rocks, WV, 26884

name: Seneca Rocks Mountain Guides
description: Teaching programs – all technical equipment provided. Indoor climbing gym and training facility on-site. Children’s, women’s only and group programs available. Seasons: Summer (April 1 to Oct. 31). At Seneca Rocks.

name: Seneca Rocks
description: Seneca Rocks, located in Monongahela National Forest, is one of the best-known landmarks in West Virginia and have long been noted as a scenic attraction and are popular with rock climbers. The rocks are a magnificent formation rising nearly 900 feet above the North Fork River. Eastern West Virginia contains many such formations of the white/gray Tuscarora quartzite. Seneca Rocks and nearby Champe Rocks are among the most imposing examples. A self-guided 1.3 mile interpretive trail beginning behind the Seneca Rocks Discovery Center offers the non-climber a way to reach the lofty heights of the rocks and view the scenic valley below.

name: Serenity Now Outfitters
description: 2,000 square foot retail location in historic downtown Lewisburg. Offering premier outdoor clothing, footwear, fly fishing and backpacking equipment, Old Town canoes and kayaks and dog supplies. Licensed and bonded guide services.

name: Sesame Inn
description: Authentic Chinese Restaurant in Weston, West Virginia

name: Seth Burton Memorial Disc Golf Complex
description: The Seth Burton Memorial DGC, one of the best kept secrets in WV disc golf. Designed by 1986 Disc Golf World Champion Johnny Sias

name: Sew Chic, LLC
description: Quilt shop with approximately 3,000 bolts of fabric, huge thread assortment, notions, embroidery design software, patterns, books and classes. Sew Chic is an authorized Bernina dealer located 1.5 miles off I-79, Exit 39. Open Mon. - Fri. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m., Sat. 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.

name: S&G Yarns and More
description: Carrying Red Heart and Lions brand yarns as well as wools. Knitting needles, crochet hooks and all notions for yarn projects. Beads and beading supplies, scrapbooking, DMC floss and iron-on patterns as well as items to embroidery. Mon-Thurs 10-6, Fri 10-5 and Sun 9-2

name: Shalimar Farm Vacation Retreat
description: Shalimar is 900 acres of private land with rugged terrain and diverse trails for beginning or advanced riders bringing their own horses. The facility is open year-round with 2 furnished cabins for riders and run-in sheds and pastures for horses. Maximum occupancy is 8, insuring a private experience. The land joins Monongahela National Forest and is traversed in part by the Cass Scenic Railroad, a steam operation from May-October.

name: Shavers Fork Cabins
description: River and Mountain side Luxury Vacation Rentals. Privately owned properties with full amenities for couples, families, hunters, fishermen, to rent while enjoying our beautiful area.

name: Shawnee Farms
description: Offering a safe and affordable venue with a sporting club course, rifle and pistol range and 5-stand wobble trap. Instruction available. Mon-Fri by appointment, Sat 9-5 and Sun 12-5

name: Shepherdstown Historic District
description: Established in the 1730s as Mecklenberg, Shepherdstown is the oldest town in West Virginia. In the wake of the Battle of Antietam, only five miles away, the town became a vast hospital for Robert E. Lee’s retreating Confederate Army. On September 20, 1862, the last significant battle of the Maryland Campaign occurred at Boteler’s Ford, about a mile down the Potomac River from the town.

name: Shepherdstown Pedal & Paddle LLC.
description: Shepherdstown Pedal & Paddle makes it easy to rent bikes, kayaks, canoes, and float tubes for the Potomac River, C&O Canal, Antietam Battlefield, or wherever you want to go! We also offer a number of packaged deals that include shuttle service. Our most popular trips are bundled into easy to plan packages; we also welcome special requests and do our best to cater to individuals and groups

name: Shepherdstown Sweet Shop
description: Join us for breakfast, lunch or an anytime snack – we’re open daily. Sit down with a steaming cappuccino and a fresh croissant or muffin, or choose from an array of contemporary sandwiches on our handcrafted breads, creative wraps, soups and sweet or savory pastries.

name: Shepherdstown Visitors Center
description: Now in its 30th year, the Shepherdstown Visitors Center assists visitors and residents alike by serving as a clearinghouse for information about events happening in the town. It promotes these events through its web page and social media, and through news releases, emails and printed materials. The Center also organizes several major annual town events, such as a spring "DogFest," a "BooFest" at Halloween, and the town's month-long Christmas celebration. Open 10am - 4pm daily.
address: 201 South Princess Street, PO Box 329, Shepherdstown, WV, 25443

name: Shiley Acres
description: For over 40 years Shiley Acres, an outdoor concert venue located in Inwood, West Virginia, has grown in to a one of the most unique nationally recognize privately owned concert venues in the United States. Located in Eastern Panhandle of WV, this venue is truely one of a kind!

name: Shiley Acres
description: Shiley Acres is an outdoor concert venue located in Inwood, West Virginia. For 40 years Shiley Acres has seen many local and national acts grace it's stage. Visit www.shileyacres.net often to keep up to date with concerts and events at the venue.

name: Shoney’s – Lewisburg
description: Family friendly, All-American Southern-style restaurant. Serving breakfast, lunch, & dinner.

name: Short Story Brewing
description: Short Story Brewing is a family-owned craft brewery in Rivesville, WV. We believe that all good things are the result of hard work and a little creativity. You can taste it in our beer, you can see it in our taproom and you can feel it in our surrounding community. And we're finally ready to share it all with you.

name: Show Your Colors
description: Show Your Colors is a collegiate retail store specializing in all things WVU Mountaineers. Apparel, accessories, tailgating, home decor and too many other items to mention. Mountaineer fan heaven.

name: Showshoe Condos
description: I have 1 and 3 bedroom condos at Snowshoe Mountain Resort that I rent. For more information go to my website www.snowshoeresort.com or give me a call at 740-286-0726 or 800-898-0004.

name: Shuckers
description: Visit Shuckers Restaurant for Italian surf 'n' turf meals like fried fish sandwiches, burgers, shrimp scampi, meatball subs, grilled shrimp, jerk shrimp in a casual seashore themed atmosphere in St. Albans!
address: 70 Olde Main Plaza, St. Albans, WV, 25177

name: Shuggy’s Antiques and Jewelry
description: Welcome to Shuggy's antiques, home of the finest antiques and jewelry in Wheeling West Virginia. Here at Shuggy's we have been dealing in jewelry and antiques for over 30 years. We've been serving the people of Wheeling West Virginia for almost 25 years. We pride ourselves on our great customer service, and try to ensure all of our customers leave happy and satisfied. Our business is family owned and operated, and we offer the best buy/ sell prices on all Antiques and jewelry in Wheeling West Virginia.

name: Silver Dragon
description: Serving Chinese food, chicken wings, hot sandwiches and wraps, blended smoothies and iced drinks.
address: 518 N. Jefferson St., Suite 23, Lewisburg, WV, 24901

name: Simmering Pot Family Restaurant
description: Open daily for breakfast and dinner. Treat yourself to one of our favorites: steak, shrimp, sandwiches, soups, salads, pasta dishes. Inside the Holiday Inn.

name: Simpson Creek Covered Bridge
description: Located near Bridgeport, the original bridge was washed out in 1899. The 75 Ft. Replacement is a half mile below the original. Also known as The W.T. Law Bridge. Location: From I-79 Exit 121, Take Secondary 24 (north) Approximately .2 Miles.
address: Simpson Creek Covered Bridge, Bridgeport, WV, 26330

name: Siriannis Cafe
description: At Sirianni's Cafe we continue to serve fresh, good tasting food in our eclectic atmosphere. We do hope you will look around and make yourself at home while here, but most of all, savor the experience of your meal. This former steamship office now churns out pizzas with sweet sauce and oozing cheese, plus other Italian appetizers.

name: Sisters Antique Mall
description: 10,000 square feet of vintage collectible antiques. You are sure to find something for anyone in Sisters Antique Mall. Come and take a walk down memory lane. Sisters Antique Mall offers a variety of glassware, tools, ephemera, jewelry, coins, toys, and much much more!

name: Sisters Antiques
description: We sell antiques, furniture, collectibles, glassware, china, jewelry and other unique gifts.

name: Sister’s Coffee House
description: Local coffee, muffins, breakfast, and lunch.

name: Sistersville Country Club
description: Sistersville Course 9 hole regulation length course Public golf course

name: Skatetown USA
description: Roller Rink with games, food and beverages Laser Storm Arena- laser tag.

name: Ski Barn At Davis
description: The Ski Barn is the largest independent ski and snowboard rental company in the Southeast. Locations serving all West Virginia ski resorts: Snowshoe, Canaan Valley, Timberline and Winterplace, as well as Wintergreen Resort in Virginia. Great rental rates...always lower than the resorts. Top quality equipment and over 28 years of superior service to the ski industry. Sales, rentals, souvenirs and accessories from names such as K2, Burton, Columbia, The North Face, Nordica, Oakley and more...
address: Blackwater Center-Canaan Valley, Rte. 32, Davis, WV, 26260

name: Ski Barn At Winterplace
description: The Ski Barn is the largest independent ski and snowboard rental company in the Southeast. Locations serving all West Virginia resorts: Snowshoe, Canaan Valley, Timberline and Winterplace as well as Wintergreen Resort in Virginia. Great rental rates...always less than the resorts. Top quality equipment and over 28 years of superior customer service to the ski industry. Sales and rentals, souvenirs and accessories from names such as Burton, K2, The North Face, Nordica, Oakley, Spyder and more.
address: Rte. 19, 3311 Flat Top Rd., Ghent, WV, 25843

name: Ski Barn- Slaty Fork
description: The Ski Barn is the largest independent ski and snowboard rental company in the Southeast. Locations serving all West Virginia ski resorts: Snowshoe, Canaan Valley, Timberline and Winterplace, as well as Wintergreen Resort in Virginia. Great rental rates...always lower than the resorts. Top quality equipment and over 28 years of superior service to the ski industry. Sales, rentals, souvenirs and accessories from names such as K2, Burton, Columbia, The North Face, Nordica, Oakley and more...

name: Ski The Valley
description: Embrace winter and Ski the Valley in Tucker County. With an average snowfall of 150 inches per year and an elevation of over 4,000 feet, we have all the natural ingredients that make our high-mountain paradise ideal for skiing, snowboarding, tubing, sledding and other seasonal activities. Check out our three premier ski resorts for the perfect winter playgrounds: Canaan Valley Resort, Timberline Mountain and White Grass!   [if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif] https://wvtourism.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/xcskiing.mp4

name: Sky Tours
description: More for families or groups with bigger kids, from my dark site location by appointment, I offer day or night astronomy demonstrations year round that will enhance your appreciation of the sky above. Video presentations, Starlab planetarium sessions, a space/time walk, solar viewing, or stargazing sessions can be scheduled anywhere including downtown Lewisburg. Learn much more at: http://www.wvskytours.com/

name: Skyline Lodge, Pub & Grill
description: Skyline Lodge, Pub & Grill provides quiet and comfortable accommodations and services for guests in the forty-seven room lodge. Experience our delicious Skyline Grill, which offers food for any tastes, as well as delicious drinks in a casual setting at Rich & Ernie’s Pub. Located one mile from Exit 28 on Interstate 77, Skyline Lodge, Pub & Grill is adjacent to Winterplace Ski Resort. With forty-two rolling acres and a lakeside overlook, what are you waiting for?

name: Slaty Mountain Preserve
description: Slaty Mountain Preserve is comprised of a dry hardwood and pine woodland including a globally rare shale barren community. The primary feature of the preserve is the high quality shale barren that is habitat to many rare species. The small dirt road accessing the preserve cuts across the shale barren community, allowing good views of the shale barren species and surrounding mountains. Hiking and visitation is limited to walking along this dirt road. All the shale barren species can be seen from the road side. Late summer (after mid August) is the best time to see the shale barren plants in bloom.  Find out more about Slaty Mountain Preserve at the Nature Conservancy website.
address: 3-14, Cove Creek Road, (near) Sweet Springs, WV, 24941

name: Sleep Inn-Summersville
description: The pet-friendly Sleep Inn hotel in Summersville, West Virginia is located off U.S. Route 19 near Summersville Memorial Hospital. Nearby destinations include, New River Gorge Bridge, Hawks Nest State Park, Carnifex Ferry Battlefield State Park and Summersville Arena and Conference Center. Amenities include free deluxe continental breakfast, free WiFi and business center. Each guest room features TVs, coffee makers, irons, ironing boards, hair dryers, refrigerators and microwaves.

name: Sleep Inn & Suites – Cross Lanes
description: Sleep Inn - Cross Lanes is conveniently located less than a half mile from Mardi Gras Casino and Resort just 10 minutes from Charleston. Free high-speed internet access, both wireless and direct-connect. Complimentary Morning Medley Breakfast that includes hot items, such as, eggs, sausage, biscuits & gravy. Free HBO and newspapers. Super clean rooms with refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, hairdryer and iron/ironing board. Next door to Cracker Barrel and TGI Fridays.
address: 15 Goff Crossing Drive, Cross Lanes, WV, 25313

name: Sleep Inn – Beaver
description: The Sleep Inn® hotel is ideally located in the heart of southern West Virginia, less than one mile from Beckley Raleigh County Memorial Airport. This Beaver, WV hotel is convenient to The Summit: Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve, a high-adventure scouting camp and the new permanent home of the National Scout Jamboree, Mountain State University, Bluefield State College, Bluestone State Park and Concord University. Winterplace Ski Resort is just 15 miles away.

name: Sleep Inn – Bridgeport
description: Conveniently located off Interstate 79, our smoke-free affordable hotel in Bridgeport gives you easy access to the city of Clarksburg and other local sites, activities and attractions, including: FBI National Crime Information Center (NCIC) Downtown Bridgeport Salem International University Downtown Clarksburg Benedum Civic Center Our valued guests will find fresh design elements and amenities that help you relax. Business guests will appreciate our copy, print and fax services. Additional amenities include our free Morning Medley breakfast buffet with plenty of hot and cold options and free coffee, plus: Free hot breakfast Free high-speed WiFi Business center Free weekday newspaper Guest laundry facilities

name: Sleep Inn – Charleston
description: Sleep Inn - Charleston is an excellent choice for both business and leisure travelers. Free high-speed internet access, both wireless and direct-connect. Complimentary Morning Medley Breakfast. Free HBO and newspapers. Close to downtown Charleston with plenty of free parking. Easy access to I-77 and I-64. Super clean rooms with refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, hairdryer, and iron/ironing board. Next door to Harding's Family Restaurant & Gift Shop.

name: Sleep Inn & Suites – Moundsville
description: A new non-smoking hotel located in Moundsville, WV. Large in room flat-panel tvs are in rooms. Amenities at our smoke-free hotel include: a fitness center and business center, which includes a meeting room that accommodates between 40-50 people. We also have an outdoor pavilion with a grill.

name: Sleep Inn & Suites – Parkersburg
description: Conveniently located off Interstate 77, the Sleep Inn & Suites® Parkersburg-Marietta hotel in Parkersburg, WV is a simply stylish sanctuary that’s designed for a happy night’s sleep. Our location offers easy access to fun activities at Blennerhassett Island Historical State Park and The Castle.

name: Sleep Inn & Suites – Princeton
description: The Award Winning Sleep Inn Princeton is a great year-round destination in the heart of Southern West Virginia featuring 108 guestrooms and spacious suites, free wi-fi, indoor heated pool, microfridges in all rooms, and free hot breakfast breakfast with waffles, scrambled eggs, and more. The Sleep Inn-Princeton is located off I-77 at Exit 9 and is a Pet Friendly hotel.

name: Sleep Inn – Ellenboro
description: The Sleep Inn® hotel in Ellenboro, WV is an uplifting, simply stylish sanctuary that’s designed for a happy night’s rest. Our affordable Ellenboro hotel is conveniently located off of U.S. 50 near boating, fishing and hiking at North Bend State Park, as well as attractions like: Berdine's 5 & Dime Ritchie County Historical Museum Cliff’s Museum of Car Memorabilia North Bend Golf Course North Bend Rail Trail

name: Sleepy Creek Presents
description: Sleepy Creek Presents is a grass roots event production company that focuses on small family friendly festivals. Our home venue is Sleepy Creek on the Potomac, a private campground located in Berkeley Springs WV, home of the annual events Sleepy Creek SpringDig, Brokedown Floatdown, and Sleepy Creek HarFest. Please visit our website for more info. See you at Sleepy Creek!

name: Sleepy Creek – WMA – Berkeley
description: 75 primitive camping sites with fire rings, lantern pole and gravel parking pad. Due to narrow, graveled roads, trailers over 17ft are not recommended. A pit type toilet and trash cans are located in each campground. Well water is available from a hand pump. Sleepy Creek Lake provides a boat launch and fishing. Downed wood can be cut for campfire use. Pets are permitted but must be kept on a leash at all times. These campsites are open year-round.

name: Sleepy Hollow Golf & Country Club
description: PGA affiliated private golf club that features an 18-hole championship golf course, tennis & pool complex and Anderson Dining Room. Best in the Valley!

name: Slight Indulgence
description: One of the most complete gourmet shops in the tri-state area. Gourmet food and wine shop featuring Godiva and Neuhaus Belgian Chocolate, gourmet food baskets and West Virginia food products. Open Mon. - Thurs. 7:30 a.m. - 6 p.m., Fri. 7:30 a.m. - 9 p.m. and Sat. 9 a.m. - 5 p.m. Lunch hours from 11 a.m. - 3 p.m.

name: Summersville Lake Marina, Inc.
description: Summersville Lake is West Virginia's #1 tourist attraction! Summersville Lake covers 2700 acres during the summer season and has about 65 miles of shoreline. It is over 300 ft. deep at the base of the dam. It is the cleanest, clearest freshwater lake east of the Mississippi River. It has the best freshwater lake diving east of the Mississippi. The marina offers overnight slips, pontoon boat rentals, ice, fuel, and sales. It also has "Sarge's Dive Shop", a full-service SDI / ERDI / NAUI dive facility. Sarge's provides scuba classes, rental gear, air, sales, kayak & canoe rentals, lake tours, and diving, swimming & snorkeling charters. Sarge's Dive Shop is also on Facebook.

name: Small Business Development Center: Eastern WV Community & Technical College
description: Building better businesses by offering help with planning, management, financing and training.

name: Small Business Development Center: Pierpont C&TC of FSU – Flatwoods
description: Small business development center helps small businesses get started in many different aspects as well as working with people who are already in business such as loan packaging etc. Fairmont State / Peirpont Community and Technical College / GSC, both higher education facilities offer courses at this location for a 2 year associate program.
address: The Braxton County Center, 200 Jerry Burton Dr., Sutton, WEST VIRGINIA, 26601

name: Small Business Development Center- Charleston
address: State Capitol Complex, Bldg. 6, Room 652, Charleston, WV, 25305

name: Smitty’s Pizza
description: Established in 1970 by Dominick S. "Smitty" Brunetti and his family. His son Dominick "Duke" and wife, Barbara continued the tradition in 1990 to present. Carry Out or Free Delivery

name: Smitty’s Susuki, Kawasaki, Yamaha
description: After 45 years the business continues to thrive and service the community. The business was opened in 1963 as a pawn shop and sporting goods store. With the opening of the motorcycle shop, the pawn shop and sporting goods store was closed. The motorcycle business has prospered ever since, due to the service provided and the patronage of the fine customers in central West Virginia. The Service Department is Five Star certified by Yamaha, and has won the Suzuki Super Service awards.

name: Smoke Camp – WMA – Lewis
description: WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT AREA LOCATED IN LEWIS COUNTY. Located on the right fork of Freemans Creek Road, access via Doddridge County Route 58/4.

name: Smoke Hole Caverns
description: Smoke Hole Caverns magnificent formations are the result of millions of years of intricate processes and trillions of drops of mineral laden water. We are worlds away - but close to home. Smoke Hole Resort is based 8 miles south of Petersburg, WV, on Highway 55 on the banks of the North Fork of the South Branch River. We are only 10 minutes North of Seneca Rocks on Rt 28/55.

name: Smoke Hole Cottages, LLC
description: These cottages are great for families with younger children. There is a playground structure with swings and a slide, and easy access to the shallow river for casual fishing. Each cottage has a kitchen and grill so you can easily prepare family picnics. We also feature boutique shopping, hunting, and fishing. Fishing offers guide service.

name: Smoke House BBQ LLC
description: Family style Restaurant with Southern Pit style Smoked BBQ, home made sides, home made sauces and dressings, Burgers, Hot dogs, Wings, Grilled Chicken & more! All made from the heart with Love! Serving lunch and dinner.

name: Smoke on the Water
description: BBQ restaurant featuring outdoor dining, local craft beer, full bar, specialty drinks, seafood, burgers, pizza and more. All our food is cooked using traditional BBQ methods and many ingredients are also smoked to provide a unique flavor in traditional BBQ favorites. Catering and take out available. Live music seasonally. Serving lunch and dinner. Location: Rt. 33 East and Isner Creek Rd.

name: Smokey’s Steakhouse
description: Right on the rim of the New River Gorge—a top-level steak house with a surprisingly casual atmosphere. Our flagship restaurant, Smokey's is a showcase timber-frame pavilion perched right smack dab on the rim of the New River Gorge. The gourmet food combined with friendly service and casual atmosphere has to be experienced to be believed. Optional seating on our outdoor deck offers spectacular views of the New River Gorge and incredible Appalachian sunsets.

name: Smoot Theatre
description: The Smoot continues to provide live entertainment throughout the year. There is music - jazz, big bands, country, bluegrass, rock and folk. Children's theatre, comedy, dance, lectures, one-man shows, meetings, seminars, and even our famous dessert tours which are held on stage. Private tours can be arranged by contacting the theater.

name: Smooth Ambler Spirits Distillery
description: Smooth Ambler is an award-winning, grain-to-glass distillery specializing in bourbon and whiskey. Using local, high-quality ingredients, a state-of-the-art copper column still, and good ole Appalachian know how, Smooth Ambler creates phenomenal spirits that showcase the real hard work, patience, and dedication that is the distinguished spirit of Appalachia. Stop in for a taste of premium local and merchant-bottled spirits or for a tour of the facility where you can see their hard working still.

name: Snow Creek Mountain Sports
description: Ski & Snowboard rental shop located on top of Snowshoe Mountain. On-mountain convenience and outstanding customer service all at rates lower than the resort. Offering the latest in ski and snowboard technology in our rental fleet as well as for sale. A full service ski shop offering names such as Burton, K2, Nordica, Oakley, Scott, The North Face, Columbia, Spyder and more. Stop in to have your equipment tuned up, or try out the latest in demo equipment, or spend the afternoon shopping.

name: Snowshoe Mountain Condos & Lodging Accommodations
description: We offer 1,2,3,and 6 bedroom Condos at wild and wonderful Snowshoe Mountain. Rent from owners and save. Our condos are slope side, ski-in and ski-out, and within walking distance to the trails and Village. Let our owner representative assist you in planning your vacation to Snowshoe.

name: Snowshoe Mountain
description: Welcome to Snowshoe. Where sheer happiness is found on every slope, with every decadent four-course dinner and hot stone massage. A favorite destination among avid skiers and adventure-seeking snowmobiler, Snowshoe also makes a great warm weather retreats centered around hiking, mountain biking and horseback riding. Where boutique shopping, spa days and family fun convene often in glorious mountaintop memories. Make your next spring getaway at Snowshoe Mountain Resort. Book Now

name: Snowshoe Properties Management
description: SNOWSHOE PROPERTIES MANAGEMENT, LLC is Snowshoe Mountain's longest Independent Property Management and Vacation Rental Company. You can choose from a luxury home or budget efficiency. We offer more homes perfect for large family and social gatherings than any other rental company in the county. Many of our Vacation Homes have awesome views of either the slopes, Village, or the Western Territory---sunrise to sunset.
address: H.C. 69, Box 24, Spruce Village, Slatyfork, WV, 26291

name: Soho’s Italian Restaurant
description: Don’t pass up fabulous Italian food in a great location—the heart of Capitol Market in downtown Charleston. Spaghetti and meatballs, lasagna and ravioli are among the favorites. Unique flavors and adventurous combinations highlight the menu.

name: Somewhere In Time Antiques & Flea Market
description: Our antique mall has over 15,100 square feet of antique merchandise. Somewhere in Time Antique Mall has been in business over 20 years, and has thousands of satisfied customers. We showcase 105 spaces of the valley's best antiques and collectibles for you to browse, with over 50 vendors. We would love for you to come visit us. Somewhere In Time Antique Mall makes the trip to Nitro, WV extra special for the antique or collectible seeker.

name: Sophisticated Hound Brewing Company
description: Downtown Princeton's Microbrewery and Tap Room in the Grass Roots District features a selection of craft beer, signature sandwiches and personal pizzas. Catch live music and enjoy the atmosphere in this up and coming location. Open Hours: Thursdays 5 pm to 10 pm Fridays 12 noon to 10 pm Saturdays 11 am - 10 pm

name: South Branch Cinema 6
description: Family entertainment center with first run movies

name: South Branch Inn – Moorefield
description: Nestled in the South Branch Valley, the South Branch Inn has 100 rooms to accommodate your lodging needs. We have a variety of rooms including suites with jacuzzis. All rooms come with a free continental breakfast, HBO, and high speed internet access as well as wireless access. We have an exercise room and a guest laundry. We are located next to Ponderosa Steak House and are open 24 hours. We also have 2 large conference/banquet rooms for your meeting or party needs.

name: South Branch Inn – Romney
description: Whether you are a business traveler or in the area to ride the Potomac Eagle Train, Romney’s South Branch Inn is the perfect place to rest after an eventful day. With 61 rooms all with free HBO, continental breakfast, and high-speed internet and some suites including Jacuzzis, R&R comes easy here. Gearing up for the rest of your stay in Romney is also made easy with a guest laundry facility and an exercise facility.

name: South Branch Meat and Cattle Company
description: Local grown Angus Freezer Packed Beef

name: South Charleston Antique Mall
description: We have an arrary of antique items to choose from including furniture and glassware, jewelry and coins, paper collectibles - books and postcards, stoneware, antique tools, and primitives in our 1800 square feet of space. Walk through an antique store with clean and wide aisles because of the large amount of space available for the items. Every item is displayed properly for your visual tour. Directions: I-64 West to Exit 56, right to Route 60 West, turn left to next light. Turn left at light and go behind Adena Indian Mound. Turn left on D Street, red brick three story building is on the right.

name: South Charleston Chamber of Commerce
description: The South Charleston Chamber of Commerce is a network of individuals, businesses, organizations, and government working together to promote and enhance business in the greater South Charleston area. Our mission is providing resources that make it easier for our members to do business!

name: South Charleston Convention & Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: South Charleston offers something for everyone. Make this central location your vacation destination. South Charleston has over 60 restaurants ranging from Mediterranean, Asian, Mexican, Italian, Farm to Table and your favorite chains. Downtown South Charleston is a safe, walkable city that is home to the second largest Indian burial Mound in the state. "D" street has a museum, theater and several Antique shops. There are five exciting shopping areas within South Charleston offering many of your favorite stores. Little Creek Park is close by with sports facilities and hiking trails. Our four lodging facilities have all of the modern amenities you expect, while providing the “down-home” style hospitality. Come see us!

name: South Hills Market and Cafe
description: South Hills Market and Café serves lunch & dinner daily. Lunch is available for carry out daily until 9pm. Dinner is served Tuesday - Thursday until 10pm and Friday - Saturday until 11pm. Happy hour is 3 to 6:30pm daily. Full bar and boutique wine list available. Catering available by appointment for any occasion. Call 304-345-2585. In 2018, South Hills Market and Cafe won a prestigious Wine Spectator Magazine award.

name: South Side Depot
description: The South Side Depot was built in 1911 just a year after the railroad came to Petersburg, WV. The building was originally built as a general store that offered merchandise as well as feed supplies. Today the store boasts of hand made West Virginia items from foods and crafts to pottery and photography and so much more. We compliment these items with specially selected home decor and primitives as well as furniture and antiques. Visitor's Center inside- pets welcome- Come say Hi!

name: Visit Southern West Virginia Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: Visit Southern West Virginia (CVB) promotes the rich history, scenic beauty and array of exciting attractions and adventures in the southern part of West Virginia. Visit Southern West Virginia (CVB) covers the nine southern most counties in the state and the region includes the City of Beckley, the New River Gorge, Fayetteville, Summersville, Hinton, Union, Princeton/Bluefield, Lewisburg and more. Stop by or visit visitwv.com to find the best places to go and things to do in the area. [if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif] https://wvtourism.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/03.08.24-Visit-Southern-WV-Listing-Compressed.mp4

name: Spark! Imagination and Science Center
description: Spark! Imagination and Science Center in Morgantown is open Tuesday-Saturday from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. The Museum has interactive exhibits and the Science Center is open on periodic Saturdays. Visitors can explore science such as nano science, space weather and dinosaurs, practice engineering skills, stretch their imagination with dress-up and puppets, and hands-on exhibits. Admission is $6 per child, $2 per adult, children under 12 months are free.
address: Mountaineer Mall 5000 Greenbag Road, St. G-12, Morgantown, WV, 26507

name: Spencer Antique Mall – Arts and Collectibles
description: Located in beautiful Downtown Spencer, the Spencer Antique Mall is over 8,000 square feet and features over 40 individual dealers. Open 7 days a week! Come shop in Air Conditioned Comfort! All major credit cards accepted. An eclectic gathering of Vintage Collectibles & Antiques Featuring Handcrafted Arts by WV Artisans & Unique Gifts

name: Spencer Heritage Park
description: Visitors Can Tour A Fully-furnished One-room Schoolhouse, See A Working Oil Derrick, And Visit A Train Depot That Has Been Converted To A Museum On Roane County History.  This facility is included in "A Guide to Accessible Recreation in West Virginia." Please check the Guide or the site for information on accessibility. Please note - a self-reporting survey was used to compile the information in this Guide; every attempt was made to verify the accuracy of the information but West Virginia Division of Tourism is not responsible for errors or inaccuracies.

name: SpencerTrails
description: The outdoor recreation hub of Central West Virginia is SpencerTrails! With over 25 miles and counting of expertly designed single track trails, unique rock gardens, ancient ruins to hike or ride your bike by, and even an award winning winery at one trailhead. The best marked trail system in the state is here in Spencer, WV. Every trail junction and trailhead marked with signs telling you the trail name and difficulty. Beautiful trailhead kiosks at all trailheads. "You Are Here" signs placed throughout trails. Interpretive arboretum. Fun "features" for mountain bikers to ride. Hike or bike to the historic 1910 concrete Ben's Run Dam, a 40' high abandoned structure that looks like a centuries old Roman Aqueduct. See amazing views of one of West Virginia's Top 10 most beautiful towns (according to The Culture Trip) from the Spencer Civil War Park. Visit the Chestnut Ridge Artist Colony from one trailhead. Ride the Tour de Lake Mountain Bike Race - one of the premier mountain biking events in West Virginia since 1994 held as the WVMBA season opener at Charles Fork Lake, this is the Daytona 500 of mountain biking. All trails are even lined with "fire tacks" making night time hiking and biking extra enjoyable.

name: Spicy Gringos
description: Since 2011, Spicy Gringo's has been one of the Ohio Valley's favorite restaurants. Why? Because we pride ourselves in serving refreshingly different Mexican dishes like our slow cooked shredded beef, Mexican rice, Mexican calzones, tacos, burritos, dessert chimmies, salads, nachos, quesadillas, chimichangas, enchiladas and the popular jalapeño burger - all of which are made with fresh, handpicked ingredients.

name: Spring Hill Cemetery and Park
description: Offering commanding views of the city, this cemetery includes a section with several Confederate soldiers' graves. Its historical significance is a tribute to the founders of Charleston and the area. Although Spring Hill Cemetery Park is still an active cemetery with a new section opened recently it is also a wonderful place to walk, enjoy nature's beauty and an awesome view of the valley. Bird watching is a very popular activity and the trees and flowers provide an outdoor classroom for the many school classes who visit often. Historians find Spring Hill Cemetery Park especially interesting since many key figures in the development of West Virginia and Charleston rest there. Civil War notables abound from both the Blue and Grey including Gen. Appleton who was an officer of a famous black regiment, The 52nd Massachusetts. Thomas Brown was the Confederate officer who sold the beloved horse "Traveler" to Gen. Robert E. Lee. Spring Hill Cemetery Park can be reached from the North end of Morris Street by going right on Piedmont Road and up the ramp over the interstate, then on up to the top of the hill on Farnsworth Drive. Open Monday through Friday 7:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Gates are open dawn to dusk 7 days a week. Among those interred are Rev. Lewis "Father" Rice, Samuel Starks and Reverend S. R. Bullock. On the National Register of Historic Places.

name: SpringHill Suites Bridgeport Clarksburg
description: Our SpringHill Suites Bridgeport Clarksburg hotel is located right off the highway offering guests a complimentary hot breakfast daily, complimentary WiFi, Onsite fitness center, outdoor pool, meeting space, onsite business center and a full bar in the evening.

name: SpringHill Suites by Marriott – Morgantown
description: The Springhill Suites is an 80 room all-suite property. Amenities include free high-speed Internet, wired and wireless Internet service, heated indoor pool, hot tub, fitness facility, complimentary deluxe season breakfast, business center, and a guest laundry facility. All rooms are a suite with a microwave, refrigerator and a pull-out sofa bed. Located in Sabraton, off of exit 4 of I-68, just outside of Morgantown.

name: SpringHill Suites (Marriott) Wheeling
description: SpringHill Suites Wheeling is conveniently located just minutes from Downtown. Our hotel will provide great service and amenities. All of our studio suites are appointed with either a king bed or two queen beds, a large work desk, a sofa bed, microwave, mini refrigerator, two phones and complimentary high speed internet access. In the morning, come down and enjoy our new breakfast including scrambled eggs, spinach, fresh fruit, Greek yogurt and cheese, just to mention a few of the newly added items. ** Please note a valid credit card is required at check in.

name: Spruce Knob Mountain Center
description: Spruce Knob Mountain Center (SKMC) is a 400 acre high-elevation nature preserve located in the Potomac Highlands of West Virginia. The Potomac Highlands feature some of the darkest night skies in the Eastern U.S., the highest peak in the state (Spruce Knob), the healthiest streams in the state, extensive Red Spruce and northern hardwood forests, natural springs, and numerous caves. SKMC offers unique yurts for lodging accommodations. Camping at the Spruce Knob Mountain Center costs $15 per person, per night. This includes access to bathroom and shower facilities. Dormitory beds are available as well, for $25 a night. We also have three small, private guest yurts nestled up against the spruce forest for $60 per night apiece. With a minimum group of ten people, delicious home-cooked meals are available for an additional $30 per person, per day. Classroom and meeting space is available for a small additional fee.

name: St. Albans Roadside Park
description: St. Albans Roadside Park lies between U. S. Route 60 (MacCorkle Avenue) and the Kanawha River. Picnic shelters are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Playground equipment and bathroom facilities are nearby and are equipped for physically challenged individuals. Overnight trailer camping is permitted on a first-come, first-served basis with a maximum stay of two nights within a 15-day period. A dumping station and water source are available. The park also has a ramp suitable for fishing and pleasure boats, permanent 40' x 56' stage is available for large events and a park dedicated to Rosie the Riveter.
address: 1499 MacCorkle Ave. / U.S. 60, St. Albans, WV, 25177

name: St. Mary’s Golf Club
description: The St. Mary's Golf Club is a 9 hole public course open March through November. This is a challenging 32-33 par, 9 hole course featuring water, hazards, trees and other landscape areas creating the layout of the course.
address: 2840 N. Pleasants Hwy, St. Marys, WV, 26170

name: Stancati’s Family Resaurant
description: Serving casual Italian food, Stacati's features its famous pizza, salads, soups, sandwiches, appetizers, dinner entrées, and desserts. Call for details. Open: Sunday - Thursday 11:00AM - 8:00PM, Friday & Saturday: 11:00AM - 9:00PM

name: Star Movie Theatre
description: A mom and pop neighborhood movie house in a Depression-era theater showing films since the early 1930s. First-run, mainstream movies shown Fri, Sat & Sun at 8pm year round and changed every weekend. Admission - $3.75 for adults. A 1949 Manley machine pops the best popcorn in four states -- served with real butter. Three couches available for only 50 cents extra. Owned and operated by Jeanne Mozier and Jack Soronen since 1977. One block north of the park on the main street. You cannot miss the colorful marquee.

name: Star Song 1 and 2 cabins
description: Star Song 1 and 2 are new luxury cabins in the peaceful countryside in the New River Gorge area between Beckley and Lewisburg. They both have 2 bedrooms, AC/heat, porches, satellite TV, wifi, mountain views, 1 1/2-2 baths, washer/dryer, and are dog friendly. Non smoking and credit cards accepted.

name: Stardust Cafe
description: Go there for lunch, and you’ll want to stay for dinner! Locally grown ingredients, great service and relaxing atmosphere. Must try the Trust Me salad, curry chicken, sticky toffee pudding and French pressed coffee. A local favorite in America’s Coolest Small Town. Dinner reservations recommended. Limited menu offered 3:30 p.m. - 5 p.m. Mon-Thurs: 9 a.m. - 8:30 p.m. and Fri-Sat: 10 a.m. - 9:30 p.m. Call for winter hours.

name: Starlight Cafe at the Green Bank Observatory
description: The Starlight Cafe, located in the Green Bank Science Center, serves fresh salads and wraps, grilled burgers, hot dogs, hand-dipped ice cream and more! Enjoy your meal with a view! Seating is in our lobby with an incredible view of the Green Bank Telescope and surrounding mountains. Where else can you view the world’s largest fully-steerable telescope while sharing a scoop (or two!) of some moose tracks ice cream?

name: West Virginia State Capitol Complex
description: Information and reservations for touring the WV State Capitol Complex: Hours: Guided tours 9:30am - 3:30pm Monday thru Friday. Tours last approximately 30 minutes. Saturdays 1pm - 4pm on the hour. (Summer hours may vary. Please call for a reservation.) Tours of the Governor’s Mansion require reservations and are scheduled on a first come, first served basis. These tours begin at the Tours and Information Desk at the Lower Rotunda of the State Capitol Building. Tours are offered on Thursdays and Fridays, starting at 9 a.m. with the last tour scheduled for 11:30 a.m. Please call Tour Supervisor Mary Ann Long at 304-558-4839 for reservations and information.
address: WV Division Culture, Capitol Complex, Charleston, WV, 25305

name: State Fair Event Center
description: Full hook-ups available. Dumping station available during fair week in August. One mile from downtown Lewisburg. Open May to October. The State Fair Event Center is the only facility in Southern West Virginia that can offer over 40,000 square feet of covered, indoor exhibit space all with restroom and kitchen facilities. Whether you have been charged with planning your company’s annual business meeting, educational seminar or corporate conference, we’ve got the solution for you. Our facility is also perfectly suited for RV rallies, association rallies/conventions, weddings, anniversaries and reunions.

name: State Fair of West Virginia
description: The State Fair of West Virginia is committed to the traditions of agriculture, family, entertainment, and education; and to develop non-fair events that utilize the existing facilities, that create opportunities for growth, and that benefit the community served by the facility.

name: Statts Mills RV Park and Cabins
description: Located on the shores of Lake O'Brien, Statts Mills offers the outdoor enthusiast a full range of activities every year. We offer 7 fully furnished cabins, tent areas, and RV (30/50 amp) sites with full hookups. A bathhouse is available for campers. Fishing, mountain biking, basketball, volleyball and kids playground are available for outdoor activities. Our facilities are available for daily, weekly or monthly rental.

name: Stealey – Goff – Vance House
description: Historical home.

name: Steer Steakhouse
address: 359 Beverly Pike Elkins, WV 26241, Elkins, WV, 26452

name: Stephens Outdoor Railways
description: Come and see all the trains and browse through our extensive inventory of Z to G gauge trains and accessories. Authorized dealer for LGB, Aristocraft, Marklin and Lionel. Don't miss our outdoor railway display Tour through trains in the garden.

name: Sterling Drive-In
description: Known for classic drive-in favorites, inside or out. Serves breakfast, lunch, dinner and coffee Services Walk-Ins Welcome Good For Groups Good For Kids Take Out Delivery Catering Waiter Service

name: Still Hollow Spirits
description: Still Hollow Spirits is a farm to bottle distillery specializing in small whiskey. We proudly use limestone mountain spring water and WV grown heirloom grains to craft our spirits. Located near Seneca Rocks and Spruce Knob, we offer whiskey tasting, bottle sales and distillery tours.

name: Stillwaters Restaurant at Stonewall Resort
description: Fresh, Local, Delicious Cuisine Dining in Stillwaters, the resort's signature restaurant, is always a pleasure. Whether you are dining inside or out, you will experience excellent service and the finest authentic cuisine. Prepared by our talented culinary staff, locally sourced game, fish and produce are prepared with our own unique flare. To make reservations, please call 304-269-8880.

name: The Stirrup Gallery of Davis and Elkins College
description: Where can you learn about the Roman Empire, marvel over a collection of brilliantly colored butterflies from Peru and get an up-close look at tools used by Native Americans? Open the glass doors to The Stirrup Gallery in Myles Center for the Arts where a world of days gone by awaits. Originally established in 2013 as a home to the 10,000-plus North American treasures of The Darby Collection, The Stirrup Gallery has continued to grow to include nine additional collections – the Lincoln Collection, Howard-Sudbrink Collection, Eleanor Gay Collection, Foster Collection, Senator Davis Collection, Swezy Collection, Gary North Collection, J. Richard & Dotty S. Kendig Collection and Reckling Collection.

name: Stone River House
description: Relax and escape to the peace and quiet by the Potomac river, and wake to beautiful romantic views of the river and mountains, in this Historic 1815 stone house situated on 2.5 acres, 450 feet of river front land. Explore and take advantage of all the activities on the river and surrounding area. Fish, bike, kayak, tube, or just sit by the river and watch the birds and wild life. Sit and read by the river or in the quite comfort of the house, or listen to music from Amazon Alexa.

name: Stone Road Vineyard
description: With the state slogan in mind, the folks at Stone Road Vineyard set out to incorporate the time, tools, and strategies developed by Mountaineers in the vinting of quality handmade wines. Family owned and operated. Makers of 14 hand-crafted red and white varieties and blended wines. Winery at 1100’ ASL. Informal farm winery; setting ideal for groups of 6 – 10. Panoramic views of Southern Wood, Western Wirt and Northeastern Jackson Counties, West Virginia.

name: Stonecoal Lake-WMA-Lewis
description: Wildlife Management Area located in Lewis County. South of U.S. 33 and 119 between Weston and Buckhannon. The area is accessible from State Routes 15, 36 and 7.

name: Stone’s Flower City
description: Candles, brass, silk flowers, etc. Offering wedding assistance and rent candelabras. We also have a wide variety of cemetery flowers.

name: Stonewall Jackson Birthplace
description: The Stonewall Jackson Chapter, United Daughters of the Confederacy, has placed a bronze plaque at 326-328 West Main St in Clarksburg to mark the birthplace of the Civil War general. A statue of Jackson at the courthouse plaza honors it's famous son. Location: Various sites, Clarksburg. Address: Greater Clarksburg CVB, 208 Court St., Clarksburg, WV, 26301. Telephone: 304-622-2157.

name: Stonewall Jackson -WMA-Lewis
description: Wild life management area located in Weston, Lewis County. Access the area by using I-79 Exits 91 and 96.

name: Stonewall Resort State Park
description: Just 3 miles from I-79 and spanning 1,900 pristine acres, this vast and beautiful park is home to Stonewall Resort and its many amenities. The park features Stonewall Jackson Lake, one of West Virginia’s most undeveloped and scenic lakes with over 82 miles of beautiful shoreline. Day guests and resort guests alike can enjoy this ideal setting for some of the state’s best bass and muskie fishing as well as kayaking, canoeing, paddle boarding, boating and more! Stonewall Resort State Park offers a variety of accommodations including scenic lakeside camping, a AAA Four Diamond Adirondack-style lodge and 10 lakeside cottages. Come explore 16+ miles of trails available for hiking or mountain biking, a 374-slip marina with boat launch & rentals, an 18-Hole Arnold Palmer Signature Golf Course with a full practice & teaching facility, state-of-the-art health & fitness facilities, a full-service spa, indoor/outdoor swimming pool and more!

name: Storc Auctions
description: Semi-retired, but will still do on-location auctions or estate sales. We have a portable self contained loudspeaker system. We have the ability to pick up and move our entire operation anywhere anytime to accommodate the needs of our customers. We believe in keeping our rates reasonable and simple and there will never be any hidden costs. My many years of retail, industrial and commercial management experience will ensure that your sale will be given the expertise it deserves. Our staff is chosen for their dedication and interest in doing a great job for you, our customers.

name: Strand Theatre
description: In 1920, owner Merton A. Sybert opened the Strand Theatre. The Strand showed first-run films until its closure in 1968, and then again during a twenty-year period of operation from 1976 to 1996. In 2002, the nonprofit Strand Theatre Preservation Society was founded to restore and reopen the Strand as a performing arts venue. With the help of funding from the State Historic Preservation Office, the National Trust for Historic Preservation, and other sources, and with work from numerous volunteers, the long process began. Visit our Renovations page for more details on the renovation process!

name: Strawberry Inn
description: The Strawberry Inn is a tiny piece of heaven. This cabin rests beside a creek where you can hear the trickle of the water on a warm summer day and welcomes conversations just as warm and memorable on its large 1/2 wrap porch. Heat, A/C and electricity make all the difference in the world when the rest of your inn surrounds you with architecture from the1800's. It is for sure a family favorite for every generation.

name: Stray Cat Cafe – Romney
description: Mexican cuisine. Dining room.

name: Stray Dog Antiques
description: Stray Dog Antiques is home to an eclectic and ever-changing assortment of antiques, collectibles, fine art, jewelry, textiles, vintage and gently used clothing and accessories, furniture, books, housewares and more!

name: Stuart Day Use Area and Campground
description: The campground has 25 sites for single use, 1 double site, and 1 group camping site for larger groups. Each campsite has a parking spur, table, fire ring, tent pad, lantern holder, and electric hookup. Water spigots are available throughout the campground. All campsites are suitable for both tent and trailer camping and can accommodate a 53-foot tow/vehicle combination. Elecriticity, showers, and flush toilets are available at the campground. Camp sites 7-15 are reservable, as are the pavillions. The facility is open 24/7 during open season which is Mid-April to the beginning of October.
address: WV Route 6 and Forest Road 91 (Stuart Drive), Elkins, WV, 26241

name: Stuart’s Smokehouse & Seafood
description: Serving hotdogs, chili, burgers, barbecue and steaks. Karaoke, live bands and outdoor patio setting next to Greenbrier River.

name: Studio 40
description: Featuring a hand-picked selection of limited-edition artisan-designed clothing, jewelry and accessories along with Comfy and Color-Me-Cotton casuals. Studio 40 also offers an array of American fine craft in glass, ceramics, lighting and regional photography.

name: Studio B Gallery & Wine Shop
description: Studio B Gallery and Wine Shop features work from over 75 West Virginia artists. Paintings, pottery, jewelry, coffee, beer, and over 250 select wines are just a few things you will find here. Also offered are art classes for children and adults, as well is wine tastings and wine and food pairings.

name: Stumptown Ales
description: We pay homage to hops, brew with passion and precision and embrace our town’s storied history. We are Stumptown Ales. IPA’s rule our taps – from easy drinking sessions to life-changing triple’s. For us, life starts at the hop.

name: Sturgill Mountain Homestead Est. 1976
description: Since pre-Civil War, Sturgill’s have worked the hills of Appalachia. In 1976, Kenneth Sturgill established the Sturgill Mountain Homestead. It is a small, quaint farm overlooking the majestic ridge lines of Mingo County, where he and his grandson continue to raise and harvest their own honey, vegetables, fruits, and livestock. His wife, Pauline, is a master artisan. She is known throughout Southern WV for her artisan breads and cakes made from produce out of her own gardens, as well as jams and quilted masterpieces. Their daughter, Alivia, who also resides on the mountain, aids in managing the farm's sustainability.
