description: Willow Gift Gallery specializes in home accessories, fine jewelry, glassware, apparel, baby gifts, fun novelties, personalized gifts, local WV products and custom ordering.

name: Windwood Fly-In Resort
description: Windwood Fly-in Resort is surrounded by beautiful landscaped scenery. This is a convenient spot for small plan owners looking for a weekend get-away. Windwood accommodates travelers with or without their wings, but we're always glad to see you land here! We are conveniently located in the heart of beautiful Canaan Valley, West Virginia. Sitting high in the Allegheny Mountain Range, this alpine valley is the highest plateau east of the Rocky Mountains. Its unique cool and moist climate allows for cold, snowy winters and pleasant summers. The valley is surrounded by the Dolly Sods and Otter Creek Wilderness Area, Canaan Valley National Wildlife Refuge, Blackwater Falls and Canaan Valley State Parks, and 900,000 acres of National Forest Land. Canaan Valley is well-known as a four-season paradise. The Inn at Windwood offers 17 clean, spacious rooms at affordable rates. Rooms include a luxurious king-size bed or a family -friendly two-double bed room, individual heating and air conditioning units, satellite television, telephone and a wireless high-speed Internet connection. Guests at the Inn enjoy a fully-equipped game room, weight room, volleyball court and an on-site restaurant. Each room has direct access to the spacious balconies overlooking Canaan Valley including Timberline ski Resort, Dolly Sods Wilderness Area, and the back country surrounding Blackwater Falls State park. Amelia's Restaurant is located within the resort and is well know for its home cooking and offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. The menu offers a variety of foods including, steak, seafood, pastas, sandwiches and more. Don't forget to try one of our homemade desserts! Our resort is open year round from 7:30 am - 9 pm and the restaurant is open Tues-Sat from 7:30 am - 9 pm and Sunday 7:30 am - 3 pm. the restaurant is closed Monday and Tuesdays.
address: H.C. 70, Box 105, Cortland Road - Canaan Valley, Davis, WV, 26260

name: Wine Cellar Park
description: Wine Cellar Park is a park where families or groups can spend peaceful quality time. It is listed in the National Register of Historic Places for the pre-Civil War Wine Cellars that have become the site of many weddings and other photo opportunities. Contained within the 300 acres of the park is a 9-hole disc golf course (soon to be 18 holes); an amphitheater; and several picnic areas, two shelters and a large group shelter. The picnic areas are close to the park's playground and nearby handicapped accessible restrooms. There are paved pathways as well as trails throughout the wooded area of the park toward and around Laura Anderson Lake. The park contains over 300 acres of unexplored terrain for hikers year round, or cross country skiing during heavy snow days in the winter.

name: Winfield Dairy Freeze
description: Serving ice cream, desserts and lots of good fast food menu options. The dine-in restaurant has an oldies theme.

name: Wingate by Wyndham-Hurricane
description: Welcome to Wingate by Wyndham in Hurricane WV, just off I-64, making travel throughout the area easy. For those flying in, we’re 30 miles from Yeager Airport (CRW) and 35 miles from Huntington Tri-State Airport (HTS). Start your day with a free breakfast of fruit, cereal, pastries, and more. Stay connected with free WiFi and our business center, work out any time of the day in our 24/7 gym, and relax with a drink at the on-site bar. We also offer free parking, a 24/7 market, barbeque grills, and dry cleaning service. Unwind in a non-smoking guest room, featuring a flat-screen HDTV with movie channels, microwave, mini-refrigerator, coffee maker, desk, ironing amenities, hair dryer, and bath products.

name: Wingate by Wyndham – Vienna/Parkersburg
description: The Wingate hotel is proud to offer a host of valuable amenities at no extra cost to you. Each morning guests wake up to a full hot continental breakfast beginning at 6 a.m. for the early risers. Breakfast includes many delicious items including pastries, fresh fruit, bagels, English muffins, eggs, bacon or sausage, biscuits and gravy, and a self-serve waffle maker. The hotel also has conference rooms available.

name: Wingate Inn
description: The Wingate by Wyndham hotel is located in the new Charles Pointe Development, near Bridgeport. Conveniently located off I-79 and 279, within walking distance to the new Buffalo Wild Wings and 6 miles from the Pete Dye Golf Course. Every Wingate by Wyndham is built for business and offers every guest virtually the same experience. Amenities include: Full continental breakfast buffet; shuttle to/from the Pete Dye Golf Club; workout facility, indoor heated pool and whirlpool; complimentary business center.

name: Wingo’s Grill
description: Wingo’s Grill is connected to the Hatfield McCoy Resort Inn and provides customers with an affordable menu of foods and beverages. Wingo's specializes in freshly smoked pork Boston Butt BBQ, served with homemade BBQ Sauces. Wingo’s Grill is open by request from the guests and visitors of Matewan. They also provide catering for groups and events.

name: Wings Ole’
description: Specializing in wings, tacos and burritos. Also serving salads. sandwiches and kids' meals.

name: Winterplace Ski Resort
description: Winterplace Ski Resort is the perfect place for beginners to learn to ski and more advanced skiers and riders to improve their technique, or just spend some time having fun with family and friends. Winterplace is easily accessible, just 5 miles off I-77, Exit 28 between Beckley and Bluefield. Explore 27 mountainous trails and enjoy WV’s largest snowtubing park. Here winter is fun for everyone!
address: 100 Old Flat Top Mt. Rd., Ghent, WV 25843 | Mailing Address: P.O. Box 1, Flat Top, WV 25841, Ghent, WV, 25843

name: Wirt County Public Shooting and Archery
description: Public shooting and archery range.

name: Wissmach Glass Co., Inc.
description: Wissmach Glass manufacturers the largest variety of colored-rolled sheet glass in the world. Throughout the years, Wissmach Glass has built an inventory that includes more than 3,000 colors, tints and patterns. We take pride in producing the finest quality art glass in the world. Hours: Monday – Friday 8 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Saturday 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. Personal tours are available.

name: Wisteria’s Gifts
description: A must visit while in Fayetteville, WV. Jewelry, Vera Bradley, collectibles, Jim Shore, WV gourmet foods and wines, beads, garden, candles, home decor and much more. Always a good place to shop for a unique gift.

name: Wolf Creek Gallery – Alderson
description: Brimming with unique gifts for the home and garden, as well as jewelry and the popular wolf creek calendar. Also featuring the Quilter’s Nook for all your quilting needs. Sat 10-5. Call for winter hours.

name: Wolf Creek Gallery
description: Eclectic clothing and accessories; fabulous footwear - Dansko, Born, Crocs and Frye; fine leather bags, belts and wallets; beautifully scented bath products; large selection of unique jewelry. Something for everyone.

name: Wolf Creek Park
description: Wolf Creek Park is nestled in the heart of West Virginia’s outdoor recreation capitol, Fayette County. The location is off of U S Route 19 at Appalachian Drive and S R 16. Envisioned as a four-season mixed use development, the Park is designed to provide jobs linked to the outstanding natural resources of the region. Wolf Creek Park will be home to employers and residents seeking close connections to the land. The Park will serve as a model of environmental sensitivity while also bringing jobs, housing and community facilities to Fayette County.

name: Woman’s Club of Fairmont
description: A glorious setting, available by reservation, for private catered dinner parties, receptions, bridge parties, club meetings or weddings. This mansion was built in 1901 and contains a magnificent ornate central staircase and much of the original furnishings and decor. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

name: Wonderment Puppet Theater
description: Wonderment Puppet Theater a year round children's puppet theater in a colorful Victorian house. We produce 6 shows a year. Our theater includes original shows, hands on exhibits, and a gift shop. All our guests receive animal crackers and a balloon after the show. We also do balloon birthday parties (any age) and special showings on weekdays for guests traveling through the area. It's a one of a kind children's theater not to be missed. Guarantee to please the entire family.

name: Wood Iron Eatery
description: Welcome to Wood Iron Eatery! Wood Iron Eatery is a small chef and wife-owned coffee house cafe located in the historic Ankrom-Dickerson House in Fayetteville, WV. We are a full service espresso bar serving breakfast, lunch and baked goods.
address: 129 S. Court Street, Unit A, Fayetteville, WV, 25840

name: Woodbrier Golf Course
description: The Woodbrier Golf Course offers an affordable 9 hole experience with loads of character. Stop in, grab a cart and go... no hassle and no tee time required. Visit our snack bar for hot dogs, hamburgers, bagged snacks & more! We also offer various sodas, water, and ice-cold beer.

name: Woodburn Shanks Pit BBQ
description: Serving traditional pit-style barbecue in Morgantown, West Virginia. After being Slow-smoked over a real hardwood fire, our BBQ is served with sauce on the side. Our sides are traditional "home cooked" style.
address: 1616 Earl L Core Rd, Morgantown, WV, 26505

name: Woodcraft Supply Store
description: Woodcraft brings quality woodworking tools, supplies and advice to its fourth generation of woodworkers through its retail stores, catalog and the Internet providing today's woodworker with friendly, professional expertise. Quality woodworking tools, supplies and advice.

name: Wooden Shoe Antiques
description: 00+ Kerosene Lamps, Old and New parts in stock, Lamp Repair both electric and oil, Glass, Pottery and Furniture.
address: 222 W. Washington St., Charles Town, WV, 25414

name: Woodlawn Cemetery
description: The first burial in what is now Woodlawn Cemetery was April 15,1875. Young Joseph Hamilton was found shot with his gun beside him. He was in the old sheep yard on the Elmus and Louisa Hamilton (early Marion County pioneers) property, the part of Middletown, now Fairmont, called Woodlawn today. With over 11,000 graves today, Woodlawn is the resting place of many of the people who helped make Fairmont, Marion County, West Virginia and the nation. Prominent interments include: Francis & Julia Pierpont, Thomas & Annie Fleming, Matthew M. Neely, James O. Watson, Aretas B. Fleming, Boaz Fleming and Peter Miller.

name: Woodridge Plantation
description: Enjoy the challenge and natural scenic beauty. Woodridge Golf Club offers one of the most unique layouts in the area with a links style 18-hole championship course with Bermuda fairways and Pennlinks bent grass greens.

name: Woods Boat House
description: Full-service marina. Sales of boats, wave runners and Pontoon boats. Docking for the season.
address: I-79, Exit 132, Rt. 250 North, Fairmont, WV, 26554

name: World Scouting Museum
description: The World Scouting Museum has the largest collection of Scouting Memorabilia in the World. Featuring 4 automata and items from every country in the world!

name: World War II Memorial
description: The World War II Memorial lists the names of 23 Glenville State College students who died during World War II. The memorial, dedicated in September 1995, is surrounded by 23 flags to honor of those who sacrificed their lives for our country. Gilmer County, W.Va.

name: World’s Largest Tea Pot
description: Constructed By William Babe Devon. Originally it was a gigantic wooden Hogshead Barrel For A Hire's Root Beer Advertising Campaign. Devon Purchased The Barrel In Pennsylvania And Had It Shipped To Chester Where It Was Set Up On Carolina Avenue, Which Is Also State Route 2. Devon was a booster of the region’s then-vibrant pottery industry, and used the Teapot to sell snacks and souvenirs. The Teapot Is 14 Feet In Diameter And Approximately 14 Feet High. The Teapot Was Moved To A Location Adjacent To The Jennings Randolph Bridge Ramp, A Heavily Trafficked Area At The Junction Of State Route 2 And U.S. Route 30.
address: Chester City Hall/Tepot 600 Indiana Ave., Chester, WV, 26034

name: Worthington Golf Club, Inc.
description: This is the only golf course located in the city of Parkersburg. It is a popular 18-hole public golf facility that has served the area for nearly 75 years. Located just two miles off I-77, exit 176. The course has a flat terrain, easy to walk & wide, tree lined fairways. There are paved concrete cart paths with a fleet of 75 carts with roofs and windshields. The course is close to hotels and restaurants. It has forward tees, slope 107 (4,967 yards), middle tees, slope 103 (5,863 yards) & back tees, slope 108 (6,106 yards). Soft spikes are permitted on golf shoes. Club Key, Golf Card, and W.Va. VIP Cards are honored.

name: Wow! Factory
description: Craft entertainment studio for all ages. Includes Paint Your Own Pottery, Glass Fusing, Mosaics and Clay Hand-building, Canvas Painting and Board Art. No appointment necessary in studio. Weekly workshops offered for adults and children. Summer Camp, Birthday Parties and Group Events. Affordable Fun for Everyone!

name: Wrong Turn Pizza & Subs
description: Serves Brick Oven Pizza, hot and cold subs & draft beer.

name: WV ATV Rentals
description: Located in Rock, W. Va., about 3400 ft up on top of Indian ridge and 5 minutes from Pocahontas trails system, WV ATV Rentals has lodging right on the Hatfield-McCoy ATV Trail. Rent a machine or take a guided tour off-road in southern West Virginia.

name: WV Brick Oven Bistro
description: Delicious, hot food available for inside dining or get it to go! Grill menu in addition to the Brick Oven Pizzas includes soups, salads, appetizers, wings, sandwiches - including the FRESHEST 1/2 lb. burgers around! Pizza dough made fresh daily with fresh cut veggies and fresh cooked meats. House specialty is the BELT sandwich - it is "egg"cellent!
address: 5254 Big Tyler Rd, Cross Lanes, WV, 25313

name: WV Fishbusters – South Branch of the Potomac River
description: Professionally guided fishing adventures along the South Branch of the Potomac River in West Virginia. Full or half day trips are available. Enjoy floating the river in a comfortable 2012 drift boat. While floating enjoy the serenity of the beautiful mountains, bald eagles, hawks, deer, turkey, turtles and other wildlife. Small mouth bass are our specialty. Cash only. Accommodations include: Cabins with a Full Kitchen, Family friendly, Mountain views, Pets allowed & River swimming

name: WV Mountain Highlands
description: West Virginia Mountain Highlands provides tourism information to people traveling to the Potomac Highlands area of West Virginia through internet, social media and printed materials to spread the word about our wonderful region. The region is blessed with nearly all the acreage (over 1 million acres) of federal National Forest lands (the Monongahela and George Washington), including the popular Spruce Knob-Seneca Rocks National Recreation Area, the Dolly Sods and Otter Creek Wilderness Areas, and many more public recreation areas used by outdoor enthusiasts throughout the year. These areas, combined with the model state parks and forests, and state wildlife management areas have become the “Year-round Outdoor Playground of the East” for those who love hiking, biking, fishing, hunting, horseback riding, bird watching, camping, backpacking, and sightseeing in the great outdoors in Summer; skiing, snowboarding, tubing, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing and exploring in Winter.

name: WV Outback ATV/ Hatfield McCoy Cabin Rentals
description: Cabins rentals on the Hatfield McCoy Trails in Matewan, WV. The cabins, parts & accessories, and a restaurant are all in one convenient location.

name: WV SKY TOURS
description: Geared for families or groups with bigger kids, from the dark site location by appointment, Day or night astronomy demonstrations are offered year round that will enhance your appreciation of the sky above. Video presentations, Starlab planetarium sessions, a space/time walk, solar viewing, or stargazing sessions can be scheduled anywhere including downtown Lewisburg. Learn much more at: http://www.wvskytours.com

name: WV Vacation Rental
description: Short term rentals in the beautiful state of WV.

name: West Virginia International Film Festival
description: The West Virginia International Film Festival was organized in October 1985 as a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization and hosted its first annual Fall Film Festival that Fall and its first Spring Festival in 1986. The WVIFF’s mission is to encourage, support, and promote the Film Arts; to plan, organize, and present an annual Fall Film Festival of critically acclaimed and culturally diverse domestic and foreign language feature films unlikely to be exhibited theatrically in West Virginia; to plan, organize, and present an annual Spring Film Festival of critically acclaimed and culturally diverse domestic and foreign language feature films and documentaries, West Virginia-produced/related films, and educational programming; to conduct these activities for entertainment, educational, and audience-development purposes; to encourage local and statewide film and video production; and to carry on any business connected therewith.

name: WVU Adventure WV Canopy Tour
description: In support of its educational and developmental mission at West Virginia University, Adventure WV has recently collaborated with the WVU Division of Forestry & Natural Resources to create a canopy tour facility. Believed to be the first university-owned and operated canopy tour in the United States, the Adventure WV Canopy Tour will be used to train practitioners, host research, and to provide fun educational experiences for the WVU community! The canopy tour is comprised of four zip-lines, an aerial bridge, and a tandem rappel station to exit the course. After exiting the course, participants will hike from the base of the final tree back to the starting point on an interpretive nature trail.

name: WVU Jackson’s Mill State 4-H Conference Center
description: Conference center - handles groups up to 400. All types of equipment needed for any meeting, educational schooling, etc. Fully-equipped computer lab. A mill, 4-H camp, museum housing agricultural, milling and homestead artifacts from 18th century. A cemetery on the grounds holds the graves of Jackson’s grandparents. Relocated to the site: the McWhorter Cabin (c. 1793), Blaker’s Mill (c. 1794) and the Mary Conrad Cabin. Visit website for info. I-79 Exit 99, left toward Weston onto Rt 33W. At fourth light, turn right onto Route 19 N. Turn left onto Jackson's Mill Road, cross the bridge, WVU Jackson's Mill is on right.

name: Wyndham Garden Charleston/Cross Lanes
description: 132 room hotel located at exit 47, I-64. Newly remodeled, family friendly restaurant on site. Tropical Indoor pool with waterfall & spa, outdoor pool, fitness room, sauna, free Wi-Fi, free breakfast, and business center.

name: Wyoming County Convention & Visitors Bureau (CVB)
description: The Wyoming County Convention & Visitors Bureau is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing visitors and businesses with information and resources regarding travel and tourism in Wyoming County, WV.

name: Yak House Rentals
description: Get away from the hustle and bustle of life. Escape to the tranquil and calming waters of the Elk River, rent a kayak and float down the Elk at your leisure; fish, swim or just be close to nature. Choose your adventure - 4.5, 6.5 or 10.5 mile trip. Prices: Single Kayak $35 Tandem Kayak $65 ; Same for Grab n Go's Fishing Kayak is $75 Parking and shuttle service provided. If bringing own kayaks, $20 per/person for transport.

name: Yankauer Nature Preserve
description: A popular preserve in Berkeley County, Yankauer Preserve is a blend of oak forests surrounded by glades of red cedar and dense thickets of fast-growing shrubs and trees. As you move into the center of the property you find a more mature forest of large oaks and maples growing amid limestone outcrops and sinkholes. The eastern edge of the property is a bluff overlooking the Potomac River. The mixed habitat makes the area ideal for birding. The preserve is a hot spot for Spring wildflower displays, as well as sighting warblers on migration. At least 105 species of plants have been identified on the Preserve. Clusters of wildflowers such as Dutchmen's Breeches, Jack-in-the-Pulpit, Hepatica, and Twinleaf are easily found in the spring. The autumn fruits of Paw Paw trees provide a snack for wild animals and not-so-wild hikers alike. There is equal diversity among the animals on the Preserve. Spring migration of waterfowl can be spectacular along the river. Breeding season welcomes sweet-singing warblers and vireos as they nest among the cedars. Barred Owls are often heard as they cry out in search for a mate. Three well marked trails take the visitor through a variety of habitat types on the preserve. The "Kingfisher Trail," a "South Trail," and "Dan Fisher Trail" all loop, and one can walk a large circle across the property. A trail brochure is available on site. The preserve is jointly managed by The Nature Conservancy and The Potomac Valley Audubon Society.

name: Yarid’s Outlet Shop
description: Specializing in fine shoes for ladies and gentlemen, as well as designer handbags and accessories. Also offering an exclusive selection of outlet, regular priced and Brighton merchandise.

name: Ye Olde Alpha
description: Ye Olde Alpha Restaurant, established in 1932, is a family owned and operated Restaurant and Lounge serving only fine, quality food and all legal beverages in a friendly, neighborhood atmosphere. A wide range of menu selections are available from Breakfast- any time- to Prime steaks and fresh seafood. Private Party rooms are available. Dining hours are daily from 11:00 am to Midnight.

name: West Virginia International Yeager Airport (CRW)
description: With competitive airfares to destinations throughout the world and service by American, Delta, United and Breeze Airlines, Yeager Airport strives to make the travel experience enjoyable and hassle-free. A short drive from downtown Charleston and just a few minutes from the intersection of three major interstates, Yeager Airport is West Virginia’s gateway to the world.

name: Yeager House Vacation Rental
description: This charming, three-bedroom cottage is located on the Staunton-to-Parkersburg Turnpike in Bartow, WV. Yeager House sits in a valley surrounded by the Allegheny Mountains and the Monongahela National Forest. The house is located on the site of the Civil War Battle of the Greenbrier River (1861) and provides easy access to hiking and biking trails, close to Snowshoe Resort and the Green Bank Observatory. Whether you are a Civil War buff or just enjoy the outdoors, Yeager House is your gateway to adventure. The house sleeps six--three bedrooms one bath. It is fully furnished and all amenities are provided: linens, paper products, hair dryer, washer & dryer, iron and ironing board, AC and WiFi. There is a fully equipped kitchen including microwave, toaster oven, and coffee maker with filters. For your relaxation there is a TV (no cable) and DVD player, magazines, books and games. The patio has table and chairs and a charcoal grill, with charcoal provided.​​

name: Yesterday’s Antiques, Coins & Collectibles
description: Small, unique family owned and operated shop. It features a wide assortment of collectors glass including: Fenton, Imperial, Blenko, etc. In addition, there are primitive items, furniture and it specializes in a large assortment of coins.

name: Yew Mountain Center
description: The Yew Mountain Center is a new experiential education non-profit in Pocahontas County offering family friendly learning weekends, field trips, and special events based on the rich ecology and culture of the area. The 500 acre property has mature forests, spring-fed ponds, well-developed trails and a rustic lodge. 450 of the acres are maturing upland hardwood forest with several miles of trails. About 50 acres are in pasture, old fields and ponds. The closest pond to the lodge is great for swimming, fishing and canoeing. Our lodge features a central great room with stone fireplace, a commercial kitchen, a dining/meeting room and six guest rooms, each with a private bath. There is a large deck on the eastern side of the building and a covered porch on the west. We also offer B&B style lodging as our schedule allows.

name: Yokum’s Seneca Rocks Stables
description: Visitors to Pendleton County, who would like to take in the breathtaking vista from atop Seneca Rocks, can do so without the exertion of climbing the trail to the top. Go by horse and enjoy a leisurely ride. Our gentle, well-trained, sturdy horses will carry you there and back. First-time riders are no problem. Experienced guides go with you on every ride. The trail is a gradual scenic climb, and parents can be assured that children six and up will find the adventure an experience to treasure.
address: Yokum Lane House 3, Seneca Rocks, WV, 26884

name: Yokum’s Vacationland
description: The only lodging located right in the heart of Seneca Rocks, West Virginia, Yokum’s Vacationland has a wide array of accommodations with tent camping, teepee camping, RV camping, fully-equipped cabins with hot tubs, motel rooms and 2 apartments. There is a general store with a deli and riverside parking with hookups for campers and motor homes. Yokum’s Vacationland has two beautiful campgrounds with views of Seneca Rocks. Tent camping and full RV hook-ups are available at both. We do not take reservations for camping. Sites are first come first serve. Lower Campground is nestled along the North Fork of the South Branch of the Potomac River. There are 15 full hook-up RV sites and 10 water/electric hook-ups along the river and throughout the campground, a playground set for children, and a bathhouse with bathrooms and showers. There is also a dump station in this campground. Tent camping is also possible in this campground, and there is a pavilion open to use and available for rent for group events. The Princess Snowbird Campground is located just across the road from Seneca Rocks. It borders Seneca Creek on one side and a cow pasture/mountain on the other. In addition to tent camping, there are 10 full hook-up RV sites and 15 sites with water/electric hookup only, both along the river and throughout the campground. The Princess Snowbird Cabins are also found in this campground, as well as the teepees, bunkhouses, 2 bathhouses with showers and toilets, and 2 pavilions. The 11 motel room are located above the store. All rooms have a kitchenette, and most have a great view of the rocks. We have 14 cabins from simple hunter's cabins to honeymoon cabins with jacuzzis, or log cabins with hot tubs. Yokum's store has just about anything you could possibly need on your trip to the mountains...groceries, camping gear, automotive, and of course souvenirs! The deli, located in the store, is open 7 days a week for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

name: Youngblood’s Antiques
description: Collectibles Store · Furniture Store · Antique Store

name: The Yurts at Kairos Wilderness Resort
description: Enjoy the beauty and wilderness in one of these luxury yurts. Each is pet-friendly and the yurt sleeps up to six people. While staying at Kairos, you can customize your own vacation. With over 1500 acres, 40 miles of trails, river activities and the beautiful Appalachian Mountains. Choose from ATV/UTV/Dirt Bike Trails, Hiking, Horseback Riding Trails, boating, fishing and swimming.
address: Shumate Falls Road, Rich Creek, VA, 24147

name: Z. D. Ramsdell House
description: The historical Zopher D. Ramsdell House, the first brick home built in Ceredo, sets along the banks of the Ohio River and is said to have helped hide slaves on the Underground Railroad. The Ramsdells were strict Quakers and abolitionists and maintained historic documents and artifacts. On the National Register of Historic Places. Visitors may tour the house Sundays, from 2-4 p.m., except holidays.

name: Zenclay Cafe, Studio and Gallery
description: ZenClay's is a place unique to Morgantown. the Cafe was established in 2001 and offers great food with a focus on local foods, a healthier lifestyle, and a great environment where you share your meals with art and music. There is a great staff who offer the best possible experience. . ZenClay's Studio was establish in 1999. Since then they have taught many classes and provided the opportunity for people who wish to learn about making pottery, ceramic objects, and many other aspects of art. ZenClay strives to provide the greater Morgantown area with a place to learn and enrich their lives with art.
